title: Staff Accountant Generalist
description:
Job Description
Our US Partner is a provider of flexible office space and coworking solutions. They offer a range of workspace options, including private offices, dedicated desks, and shared coworking spaces. Their services are designed to cater to the needs of individuals, startups, and larger companies.
We're seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Staff Accountant Generalist to join our team. You will work as part of the Transaction Services (TS) team and Core Accounting Team, as needed, and be responsible for completing various operational finance tasks in relation to accounts receivable, accounts payable, cash, prepaids, journal entries and financial reporting. You will be a critical member of the Finance team and have broad exposure across all areas of the business as you work with the various business segments to ensure all transactions are booked in a timely and accurate manner.
This is a full-time role, on a US shift and on a WFH set-up.
If you have the right skill set, this may be your opportunity to enter this fast-growing organization.
Responsibilities:
Participate in the month-end close process and complete Bank Reconciliations for certain entities.
Assist in researching old variances on the Bank Reconciliations.
Prepare journal entries to be reviewed by accounting team, related to Stripe Fees, Utilities Accruals, bank fees, ACH payments, etc.
Record bank transactions on a daily/weekly basis. This will ensure most bank transactions are recorded during the month and facilitate and reduce the time spent to reconcile cash accounts during the month-end financial close process.
Download Utilities invoices from Utility Vendor online accounts to support for recording utility payments and accruals.
Monitor Prepaid Expenses and Prepaid Insurance that hit during the month; download and save Prepaid expense and prepaid insurance support invoices to a designated folder.
Assist with Accounts Payable Aging clean-up.
Assist with obtaining support and amortization of Prepaid expenses;
Assist with business license registrations/renewals using an online business license tracking tool to ensure licenses are current and paid on time.
Assist with maintaining personal property tax tracker to ensure taxes are filed and paid on timely manner
Roll forward and prepare of Balance Sheet Account reconciliations;
Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to, participating in special
projects, system enhancements, or adhoc analyses, as assigned.
Provide support to the TS and Core Accounting Teams, as needed.
Requirements:
Relevant Accounting education
Mid to advanced excel proficiency
Minimum of 5 years of direct experience in accounting related functions
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to
interact effectively and professionally with colleagues and managers
Strong analytical disposition with high attention to detail, accuracy and
Organization
Creative thinker and problem solver
Proven ability to meet deadlines
Strong Microsoft Office skills set

Your analytical mindset and creativity will play a crucial role in achieving our business objectives.
WHO WE ARE
MySigrid is a Premium Executive and Personal Assistance Service staffed by humans powered by technology. We provide the right people, platform, and processes to optimize busy executives’ lives, allowing them to outsource the day-to-day activities that keep their personal and professional lives on time and on target. We aim to democratize access to executive support and to create jobs using technology instead of replacing them.
We use MySigrid, our proprietary Collaboration & Task Management Platform, to solve tasks efficiently and collectively - improving quality, reducing human error, and increasing speed. MySigrid is a ‘state-of-the-art’ technology platform designed to optimize the work processes of our Executive Assistants, allowing them to deliver world-class remote support to multiple clients, as well as giving them the flexibility to configure an optimal work/life balance.
Key Responsibilities:

Analytics and Reporting: Monitor and report on campaign performance using HubSpot analytics, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members on HubSpot best practices and features to maximize usage across the organization.
Market Research: Conduct market research to identify trends, customer needs, and competitive positioning to inform marketing strategies.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align sales and marketing efforts and ensure a cohesive brand message.

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
Proven experience (3+ years) in sales and marketing while using Hubspot
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst (SQL/BI)
location: Santa Ana, Manila City, Metro Manila
description:
About Us
HelloConnect
HelloConnect is a subsidiary of HelloFresh, founded to address years of challenges faced in its own customer care. Leveraging our extensive experience in developing customer care tailored to the immediate needs of HelloFresh, our solutions are hyper-focused on serving high-growth companies. Located in Manila, Philippines, we are now making this service available to other companies to benefit from our experience, scale, cost savings, and service level improvements.
HelloFresh
HelloFresh is a global leader in delivering delicious meal kits and grocery boxes straight to customers' doorsteps. We are dedicated to providing high-quality, convenient, and sustainable meal solutions that inspire people to cook and eat healthy at home. Our commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction drives our ongoing success.
Job Overview
The Business Intelligence Analyst will help our organization make informed decisions by transforming available data into meaningful insights. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to gather requirements, process and analyze data, and create self-service dashboards that drive initiatives.
Key Responsibilities
Support decision-making by translating business requirements into BI products
Develop and maintain data models, automation, reports, and dashboards using BI tools.
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing basic data validation and quality checks.
Apply statistical techniques and models to address broad business questions and test hypotheses
Actively engage with stakeholders to gather information, explore options, present findings/proposals, and answer clarifying questions.
Create and maintain comprehensive, up-to-date documentation on the team’s data products
Take ownership of several data products, ensuring they remain accurate, up-to-date, and relevant
Provide ad-hoc analysis, data extraction, and support to leadership and other departments to address specific business questions using readily available data.
Skills and Preferred Qualifications
Industry experience in reporting, BI, data analysis, or a similar position with an operations focus
Proficiency with SQL, BI tools, or Python for developing data models, automation, and dashboards. Tableau experience is a plus
Experience performing business statistics (e.g., descriptive statistics and statistical inference)
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills for both business and technical stakeholders
A curious mindset with an inquisitive approach to problem-solving
Openness to learning and a proactive effort to expand knowledge and skills
Ability to work independently and autonomously
Why work for us?
At HelloConnect, you'll join an organization that values innovation and leverages cutting-edge technology to transform customer experiences. With a collaborative culture, continuous learning opportunities, and a customer-centric focus, you'll contribute to impactful projects that drive business success. Upholding ethical standards and promoting diversity and inclusion, HelloConnect fosters a positive work environment. Your well-being is prioritized through comprehensive benefits and perks. Join us to shape the future of digital experiences and make a difference in the lives of our clients and their customers.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
About the Company: 
Career Team is a leading provider of software solutions designed to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of social service organizations and workforce government agencies. Our case management system supports non-profits, government agencies, and workforce development teams with participant engagement, streamlined operations,  improved client outcomes, and modernized service delivery.
Job Overview:
We are seeking a motivated and energetic Entry-Level Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing sales team. This role focuses on generating leads and building relationships with potential clients in the workforce development and non-profit sectors. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills and a passion for making a difference in the social services space. Domain experience with non-profit organizations and workforce development programs preferred.
In this role, you will work from 11:00pm to 8:00am PHST.
Why Join Us?
Be a founding member of a dynamic team shaping the future of our products.
Make a tangible difference in the lives of individuals.
Grow and learn in an environment that values innovation.
Receive coverage under the company sponsored HMO plan.
Career Team also offers a competitive total rewards package including:
amazing options for advancement;
HMO with an option to add dependents;
paid holidays and 15 paid time off, offered on an accrual basis.
Your Impact on Career TEAM’s Success:
Lead Generation: Research, prospect, and identify potential leads within the workforce development and non-profit sectors.
Outbound Outreach: Conduct cold calls, emails, and social media outreach to introduce our software platform and its benefits to key decision-makers.
Qualification: Qualify leads by gathering information about potential clients' needs, pain points, and goals related to social services software.
Lead Nurturing: Engage with potential clients to develop interest in our platform and move them through the early stages of the sales funnel.
Collaboration: Work closely with the sales team to ensure a smooth transition of qualified leads to the Account Executives for further engagement.
CRM Management: Accurately track and update lead interactions and progress within the CRM system.
Market Knowledge: Stay informed about trends, challenges, and opportunities in the social services, workforce development, and non-profit sectors.
The Ideal Qualifications for this Position Include:
Passion for helping organizations improve their impact on communities and individuals.
Strong desire to work in sales and the social services/non-profit sectors.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Self-motivated, results-driven, and goal-oriented with a strong sense of initiative.
Ability to build relationships and engage with diverse audiences.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience (preferred).
Experience with CRM software (HubSpot, etc.) is a plus, but not required.
Written and verbal English communication proficiency required.
Why Join Us?
Impact: Contribute to improving the efficiency and effectiveness of social services and workforce development organizations.
Growth: Opportunity for career development and advancement in a fast-growing company.
Training & Support: Receive comprehensive onboarding and continuous training to support your success in the role.
Culture: Join a collaborative, inclusive, and mission-driven team.
Salary: compensation includes a base salary of 35,000 - 40,000 PHP/month plus  commission
About Career TEAM:
Founded in 1996, Career TEAM is socially conscious organization that seeks to close the nation’s opportunity divide through government-funded workforce development programs designed to help individuals get the skills, knowledge, and resources needed to obtain quality employment.  In addition to administering these programs, Career TEAM develops and leverages cutting-edge software tools to ignite transformative change within the workforce development industry.  Career TEAM is revolutionizing the operational landscape for workforce development professionals through its Career Edge platform, which includes state-of-the-art job training tools and advanced case management systems.  For more information see www.careeredge.com and www.careerteam.com.
Career TEAM’s outstanding record has resulted in numerous honors, including:
Named by Inc. Magazine as one of America's 500 fastest growing privately held companies
Recipient of the US Chamber of Commerce Blue Chip Enterprise Award for innovation
Featured by 60 Minutes, CNN, Money Magazine, Inc. Magazine and the British Broadcasting Network as an innovative, government funded solutions program
Invited to the White House after being cited by the National Welfare-to-Work Partnership and National Alliance of Business as a top 10 US training provider
Career Team is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.
Background Check Requirements. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background check (including criminal, prior employment and education verification). Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current employees who apply for the position.

title: TPRP Representative - Antipolo
description:
Are you ready to start your legaSEA? SEAOIL is looking for passionate talents to help make a difference in the lives of Filipinos and fuel their better future. Here's your chance to grow your career with the largest and leading independent fuel company in the country - join us as our next TPRP Representative - Antipolo! 
What is this role about?
The role involves overseeing LPG refilling operations at a Third-Party Refilling Plant (TPRP) on behalf of SeaOil Philippines Inc. (SPI). This includes managing the documentation for LPG sales, coordinating with suppliers for replenishments, and ensuring that all transactions and inventory reports are accurate and up-to-date. The individual in this role is also responsible for ensuring the proper sealing, filling, and weight of LPG cylinders and bulk trucks, while also ensuring compliance with contracts and supply agreements. They serve as the liaison between SPI, its refilling partners, and suppliers, making sure that SPI's business interests are protected.
What will YOU do? 
Coordinate with bulk supply points to request and manage LPG supply replenishments
Interact with suppliers for terminal issuance of ATL and related documents
Prevent product runout in TPRPs through proactive inventory monitoring and coordination
Monitor and update inventory stock for bulk LPG, cylinders, and seals; manage replenishments as needed
Update and maintain accurate dispatch and inventory reports for all bulk transactions at supplier terminals and TPRP plants
Communicate sales and remaining inventory status to the LPG team via work chat and/or SMS
Ensure all cylinders are properly sealed and filled with accurate LPG content; verify weight and seals on bulk trucks and Seagas cylinders
Prepare and process documents for loaded bulk trucks, proof of filled cylinders, and truck releases
Collaborate accounting to ensure timely invoicing based on daily sales and transactions
Coordinate with LPG Operations and Metal Management to manage seals, consumables, cylinder repairs, swaps, and requalification needs
What will YOU need?
At least 1-2 years of related experience, preferably from the Manufacturing, Retail, Oil/Gas industry - with at least 1 year of people management experience
Adept in Data Analysis, Business Analysis.
Willing to be assigned in a TPRP or suppliers terminal in Antipolo

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Job Description:
Design and lead the implementation of a solutions architecture across a group of specific business applications or technologies based on enterprise business strategy, business capabilities and business requirements.
Manage and develop the architecture for a broader scope of projects, working closely with application architects that manage and design architecture for a single project or initiative.
Provide consulting support to project teams to ensure the project is aligned with theoverall enterprise architecture.
Lead and manage development team/s to ensure code quality and implementation is aligned to the designed technical solution
Oversee code reviews and address technical concerns from engineers
Understand technology trends and the practical application of existing, new, and emerging technologies to enable new and evolving business and operating models.
Understand, advocate and augment the principles of information technology strategies.
Analyze the business-IT environment (run, grow and transform the business) to detect critical deficiencies, and recommend solutions for improvement (systems of record, differentiation and innovation).
Analyze the technology industry, competitors and market trends, and determine their potential impact on the enterprise.
Define the principles, guidelines, standards and solution patterns to ensure solution decisions are aligned with the enterprise's future-state architecture vision.
Design and direct the governance activities associated with ensuring solutions architecture assurance and compliance.
Develop a roadmap for the evolution of the enterprise application portfolio from future to current state (as defined by the solutions architecture).
Facilitate the evaluation and selection of software product standards and services, as well as the design of standard and custom software configurations.
Consult with application and infrastructure development projects to fit systems or infrastructure to architecture, and identify when it is necessary to modify projects to accommodate the solutions architecture.
Identify the organizational impact (for example, on skills, processes, structures or culture) and financial impact of the solutions architecture.
Document all solution architecture design and analysis work.
Work closely with the program management office (PMO) or project management office to ensure the execution of plans corresponds with what is being promised.
Requirements
Qualifications:
Knowledge on design patterns, enterprise integration patterns, cloud architecture, API creation and design
Understands and can interpret reference architectures
Critical thinking, big picture thinking, and can use different lenses to interpret technical and business requirements
Professional experience with Node.js, flutter, kafka, AWS components

title: Director of Sales & Marketing25107565
description:
JOB SUMMARY
Functions as the leader of the property’s sales department for properties with bookings over 300 peak rooms and significant local catering revenue. Manages the property's reactive and proactive sales efforts. Provides day to day leadership to sales associates to achieve property sales objectives with overall responsibility for achieving booking goals and property revenues. Implements the brand’s service strategy and applicable brand initiatives in all aspects of the sales process and focuses on building long-term, value-based customer relationships that enable achievement of the hotel’s’ sales objectives. Evaluates the property’s participation in the various sales channels (e.g., Area Sales, Group Sales within the Sales Office, electronic lead channels, etc.) and develops strong working relationships to proactively position and market the property. Manages the marketing budget to enable development of property specific campaigns, promotions and collateral to drive revenue and meet property objectives. Interfaces with regional marketing communications for regional and national promotions pull through. Develops and implements property–wide strategies that deliver products and services to meet or exceed the needs and expectations of the brand’s target customer profile and property associates and provides a return on investment to the owner and Marriott International.
CANDIDATE PROFILE 
Education and Experience
Required:
• 2-year degree from an accredited university in Business Administration, Marketing, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 4 years experience in the sales and marketing or related professional area.
OR
• 4-year bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 2 years experience in the sales and marketing or related professional area.
Preferred:
• 4 year college degree.
• Demonstrated skills in supervising a team.
• Lodging sales experience.
• Hotel industry work experience, demonstrating progressive career growth and a pattern of exceptional performance. 
  CORE WORK ACTIVITIES
Managing Sales Activities
• Manages the development of a strategic account plan for the demand generators in the market.
• Manages the property's reactive and proactive sales efforts.
• Determines and develops marketing communication activities, in conjunction with Regional Marketing Communications.
• Provides customer intelligence in evaluating the market and economic trends that may lead to changes in sales strategy to meet or exceed customer expectations.
• Reviews the Strategic Alignment Review (STAR) report, competitive shopping reports and uses other resources to maintain an awareness of the hotel’s market position.
• Researches competitor’s sales team strategies to identify ways to grow occupancy and RevPAR and increase market share.
• Attends sales strategy meetings to provide input on weekly and overall sales strategy.
• Suggests innovative marketing ideas and develops deployment strategies to continue to grow market share.
• Evaluates and supports participation and account deployment with Area Sales and Group Sales within the Sales Office.
• Serves as the sales contact for the General Manager, property leadership team, Group Sales and Area Sales leaders.
• Serves as the sales contact for customers; serves as the customer advocate.
• Serves as hotel authority on sales processes and sales contracts.
• Serves as the property sales liaison with Area Sales, Group Sales, Revenue Management, Event Management, Regional Marketing Communications and other hotel departments as appropriate.
• Participates in sales calls with members of the Sales and Marketing team to acquire new business and/or close on business.
• Identifies public relations opportunities and coordinates activities to augment the overall marketing communication strategy.
• Supports the General Manager by coordinating crisis communications.
• Executes and supports Marriott’s Customer Service Standards and hotel’s Brand Standards.
• Executes and supports the operational aspects of business booked (e.g., generating proposal, writing contract, customer correspondence).
• Participates in and practices daily service basics of the brand (e.g., , Marriott Hotels and Resorts (MHR) Spirit to Serve Daily Basics, Renaissance Hotels and Resorts (RHR) Savvy Service Basics, Courtyard, SpringHill Suites, Fairfield Inn Basics of the Day, Residence Inn Daily Huddle, or TownePlace Suites Morning Meeting).
• Implements a seamless turnover from sales to operations and back to sales while consistently delivering high level of service.
• Monitors the effective resolution of guest issues that arise as a result of the sales process by creating mechanisms to channel issues to property leadership and/or other appropriate stakeholders.
• Maintains successful performance by increasing revenues, controlling expenses and providing a return on investment for the owner and Marriott International.
• Implements the brand’s service strategy and applicable brand initiatives in all aspects of the sales process and focuses on building long-term, value-based customer relationships that enable achievement of the hotel’s’ sales objectives.
• Interfaces with regional marketing communications for regional and national promotions pull through.
• Performs other duties, as assigned, to meet business needs.
Building Successful Relationships
• Develops strong partnerships with local organizations to further increase brand/product awareness.
• Develops and manages internal key stakeholder relationships.
• Develops strong community and public relations by maintaining property participation in local, regional and national tradeshows and client events.
• Executes exemplary customer service to drive customer satisfaction and loyalty by assisting the customer and monitoring their satisfaction before and during their program/event.
• Serves the customer by understanding their needs and recommending the appropriate features and services that best meet their needs and exceed their expectations, while building a relationship and loyalty to Marriott.
• Gains understanding of the hotel’s primary target customer and service expectations; serves the customer by understanding their business, business issues and concerns, to offer better business solution both prior to, and during the program/event.
Leadership
• Functions as the leader of the property’s sales department for properties with bookings over 300 peak rooms and significant local catering revenue.
• Develops sales goals and strategies and verifies alignment with the brand business strategy.
• Executes the sales strategy in order to meet individual booking goals for both self and staff.
• Coaches leaders of revenue generating departments in developing effective revenue strategies and setting aggressive goals that will drive the property's financial performance.
• Verifies Sales team understands and is leveraging Marriott International (MI) demand engines to full potential.
• Works with Human Resources, Engineering and Loss Prevention to monitor compliance with local, state and federal regulations and/or union requirements.
• Partners with Human Resources to attract, develop and retain the right people in order to support the strategic priorities of the market.
• Creates effective structures, processes, jobs and performance management systems are in place.
• Sets goals and expectations for direct reports using the Leadership Performance Process (LPP), aligns performance and rewards, addresses performance issues and holds staff accountable for successful results.
• Forecasts talent needs and manages talent acquisition strategy with Human Resources (HR) to minimize lost time due to turnover.
• Maintains an active list of the competition’s best sales people and executes a recruitment and acquisition plan with HR.
• Supports tools and training resources to educate sales associates on winning catering solutions.
• Champions leadership development and workforce planning priorities by assessing, selecting, retaining and developing diverse, high-caliber talent that can lead the organization today and strengthen the leadership bench for the future; continues to upgrade the sales & marketing talent; works with HR to anticipate future talent needs based on business growth plans.
• Identifies, trains and mentors group sales associates; utilizes all available on the job training tools for associates.
• Transfers functional knowledge and develops group sales skills of other discipline managers.
• Provides day to day leadership to sales associates to achieve property sales objectives with overall responsibility for achieving booking goals and property revenues.
• Evaluates the property’s participation in the various sales channels (e.g., Area Sales, Group Sales within the Sales Office, electronic lead channels, etc.) and develops strong working relationships to proactively position and market the property.
• Manages the marketing budget to enable development of property specific campaigns, promotions and collateral to drive revenue and meet property objectives.
At Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated. Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.
When you join the Sheraton family, you become a member of its global community. We’ve been a place to gather and connect since 1937. At Sheraton, associates create a sense of belonging in more than 400 communities around the world. We invite, we welcome, and we connect guests through engaging experiences and thoughtful service. If you’re a team player who is excited to deliver a meaningful guest experience, we encourage you to explore your next career opportunity with Sheraton. Join us on our mission to be ‘The World’s Gathering Place’. In joining Sheraton Hotels & Resorts, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

title: Accountant
description:
Just imagine your future with us…
At Aurecon we see the future through a very different lens. Do you?
Innovation, eminence and digital are at the heart of everything we do. Are you excited about the future?
Are you driven by the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and complex projects around the world and to learn from the best? We are.
Diversity is at the core of everything we do. We work together to create a culture based on respect, trust and inclusiveness. Our differences are what fuel our creativity.
What will you do?
We know the work we do is vital in assisting Aurecon's business globally. Here are the key things you will do to ‘bring ideas to life’.
Responsible to preparation of Bank Reconciliation for the group, support to Intercompany sweep, and month end journals as support to AU Finance
Preparation of journal entries such as allocations, intercompany interest, accruals, adhoc Journals as part of BAU.
Assist to prepare regular monthly balance sheet account reconciliations with supporting analysis and schedules
Assist in all internal and external audit engagements such as submission of the required schedules, reports and supporting documents.
Involves in Process improvements and to support the team on some other tasks
Ensure adherence to company policies and guidelines and to assist in documentation and monitoring of internal controls.
Assistance to Half Year and Fiscal Year End Audited Financial Statement preparation including board papers.
Other ad-hoc tasks that may be assigned by the Group Accounting Team Lead, Finance Manager (PH, ANZ and Group Accounting Head.
What can you bring to the team?
Firstly, strong sense of responsibility, flexibility, and adaptability to varying request. Demonstrate excellent time management and organizational skills. And as part of a new team, you will have the opportunity to shape this role and have input into how we evolve it over time to WOW our employees and make an even bigger impact on the world.
You will also need the following:
Qualifications
3+ years of experience in a similar role or general accounting/finance, banking, taxation experience is an advantage
Has auditing background/experience
Relevant Accounting qualification required and/or part way through studying CPA or CA qualification is an advantage
Good oral/written communication skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint
With dept experience in various ERP Accounting System especially with Workday Finance
Our Aurecon Attributes describe the types of people we bring together for clients. We don’t expect you to have all eight of the attributes, but one that is unique to you.
Finally, we value that each of our team members brings something different to Aurecon. We look for people who have had a broad range of experiences throughout their career and can demonstrate how they have worked as part of a team to bring ideas to life. Does that sound like you?
About us
We’ve re-imagined engineering.
Aurecon is an engineering and infrastructure advisory company, but not as you know it!
For a start, our clients’ ideas drive what we do. Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world’s most complex challenges. And through a range of unique creative processes and skills, we work to re-imagine, shape and design a better future.
We listen deeply and intently, which helps us see opportunities, possibilities and potential that others can’t. Think engineering. Think again.
Want to know more?
You can learn more about what it’s like to work at Aurecon by visiting the careers section of our website.
If you are intrigued or excited by what you have read, then we want to hear from you. Apply now!

title: UNIQLO Management Candidate (Management Trainee)
description:

With a 360° approach, the UMC program ensures that candidates are fully equipped with the tools and knowledge needed to excel as retail leaders. title: Work from Home Freedom!!
description:
Unlock Your Potential with The Freedom Geek!
Are you tired of the daily commute? Do you crave a career that offers flexibility and growth? Look no further! We're seeking enthusiastic individuals to join our dynamic team for a remote, home-based adventure. Say goodbye to the mundane and hello to a thriving career with us!

Job Highlights:
Work from Home: Enjoy the comfort and convenience of working remotely.
Flexible Hours: Set your own schedule and embrace true work-life balance.
Global Client Exposure: Work directly with English-speaking business owners worldwide.
Part-Time or Full-Time: Choose the work arrangement that suits you best.
Independent Contractor: You manage your own taxes and business responsibilities - this is not an employment role.

About Us:
Welcome to The Freedom Geek, where we connect skilled Filipino professionals with entrepreneurs across the globe. Headquartered in London, we provide top-notch virtual assistant services to help clients grow their businesses. As an independent contractor, you’ll directly contribute to clients’ success while enjoying the freedom and flexibility of running your own professional services business.

This Opportunity is for You If You Want…
To explore the world of remote work as a self-employed professional.
To reclaim your time from the daily commute.
More work-life balance in a home-based career.
To learn new skills and leverage your existing expertise.
To make a real impact on clients’ businesses.
To start immediately or in the near future.

This Opportunity is NOT for You If…
You’re not willing to take responsibility for your own work.
You struggle with self-discipline or organization.
You’re not open to learning new things.
You prefer the structure of a traditional employer rather than the independence of contractor work.

The Role
As an independent contractor, you’ll work directly with our overseas clients to support their operations and achieve their goals. You’ll handle a variety of tasks with minimal supervision, taking full ownership of your work. This is a long-term opportunity with room for personal and professional growth as you help clients thrive globally.

Tasks Could Include:
Providing exceptional customer support for clients.
Building and maintaining contact databases.
Managing emails and communications efficiently.
Conducting research and generating leads for clients.
Managing social media tasks, including content creation and audience engagement.
Coordinating calendars and booking appointments.
Assisting with diary management, administrative tasks, data entry, and bookkeeping.
Handling various research or project-based tasks as needed.
Occasionally assisting with personal errands for clients when requested.

Skills Required
Excellent organizational and administrative skills.
Strong written and verbal English.
Interest in social media is a plus, but not essential.
Exceptional attention to detail.
A proactive and enthusiastic self-starter.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.
Adaptability to change.

Additional Requirements
Stable 10mbps internet connection with backup.
Working computer/laptop (Minimum: Intel i5 or equivalent, 8GB RAM).
Minimal to no power outages in your area.

Important Reminder
This is a self-employed independent contractor opportunity. You are responsible for your own taxes and compliance with Philippine law. 

GOOD LUCK!
Join us on this exciting journey, and take charge of your future with flexibility, independence, and global client opportunities!

title: Property & Guest Relations Officer (Virtual Assistant) | WFH
description:
Creating Unforgettable Escapes, One Stay at a Time
Our client is a premier real estate and hospitality group known for managing some of Australia's most stunning vacation properties. Combining modern technology with personalized guest care, they specialize in creating seamless short-term rental experiences. From luxurious getaways to boutique residences, they redefine how property owners and travelers connect-through genuine hospitality, smart systems, and a passion for service excellence.
Job Description
As a Property & Guest Relations Officer, you'll handle daily property operations, guest communication, and reservation management for luxury stays. From coordinating cleans to perfecting guest experiences, you'll play a key role in keeping every booking, property, and owner relationship running seamlessly.
Job Overview
Employment type: Full-time
Shift: Day Shift, Weekends Off
Work setup: Work From Home / Hybrid
Exciting Perks Await!
Day 1 HMO coverage with free dependent
Competitive Salary Package
Permanent WFH/Hybrid work arrangement
Prime office location in Makati (Easy access to MRT stations, restaurants, and banks)
Day shift schedule
Fixed weekends off
Salary Advance Program through our banking partner (Eligibility and approval subject to bank assessment. Available to account holders with minimum of 6 months company tenure.)
Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization
Standard government and Emapta benefits
Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek
Minimum of 2 years of experience in property management, hospitality operations, or administrative support
Proficient in Homhero, RMS, and major booking platforms (Airbnb, Booking.com, VRBO), with basic knowledge of invoicing and financial coordination
Strong organizational and communication skills, able to manage reservations, maintenance coordination, and guest or owner correspondence
Detail-oriented, proactive, and adaptable to new systems and processes such as Resly and other operational tools
Your Daily Tasks
Dashboard
Manage daily arrivals, charge bonds, update clean status, validate guest lists, and prepare arrival access information.
Send manual arrival access info for early check-ins.
Reservations List and Chart
Enter and receive guest reservations, modifications, payments, and reservation details.
Registrations
Validate online guest registrations, check IDs and credit cards, and request updated ID stickers for outdated addresses.
Request physical credit card copies if only digital versions are provided.
Cleaning
Add cleaners and cleaner teams; check pending cleans.
Coordinate refresh cleans and cleaner concerns through WhatsApp.
Review cleaning history for performance and create cleaner reviews.
Maintenance
Coordinate maintenance issues with Property Managers.
Delete or complete maintenance items after resolution.
Organize third-party contacts for maintenance and send work orders as required.
Contacts
Import owner statements after each payment run.
Review and download statements as needed.
Communicate with owners for bulk emails or follow-ups.
Correspondence
Create, modify, and implement scheduled templates for guests and owners.
Invoice Scanning
Upload, enter, and approve all invoices from third parties, cleaners, etc.
Double-check invoices before approval, ensuring they are ready one day before the 1st and 15th payment runs.
Booking Engine
Create and modify listings, set property availability, and prepare packages before going live.
Modify packages and create special discounts when necessary.
Booking Engine Availability
Set base rates, adjust rates and minimum stays, and configure stop-sells or closed-to-arrival settings as requested by Property Managers or owners.
Property Management
Complete property details before going live.
Create compendiums, custom fields, and check-in notes for each property.
Channel Management
Check bulk-connected account settings and ensure synchronization across platforms.
Other Settings
Import new sundries from RMS as needed.
Help Centre
Communicate with Homhero Live Agents for technical or process support.
Process of Entering a Property
Manage the entire workflow from entering property details to creating listings and publishing them live.
Managing Escapes Listing Platforms
Oversee listings across Airbnb, Booking.com, VRBO, and Marriott.
Answer guest questions and concerns across all platforms.
Manage listings, apply discounts, process cancellations and modifications, and contact platform support as necessary.
Set up Booking.com finance settings.
Create or respond to guest reviews and feedback.
Email Management
Manage Escapes Concierge and Personal Belle email accounts.
Serve as the main person managing the client inbox.
Check and action all emails daily, forwarding those that need Property Manager assistance.
Respond to guests, owners, third parties, and inquiries via email.
Forward Airbnb payouts to Realplus daily to ensure correct booking allocation.
Allocate resolution payouts for refunds or host cancellations as necessary.
Financials
Action items in the daily trust reports.
Manage outstanding balances, charge due guests, and handle deposits (most payments are automated).
Coordinate with Tarsh/Licensee and Realplus regarding payments, refund requests, or adjustments.
RMS Tasks
Enter new properties and owners for Escapes.
Enter new sundries and third-party information.
Make necessary modifications to guest reservations.
Check owner folios, Z Cleaning funds, and account balances.
Handle the full process of archiving properties.
Realhub/Realbase Tasks
Create or edit property compendiums.
Design social media templates such as guest reviews and "Escape of the Week" features (occasionally assisting the marketing team).
Marketing / Social Media Tasks
Create social media tiles in Canva.
Create and schedule posts, engage on Instagram and Facebook for Escapes pages (supporting the marketing team as needed).
Design Belle Escapes invoices in Canva upon guest request.
Create other marketing materials in Canva as requested by Property Managers.
Residential Tasks
Enter lease appraisal requests in Agentbox.
Enter property and owner details in PME after handover (data entry).
Save handovers, lease appraisals, and management agreements in SharePoint, creating folders when not yet set up.
Send daily PME Outbox emails and SMS at 5 PM.
Handle other Property Manager requests (Canva edits, admin assistance, etc.).
Resly Preparation and Onboarding Tasks
Complete onboarding tasks assigned by the Onboarding Manager for the transition to Resly.
Participate in ongoing training and preparation for the November 6, 2025 system go-live.
Other Assistance
Provide additional administrative and operational support to Property Managers and Receptionists as needed.

description:

Role Purpose: The Strata Assistant plays a critical role in supporting the management and operation of strata properties, providing day to day support to Strata Managers, ensuring services are provided in accordance with company policies and relevant legislation. The role includes drafting and sending breach notices, remedial work letters, and other communications to clients and contractors, assisting with maintenance, preparing management documents, and supporting meetings. The Strata Assistant also provides essential support in managing a strata portfolio, liaising with owners, tenants, and contractors, and ensuring compliance with the Strata Schemes Management Act and other regulations. It is not the intention of the position description to limit the scope or accountabilities of the position but to highlight the most important aspects of the position. The aspects mentioned herein may be altered in accordance with the changing requirements of the role.

Key Areas of Accountability Area Activities/Tasks Strata Portfolio Management Assistance • Assist in the management of the Strata Portfolio in accordance with company policies and procedures. • Maintain all records and filing in accordance with relevant Acts, including the Strata Schemes Management Act. Correspondence & Documentation • Draft and send breach notices, remedial work letters, and other communications in a timely and accurate manner. • Prepare and issue Notice to Comply documents for Owners Corporations. • Generate and issue Section 184 Certificates. • Issue maintenance orders on behalf of Owners Corporations. • Prepare management agency agreements and assist in setting up new buildings. Client & Stakeholder Inquiries • Respond to client inquiries via phone, email, or in person, providing professional and efficient customer service. • Assist with maintenance of common property, including addressing complaints, general requests, maintenance issues, emergency repairs, etc. • Build and maintain strong relationships with owners, tenants, contractors, and other stakeholders. Repairs, Maintenance & Quotations • Coordinate repairs and maintenance activities, ensuring work orders are clear, precise, and completed on time. • Request quotations on behalf of Owners Corporations for required work and services. • Liaise with contractors and suppliers to ensure repairs and services meet the required standards. Meeting Support • Assist in the preparation and organisation of meetings, including attendance, vote counting, and minute-taking. • On rare occasions, the role may require attendance at meetings outside of regular office hours. • Chair meetings when a Strata Manager is not available, ensuring that all decisions are accurately recorded and actions are taken

Financial Assistance • Assist with the payment of invoices to tradespeople, with committee and manager’s approval. Functional Requirements & Location: Functional Must have capacity to meet the physical demands of the role, including but not limited to: • Regular sitting, standing and walking. • Able to navigate stairs, including walking up and down as required. • Perform basic housekeeping tasks such as bending, reaching, squatting, and lifting. Location The location of this position may change based on business needs. Neighbourly reserves the right to modify the work location or require employees to work from different locations or remotely, as determined by the Neighbourly’s operational requirements. Employees will be notified of any significant changes to the location in a timely manner

Essential Requirements
Experience • Previous experience dealing directly with clients, addressing inquiries, and providing high-level customer service. Communication Skills • Written Communication: Drafting clear and professional correspondence and documentation. • Verbal Communication: Strong phone and face-to-face communication skills Key Attributes • Ethical Integrity: Adherence to high ethical standards, maintaining confidentiality and compliance with all relevant laws and company policies. • Organisational Skills: Exceptional ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritise responsibilities, and ensure all deadlines are met. • Attention to Detail: Meticulous in reviewing documents, ensuring accuracy in record-keeping, and providing precise communications. • Problem Solving: Proactive in identifying and addressing issues, offering effective solutions to challenges as they arise. • Customer Focused: A strong commitment to providing excellent service and building lasting relationships with clients and contractors. • Adaptability: Able to manage change and

WHAT WE VALUE

·     Laugh and Learn: We don’t take ourselves too seriously, just our results.

Come for a career, stay for the fun!

title: Virtual Assistant / office administrator for a Plumber (Remote)
description:
Company Overview
WPG Plumbing Group is your trusted partner for all plumbing, gas, heating, and cooling needs in Melbourne’s Western Suburbs and beyond. Founded in 2019 by Andrew Forder, a seasoned plumber with over 17 years of experience, WPG Plumbing Group is committed to delivering reliability, customer satisfaction, and unparalleled quality of work. We are redefining the plumbing industry by setting new benchmarks for service excellence.
Website: https://www.wpgplumbing.com.au/
About the Role
We are seeking a skilled and proactive Virtual Assistant / Office Administrator based in the Philippines to provide high-level remote support to the Director of WPG Plumbing Group. The ideal candidate will also contribute to marketing activities and other business support tasks. This role is ideal for someone with strong administrative capabilities, an eye for marketing, and a passion for helping businesses grow.
The role is split approximately as follows:
50% Executive Assistant & Administration
30% Marketing Support
20% Other Business Support Tasks
You will work closely with the business owner, supporting day-to-day operations and strategic initiatives. Flexibility, attention to detail, and a proactive approach are key to success in this role.
This role is being recruited by Clarke Point, a premier Singapore-based agency dedicated to delivering global recruitment and staffing solutions, (www.clarkepoint.com) and is for a long-term, full-time Independent Contractor.
Key responsibilities
Executive Assistant & Administrative Support (50%)
Calendar and diary management for the Director
Managing and responding to emails on behalf of the Director
Coordinating meetings, appointments, and events
Data entry, document formatting, and preparation of reports
Maintaining digital filing systems
Drafting professional correspondence and internal communications
Research and documentation tasks as required
Support with supplier and subcontractor communications
Marketing Support (30%)
Assisting with social media content creation and scheduling
Coordinating and drafting email campaigns
Updating website content and blog posts (basic CMS or WordPress knowledge helpful)
Monitoring and reporting on digital marketing performance
Assisting with online reviews and reputation management
Supporting marketing campaigns and promotions
General Business Support (20%)
Supporting job management system updates (e.g. logging jobs or job progress)
Preparing simple templates, quotes, or invoices as directed
Liaising with admin or operational team members
Assistance with CRM data management and lead tracking
Other ad hoc tasks as required by the Director
Mandatory Criteria
Experience working as an Independent Contractor for an Australian, American or similar client
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in an Executive Assistant or virtual assistant role
Excellent written and spoken English (clear communication essential)
Strong organisational and time management skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and Google Workspace
Experience using remote working tools such as Zoom, Slack, Trello, Asana, or similar
Social media management experience for a business or brand
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities independently
Nice-to-Haves
Experience in the plumbing, trades, or construction industry
Familiarity with basic graphic design tools (e.g. Canva)
Understanding of Australian business culture
Experience working with small businesses or trades professionals
Comfort using CRMs, job scheduling software, or quoting/invoicing platforms
Ideal Personality Attributes for Success
Proactive and resourceful
Confident communicator with a positive attitude
Highly organised with excellent attention to detail
Reliable, trustworthy, and respectful of confidentiality
Willing to learn and adapt to a dynamic environment
Committed to helping the business grow and succeed
Remote Work Setup Requirements
To ensure a smooth and professional remote working experience, candidates must have the following:
Quiet and Dedicated Home Office Setup – 
Professional and distraction-free workspace
Ergonomic chair and desk recommended
Laptop or Desktop Computer – Minimum specifications:
Intel i5 or AMD Ryzen 5 processor (or better)
At least 8GB RAM
Windows 10 or macOS 11 and above
Stable Internet Connection – Minimum speed of 25 Mbps (download/upload)
Wired (LAN) connection for stability is preferred
Backup internet source (e.g., pocket Wi-Fi or mobile hotspot) is a plus
Clear Audio Equipment –
Noise-cancelling headset with built-in microphone
Clear audio for calls and video meetings
Working Webcam – Required for virtual meetings and team check-ins
Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) or access to a backup power source
Especially important for areas prone to power outages
Up-to-date Antivirus or Security Software – To protect company and client data
Compensation Package
This role is for a long-term, full-time Independent Contractor with the following additional perks:
Vacation Leave: 12 days per year, granted upon successful completion of the probation period.
Sick Leave: 6 days per year, available annually.
Health Insurance Allowance: ₱2,500 per month provided toward family health insurance after the probation period.
Flexible Work Environment: Fully remote, Monday to Friday, aligned with Australian business hours.
WPG Plumbing is based in Melbourne, Australia, thus the work hours will follow Melbourne time (GMT +10) with some flexibility.
How to Apply
For your application to be considered, please submit the following:
Your resume
A short cover letter outlining your suitability for this role. Your cover letter must include the word “CLARKE” in capital letters and a summary of your experience working as a full-time independent contractor or online freelancer.

title: Flight Specialist
description:
FLIGHT SPECIALIST

Job Type: Full time
Location: Manila Remote/Hybrid 
Reporting to: Flights Team Lead
Job Purpose: 
We are seeking a customer-focused and detail-oriented Flight Specialist to join our team. As a Flight Specialist, you will play a critical role in providing exceptional customer service to our passengers, ensuring their travel arrangements are seamless and efficient.
What will be your key responsibilities?   
Ticket Sales and Reservations:
Assist passengers with booking flights, selecting seats, and managing their travel itineraries.
Process ticket purchases, payments, and refunds.
Manage reservation changes, cancellations, and upgrades.
Queue Management:
Manage and prioritize customer requests within a queue system.
Respond to inquiries and requests in a timely and efficient manner.
Ensure all customer requests are addressed and resolved promptly.
Customer Service:
Provide personalized and efficient customer service, resolving inquiries and addressing passenger concerns.
Handle customer complaints and escalate issues as needed.
Ensure a positive and memorable travel experience for all passengers.
Fare and Routing Knowledge:
Stay updated on fare structures, special offers, and routing options.
Provide accurate and comprehensive information to passengers regarding flight options and pricing.
System Proficiency:
Be proficient in using reservation systems, ticketing software, and other relevant tools.
Maintain accurate records of passenger information and travel details.
Communication and Collaboration:
Communicate effectively with passengers, colleagues, and other departments.
Work collaboratively with other teams to ensure a smooth and efficient passenger experience.
What are we looking for?
Candidates must have 2 years experience in Flights customer service or similar function
Candidates must have excellent verbal & written English communication skills
Candidates must have an  In-depth knowledge of airfares and routing
Candidates must have intensive experience with GDS 
Candidates must have strong time management and organizational skills
Candidates must have proficiency in efficient time management and adept task prioritization
What can you expect from Goway?
Imagine working for a company where your career feels like an adventure. At Goway, you’ll join a global community that supports one another:
We offer a competitive salary accompanied by performance incentives, and we place real importance on time away from work, such as paid personal days for when life calls for them and your birthday off each year.
Your future matters to us, so we match your RRSP contributions and provide comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage.
Our commitment to professional growth means you’ll have access to continuous learning and industry-leading training that keeps you at the forefront of travel innovation.
Travel is in our DNA, so you’ll enjoy exclusive perks and discounts on worldwide getaways.
Since we operate across Toronto, Vancouver, Los Angeles, Manila, Sydney, and beyond, you’ll collaborate across cultures and shape a career path that reflects your ambitions.
Goway is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate differences and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace for everyone. We appreciate every applicant’s interest. Please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
How to Apply: 
If this role feels like your next step, click "Apply Now" to create your profile, upload your CV, and share a few details about yourself. Our talent team reviews every application, and if your experience aligns with our needs, we will reach out to set up the next step.
Recruitment scams & fraud warning:
Please be aware of any suspicious emails or WhatsApp activity from individuals pretending to be recruiters or senior personnel at Goway Travel. We will never ask you to install an app during the recruitment process. If you receive a message of this nature, please ignore it and report it to Goway.
About Goway
Founded in Toronto in 1970 by Australian economist Bruce Hodge, Goway has evolved from a one-person dream into a family-owned global leader in tailor-made travel. With our headquarters in Toronto and hubs in Vancouver, Los Angeles, Sydney, and Manila, our team of over 700 talented employees designs travel experiences in more than 115 countries across all seven continents. We’re united by a passion for travel and are committed to doing the right thing: supporting diversity, equity, inclusion, and sustainable tourism that enriches local communities. Whether working remotely or side by side in one of our offices, we operate as one forward-thinking team, transforming wanderlust into life-changing adventures for our fellow Globetrotters. Discover more at goway.com

title: Remote Desktop Support Specialist; URGENT!;
description:
Remote Desktop Support Specialist

Job Summary:
The Remote Desktop Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical assistance and support to end-users experiencing issues with their desktop systems, software, and related technologies. This role involves troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving technical problems remotely, ensuring minimal downtime and optimal performance for users. The specialist will also assist in the setup, configuration, and maintenance of desktop systems and software, as well as provide guidance and training to users as needed.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Technical Support:
  - Provide remote technical support to end-users for desktop hardware, software, and network-related issues.
  - Diagnose and troubleshoot technical problems, including but not limited to operating system errors, software malfunctions, and hardware failures.
  - Resolve issues related to email, internet connectivity, and other desktop applications.

2. System Configuration and Maintenance:
  - Assist in the setup, configuration, and maintenance of desktop systems, including operating systems, software applications, and peripheral devices.
  - Perform remote installations, upgrades, and patches to ensure systems are up-to-date and secure.
  - Monitor system performance and implement solutions to optimize functionality.

3. User Assistance and Training:
  - Guide users through step-by-step solutions, either over the phone, via email, or through remote desktop software.
  - Provide training and support to users on new software, hardware, and IT policies.
  - Create and maintain user documentation and FAQs to assist with common issues.

4. Incident Management:
  - Log and track support requests using a ticketing system, ensuring timely resolution and follow-up.
  - Escalate complex issues to higher-level support teams or vendors as necessary.
  - Maintain detailed records of issues, resolutions, and user interactions.

5. Security and Compliance:
  - Ensure all desktop systems comply with company security policies and standards.
  - Implement and enforce data security measures, including antivirus software and firewalls.
  - Assist in the management of user accounts, permissions, and access controls.
Qualifications:

Education:
 - Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.

Experience:
 - Proven experience in a desktop support or technical support role, preferably in a remote capacity.
 - Familiarity with remote desktop tools and support software (e.g., TeamViewer, Remote Desktop Connection).

Technical Skills:
 - Proficient in Windows and macOS operating systems.
 - Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and other common desktop applications.
 - Understanding of networking concepts, including TCP/IP, DNS, and DHCP.
 - Experience with Active Directory and user account management.
 - Basic knowledge of hardware components and troubleshooting techniques.

-Soft Skills:
 - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users.
 - Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
 - Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote work environment.
 - Customer-focused with a commitment to providing high-quality support.

Work Environment:
- This role may require working in 24/7 shifts, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

title: Administrative Assistant (Virtual Assistant) | Work Onsite-Ortigas
description:
ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT (VIRTUAL ASST)
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT (VIRTUAL ASST)?
The Administration Officer is responsible for providing day-to-day administrative and compliance support to ensure smooth business operations. This role manages staff onboarding, travel and accommodation bookings, inbox coordination, and documentation, while supporting vendor compliance and project mobilisation. The Administration Officer also ensures accurate job entry, purchase orders, and work orders are maintained within company systems.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Staff Onboarding & Compliance
● Coordinate onboarding of new staff, including inductions, training documentation, and credential checks.
● Maintain accurate employee records and compliance documentation.
● Support vendor compliance processes by supplying and tracking required documents.
Travel, Accommodation & Mobilisation
● Book flights, accommodation, and vehicle hire for staff mobilisation to site.
● Prepare mobilisation packs, including permits, tickets, and required paperwork.
● Maintain scheduling of accommodation and housing allocations.
Office & Inbox Management
● Manage the central company inbox, triaging and responding to emails in a timely manner.
● File, organise, and distribute documents to relevant staff.
● Support internal communication and ensure accurate document version control.
Job & Work Order Management
● Enter new jobs into company systems and ensure information is accurate.
● Prepare and issue purchase orders and work orders.
● Track the status of POs, jobs, and compliance documents to keep records up to date.
Vendor & Client Support
● Respond to vendor enquiries relating to administration and compliance requirements.
● Provide requested documents promptly to clients and stakeholders.
● Assist the Managing Director and Operations Manager in preparing client-facing documentation.
Delegations & Exclusions
Delegations (Owns):
● Day-to-day administration tasks, including onboarding, bookings, and document management.
● Job entry into systems, issuing work orders and purchase orders.
● Inbox management and vendor compliance submissions. Supports:
● Managing Director by ensuring vendor and client compliance requirements are met.
● Operations Manager by preparing mobilisation packs, bookings, and job documentation.
● Accounts Officer by providing administrative support on timesheets, POs, and vendor information. Exclusions (Retained by Managing Director):
● Final approval of contracts, financial commitments, and vendor agreements.
● Strategic workforce planning, housing policy, and long-term resource allocations.
● Client relationship management and commercial negotiations.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
● Strong organisational and coordination skills.
● Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
● Clear written and verbal communication skills.
● Accuracy and attention to detail in data entry and documentation.
● Proficiency with office software, booking systems, and document management platforms.
● Professional, reliable, and proactive approach to supporting operations.
● Ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive staff and vendor information.
Role type
Administration,

description:

Accodal is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented HR & Recruitment Software Product Manager based in the Philippines to sit at the intersection of people operations and product. Midday: jumping on calls or chats with clients, recruiters, and HR users to troubleshoot issues, provide HR/recruitment support, and capture feedback about what’s working (and what’s not).
Afternoon: validating fixes and new features, updating documentation, and sharing structured feedback with engineering and design to drive the next iteration.
This position is ideal for someone who enjoys blending people operations with product thinking—using administrative precision, analytical skills, and empathy for users to improve how the organization operates.

Key Responsibilities
HR, Recruitment & Client Support (User Discovery)
Assist in end-to-end HR and recruitment operations including onboarding, documentation, benefits administration, and offboarding—so you deeply understand user workflows.
Serve as a key point of contact for client inquiries, ensuring timely, professional, and accurate responses; escalate and triage issues effectively.
Support client onboarding and maintain smooth communication channels; capture and categorize client/user feedback for product discovery.
Maintain client documentation and support materials to ensure consistent service quality and up-to-date guidance.
Product & Systems Coordination
Collaborate with the software development team to plan projects, define requirements, and maintain a prioritized backlog in our PM system.
Provide structured feedback on system usability, employee/candidate interfaces, and client-facing workflows; turn feedback into clear user stories and acceptance criteria.
Identify recurring operational pain points and recommend improvements through automation, UX enhancements, or process redesign.
Test and review HR/recruitment automation tools; perform UAT and coordinate sign-off with stakeholders.
Monitor and document process and product performance metrics (e.g., time-to-hire, onboarding cycle time, support resolution time) to support continuous improvement.
Cross-Team Collaboration
Act as a bridge among HR, Recruitment, Finance, Customer Support, and Tech—ensuring user needs are translated into actionable system improvements.
Coordinate change management: release notes, training sessions, short loom/video walkthroughs, and help-center updates.
Track feedback loops end-to-end: from issue intake → prioritization → delivery → validation → measurable outcomes.
Compliance and Documentation
Ensure consistent application of company policies, procedures, and government regulations in product and process design.
Maintain accurate and organized digital filing systems for HR-related documentation.
Support internal audits and data accuracy checks across HR and operations systems.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, Psychology, Information Systems, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in HR operations and/or Recruitment and hands-on work with HR tech/SaaS tools (product, ops, or admin capacity).
Familiarity with Philippine labor laws and compliance requirements (SSS, PhilHealth, Pag-IBIG, BIR, etc.).
Strong organizational and communication skills with high attention to detail; comfortable facilitating calls and synthesizing feedback.
Experience with HRIS platforms such as Sprout or similar tools; exposure to ATS/CRM workflows is a plus.
Comfortable working with digital workflows, AI/automation tools, and data-driven reporting; basic proficiency with spreadsheets and analytics.
Bonus:
experience writing user stories/acceptance criteria, doing UAT, or using tools like Figma for light prototyping.
Demonstrated ability to work independently in a remote environment and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Success Metrics (What Good Looks Like)
Reduced support volume or faster resolution times for common user issues.
Measurable improvements in key HR/recruitment cycle times (e.g., onboarding completion, time-to-hire).
High adoption and satisfaction scores on released features (validated via surveys or usage analytics).
Clear, consistent documentation and release communication that reduces confusion and rework.
Location: Philippines (remote WFH).
Schedule: PH 6am shift start 
If you’re passionate about improving HR and recruitment through better software and you love turning user feedback into real product outcomes let’s talk.

title: Senior Administrator
description:
About Us
We’re a small consulting team that genuinely values trust, accountability, and quality. Everyone here is a specialist in their own space, and we all play a part in delivering great outcomes for our clients. We don’t micromanage — we set clear goals, follow strong processes, and trust people to take ownership and deliver work they’re proud of.
The Role
We’re looking for a highly organised, detail-driven Senior Administrator to support our IT consulting operations. You’ll be the steady hand behind the scenes — managing workflows, verifying reports, maintaining documentation, and ensuring that everything runs smoothly across multiple projects.
If you thrive on structure, precision, and process, and you like being the person who keeps everything on track, this is a role where your contribution truly matters.
What You’ll Do
Administrative & Project Support
Manage service tickets (e.g. via ServiceNow) and update associated records and logs.
Prepare meeting agendas, take minutes, and track action items to completion.
Monitor shared project inboxes to ensure timely responses, task allocation, and follow-ups related to technology deployments.
Following Documented Procedures (Confluence)
Carry out daily tasks using documented procedures in Confluence.
Flag outdated or unclear processes and help keep documentation accurate.
Ensure new documentation is created in a structured, easy-to-follow way.
Task & Workflow Management (ClickUp)
Use ClickUp to manage, track, and update tasks and deliverables.
Collaborate with team members through task comments, attachments, and progress tracking.
Maintain clean and consistent ClickUp folders, templates, and task structures.
Quality Assurance & Reporting
Review reports, Excel exports, and Power BI dashboards for completeness and accuracy.
Identify anomalies, formatting issues, and inconsistencies before client delivery.
Maintain checklists or logs of quality reviews to ensure every deliverable meets internal standards.
Operational & Process Support
Suggest and implement small improvements to administrative workflows.
Maintain internal registers (assets, compliance trackers, supplier logs, etc.).
Uphold naming conventions and documentation standards across the business.
Procurement & Supplier Coordination
Assist in sourcing and managing suppliers for branded merchandise and promotional items.
Track quotes, orders, and delivery timelines, ensuring they meet internal quality and branding requirements.
What Makes You a Great Fit
5+ years of experience in administrative or operational roles within IT, consulting, or data-heavy environments.
Exceptional attention to detail, especially when reviewing large volumes of data or reports.
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel (filters, pivot tables, formulas).
Experience checking Power BI or similar dashboards for accuracy and presentation.
Comfortable using ClickUp (or Asana/Jira) for task management and Confluence for documentation.
Strong written and verbal English communication skills — you can manage inboxes, clarify requests, and communicate clearly with clients and internal teams.
Naturally proactive — if you’ve finished your tasks, you look for what’s next.
Confident in solving problems independently, but collaborative when it counts.
Familiarity with IT or cybersecurity terminology is a plus.
Why You’ll Love Working With Us
We trust you to own your work — no micromanagement, just clear expectations.
Flexible remote setup with structure and support when you need it.
Exposure to a variety of IT and cybersecurity projects, where no two weeks are quite the same.
Opportunities to expand your skills — project coordination, reporting, systems, and more — without getting boxed into one fixed role.
Join a close-knit, professional team that values quality, process, and personal growth.
