title: Production/Application Support Lead
company: ICAP Management Services Ltd, Philippine Branch
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
The TP ICAP Group is a world leading provider of market infrastructure.
Our purpose is to provide clients with access to global financial and commodities markets, improving price discovery, liquidity, and distribution of data, through responsible and innovative solutions.
Through our people and technology, we connect clients to superior liquidity and data solutions.
The Group is home to a stable of premium brands. Collectively, TP ICAP is the largest interdealer broker in the world by revenue, the number one Energy & Commodities broker in the world, the world’s leading provider of OTC data, and an award winning all-to-all trading platform.
The Group operates from more than 60 offices in 27 countries.  We are 5,300 people strong.  We work as one to achieve our vision of being the world’s most trusted, innovative, liquidity and data solutions specialist.

Role Overview
This is an exciting opportunity to join a team at the forefront of transformation. As the Manila Production Lead, this role will play a pivotal role in reshaping how Production aligns with our business lines – driving service excellence and operational agility. This is a unique opportunity to lead structural change within our Manila office, setting the tone for high-performing teams and becoming the local escalation point for critical production issues.
The current team provides Level 2 support for applications across TP ICAP, operating in a high-profile, business-facing capacity. This role engages directly with the core technologies that underpin TP ICAP’s position as a leader in electronic trading.
We are seeking a candidate with proven experience leading Level 2 support teams, combining strong technical expertise as well as leadership qualities that will help set the tone and culture of the team in Manila. This is a hands-on role, and familiarity with supporting distributed applications across both cloud and on-prem environments will be key to quickly becoming a trusted escalation point for both local and global teams.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills are essential, enabling you to build effective partnerships with global colleagues and foster solid relationships within the business. A passion for automation is highly desirable, particularly if you have a track record of using it to drive efficiency and optimise team performance.
Given the dynamic nature of the environment, flexibility around working hours is important, and some weekend work will be required.

Functional Role Responsibilities
Manage and lead Manila-based resources within the global Production function
Cater to installation requests coming from QA and Development groups that range from bug fixes, upgrades and enhancements of trading applications in accordance to established and documented baselines, policies and procedures.
Manage both Incident and Problem Management activities as well as Change
Monitor and administer all trading application functionality and the performance of system environment.
Act as escalation point from first line support that troubleshoot problems by responding to daily broker/trader application trouble call requests. Provide higher-level deep dive analysis to that of first line counterparts.
Manage the Application stack across non-production and production environments, working closely with the equivalent support teams within the EMEA and US regions. 
Write scripts using Shell, Perl, Powershell, Python or SQL to automate installation, monitoring and data capture to check the health of the system.
Create good quality documentation that describes application setup and procedure on how to accomplish a task (runbooks for installation procedures, remedies to known application issues and troubleshooting steps).
Actively engage and contribute to meetings and conference calls that discuss production issues, scheduled production change or upcoming projects.
Submit change control requests to document change in both non-production and production environments, proactively following-up status until completed.
Lead major projects and Incident calls that the team are involved in, fostering a culture of collaboration and continual improvement.
Ensure teams workloads are managed in-line with, and appropriate to, global team standards, policies and SLA’s.

Management Role Responsibilities
Lead and ensure that the teams achieve the behavioural objectives set by management.
Monitor and track the team’s key performance indicators.
Propose new operational plans, including targeted budgets, work allocations and staff forecasts
Responsible for driving the team to collaborate effectively with other teams and / or stakeholders  for more efficient business operations.
Developing learning roadmaps to support the professional development of the team essential to their core skills set.
Oversee and work with functional heads on recruitment and developing internal mobility opportunities for the team

Experience / Competences
Essential
Windows Server operating systems
Unix / Linux – Preferably power user level
SQL (T-SQL, SQL Server Management Services)
Working knowledge of networking tools (e.g. ssh, sftp, traceroute)
Shell Scripting (PowerShell, Bash, Perl)
Strong grasp of change management process
Demonstrate strong experience in Monitoring / Observability tooling
Strong grasp of ITIL based support process. Incident escalation etc Proven Team Management track record of 5 years plus in such a role

Desirable
Automation tools (Ansible, TFS, Jenkins)
Knowledge of HTML, Javascript and CSS preferred
Some experience with SQL language and Databases a major plus

Client Focused
Personable and engaging
Communicates effectively and efficiently to internal and external stakeholders
Build relationships and networks with both internally and externally wherever possible
Demonstrates strong customer focus
Demonstrates ability to work effectively with others
Constructively handles disagreements to reach a resolution
Ability to work with diverse groups/ personalities

Job Band & Level
Manager / 6

title: Global Service Desk - Service Delivery Manager
description:
Location: Taguig City, Philippines
Professional Area: Information Technology
Contract Type: Permanent
Professional Level: Experienced
Reporting to: Global Service Desk Director

Global Service Desk - Service Delivery Manager

The Global Service Desk (GSD) is responsible for providing frontline IT support to the JTI business. While operational services are outsourced to external service providers, the GSD sets performance targets and quality standards that align with JTI’s business needs, ensures service providers meet these targets, and drives the development of user experiences using the newest technologies and standard methodologies in service delivery.

The GSD Service Delivery Manager holds overall responsibility for IT support services delivered by the GSD to JTI teams within the European time zone, as well as for the quality of services provided by the European shift of the outsourced provider.

This role plays a key part in building and maintaining strong, collaborative partnerships with JTI business teams and IT management in the European time zone, ensuring that GSD services continue to evolve and adapt to meet the changing needs of the business.

As the GSD Service Delivery Manager in the area of D&IT, you will do the following:

1.) GSD Service Delivery: The GSD Service Delivery Manager ensures that IT support services provided to JTI users in the European time zone meet JTI GSD service standards, including SLA, KPI, and quality targets, and are delivered in full alignment with GSD processes. These services are primarily handled by the European shift teams based in the Manila and Pune hubs of an outsourced service organization, working in collaboration with other GSD hubs as needed. For the European shift of the outsourced provider, the role is responsible for organizing and maintaining effective operational controls, leading regular service delivery review sessions, and ensuring that service improvement and development programs are in place and delivered as agreed. The manager also conducts vital quality checks in line with the GSD Quality Framework, ensures that the provider’s staff meet the required GSD profile and level of expertise, and certifies provider agents for service readiness through the GSD University program

2.) Alignment with JTI Business demand in the European Timezone: Build and maintain strong relationships with business and IT management in the region to stay informed about business developments and understand the demand for GSD services. Ensure that services are adapted to meet the region’s actual needs in terms of support volume, scope, language, and other service requirements. Promote awareness of GSD services and strategy within the region, securing the support and engagement of both business and IT management to ensure alignment with organizational goals

3.) Contribution to the GSD Strategy and Development: Proactively contribute ideas to the strategic development of GSD, with a focus on improving efficiency and enhancing user experience. Participate in and support the development and implementation of specific strategic initiatives, particularly within the Asia region, and lead such initiatives when assigned. Actively seek out and learns industry standard methodologies, collaborating with the service provider to identify the most effective ways to advance GSD services by demonstrating the combined expertise and experience of both the provider and JTI GSD

4.) Managing the GSD Service Scope for European Timezone: Stay informed about new IT projects and technology implementations in the regions, leading GSD takeover initiatives with a focus on analyzing technologies from the user’s perspective and contributing to knowledge management and communication. Ensure that the team possesses the knowledge and expertise needed to provide professional support for new technologies, and organizes the necessary support capacity with the outsourced provider for both ongoing operations and intensive support phases. During these intensive phases, contribute to trend analysis of registered issues to identify patterns and areas for improvement

5.) Financial Performance and Contract Management: Control billing to ensure provider charges are accurate, while proactively planning and organizing changes in the scale and scope of outsourced services to address evolving service demands. Contribute to budget AP/SP/LE planning by evaluating the financial impact of these changes, ensuring resources are aligned with business needs and service requirements.

6.) Processes and Procedures: Ensure continuous compliance with JTI Policies & Procedures and perform J-SOX controls as specified in the J-SOX Global Reference Model.

title: Customer Support / Dental Technician - (Remote)
description:
Role Title: Customer Experience Specialist 

ECLARO: A quick Summary

ECLARO is an award-winning professional services firm headquartered in New York City and operating in the U.S., Canada, UK, Ireland, Australia and the Philippines. We are dedicated to a singular purpose: providing the Right People to meet every client's needs and solve business challenges through strategic staffing, permanent placement, custom outsourcing & offshoring. Utilizing our proprietary TRINIT-E® Service Maturity Model, we help clients implement programs to promote innovation, automation and process improvement.

About the Role:
We are seeking a skilled Customer Experience Specialists to support dental offices and clinicians using dental scanning hardware and software. You'll manage live chat inquiries, troubleshoot technical issues, and deliver an exceptional support experience—often during urgent, patient-facing moments in the dental practice.

This role is ideal for professionals with strong written English, technical troubleshooting
experience, and a service mindset suited for healthcare or clinical support
environments.

Key Responsibilities
• Provide live chat support to U.S.-based dental practices using scanners and software
• Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to hardware, software, and device setup as well as clinical workflows.
• Guide users step-by-step through technical fixes with clear and concise written English
• Prioritize speed and accuracy when patient care is involved
• Maintain accurate documentation in support systems and tools
• Escalate complex cases to internal teams (tech support, operations, product) when needed
• Continuously learn new workflows, tools, and support practices

Qualifications:
• 1+ years of experience in a customer or technical support role (live chat preferred)
• Strong technical troubleshooting abilities, especially with devices and software
• Excellent command of written English (spoken fluency not required)
• Familiarity with healthcare or dental practice workflows is a plus
• Calm, professional, and clear under pressure—especially during time-sensitive situations
• Organized and detail-oriented, especially with ticket handling, documentation, and multitasking.

Preferred but Not Required
• Exposure to dental platforms such as 3Shape, intraoral scanners, or CAD/CAM software
• Experience in healthcare, dentistry, or medical device support
• Understanding of device setup, connectivity, and basic network troubleshooting

title: Real Time Index and Data Distribution Regional Lead, APAC
description:
Your Team Responsibilities
The Production Shared Services (PSS) function is responsible for the seamless and timely delivery of MSCI products and services to clients across multiple business lines, including Index, Analytics, and Sustainability & Climate. The work is highly time-sensitive and business-critical, requiring exceptional accuracy, judgment, accountability, and collaboration. The team operates on a global follow-the-sun model across APAC, EMEA, and the Americas.
Key responsibilities of the team include:
Enterprise Production Operations: Accurate and timely delivery of workflows across multiple business units.
Incident Management: Identifying and resolving production issues, coordinating with stakeholders, and contributing to root cause analysis and permanent remediation.
Client Case Handling: Managing production-related queries and tickets, ensuring prompt resolution in partnership with global teams.
Change and Release Readiness: Supporting testing, deployments, and governance for product enhancements and new releases.
Business Continuity & Resilience: Safeguarding uninterrupted operations and ensuring readiness for critical events.
Automation and Transformation: Driving initiatives to modernize, scale, and improve production processes across business units.

Your Key Responsibilities
As a Regional Lead, you will be accountable for safeguarding enterprise data integrity and driving delivery excellence across MSCI’s most critical workflows. You will:

Team Management & Oversight:
Lead, mentor, and develop a regional team of production analysts, SMEs, and managers.
Serve as the escalation point for critical incidents and disruptions, ensuring prompt issue resolution and communication.
Drive knowledge retention and training through formalized programs, serving as a sponsor for onboarding and continuous learning efforts.
Stakeholder & Cross-Functional Engagement:
Represent regional operations in global forums and partner with Product Management, Quality & Risk Management, and Technology.
Coordinate with CRM and Sales to ensure excellent client service and proactively manage production expectations and deliverables.
Support regulatory engagement by coordinating audits, surveys, and client due diligence requests.
Governance & Risk Management:
Uphold and enhance operational SOPs, data quality frameworks, and control processes.
Manage change initiatives and production readiness for new or modified products, including regulatory requirements like IOSCO/EU BMR.
Ensure adherence to SLAs and internal compliance standards across all operational workflows.
Project and Transformation Leadership:
Drive regional execution of strategic initiatives including cloud migration, process automation, and delivery channel enhancements (e.g., Snowflake, APIs).
Oversee transformation KPIs and ensure regional alignment with global production metrics and incident reporting standards.

Your skills and experience that will help you excel
12+ years of experience in data operations, production services, or financial data/analytics workflows (experience with Index Data Operations strongly preferred), with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
Demonstrated experience in incident/problem management with ability to engage senior stakeholders under pressure.
Strong leadership attributes demonstrated through initiative, problem ownership, and the ability to guide and influence peers, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.
Strong technical and operational mindset, with preferred experience in automation (Python, SQL, or similar), workflow orchestration, and cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Snowflake)
Familiarity with AI/ML tools, APIs, and automation platforms, and an interest in applying them to production workflows.
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset, with the ability to innovate beyond BAU operations.
High attention to detail, accountability, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced, global environment.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, capable of representing enterprise operations in global forums.
Committed to a full-time onsite work arrangement

description:

Work Schedule: Night Shift (Following Pacific U.S. Time Zone)
Location: Eastwood, Libis, Quezon City
Salary Package: 45,000 to 55,000 PHP/Monthly
Job Description
Our client is seeking a proactive and highly organized Project Client Liaison to serve as the critical link between their Sales and Production teams. This role ensures that client expectations are communicated clearly, production milestones are met, and project updates flow smoothly between all stakeholders.
The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, skilled at managing timelines, and thrives in a fast-paced environment where adaptability and follow-through are key.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Act as the primary point of contact between the client, Sales team, and Production team
Translate client requests into actionable tasks and deliverables for the Production team
Monitor project timelines and deliverables to ensure deadlines are met
Schedule and facilitate internal and client-facing meetings
Track scope changes and ensure all adjustments are communicated, documented, and approved
Anticipate and flag potential delays, bottlenecks, or misalignments between client expectations and production bandwidth
Ensure that all stakeholders are aligned and updated on progress through regular status reports or check-ins
Coordinate task assignment and follow-ups with the appropriate team members
Assist in maintaining documentation, project tracking systems, and communication logs
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree of any related field
2-4 years of experience in project coordination, account management, or client-facing roles
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to shifting priorities
Experience working with US based clients
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana, Monday.com, or similar)
Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively with remote teams
What we're looking for:
Clear and professional phone presence
Organized and detail-oriented; able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines without dropping the ball
Self-starter who’s comfortable working independently and taking initiative
Able to anticipate needs and adapt to changing priorities
Calm under pressure and solution-oriented when faced with challenges
Passionate for learning and professional growth, and someone who is not afraid to ask questions and be open to learning.
About Intelassist
Established in 2007, Intelassist is a remote staffing organization that originated from a collaboration between US-based industry professionals and an experienced operational team in Manila, Philippines. Our US team brings over 20 years of experience in engineering, manufacturing, IT, finance, and high-level operations, while our Manila-based team offers over 15 years of experience in delivering exceptional support to global enterprises.
 Our coast-to-coast US offices, in collaboration with our dedicated employees in the Philippines, enable us to deliver results to clients in various markets and for a wide range of roles. With over 15 years of experience in the BPO industry, Intelassist places a strong emphasis on organizational resilience and social stewardship to foster lasting, meaningful partnerships within our team and with our clients.
 At the core of our business lie our people. Our ability to recruit, train, and, most importantly, retain exceptional team members is not only what enables Intelassist to attract the region’s finest talent but also what bestows stability upon our clients through reduced turnover and tangible outcomes.
 With a workforce of slightly over 1,000 employees, we strike a balance – substantial enough to possess profound insight into the Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) industry, yet intimate enough to maintain the family-like, high-energy work atmosphere that our candidates seek.
 At Intelassist, we specialize in sourcing, training, and retaining top-tier talent, each exclusively dedicated to meeting our clients’ unique needs. Our proven track record and local presence ensure that Intelassist clients enjoy increased productivity, reduced staff turnover, and significant cost savings.
What benefits await you by joining Intelassist?
Global career advancement and networking opportunities.
Access to both virtual and on-site intensive courses for career and personal development enhancement.
Monetary rewards for successful referrals that are hired.
Guaranteed weekends off and a total of 20 paid leave days upon regularization.
Collaborative work environment
Eligibility for Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) coverage starting from the first month of employment, with coverage of up to 100,000 PHP per illness.
WHY INTELASSIST?
We grow together. We value your effort. We aim to empower you.

title: Outbound Associate/Officer - Shophygiene PH - Night Shift - Bagumbayan, Taguig
description:
ShopHygiene is the official e-commerce platform of Sanitary Care Products Asia, Inc., offering Filipinos easy access to trusted hygiene brands like Sanicare, Femme, Naturale, Cheers, Tisyu, and SCPA Solutions.
The Outbound Associate / Officer is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day outbound fulfillment activities handled by third-party (3P) warehouse personnel. This role ensures operational targets are met in line with platform KPIs and service level agreements (SLAs), while coordinating across teams to support fulfillment accuracy and efficiency.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Outbound Fulfillment Supervision- Manages daily order processing handled by third-party (3P) warehouse personnel. Ensures tasks are assigned efficiently and outbound targets are met in line with fulfillment KPIs and SLAs.
Dispatch & Courier Coordination - Supervises dispatch operations and handover to courier partners. Resolves handoff issues and ensures timely and accurate order releases.
Cross-Team Coordination - Works closely with Customer Service, Inventory, and Purchasing to resolve fulfillment concerns and maintain smooth operations across teams.
Performance Monitoring & Reporting - Tracks outbound KPIs and prepares weekly performance reports. to guide fulfillment efficiency. Actively monitors order flow, escalating delays or SLA breaches while recommending improvements based on operational data.
Process Optimization - Identifies inefficiencies and suggests adjustments to improve fulfillment speed and accuracy. Supports implementation of scalable workflows.
Third-Party Team Management - Handles scheduling, performance reviews, and training for 3P warehouse staff, ensuring accountability and alignment with company standards.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or any related fields.
Minimum of 2–4 years of experience in fulfillment or warehouse operation.
Background in sales operations, especially order fulfillment.
Understanding of e-commerce, warehouse management system (WMS) and ordering system (OMS).
Skilled in analyzing operational bottlenecks and implementing improvements.
Strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task under pressure with attention to detail
Collaborative, resilient, and adaptable team player
Knowledge in Operational Principles, Logistics and Supply Chain Management is an advantage.
Must be willing to work onsite at Industrial Estate, Bagumbayan, Taguig City from Monday to Saturday, Night Shift of 8PM–5AM.

title: Estimator / Sales Assistant (Remote)
description:
Company Overview
Blink Digital is a Melbourne-based business specialising in high-quality digital signage and print solutions tailored for commercial environments. From LED displays to custom signage projects, Blink Digital offers end-to-end solutions across planning, design, production and installation. The team prides itself on responsive customer service, innovation, and reliable project delivery.
Website: blinkdigital.com.au
About the Role
Blink Digital is seeking a remote-based Estimator / Sales Assistant located in the Philippines to support the company's estimating and sales processes. Reporting directly to John Brown, this role is ideal for a proactive and detail-oriented professional with excellent spoken English and prior experience working with Australian businesses.
The successful candidate will create pricing estimates for client projects, follow up sales prospects via phone, email and SMS, and provide general administrative support to ensure efficient sales operations. A background in signage, digital print, or construction will be highly regarded.
This role is being recruited by Clarke Point, a premier Singapore-based agency dedicated to delivering global recruitment and staffing solutions, (www.clarkepoint.com) and is for a long-term, full-time Independent Contractor.
Key Responsibilities
Prepare price estimates and quotations for prospective clients based on project specifications and pricing models.
Liaise with clients to clarify project details and ensure accurate quoting.
Follow up leads and sales opportunities via outbound calls, SMS and email, using a professional and engaging approach.
Track and manage quote requests and sales pipelines in CRM or project management tools.
Assist in drafting client proposals, contracts and documentation.
Coordinate internally with production or technical teams to confirm pricing components or timelines.
Perform sales administration tasks, including maintaining client records, updating spreadsheets and managing file storage.
Support reporting on sales metrics, conversion rates and pipeline progress.
Conduct research on clients, competitors or industry trends to support sales activity.
Maintain a high level of professionalism and responsiveness when representing Blink Digital to prospects and clients.
Mandatory Criteria
Experience working as an Independent Contractor for an Australian, American or similar client
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills, with a clear and confident phone manner.
Strong administration skills, including handling quotes, emails, and follow-ups with minimal supervision.
High attention to detail and accuracy when working with numbers and client information.
Comfortable using CRMs, cloud-based tools and productivity software (e.g., Google Workspace or Microsoft Office).
Nice-to-Haves
Prior experience in signage, digital printing, construction, or related industries.
Knowledge of estimating or quoting practices within service-based or project-driven businesses.
Familiarity with project management or quoting software used in signage or construction (e.g., Simpro, AroFlo, Quotient, etc.).
Previous involvement in inside sales or telesales campaigns.
Comfortable using VOIP phone systems or call tracking tools.
Ideal Personality Attributes for Success
Proactive – Takes initiative and anticipates next steps without being micromanaged.
Detail-Oriented – Cares about getting the numbers, names and details right.
Professional Communicator – Speaks clearly, confidently and appropriately for an Australian business audience.
Organised – Maintains accurate records, follows processes and keeps systems up to date.
Reliable & Consistent – Shows up on time, communicates progress and follows through on tasks.
Remote Work Setup Requirements
To ensure a smooth and professional remote working experience, candidates must have the following:
Quiet and Dedicated Home Office Setup – 
Professional and distraction-free workspace
Ergonomic chair and desk recommended
Laptop or Desktop Computer – Minimum specifications:
Intel i5 or AMD Ryzen 5 processor (or better)
At least 8GB RAM
Windows 10 or macOS 11 and above
Stable Internet Connection – Minimum speed of 25 Mbps (download/upload)
Wired (LAN) connection for stability is preferred
Backup internet source (e.g., pocket Wi-Fi or mobile hotspot) is a plus
Clear Audio Equipment –
Noise-cancelling headset with built-in microphone
Clear audio for calls and video meetings
Working Webcam – Required for virtual meetings and team check-ins
Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) or access to a backup power source
Especially important for areas prone to power outages
Up-to-date Antivirus or Security Software – To protect company and client data
Compensation Package
This role is for a long-term, full-time Independent Contractor with the following additional perks:
Vacation Leave: 12 days per year, granted upon successful completion of the probation period.
Sick Leave: 6 days per year, available annually.
Health Insurance Allowance: ₱2,500 per month provided toward family health insurance after the probation period.
Flexible Work Environment: Fully remote, Monday to Friday, aligned with Australian business hours.
Blink Digital is based in Brisbane, Australia, thus the work hours will follow AEST (UTC +10:00) and does not observe Daylight Saving Time with some flexibility.
How to Apply
For your application to be considered, please submit the following:
Your resume
A short cover letter outlining your suitability for this role. Your cover letter must include the word “CLARKE” in capital letters and a summary of your experience working as a full-time independent contractor or online freelancer.

description:

Full-time BPO - 5 Days/week (Mon-Fri)

At Duo Group, we value unique perspectives and encourage you to act on your ideas. You bring the skills and the customer-first mentality; we’ll provide the tools and environment for you to do your best work. We are a dynamic, fast-paced company where everyone rolls up their sleeves and is driven to achieve outstanding results.

Translate provided scripts and complex topics into clear, concise, and visually appealing videos.  
Maintain brand consistency by following established visual and stylistic guidelines.  
Continuously improve video quality and explore new visual storytelling techniques.  
Manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Collaborate with video editors to integrate motion graphics into video projects.  

Candidate Expectations:  
Must live in Metro Manila  
Access to a back-up generator & mobile data (As we need you operational during power interruptions)  
Own working set-up (Laptop on Windows 11, 2nd monitor, headset, webcam, dedicated GPU, at least 16GB RAM, and fast SSD scratch disk.)

Qualifications:  
Prior Experience Editing a Podcast Video.  
Minimum 2 years experience in Video Editing and Motion Graphics, preferably in BPO but not essential  
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Premiere or After Effects)  
Strong After Effects skills (shape layers, keyframing, track mattes, parenting/precomps, basic expressions) and Premiere Pro proficiency. 
Prior experience editing long-form content; explainer or VO-led educational work is a strong advantage. 
Knowledgeable in the various social media sizes and formats, tools, features, and trends

title: Senior Technical Designer | Work From Home (A-NM)
description:
Position Summary:
We are seeking an exceptional Senior Technical Designer and 3D Visualizer to join our design pod in the Philippines. Reporting to the Project Manager and Creative Director, you will transform our bold concepts into impeccably detailed construction documentation and photorealistic renderings, ensuring every drawing and visualization meets the studio’s elevated standards and accelerated timelines.

Job Details:
Work from Home
Monday to Friday | 10:00 PM -7:00 AM (Manila Time)
Following US Holidays

Responsibilities:
Drawing Production and Detailing
Produce full drawing sets, plans, RCPs, elevations, sections, millwork & lighting details, in Revit / AutoCAD that meet the studio’s BIM + CAD standards.
Integrate MEP / structural information, identify clashes, and propose constructible solutions.
Maintain and expand the studio’s Revit family library; create parametric families for bespoke millwork, lighting, and FF&E
3‑D Modelling and Rendering
Build high‑fidelity models in SketchUp or Revit and generate photorealistic stills / walk‑throughs using V‑Ray, Corona, or Enscape.
Optimise materials, lighting, entourage, and post‑production for luxury realism and atmospheric storytelling.
Produce diagrammatic exploded axons, mock‑ups, and vignette studies to communicate complex junctions.
Design Development Support
Iterate quickly from red‑lines, mark‑ups, and verbal direction.
Offer technical insight on stone cladding, integrated lighting, millwork joints, waterproofing, and FF&E integration.
Collaborate with interior designers to ensure design intent is preserved through construction.
Quality Assurance and Documentation Control
Apply the studio’s 42‑point QC checklist; achieve ≥ 98 % dimensional and annotation accuracy.
Adhere to ISO 19650 naming conventions and BIM 360 folder hierarchy; archive milestone files per data‑retention policy.
Collaboration and Communication:
Attend weekly virtual coordination calls and post daily Monograph updates.
Coordinate with project architects, engineers, and vendors to embed up-to-date technical data sheets.
Mentor junior visualizers within the outsourcing team, providing feedback and best practice guidance.

Qualifications:
5–8 years’ experience with tier one luxury or global hospitality projects.
Bachelor’s degree in Architecture, Interior Design, or related field.
Expert proficiency in Revit, AutoCAD, SketchUp, 3ds Max, V Ray/Corona, Enscape, and Adobe CC.
Deep knowledge of interior assemblies, integrated lighting, millwork fabrication, and US codes (IBC, ADA).
Strong English communication skills and ability to manage 3–4 concurrent projects across time zones.
Portfolio showcasing at least three built projects with full drawing sets and photorealistic renderings.

title: Bidding Specialist (Remote / Work From Home)
description:
Job description
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Bidding Specialist to join our growing team. The Bidding Specialist will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and responding to Requests for Proposals (RFPs), Invitations for Bids (IFBs), and other procurement opportunities. This role requires a strong understanding of the software development lifecycle, excellent writing and communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines. The ideal candidate will be adept at crafting compelling and compliant proposals that showcase our software solutions and secure new business for the company.
• Proactively identify and track relevant bidding opportunities from various sources (government portals, industry websites, tender notifications, etc.).
• Conduct thorough analysis of RFPs, IFBs, and other solicitation documents to understand requirements, scope, evaluation criteria, and terms and conditions.
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including sales, technical teams, product development, legal, and finance, to gather necessary information and develop comprehensive bid strategies.
• Develop a clear understanding of our software products and services to effectively articulate their value proposition in bid responses.
• Write clear, concise, and persuasive proposal content, including executive summaries, technical responses, management plans, and pricing justifications.
• Ensure all bid submissions are compliant with client requirements, company standards, and legal regulations.
• Manage the end-to-end bid process, including creating timelines, assigning tasks, tracking progress, and ensuring on-time submission.
• Facilitate review meetings with internal teams to ensure accuracy, completeness, and quality of all bid materials.
• Conduct post-submission analysis to identify areas for improvement and best practices for future bids.
• Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and procurement best practices.
• Participate in pre-bid conferences and clarification sessions as needed.
Minimum Qualifications
• Graduate of any four-year course.
• Proven experience (at least 2 years) in a bidding, proposal management, or technical writing role, preferably within a software or technology company.
• Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle and common software solutions (e.g., SaaS, custom development, enterprise software).
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
• Ability to translate complex technical information into clear, compelling, and easy-to-understand language.
• Proficiency in Google Suite.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

WHAT SHOULD YOU HAVE?
Minimum 3 years in an application/production support role or equivalent preferably in payments industry.
Operational experience in a 24/7 high availability, real-time payments processing environment
Strong documentation and communication skills
Strong analytical abilities, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills
Experience in using ITSM tools e.g. ServiceNow, Jira Helpdesk,
Passionate for resolving customer Issues and maintaining the application availability.
Pre/Post verification testing activities before/after code deployment
Release and deployment management.
Incident, problem, and Change management using ITIL best practices.
Technical (Base):

Running / executing Python scripts
Able to review API documentation (internal + external) and test APIs
Able to review code from external developers - inline with in-house/external product APIs
Troubleshooting issues using logging tools eg Opensearch / AWS Cloudwatch

Desirable:
Knowledge in Payment processes - Authorization, Settlement, Funding, common
Acquirer/Payfac activities

title: Head of Data Asset Management
description:
At TransUnion, we strive to build an environment where our associates are in the driver’s seat of their professional development, while having access to help along the way. We encourage everyone to pursue passions and take ownership of their careers. With the support of colleagues and mentors, our associates are given the tools needed to get where they want to go. Regardless of job titles, our associates have the opportunity to learn new things and be a leader every day.

Come be a part of our team – you’ll work with great people, pioneering products and cutting-edge technology.

We are seeking a dynamic, experienced, and results-driven Director of Data Operations & Performance to lead a team of Analysts and collaborate across multiple internal functions in support of our long-term mission: Information for Good.

This leadership role is responsible for driving operational excellence and strategic outcomes in two key areas:
Continuous Improvement & Insight Delivery
Enhance the quality and utility of our core asset—credit data—through ongoing database optimization.
Empower internal teams and external clients with actionable insights that maximize data value.
Data Onboarding & Customer Support
Oversee the onboarding of data suppliers, ensuring timely ingestion and monitoring of delivered data.
Respond to customer inquiries and support requests with precision and efficiency.
The ideal candidate will bring a strong blend of data analysis, project management, and cross-functional collaboration skills to proactively identify and resolve risks and issues. You will serve as a central point of contact for understanding and navigating TransUnion’s data ecosystem.

You will be accountable for the successful development, integration, and launch of new or enhanced applications, products, processes, and business rules. This includes close partnership with teams across Data Governance, Global Technology, Legal, Compliance, and Product Management.
What you’ll bring
8+ years of experience in data management, data strategy, or analytics, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
Deep understanding of data acquisition, ingestion pipelines, data quality frameworks, and governance best practices
Must be comfortable presenting ideas and information to all levels within the organization and able to communicate your vision, and implement solutions to drive positive results for the organization
Proven ability to build relationships and effectively interact with senior executives, product development, customers, sales personnel and matrixed support functions
Experience in managing a team of analysts with the ability to motivate team members to meet team goals and measuring results
Experience facilitating discussions with groups of stakeholders with varying goals and accountabilities related to core business datasets
Strategic, conceptual thinker with proven ability to facilitate organizational and behavioral change
Proven experience in data analytics concepts, processes, and applying industry best practices
Proven project management skills with the ability to juggle multiple tasks with competing priorities and highly organized with attention to detail; comfortable working under deadlines and producing key deliverables
Excellent problem-solving skills in resolving complex challenges within a dynamic matrix environment
Ability to develop and socialize the success of operational programs and processes using metrics
Must be a self-starter with strong planning and organizational skills, motivated by challenges, and possess a customer-focused, results-oriented attitude
Impact You Make
Establish and monitor data quality metrics, governance frameworks, and operational KPIs to ensure data integrity and usability.
Partner with data science, product, and technology teams to ensure data assets are optimized for analytics and product development.
Lead and mentor a high-performing team of data professionals across geographies, fostering a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Responsible for the day-to-day activities including delegating projects and managing team workload, work assignments, and quality of performance by providing coaching in effort to accomplish desired end results
Develop and execute a regional data strategy aligned with enterprise goals, business priorities, regulatory requirements, and market opportunities.
Lead and champion our operating model using new technology and applications while delivering high quality results while taking active role in roll-out of Global Operating model
Build and drive internal continuous improvement culture through innovation, collaboration, and lean thinking while achieving organizational buy-in
Develop and create operations and workflow management processes and procedures while introducing metrics to measure success
Communicate data incidents to business leaders, legal, compliance, and customers/furnishers and introduce processes to mitigate future risk
Use problem solving skills, and knowledge of our applications and processes to introduce resolutions that limit impact to customers/consumers
Create and formalize proactive strategies to advance data quality monitoring and improve our data quality
Work with GT to analyze data and test results to ensure integrity is maintained throughout program lifecycle and ensure market and business needs are satisfied
Conduct Business Acceptance Testing (BAT) in relation to major data events and/or application/platform changes to ensure no material impact to data & products which could adversely impact customers and/or consumers
Develop and implement processes & system enhancements to establish and maintain data quality standards
Review current operations and identify opportunities in tools, processes, and talent, to make recommendations towards increased quality and efficiency
Educate and influence internal partners on best-practice approaches gleaned from current and previous experiences
We’d love to see:
Experience in credit reporting, financial services or direct marketing industry
Business process mapping and process data mining experience
Understanding of Databases/File Structures:  DB2, PGS, Oracle, SQL, Big Data Platforms
High level understanding of software development methods and ETL methodologies

title: Go-To-Market Execution Lead - Lagro Quezon City
description:
At Coca- Cola Europacific Aboitiz Philippines, we are driven by our purpose to Refresh the Philippines and Make a Difference-- continuously leading the Beverage Industry with our Great People, Great Beverages, Great Execution and Great Partners. As we continue to Grow and shape the future, we are seeking passionate and innovative talents to join our team and make a difference with us.
Our commitment to excellence has been recognized through numerous industry awards such as Great Place to Work, Best Places to Work in Asia, Dream Employer of the Year, and Universum's Most Attractive employers- and we take pride in our achievements and the impact we have made in the beverage industry.
Role Overview:
This position is responsible for implementing and optimizing distribution strategies of the Region to ensure that products reach the end consumer in the most efficient, cost-effective, and customer-focused manner.

Key Responsibilities:

1.1 Execute Go-To-Market (GTM) Integrated Activity Plan and local pilot initiatives.

1.7 Collaborates with Line Manager on terms of Region RTM Initiatives – Partner Transitions, WS Upgrade, Consolidation or Disengagements.

2. Systems Implementation & Management
2.1 Serves as Level 1 support for frontline; Ensure Sales Call List data accuracy by coordinating with the database admin support center
2.2 Serves as the Level 2 support (Level 1 = Digital Business Partner) for partners
2.3 Ensures that all contracts are updated and uploaded in the system
2.4 SAP. Coordinates with Support Center on the MDM Process; Ensure set-up CommCon in the system (MDM for both standard and off-standard entries).

3. Network Collaboration
3.1 Work closely with sales to execute GTM strategies
3.2 Collaborate with support functions for GTM execution
3.3 Collect documents and requirements from Partner during engagements and disengagements
3.4 Route the partner contracts to all signatories
3.5 Trade validation to ensure a healthy RTM ecosystem 3.6 Participate in MBRs/ WORs/ Trainings

Suitable Candidates will need to demonstrate the following:
*Bachelor's degree holder in Business Administration, Marketing, Industrial Engineering, Management, or any Business-Related programs.
*Relevant work experience in General Trade, Special Markets/Modern Trade, Key Accounts, an advantage. Work experience in the FMCG industry an advantage
*Must be proficient in Excel
*Must have skills in:
(1) Microsoft Office applications
(2) use of digital solutions
(3) geographical knowledge,
(4) oral and written communication
*Must possess professional driver's license for 4-wheels
Reach us through our Social Media Pages!
Thrive with us at Coca- Cola Europacific Aboitiz Philippines and be part of a Company that is shaping the future of the beverage industry. Together, we can create great moments and make a positive impact on the lives of millions. Apply today and let's refresh the world together!

title: Communications Officer

title: Data Scientist
description:
Company Overview:
We are a company built on trust and loyalty. MBVA 24/7 started in 2018 and has continuously fostered skilled and talented Virtual Assistants for many clients. Our team of virtual assistants provides services all over the US, and we sure won’t be stopping there! Our main office is located in Arizona and Manila. We have a legion of virtual assistants all over the Philippines who work directly with our clients.
Our clientele ranges from doctors' offices to publishing companies. We make sure that our Virtual Assistants get all the training they need for a seamless partnership with our clients. MBVA 24/7 is committed to providing only the best to our partners.
We are here for you. Our purpose is to help you succeed in the medical and business virtual world, and we won’t stop until you get there!
Position Overview
We are seeking a Data Scientist with strong analytical and technical skills to lead the development of
dashboards, reports, queries, and automation workflows that turn raw operational data into actionable
insights. The ideal candidate is hands-on, detail-oriented, and able to translate business needs into data-driven solutions that support decision-making across teams such as operations, finance, and product.

Job Responsibilities:
 Data Analysis & Reporting
·         Design, build, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to monitor business performance and operational KPIs.
·         Develop SQL queries and data models to extract and aggregate data from multiple sources
·         (databases, APIs, spreadsheets, and cloud systems).
·         Partner with business stakeholders to define and track key metrics, ensuring reports are accurate, timely, and relevant.
Automation & Data Workflows
·         Build data automation scripts and pipelines to streamline reporting processes and reduce manual work.
·         Implement ETL/ELT workflows (e.g., using Python or Power Automate) to consolidate data from
various internal and third-party systems.
·         Automate recurring analyses, alerts, and quality checks to ensure data integrity.
Operational Insights & Continuous Improvement
·         Identify opportunities for efficiency and performance improvement using data insights.
·         Collaborate with product, engineering, and operations teams to develop data-driven recommendations and predictive models when relevant.
·         Support ad hoc analyses and internal data requests, ensuring stakeholders have reliable, well-structured information.
 Job Qualifications:
Required
·         Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or related field.
·         2+ years of experience in a data analytics, business intelligence, or data science role.
·         Proficiency in SQL
·         Proficiency in Python
·         Experience with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker Studio.
·         Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL concepts, and workflow automation.
·         Ability to translate business questions into structured analytical problems.
·         Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.
Preferred
·         Experience integrating data from APIs, spreadsheets, and CRMs/EMRs.
·         Familiarity with cloud data environments (e.g., Azure, Google BigQuery, AWS Redshift).
·         Knowledge of healthcare data is a plus.
·         Exposure to AI/LLM-based data summarization or automation tools.

Hardware and Software Requirements:
Hardware:
·         AMD Ryzen 3 3200G APU or Intel Core i5 (at least 7th gen) Intel CPU
·         16GB DDR4 RAM
·         120 - 480gb SSD
·         Jabra Biz 1100 / Logitech H390 or similar Noise-canceling Headset
·         1 – 2 Monitors (at least 21in)
·         1080p HD Webcam
·         Internet Speed: 50mbps (Fiber/DSL) LTE not accepted
Software:
·         Genuine Windows 10 Licensed Computer
·         Microsoft Office Suite

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and familiarity with AI-engineered forecasting tools
Highly analytical with keen attention to detail and strong problem-solving abilities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, coupled with strong negotiation and supplier relationship management
Preferred Qualifications:
APICS CPIM, CSCP, or equivalent supply chain certification
Familiarity with AI-driven retail analytics platforms (e.g., DataRobot, AWS SageMaker, ChatGPT-based analysis workflows, or custom ML pipelines)
Experience using AI-based visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Looker integrated with AI)
Ability to work with large language models (LLMs) for ad-hoc analyses, business summaries, and decision support
Awareness of emerging AI tools for e-commerce, such as AI-based keyword optimization or AI-powered advertising analytics
Your Key Contributions

Inventory Oversight & Accuracy
Create restock plans and send replenishment orders based on forecasts and Amazon's recommended restock limits
Conduct daily reconciliation between Amazon Seller/Vendor Central, 3PL systems, and ERP to ensure accuracy of on-hand and available-to-sell inventory
Monitor inbound purchase orders, lead times, and carrier performance to ensure inventory arrives ahead of forecasted demand
Implement cycle counts and audit processes with 3PLs to maintain 98%+ inventory accuracy
Maintain a healthy Inventory Performance Index (IPI) by balancing in-stock rates and reducing excess inventory
Track inbound shipments and confirm on-time delivery to Amazon warehouses
Forecasting & Replenishment
Develop forecasting models using Amazon reports (e.g., Inventory Health, Business Reports) and external tools
Collaborate with Demand Planning and Sales teams to translate forecasts into purchase orders and replenishment schedules
Build and maintain safety stock models by product category, adjusting for seasonality, promotions, and market trends
Identify SKUs at risk of stockout or overstock and provide mitigation plans to Account Managers and leadership
Supplier & 3PL Relationship Management
Serve as the primary point of contact for suppliers and 3PL partners, ensuring accountability for on-time shipments, fill rate targets, and service-level agreements
Escalate recurring supplier or logistics issues and recommend alternative sourcing or distribution solutions
Negotiate with 3PLs for storage and fulfillment efficiencies to reduce costs while ensuring timely delivery to customers
Process Improvement & Compliance
Evaluate and optimize order management, replenishment, and shipping processes to reduce cost-to-serve
Ensure compliance with Amazon and marketplace requirements for packaging, labeling, preparation, and shipping
Coordinate with Marketing and Advertising teams to align promotions with available inventory
Partner with Quality Assurance to analyze defective or returned products and implement corrective actions with suppliers
Data & Reporting
Build weekly and monthly reports tracking inventory health, including turns, weeks of supply, days on hand, stockouts, and aged inventory
Use data to recommend SKU rationalization, portfolio optimization, and readiness for new product launches
Prepare executive-level reports on inventory KPIs with actionable insights and recommendations
Monitor storage fees, long-term storage costs, and removal activities to minimize waste

title: Job Coordinator
description:
The Job coordinator will be responsible for fulfilling clients’ manpower requirements end-to-end in a fully remote environment. This role requires strong organizational skills, effective communication, and proficiency in Excel. The Job Coordinator will work closely with job applicants and clients to ensure that jobs are filled up efficiently.
Key Responsibilities:
Manpower Coordination
Source for candidates by posting job advertisements in pre-defined channels in a timely and accurate manner
Engage with applicants and answer questions that they may have regarding the job
Perform basic due diligence and onboarding process for the applicants according to Standard of Procedure (SOP)
Schedule manpower according to clients’ requirements.
Ensure attendance and quality of manpower e.g. by sending reminder messages and ensuring that they possess the appropriate attire for the job task
Manpower Time-Tracking and Record Keeping
Ensure accuracy and timely updating of manpower time-in and time-out. Depending on client and job nature, the method of time tracking/ attendance tracking may be different e.g. via a portal / excel sheet / timesheets
If any deductions are required for attire item purchase/ lateness, to ensure these notes are captured timely and accurately in staff’s records
Client Management
Respond to clients’ job requests and clarify details as necessary
Provide timely updates to clients regarding the take-up rate of their staffing requirements
Provide timely updates to clients on manpower attendance and assist them whenever necessary if replacement manpower is required
Answer to any questions clients may have relating to their manpower requirements
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Project Management, or related field.
Proficiency in Microsoft and Google tools, especially Excel.
Proven experience in a coordination or project management role, preferably in a remote setting.
Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast paced and remote environment.
Attention to detail and strong problem-solving skills.
Working Conditions:
Fully remote position
Shift-based working hours, preference can be indicated but shift will be allocated based on team’s bandwidth and jobs seasonality.
AM shift: 8AM – 5PM
PM shift: 2.30PM – 11.30PM
Working days
6-days work week.
Thursday – Sunday are required working days.
You may indicate preference for your off day to be either of Mon/Tues/Wed.
Must have a reliable internet connection and a suitable remote workspace.
May require occasional virtual meetings outside of standard business hours to accommodate global team members.
Follows Singapore Holiday

title: Logistics Team Lead (WFH)
description:
About Us
HelloConnect
HelloConnect is a subsidiary of HelloFresh, founded to address years of challenges faced in its own customer care. Leveraging our extensive experience in developing customer care tailored to the immediate needs of HelloFresh, our solutions are hyper-focused on serving high-growth companies. Located in Manila, Philippines, we are now making this service available to other companies to benefit from our experience, scale, cost savings, and service level improvements.

HelloFresh
HelloFresh is a global leader in delivering delicious meal kits and grocery boxes straight to customers' doorsteps. We are dedicated to providing high-quality, convenient, and sustainable meal solutions that inspire people to cook and eat healthy at home. Our commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction drives our ongoing success.

Job Description

The Logistics Team Leader responsibilities include managing the Philippines-based HelloConnect Logistics team, involving task delegation, training, onboarding, OKR management, and team activities. This role requires exceptional communication and presentation skills to effectively lead meetings, create executive-level decks, and engage with stakeholders across functions. The Team Leader will drive adherence to policies and performance standards, build task checklists for efficiency, and proactively seek opportunities for improvement. They will also conduct performance reviews, support hiring, create SOPs, develop reporting and metrics for operational visibility, and foster a culture of curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning within the team.

Responsibilities and duties
Responsible for managing the Philippines-based HelloConnect Logistics team, delegating daily tasks, managing training, onboarding, OKR responsibilities, holidays, and team-building activities.
Lead and manage the HC logistics team, ensuring adherence to company policies, procedures, and performance standards.
Prepare and deliver presentations, reports, and updates to leadership and stakeholders, ensuring information is communicated clearly, concisely, and professionally.
Drive reporting and metrics on operational performance, highlighting trends, risks, and opportunities for process improvement.
Proactively build and maintain daily task checklists for the team and ensure all tasks are completed to performance standards. Providing hands on support with tasks completion during team vacations, emergencies.
Complete performance reviews of direct team members, supporting hiring for new roles, and demonstrating proven experience in managing team performance through clear KPIs and metrics.
Build standard operating procedures (SOPs) for direct and indirect teams, identifying areas for improvement, maintaining a proactive approach to prevent potential challenges.
Assist the HelloFresh Inbound Logistics team with reporting and analysis support, ensure coverage during peak periods and vacations, and enhance collaboration with HelloFresh Logistics Specialists.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including procurement, production, and 3PW partners, to foster seamless collaboration and communication.
Plan and run regular engagement events with the Philippines-based HelloConnect team.
Skills and preferred qualifications
Experience in Logistics and Supply Chain, preferably in the food or CPG industry.
Fluency in written and verbal communication; proven ability to lead meetings, present to stakeholders, and create clear, impactful decks.
Curious and process-driven mindset, with a strong desire to learn, collaborate, and proactively take ownership of initiatives.
Proven people leadership experience, including performance management, KPI setting, and coaching team members for success.
Strong Microsoft Office skills, with advanced experience in Microsoft Excel; proficiency in PowerPoint required for professional presentation development.
Ability to work with little supervision and track multiple processes.
The ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Outstanding organization and detail orientation.
Why work for us?
At HelloConnect, you'll join an organization that values innovation and leverages cutting-edge technology to transform customer experiences. With a collaborative culture, continuous learning opportunities, and a customer-centric focus, you'll contribute to impactful projects that drive business success. Upholding ethical standards and promoting diversity and inclusion, HelloConnect fosters a positive work environment. Your well-being is prioritized through comprehensive benefits and perks. Join us to shape the future of digital experiences and make a difference in the lives of our clients and their customers.

title: Salesperson (EdTech) — Australia Schools (Full-Time, Remote)
company: The Trustee for Big Blue Marble Family Trust
description:
Company Overview
VR Centre is Australia’s leading provider of immersive and AI-enhanced education tools. We partner with RTOs, TAFEs, universities, and schools to modernise training through virtual environments, AI tutors, assessment feedback tools, and avatar-led role-play simulations.

The Role
We’re hiring a full-time Salesperson to grow across schools and education providers in Australia. You’ll get structured training (scripts → training videos) and practice with a lifelike avatar “customer” to sharpen discovery, demos, and objection handling before jumping on real calls. Great fit for early-career sales talent who are coachable, organised, and hungry to learn.
What You’ll Do
Prospect and qualify schools, RTOs, and education providers across Australia.
Run discovery calls, demos, and follow-ups; keep a clean CRM pipeline.
Tailor VR and AI solutions (e.g., AI tutors, assessment tools, role-play simulations) to each school’s needs.
Book and run meetings with decision makers (principals, heads of department, training managers).
Coordinate with Marketing and Product on proposals, pilots, and onboarding handoffs.
Hit monthly targets for meetings, demos, and qualified opportunities.
What We’re Looking For (Must-Haves)
Excellent English (spoken & written): confident on video/phone; clear, easy-to-understand delivery.
Market experience or readiness: proven success selling to US/AU/NZ/Asia (any one is fine) or strong evidence you can ramp fast with coaching (wins from support/teaching/CSR, side projects, etc.).
Outbound prospecting chops: can research accounts, build target lists, and run multi-touch sequences (email, LinkedIn, calls) that convert to meetings.
Discovery & demo skills: you ask smart questions, tailor demos to a school’s needs, and handle objections (budget/timing/stakeholders) with calm, positive persistence.
Multi-stakeholder selling: comfortable navigating principals, heads of department, IT, procurement, and training managers.
Process-driven & coachable: you like playbooks, scripts, and scorecards; you keep immaculate CRM notes and accept weekly call reviews.
Time-zone alignment: able to work AU business hours; occasional flexibility to meet US/NZ/Asia stakeholders when needed.
Tools: experience with a CRM (HubSpot/Salesforce), Google Workspace, Zoom/Meet, and LinkedIn (Sales Navigator a plus).
Professional writing: concise outreach, clear follow-ups, and proposal/recap emails that move deals forward.
Nice to Have
EdTech / Education background (K–12, RTO/TAFE/VET, or Higher Ed), or selling SaaS to public sector/schools.
Familiarity with AU (state systems & school terms), NZ (MoE/boards), US (districts), and Asia (international/independent schools) buying cycles.
Experience running pilots/POCs, basic RFP exposure, and working with channel partners/resellers in Asia.
Comfort positioning VR/AI solutions (we’ll train you thoroughly).
Evidence of consistent activity/targets in prior roles (quality meetings set, demos/month, pipeline hygiene, SQOs).
Training & Support
Structured onboarding with step-by-step playbooks and training scripts
Video-based training derived from those scripts.
Avatar practice customer sessions with feedback.
Ongoing coaching, call reviews, and a clear progression path.
Compensation & Incentives
Pay: 31,000 Php to 47,000 Php + commissions.
Work Setup & Schedule
Location: Remote (Philippines)
Schedule: Monday–Friday, aligned to Australian business hours (AEST/AEDT)
How to Apply
Click Apply and include:
Your CV/resume
3–5 sentences on why you want to sell EdTech to Australian schools

title: UC Support Engineer (Avaya IP Office/Unified Communications)
description:
Powering Global Conversations Through Technology.

Our client, Aura Alliance, Ltd., is a London-based managed services leader transforming the way businesses communicate. Their modern, people-first culture empowers professionals to thrive, innovate, and redefine global connectivity.

As a UC Support Engineer, you'll provide remote technical support, diagnostics, and administration for Avaya IP Office and other unified communication systems. Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)

Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek

Desired Skills
3-5 years of experience supporting Avaya IP Office and/or Avaya Aura environments

Hands-on experience with Avaya tools such as IP Office Manager, Web Manager, Voicemail Pro, or System Status Application

Personal Attributes
Strong ability to take ownership of tasks and drive them to completion
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across diverse teams and customer levels
Strong organizational and time-management skills, able to multitask in a fast-paced environment
Customer-focused mindset with a proactive approach to solving problems
A proactive and detail-oriented individual with exceptional project coordination skills
Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment
A customer-first mindset with the ability to identify and address client needs effectively
Your Daily Tasks

Provide Tier 1 and Tier 2 technical support for Avaya IP Office and related Avaya solutions (Aura, CM, Session Manager, Communication Manager, Voicemail Pro, etc.)
