Monitor and manage system alerts, ensuring proactive identification of issues before customer impact
Assist with moves, adds, and changes (MACDs) on customer systems
Coordinate with third-party vendors or carriers as required for incident resolution
Maintain awareness of system updates, patches, and version compatibility to ensure best practice support
Participate in internal knowledge sharing and contribute to continuous improvement of support processes
Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Technical Support Representative I - JR0302131
description:
As the world works and lives faster, FIS is leading the way. Our fintech solutions touch nearly every market, company and person on the planet. Our teams are inclusive and diverse. Our colleagues work together and celebrate together. If you want to advance the world of fintech, we’d like to ask you: Are you FIS?
Role location: Hybrid (three days in-office, two days virtual)
What you will be doing:
Provides desk-side assistance in resolving technology support issues.
Performs installations, repairs, upgrades, backups and other maintenance tasks.
Provides effective customer service in a 24X7X365 production environment (rotating on-call and holiday support may be required.
Utilizes soft skills and troubleshooting skills to resolve client issues and questions.
Asks probing questions to gather relevant information on routine and complex calls.
Uses effective listening skills to develop understanding of client questions or issues.
Installs, configures and troubleshoots desktop systems, workstations, servers and network issues in a heterogeneous environment.
Documents, tracks and monitors client incidents in ticketing system to ensure a timely resolution.
Prioritizes and escalates support incidents and requests based on business impact and documented guidelines.
Maintains passwords, data integrity and file system security for the desktop environment.
Communicates highly technical information to both technical and nontechnical personnel.
Recommends solutions including new acquisitions and upgrades.
May participate in development of information technology and infrastructure projects.
May have expertise in commonly used business applications.
May handle phone and email assistance as well.
 What you bring:
Experience in Helpdesk support - individuals capable of taking calls, do root-cause analysis, provide solutions to customers
2 years and up experience in Active Directory (password reset, creation of accounts and etc.)
Remote-user support
Must be amenable to work on a Hybrid setup (up to 3x a week onsite)
Ability to verbalize or express complex technical concepts effectively in writing and overall excellent communication and customer interface skills
Skill in troubleshooting and using diagnostic tools for client accessibility problems to applications and network (e.g., resetting password, bouncing PU, resetting remote devices
Knowledge of basic problem resolution and escalation practices
Ability to provide appropriate level of support and guidance with FIS applications and procedures
Effective use of listening skills to develop an understanding of client inquiries and problems
Excellent team player
Self-motivated to learn new technology and new ways to deliver support
Shows enthusiasm when providing technical support
Stays up to date with latest technology
Problem Solving and critical thinking skills

What we offer you:
At FIS, you can learn, grow and make an impact in your career. Our benefits include:
Flexible and creative work environment
Diverse and collaborative atmosphere
Professional and personal development resources
Opportunities to volunteer and support charities
Competitive salary and benefits

title: Admin Logistics Accounting Assistant | Work Onsite
description:
ADMIN LOGISTICS ACCOUNTING ASSISTANT
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN ADMIN LOGISTICS ACCOUNTING ASSISTANT?
The Admin / Logistics / Accounts Assistant is responsible for supporting the finance, logistics, and administrative operations of the business. This role provides essential support in accounts payable/receivable, order processing, freight coordination, and general office administration. The position requires strong attention to detail, time management, and the ability to work collaboratively across departments to ensure efficient business operations.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
1. ACCOUNTS & FINANCE SUPPORT
Process accounts payable and receivable, including invoice creation and reconciliations.
Conduct bank and credit card reconciliations in line with company procedures.
Assist with month-end processes, reporting, and filing of financial records.
Prepare debtors and creditors reports for management.
Support debt collection activities when required.
Create and manage payment batches, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
Maintain accurate filing and archiving of financial documents.
2. LOGISTICS & DISPATCH
Create new sales orders in the system (EXO) and maintain records.
Coordinate with freight companies to determine shipping requirements (pallet size, weight, destinations).
Obtain and compare freight quotes; prepare consignment documentation.
Print and apply freight and product labels for shipments.
Prepare and scan dispatch paperwork, saving digital copies for records.
Liaise with clients to confirm dispatch and provide tracking information where necessary.
Book pickups with freight providers and monitor delivery progress.
3. STOCK & RECEIVING
Scan and record delivery dockets for incoming goods.
Record batch numbers and update stock records in EXO.
Receive goods accurately in the system and ensure proper labeling for stock control.
Assist with inventory checks to ensure stock accuracy and availability.
4. ADMINISTRATION & SUPPORT
Provide general administrative assistance to the finance and logistics teams.
Support CRM entries and updates (e.g., Hubspot).
Maintain stock/ordering records via Comstock or other internal systems
Assist with customer communications, including PO confirmations and email correspondence.
Ensure proper document control, filing, and digital archiving of all admin/logistics paperwork.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Strong knowledge of accounts processes (payables, receivables, reconciliations).
Practical experience in logistics, freight coordination, and dispatch.
Proficiency in ERP systems (EXO) and CRM tools (Hubspot, Consignment Stock).
High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Strong written and verbal communication.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
REPORTING & RELATIONSHIPS
Reports directly to: Accounts / Operations Manager.
Works closely with: Finance team, warehouse staff, and external freight providers.
Liaises with: Clients for dispatch and order-related communications.

title: Capacity Analyst (IT Capacity)
description:
Our Purpose
Here at Datacom, we connect people and technology to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in whilst embodying a culture of trust and respect for employees and customers alike.
About Datacom
Datacom is ones of Australia and New Zealand’s largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. As an ANZ company, we have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.
At Datacom you'll be recognised and valued for your contributions. We're growing year on year and can provide stability, career opportunity and a collegial, agile, flat-structured environment that empowers people and promotes autonomy. We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. We operate at the leading edge of technology to help ANZ’s largest enterprise organizations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.
Role Overview
The Capacity Analyst is responsible for assisting the Capacity Manager to ensure there is adequate IT Capacity to meet required levels of service. This role involves conducting capacity analysis and reporting for client's infrastructure systems, servers, databases, storage systems, datacenter space, and other services.
The Capacity Analyst is responsible for (but not limited to):
Facilitate data collection, consolidation and quality assurance of data for capacity reporting. Ensure the data collection process is streamlined and reviewed for improvements.
Provide capacity reports timely, with accurate reporting of all capacity related issues to key stakeholders and clients.
Perform basic analysis on capacity data.
Follow-up with internal teams regarding capacity requests.
Assist the Capacity Managers with data collections and analyses, and other tasks as required. Manage client requests for information or adhoc reports.
Ensure that the client’s services and infrastructure can deliver the agreed capacity and
performance targets in a cost effective and timely manner.
Take reasonable care that their actions (or inactions) do not harm the Health and Safety of self or others. Reports all incidents, hazards or unsafe work practices as per Datacom policy.


Requirements

What You’ll Bring
Basic understanding of IT architecture, including desktop hardware, enterprise applications, databases, storage, servers and networks
Knowledge of various software and performance monitoring techniques
ITSM framework and process knowledge for Capacity Management function and allied processes, including Change and Problem Management
Demonstrated knowledge of appropriate Capacity Management toolsets
Demonstratable experience of reporting of capacity issues
Proven background of capacity analysis


Benefits

Our office is at BGC Taguig and we have hybrid work setup(Twice a week) and a flexible work schedule and we promote Work-Life balance, and an APAC focus means no graveyard shifts!
We also provide exciting perks such as spotter fees, HMO with Free 4 Dependents, Leave credits, Performance bonuses, and a work-life balance environment
Why Join Us?
As one of Australasia's IT powerhouses, Datacom offers the agility and innovation of a startup, coupled with the influence and opportunities of an industry leader. Our people-first culture is palpable - you'll feel it the moment you walk through our doors.
We offer an array of perks, from vibrant social events to serene chill-out spaces, hybrid working setups, and an abundance of professional development opportunities. At Datacom, you'll grow your career, connect deeply with peers, and bring your true self to work every day.
Leading the charge in tech, we tackle some of the biggest challenges and most exciting opportunities across Australia and New Zealand. If you're eager for adventure and driven by possibility, you'll fit right in.
Join us as we champion an inclusive, fun, and supportive workplace where your contributions are celebrated, and your growth is nurtured. Together, let's explore what's possible and create the future!

title: Client Services Manager | Permanent Homebased w/ HMO

Managing the day-to-day planning, operations, and problem-solving of a team of Medical Client-VA pairs to meet with required targets set by clients as a Client Services Manager

Working with clients to help grow their businesses with the help of all services offered by Global Medical as Client Services Manager

Managing the clients and their needs with Global Medical’s services (Mitigating concerns, anticipating growth, identifying patterns, handling situations, high-level escalations, negotiations, etc.)

Self-starter and highly-motivated

title: Commercial Operations Coordinator | Onsite BGC
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
COMMERCIAL PROJECT COORDINATOR
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.

About our Client
Our client is an Australian window furnishings company with roots in Melbourne and a presence across Australia. They work on a variety of projects ranging from high end homes to large-scale commercial projects and pride themselves on delivering high-quality, design-led solutions. They're a fast-growing, collaborative team that values creativity, efficiency, and getting the job done — all while having a bit of fun along the way.
Position Overview
As a member of the Commercial Operations team, you will be responsible for supervising, managing and monitoring individual jobs for large commercial projects from the estimating team. Your proactive approach will ensure great communication and a smooth operational process between Lovelight and the client.
This position reports functionally to the Team Leader – Operations.
Key Responsibilities
Receive and process builder account purchase orders, read construction floor plans and provide marked up floor plans of window furnishings for technicians
Receive and process builder account purchase orders, read construction floor plans and provide marked up floor plans of window furnishings for technicians
Receive and action site measures and installations as requested through the builder call-up process
Arrange order forms to suit requirements of each individual, submitting in a timely manner to correct suppliers
Build a rapport with builder account site supervisors and construction managers and estimation departments
Resolve difficult jobs by liaising with varies departments of the builder account
Assist with any request of quotes from the builder’s, deal with FRI’s and variations
Ensure all invoices are sent to the builder in a timely manner to receive on time payment
Develop a business relationship with the suppliers of the business to enable appropriate coordination of deliverance of products
Maintain high level of communication with subcontractors, and action daily reports and invoices and review back charges
Provide administrative support to managers and team members
Assist with operations to enter jobs into tracker
Updating SWMS and insurances for all projects
Assist in scheduling and provide administration support
Quoting and arranging service calls
Deliver the highest quality customer service
Must have qualifications, skills, and experience
At least two years’ strong experience in administration or office support in window furnishings or directly applicable industry
The ability to learn quickly, be open to taking instruction, and always want to know more
Your customer service and phone manner will be professional at all time
Self‐motivated is the norm for you and you will have the ability to multitask, prioritise, juggle demands and keep smiling while you do it!
We want you to have an outgoing and engaging personality with the ability to quickly build rapport
The ability to quickly develop and maintain working relationships with other team members
You will be super‐organised, with an impeccable eye for detail and process
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and a high level of computer proficiency
An alignment with the Lovelight values and approach to work and people
Why Join our Client?
Sign-on bonus equivalent to 1-month salary for anyone who starts on or before December 22, paid prior to Christmas
Generous Leave Entitlements – Enjoy 25 days of personal leave per year, empowering you to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
Wellbeing Leave – 5 days of additional leave that accrues over time, giving you the flexibility to prioritize your mental and physical health.
Balanced Work Schedule – Enjoy an 8 hour standard shift, including a 30-minute break, for a structured yet flexible day.
Extra RDOs – Benefit from 4 additional paid days off each year, scheduled in months without public holidays, so you can unwind and recharge.
Weekly Team Lunches – Connect with your colleagues over a delicious, company-funded meal every week.
Quarterly Team Events – Bond with your team through exciting activities like dinners, laser tag, ice skating, and more.
Flexible Work Options – Tailor your work schedule to fit your personal and professional life seamlessly.
Collaborative & Supportive Culture – Thrive in an environment that values teamwork, innovation, and mutual growth.
Expected behaviours
We expect that you will:
bring positivity and energy to your role, working the number of hours necessary to perform your duties competently and efficiently
work outside of regular office hours when needed use your best efforts to promote the interests of Lovelight at all times and do what we ask of you, when we ask you to do it
know and adhere to our company policies, procedures and guidelines that exist to help us
be our best and to keep us all safe embrace difference and value all aspects of diversity
be respectful of others and discourage discrimination

Role type
Administration, Operations, and Support
Role
Others
Locations
Uptown Place, Bonifacio Global City, Taguig
Work Schedule
Mondays-Fridays 6:30 AM to 3:30 PM Philippine Time

title: Senior Data Operations Support Associate
description:
Who We Are:
Dynamite Games is at the forefront of creating unparalleled gaming experiences for digital natives and the next generation of gamers. Our commitment to innovation and quality drives us to develop games that are not only visually stunning but also deeply engaging. Leveraging cutting-edge technology, we strive to deliver experiences that resonate with modern gamers, offering unique narratives and immersive gameplay.

What We Need:
We are looking for a Senior Data Operations Support Associate to join our ranks of growing game lovers, to support our growing operational needs. You will be working with a team of very experienced producer, game developers, artists and designer to create and operationalize HTML5 games.
We have a vibrant and fun work environment, there are plenty of gaming sessions and sharing sessions both internally (within the studios) and externally. If you enjoy building small to midsize game projects, if you think that you have what it takes to develop a successful product line of mobile games, we encourage you to apply now and find out more about what we have to offer.

Key Responsibilities
Answer customer support requests via our Jira ticketing system taking ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution. Liaise with the Development Team to ensure game releases run smoothly
Follow a planned schedule to monitor and manage live games configuration. Conduct risk assessment for games in development and assist with testing work to verify and report bugs.
Develop clear and concise documentation of business processes, workflows, and standard operating procedures (SOPs) that is easily comprehensible to both technical and non-technical teams. Collaborate with stakeholders to map out existing processes and identify opportunities for improvement.
Identify project risks and issues, proposing and implementing solutions to mitigate risks and ensure smooth project execution. Coordinate with stakeholders to ensure project goals and deliverables are clearly defined and met.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and metrics to track business performance.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to prepare comprehensive reports and presentations for leadership team
Rotate 8-hour night shifts or other shifts, as and when required.

Who We Think Will Be A Great Fit:
A Degree in Software/Computer Science/Computing/Computer Engineering/IT discipline or equivalent is preferred
4+ years working experience in technology or operations environment
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights. Good working functional proficiency in SQL is a must.
Experience with any business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, hubble ) is a must.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex ideas to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to detail with a focus on accuracy and quality in both analysis and documentation. Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to overcoming challenges.
(The candidate should be comfortable working on night and other rotating shifts, as and when required)

title: B2B Telesales Executive
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
Company Description
About SEEK
At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and to help organisations succeed.
By joining us, you'll be part of a multi-national technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it's where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.
Why join us?
Be part of a multi-national tech company with strong core values to help us solve complex challenges for our customers while building a flexible, exciting career – one that could take you anywhere.
We're looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment.
As one of Asia Pacific's largest tech companies, you'll contribute to multi-lingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region.
Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.
Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences and courses while you work alongside seasoned experts.
Job Description
About the role
We're looking for a Sales Executive to help grow our SME portfolio by driving outbound sales. This role focuses on high-volume calling to connect with potential clients, offer recruitment solutions and close deals. While mostly phone-based, you'll also attend client meetings in person when needed. If you thrive in fast-paced sales environments and enjoy building relationships, this could be a great fit for you.
Responsibilities
Drive outbound sales by making high-volume calls daily to engage and convert leads into long-term clients
Achieve daily call volume targets of 70-100 outbound calls to prospective clients
Present SEEK's recruitment solutions through virtual and in-person meetings, with field visits conducted as needed based on client preference
Tailor proposals using market insights to deliver standout solutions that meet each client's unique needs
Stay across industry trends, competitors and emerging opportunities to help position SEEK as the go-to recruitment partner
Manage your sales pipeline via CRM – track proposals, update statuses and ensure timely follow-through across all opportunities
Skills and experience
Strong experience in outbound tele or inside sales, ideally in high-volume environments (up to 100 calls/day)
Minimum 1-2 years of proven outbound tele or inside sales experience required
Background in inside sales, SaaS/tech, or recruitment-related services is preferred
CRM-savvy and comfortable juggling multiple leads at different sales stages
Resilient, detail-oriented and outcome-driven – with a genuine passion for helping people and businesses succeed
Strong communicator – both verbal and written; being able to speak Bisaya is a bonus!
Bachelor's degree in any field
Open to profiles with Sourcing background are encouraged to apply
Additional Information
At SEEK we offer:
• Hybrid set up
• A commitment to operating sustainably, a certified carbon neutral business operation, with the target of 100% renewable energy by 2025, and net zero by 2030
• Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Day
• The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
• SEEKer Support, a confidential service that offers employees access to free quality counselling sessions with a mental health professional of choice [DEI]
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

title: Mortgage Processor Specialist
description:
Ready to shape the future of work? 
At Genpact, we don’t just adapt to change—we drive it. AI and digital innovation are redefining industries, and we’re leading the charge. Genpact’s AI Gigafactory, our industry-first accelerator, is an example of how we’re scaling advanced technology solutions to help global enterprises work smarter, grow faster, and transform at scale. From large-scale models to agentic AI, our breakthrough solutions tackle companies’ most complex challenges. 
If you thrive in a fast-moving, tech-driven environment, love solving real-world problems, and want to be part of a team that’s shaping the future, this is your moment. 
Genpact (NYSE: G) is an advanced technology services and solutions company that delivers lasting value for leading enterprises globally. Through our deep business knowledge, operational excellence, and cutting-edge solutions – we help companies across industries get ahead and stay ahead. Powered by curiosity, courage, and innovation, our teams implement data, technology, and AI to create tomorrow, today. Get to know us at genpact.com and on LinkedIn, X, YouTube, and Facebook. 
Inviting applications for the role of [Process Developer], [Invoice to Cash (Practitioner)]! 
We are looking for a Candidate with experience in Home lending who would be responsible for credit verification/assessment processes and adhering to lending policies to ensure that an acceptable level of risk is maintained to enable an unconditional approval. 
Responsibilities 
In this role, you will be responsible for all the activities related to credit assessment of Home Mortgage. Few of the responsibilities are mentioned below: 
Managing workflow from a central queue in a timely manner 
Completing credit verification checks (income, General Living expenses, NCCP requirements, security and others) to ensure application input is meeting the Bank policies and responsible lending requirements 
Managing the end to end assessment of the lending process through to decision 
Preparation of files and ensuring all required documentation is included in submissions 
Understand key requirements of credit to ensure lending applications are completed in line with bank policies 
Understanding of computer systems to ensure records accurately reflect customer position 
Work with Credit team to ensure objectives are met in timely manner 
Understand key requirements of credit to ensure lending applications are completed in line with Bank policy 
Adherence to compliance regulations and manage any potential risks 
Contribute to process improvement and quality framework 
Liaise with third party brokers, clients and stakeholders 
Getting results that help our customers achieve their financial lifestyle goals 
Qualifications we seek in you! 
Minimum Qualifications / Skills 
A skilled team player 
Highly proficient in MS-Office suite- Word, PPT, Excel etc. 
Expert in client relationship management; can communicate efficiently & independently on broker/banker/client calls 
Proficient in executing tasks efficiently and in time independently without much mentorship 
Proficient in working in an agile environment and demonstrate high attention to detail 
Capable of working independently on managing their respective portfolios and delivering it within their stipulated timelines 
Capable of assisting the management by providing process improvement ideas to reduce waste and improve efficiency of the process 
Preferred Qualifications/ Skills 
Tertiary education within business/financial services 
Prior-experience in Retail Banking/Mortgage or Finance industry 
Highly Proficient in working on MS Office suite. 
Strong written and verbal communication skills 
Excellent Interpersonal skills 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skill 
Good conceptual knowledge and strong exposure to Banking Mortgage Operations 
Why join Genpact? 
Be a transformation leader – Work at the cutting edge of AI, automation, and digital innovation 
Make an impact – Drive change for global enterprises and solve business challenges that matter 
Accelerate your career – Get hands-on experience, mentorship, and continuous learning opportunities 
Work with the best – Join 140,000+ bold thinkers and problem-solvers who push boundaries every day 
Thrive in a values-driven culture – Our courage, curiosity, and incisiveness - built on a foundation of integrity and inclusion - allow your ideas to fuel progress 
Come join the tech shapers and growth makers at Genpact and take your career in the only direction that matters: Up. 
Let’s build tomorrow together. 
Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex/age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training.

title: Portfolio Services Director
company: CBRE GWS BUSINESS SUPPORT SERVICES PHILIPPINES, INC.
description:
About the role

As BSO Portfolio Services Director, you will provide strategic leadership and operational management to the department. Portfolio Services is the CBRE global line of business responsible for world-class portfolio administration and audit, rent management, including full treasury, data reporting, while managing trusted relationships with internal and external partners and customers.

What you'll do

· Provide strategic direction for the entire regional function, shape the mid-term and long-term strategic plans, transform through process, automation and technology.
· Ensure best knowledge, process, and operational excellent management practices across the function. Inspire, influence and lead change to ensure winning client outcomes.
· Identify and solve multi-dimensional, complex, operational, and organizational problems leveraging the appropriate resources within or outside the department.
· Partner with the other regional and global service delivery and platforms to ensure great global service consistency and one-team approach in diverse and geographically spread business.
· Lead the team of 250+ employees with vision and through several direct reporting managers to ensure great employee engagement, retention, and excellent client outcomes.
· Provide career opportunities, develop, and train the employees with passion and enthusiasm. Mentor and coach as needed to ensure your team continues to upgrade their skills and competences.
· Manage the entire function budget (over 300 larger and smaller US, EMEA and APAC accounts)
· Lead by example and model behaviors that are consistent with CBRE RISE values Respect, Integrity, Service, and Excellent in all you do.

What you'll need
Bachelor's Degree preferred with 13+ years of relevant experience. In lieu of a degree, a combination of experience and education will be considered.
Ability to lead with strategic thought leadership, go above and beyond and deliver exceptional solution to problems with strategical analytical mindset.
Solid leadership experience in the areas of talent management, development, mentoring, and cultural intelligence is a must.
Leadership skills to set independently, manage and achieve challenging targets, while demonstrating courage and initiative.
Proven track record of managing complex corporate process, tools and technologies with innovation and open mind for change.
Ethics, compliance, and professionalism.

Company Perks and benefits:

* Government Mandated Benefits
* Hybrid Work Setup
* Paid Leaves (15 SL and 15 VL annually)
* HMO with up to three free dependents
* Life Insurance
* Annual Performance Bonus
* Annual Merit Increase

Why CBRE?

When you join CBRE, you become part of the global leader in commercial real estate services and investment that helps businesses and people thrive. We are dynamic problem solvers and forward-thinking professionals who create significant impact. Our collaborative culture is built on our shared values - respect, integrity, service and excellence - and we value the diverse perspectives, backgrounds and skillsets of our people. At CBRE, you have the opportunity to realize your full potential.

Our Values in Hiring

At CBRE, we are committed to fostering a culture where everyone feels they belong. We value diverse perspectives and experiences, and we welcome all applications.

title: Data Analyst | Onsite | Ortigas | Night Shift | Day 1 HMO
description:
Data-Driven Wellness on a Global Scale

Join a team that transforms raw data into strategic insights that drive business success.

Our client is a world-class innovator in the health, wellness, and rehabilitation industry, empowering people to live healthier lives through science-backed products and intelligent technology. With operations spanning multiple continents, they blend human care with analytical precision-leveraging data to improve decisions, elevate performance, and redefine wellness. By joining their team, you'll contribute to a legacy that combines compassion, technology, and global impact.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst, you will collect, process, and analyze data to uncover insights that drive smarter business decisions. You'll build dashboards, forecast trends, and collaborate across teams to optimize marketplace performance, efficiency, and growth.

Job Overview

Employment type: Full-time
Shift: Night Shift, Weekends Off
Work setup: Onsite, Megatower, Ortigas

Exciting Perks Await!
Day 1 HMO coverage with free dependent
Competitive Salary Package
Night differential pay to maximize your earnings
Prime office location in Ortigas (Easy access to MRT stations, restaurants, and banks)
Fixed weekends off
Salary Advance Program through our banking partner (Eligibility and approval subject to bank assessment. Available to account holders with minimum of 6 months company tenure.)
Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization
Standard government and Emapta benefits
Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek

Required Education
Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field
Required Experience
2-4 years in analytics, preferably in eCommerce, marketing, or marketplace environments
Hands-on experience with Amazon Vendor/Seller Central reporting, Pacvue, or similar platforms strongly preferred
Proven experience building dashboards and performing advanced data analysis
Other Required Qualifications
Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, advanced formulas, index/match, macros), SQL, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI)
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to identify trends, correlations, and actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills to influence cross-functional stakeholders
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple competing priorities under tight deadlines
Preferred Certifications
SQL, Python, or BI tool certifications (Tableau, Power BI) preferred
APICS or supply chain certifications (CSCP, CPIM) a plus for inventory/demand planning alignment
Other Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with AI-driven retail analytics platforms (e.g., DataRobot, AWS SageMaker, ChatGPT-based workflows)
Experience integrating AI with Tableau, Power BI, or Looker for faster analysis
Ability to use large language models (LLMs) for ad-hoc analyses and business reviews
Awareness of emerging AI tools for e-commerce and advertising analytics
Your Daily Tasks

Data Collection & Analysis
Maintain a "golden dataset" as a single source of truth for all Amazon-related data
Define and enforce SKU, ASIN, and product hierarchy standards
Integrate multiple data sources from Amazon platforms and analytics tools
Build predictive models and perform root cause analyses to improve performance
Reporting & Visualization
Create automated dashboards and scorecards using Power BI, Tableau, or Excel
Standardize reporting templates across Marketplace, Paid Media, Finance, and Operations
Translate complex data into clear, visually engaging presentations
Business Partnering & Collaboration
Analyze campaign efficiency for Paid Media teams
Support Account Managers with product and category performance insights
Collaborate with Inventory Managers to align sales forecasts with stock availability
Financial & Compliance Support
Audit advertising charges and compliance deductions to minimize financial leakage
Partner with Finance on accruals, reconciliations, and profitability analysis
Document processes to reduce errors and discrepancies
Innovation & Process Improvement
Evaluate and test new AI-powered data tools and platforms
Recommend process enhancements to improve reporting accuracy and speed
Mentor team members on BI tools, SQL, and analytics best practices
KPIs:
Weekly/monthly reports delivered on time and 90% accurate
Amazon chargebacks/shortages under 3% of sales
Forecast accuracy of at least 80% for demand planning
24-hour turnaround for urgent ad hoc analysis requests
Required Competencies

Executes on Strategic Direction
Actively supports strategic initiatives with team, vendors, and customers
Proactively addresses challenges and adapts to changing priorities
Collaborates effectively to achieve business objectives
Energizes the Organization
Acts in alignment with the company's vision, purpose, and values
Takes initiative, inspires others, and embraces innovation
Helps peers adapt confidently to change and new directions
Drives & Delivers Results
Commits to achieving measurable goals and delivering excellence
Promotes collaboration and accountability across teams
Anticipates problems, escalates effectively, and drives resolutions
Builds Organizational Capabilities
Seeks continuous learning and growth opportunities
Serves as an ambassador for the organization and recruits top talent
Builds trust and manages relationships with empathy and insight
Maintains awareness of trends that impact business performance
Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Workforce Manager
description:
About TaskUs: TaskUs is a provider of outsourced digital services and next-generation customer experience to fast-growing technology companies, helping its clients represent, protect and grow their brands. Leveraging a cloud-based infrastructure, TaskUs serves clients in the fastest-growing sectors, including social media, e-commerce, gaming, streaming media, food delivery, ride-sharing, HiTech, FinTech, and HealthTech. 

The People First culture at TaskUs has enabled the company to expand its workforce to approximately 45,000 employees globally. Presently, we have a presence in twenty-three locations across twelve countries, which include the Philippines, India, and the United States.

It started with one ridiculously good idea to create a different breed of Business Processing Outsourcing (BPO)! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion, exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge at a moment’s notice, and mastering consistency in an ever-changing world.

What We Offer: At TaskUs, we prioritize our employees' well-being by offering competitive industry salaries and comprehensive benefits packages. Our commitment to a People First culture is reflected in the various departments we have established, including Total Rewards, Wellness, HR, and Diversity. We take pride in our inclusive environment and positive impact on the community. Moreover, we actively encourage internal mobility and professional growth at all stages of an employee's career within TaskUs. Join our team today and experience firsthand our dedication to supporting People First.


What does a Workforce Manager really do? Think of yourself as one of the key leaders of the department, so not just anyone is qualified for this role! We make sure we get the best of the best, after all, we are a ridiculously good company so we make sure our employees are top notch. So come on, now we need your full concentration because it’s time to imagine what it’s like being a Workforce Manager.

Imagine yourself going to work with one thing on your mind: to deliver the world's best customer experience by striking a balance between service and cost. As you tackle your new tasks for the day, you know that it will lead to one thing: that you will supervise the Operational and fiscal activities of the Workforce Management team.

As a Workforce Manager, you will ensure accuracy of billing processes and procedures for all clients within the site. You will identify and report on account profitability opportunities and recommend strategies to improve campaign processes. You will be held accountable for schedule adherence, service level, absenteeism, and other applicable service and efficiency metrics. Along with this, you will forecast and prepare for voice and non-voice volume and monitor seat occupancy, average handle time and other factors to measure campaign performance. You will also work closely with stakeholders and clients to resolve manpower staffing and scheduling concerns. You will manage the campaign in accordance with company policies, procedures, and client service level metrics and expectations.

Do you have what it takes to become a Workforce Manager?

What is it we’re looking for? Since this is a Managerial post, we need someone who is seasoned, someone with leadership and organizational skills, to even call themselves one. If you have been managing people and teams in a Workforce Supervisor, Workforce Associate Manager, or Workforce Assistant Manager post for at least 3 years, then it’s you we are looking for!

We need someone who has the ability to manage multiple, complex, ongoing tasks and projects. Someone who has a high attention to detail and has a strong desire to optimize procedures and processes. We need someone who is proficient in statistical analysis and possesses good computer and software skills. Someone who has a working knowledge of database applications such as MS Office (Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint), or the ability to learn technology very quickly. We also need someone to put in knowledge on Capacity planning. Forecasting and knowledge in Google Suites is a plus!

We’d be eager to speak to you if you have strong verbal and written communication skills, a high achiever and self-starter; but most importantly, you’ve got to have a “people first” leadership and coaching style.

How We Partner To Protect You: TaskUs will neither solicit money from you during your application process nor require any form of payment in order to proceed with your application. Kindly ensure that you are always in communication with only authorized recruiters of TaskUs.

DEI: In TaskUs we believe that innovation and higher performance are brought by people from all walks of life. We welcome applicants of different backgrounds, demographics, and circumstances. Inclusive and equitable practices are our responsibility as a business. TaskUs is committed to providing equal access to opportunities. If you need reasonable accommodations in any part of the hiring process, please let us know.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
About Us
We’re a small, fast-paced IT consulting business that helps organisations run more efficiently through structured processes, great systems, and reliable delivery.
Our team values trust, accountability, and precision — we don’t believe in micromanagement, but we do believe in excellence. Everyone here is a specialist in their craft and takes pride in producing work that meets a consistently high standard.
We’re now looking for an experienced Executive Assistant to work directly with the Director — someone who can bring order, structure, and proactive thinking to each day.
The Role
This is not a traditional scheduling or travel-heavy EA role. Instead, you’ll act as the Director’s right-hand — managing inboxes, prioritising communications, and ensuring that tasks are captured, tracked, and followed through to completion.
You’ll also maintain structure across our task management system (ClickUp), help coordinate activities between the Director and the team, and make sure nothing slips through the cracks.
Your focus is on clarity, organisation, and follow-up — turning noise into order and keeping things moving smoothly.
A Typical Day Might Include
Starting the morning by cleaning and organising the Director’s inbox before the workday begins.
Holding a short morning check-in to review the day’s priorities, key tasks, and follow-ups.
Updating ClickUp task cards, tracking progress, and prompting team members where needed.
Monitoring incoming emails and messages throughout the day, flagging what needs attention and what can be delegated.
Holding a short afternoon debrief — summarising what was completed, what’s pending, and what tomorrow looks like.
You’ll become the Director’s point of calm in a busy environment — ensuring that information flows efficiently, priorities stay aligned, and delivery stays on track.
What You’ll Do
Inbox and Task Management
Manage the Director’s inbox: organise, prioritise, and ensure timely responses.
Translate key emails into ClickUp tasks with clear priorities and ownership.
Follow up on outstanding actions and deadlines with the team.
ClickUp Coordination
Maintain a well-organised ClickUp workspace with clear folders, priorities, and due dates.
Track progress on tasks and ensure updates are accurate.
Summarise activity and flag issues that need the Director’s input.
Daily Support and Communication
Conduct short morning and afternoon calls with the Director.
Provide concise updates on task statuses, follow-ups, and blockers.
Filter and summarise information — highlighting what’s important without overloading detail.
Team Liaison and Follow-Up
Coordinate with project managers and service delivery staff to confirm progress.
Ensure all parties are aligned on deliverables and timelines.
Proactively flag risks or delays before they become issues.
Who You Are
10+ years’ experience as an Executive Assistant or Senior Administrator supporting senior leadership.
Exceptionally organised, with a sharp eye for detail and strong follow-through.
Confident using Outlook, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, and ClickUp (or similar task management tools).
Excellent English communication skills — written and verbal.
A critical thinker who can handle complex information, filter what matters, and make good judgment calls.
Comfortable managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Self-motivated, accountable, and reliable — you learn quickly and get things done without needing reminders.
Not suited for:
Those looking for a project management pathway, or who need close supervision or repeated training. This is a senior, stable EA role for someone who takes pride in being the organisational backbone of a busy business.
Why You’ll Love Working With Us
Work directly with the Director of a fast-growing IT consulting firm.
Remote-first culture — full trust and flexibility, aligned to Australian hours.
Exposure to real client projects and outcomes — your work has visible impact.
A high-trust, no-micromanagement environment that rewards initiative and precision.
Long-term stability — this is a role for someone who enjoys mastering the EA craft.

title: Medical Receptionist - Work from home (SD)
description:
Job Summary:
We are currently seeking a professional, organized, and personable Medical Receptionist to join our healthcare team. The Medical Receptionist will be responsible for scheduling patient appointments, verifying insurance coverage, and providing basic customer service to ensure a smooth and efficient experience for our patients. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, a detail-oriented mindset, and a commitment to upholding the highest standards of patient care.
Job Details:
Work from home
Possible Shifts:
Monday to Friday | 9 PM to 6 AM Manila Time
Monday to Friday | 10 PM to 7 AM Manila Time
*Following US Holidays
Responsibilities:
• Schedule patient appointments:
o   Manage and maintain appointment calendars for physicians and other medical staff.
o   Accurately schedule appointments for patients and guide patients throughout to ensure they have completed all necessary items prior to arriving to the dental offices.
o   Confirm appointments and send reminders to patients as necessary.
o   Reschedule appointments and communicate changes with patients and medical staff.
• Verify insurance coverage:
o   Obtain and review insurance information from patients or their representatives.
o   Validate insurance eligibility and coverage for appointments and procedures.
o   Coordinate with insurance providers to resolve any discrepancies or issues.
o   Update and maintain accurate patient records in the electronic health record system.
• Provide basic customer service:
o   Address patient inquiries and concerns in a professional and courteous manner.
o   De-escalate situations involving dissatisfied customers, offering patient assistance and support.

 Qualifications:
• High school diploma or equivalent required; additional education or training in healthcare administration and/or associate degree preferred.
• At least 2 years of experience in a medical receptionist, administrative, or customer service role in a healthcare setting. Prior experience in dental office administration and insurance verification is strongly preferred.

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Excellent problem-solving skills.
• Strong organizational and time-management abilities.

• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
• Detail-oriented and able to maintain accurate patient records.
• A professional and compassionate demeanor with a commitment to providing excellent patient care.

title: Group Reservations Agent - Sabre Expert
description:

• Works in conjunction with the Group air team to meet client defined meeting parameters and proactively escalating client, supplier, or program issues to management for timely resolution.

title: Compensation & Benefits Specialist
description:
At Snappr, we make it effortless for businesses to access high-quality visual content at scale. As the world’s leading marketplace for photography, video, and editing, we connect top creators with brands that need to tell their stories through powerful visuals. By combining cutting-edge technology with a discerning eye for creativity, we help businesses grow through content that stands out.
Our culture is built on extreme ownership and peak performance. We are customer-obsessed, data-informed problem solvers who thrive on radical candor, embrace challenges by loving the dirt, and refuse mediocrity. We believe in accountability, humor, and diversity — and we’re united by a mission to help businesses tell better visual stories.

About the role:
As a Compensation & Benefits Specialist, you will be challenged to join our People Operations team and oversee the compensation and benefits. Your impact on the team will be the lifeblood that powers Snappr’s explosive growth and enables our employees to be well taken care of as they help our consumers and enterprise clients access on-demand photography worldwide. 

What you'll do:
Compensation & Benefits Administration
Own the entire payroll function and be accountable for its accuracy and timeliness by working with leaders to        resolve timekeeping discrepancies, reviewing payroll and government remittances computed by our accountant, and tracking additional payments (e.g., reimbursements, deductions, performance pay, referral bonuses)
Analyze, reconcile, and correct any discrepancies or errors related to payroll and benefits
Facilitate enrollment of employees into compensation and benefits platforms (e.g,. timekeeping and LMS software, payroll bank provider, HMO); Ensure that attrited or unqualified employees are removed from these platforms on time
Orient and assist employees in the availment of benefits such as leaves, HMO, loans, maternity, sickness, and government subsidies
Be up to date with local compensation, statutory, and taxation laws
Total Rewards Strategy
Act as a thought partner in designing a Total Rewards Philosophy and Strategy that promotes equity, attracts top talent, and motivates a high-performing culture
Design and execute benefit and rewards programs aligned with the company’s philosophy and strategy
Conduct regular compensation benchmarking and maintain an internal job band structure based on benchmarked data
Evaluate and report on the effectiveness of employee benefit programs
Vendor Management
Act as the main point of contact for Snappr’s third-party vendors (e.g., Accountant, HMO Provider, Payroll SAAS Provider) and keep vendors accountable for maintaining SLAs*
Lead the selection and transition to a more effective payroll provider
*Our accountant currently handles payroll computation and disbursement, government contributions, and taxation. While the Benefits Specialist will not facilitate these processes, they are expected to ensure that these functions are performed with accuracy and in compliance with Philippine labor policies.

What you’ll need:
At least 3 years of experience in administering payroll and benefits, preferably fully owning the Compensation & Benefits function
At least 1 year of experience in collaborating with HR and management in designing and improving compensation and benefits programs and processes
Experience in using Sprout as a payroll software is a plus
Extensive knowledge of payroll procedures, HMO administration, government benefits, and current labor rules and regulations
Communicates clearly and manages stakeholders effectively, especially when explaining payroll discrepancies, walking through compensation data, and proposing new compensation and benefits programs
Great spreadsheet skills to analyze data, solve problems, and manage projects
Strong knowledge of market salary ranges and familiarity with Total Rewards are bonuses
A "let's get it done" mindset
Should be willing to report 100% onsite in Ortigas

Job benefits:
Competitive salary
Transportation allowance provided
20% night differential (if applicable)
Health Insurance (Day 1 HMO w/ dependents)
Free daily meals
Paid Time Off
Company Equity

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Graduate of a 4-year course.

title: Pre-Press Operator (Remote)
description:
Company Overview
Print Logistics is an Australian-owned print and creative services company delivering exceptional print quality, precision, and customer service. Based in Melbourne, the company provides a full suite of digital and offset printing solutions, packaging, large-format graphics, and finishing services. With a reputation for technical excellence and reliability, Print Logistics serves clients across diverse sectors including retail, corporate, and creative industries.
The company combines state-of-the-art Heidelberg presses, advanced prepress technology, and a passionate team of professionals who take pride in ensuring every job meets the highest standards of craftsmanship.
Learn more at printlogistics.com.au
About the Role
Print Logistics is seeking a Pre-Press Operator to join its growing production team. This is a remote, full-time role based in the Philippines, working closely with the Australian production team to prepare, check, and optimise files for printing.
The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, technically proficient with Adobe Creative Suite and prepress workflow tools, and experienced in preparing print-ready artwork for both offset and digital printing. They will play a vital role in ensuring the smooth transition of client files from design to press, maintaining Print Logistics’ commitment to accuracy and quality. The role reports directly to the Manager.
This role is being recruited by Clarke Point, a premier Singapore-based agency dedicated to delivering global recruitment and staffing solutions, (www.clarkepoint.com) and is for a long-term, full-time Independent Contractor.
Key Responsibilities
Review and pre-flight client-supplied files for print readiness.
Correct file issues related to bleed, resolution, colour profiles, and fonts.
Prepare, impose, and proof files for digital and offset printing.
Operate and manage workflow through Heidelberg and Enfocus systems.
Create press-ready PDFs using Adobe Creative Suite and PitStop Pro.
Liaise with the Australian production team to confirm job specifications and timelines.
Maintain accurate file naming and job tracking in company systems.
Perform quality assurance checks to ensure all output meets Print Logistics standards.
Support the continuous improvement of file preparation workflows and templates.
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure smooth production scheduling and handovers.
Mandatory Criteria
Experience working as an Independent Contractor for an Australian, American or similar client
Minimum 3–5 years’ experience as a Pre-Press Operator or similar role.
Demonstrated experience working in a commercial printing environment.
Strong technical proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop).
Hands-on experience with Enfocus PitStop Pro and Heidelberg print software.
Solid understanding of prepress processes including imposition, trapping, colour management, and proofing.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy under tight deadlines.
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
Reliable internet connection and suitable home workstation for remote collaboration.
Nice-to-Haves
Prior experience working for an Australian printing company.
Familiarity with PDF workflow automation systems.
Basic understanding of packaging design and finishing techniques.
Experience with digital asset management systems.
Knowledge of colour calibration tools and ICC profiling.
Ideal Personality Attributes for Success
Meticulous and detail-oriented – Ensures precision and accuracy in every job.
Technically curious – Keen to learn new tools and optimise workflow efficiency.
Collaborative communicator – Works effectively across remote teams and time zones.
Proactive problem-solver – Anticipates and resolves file issues before they escalate.
Dependable and consistent – Delivers high-quality work reliably and on time.
Remote Work Setup Requirements
To ensure a smooth and professional remote working experience, candidates must have the following:
Quiet and Dedicated Home Office Setup – 
Professional and distraction-free workspace
Ergonomic chair and desk recommended
Laptop or Desktop Computer – Minimum specifications:
Intel i5 or AMD Ryzen 5 processor (or better)
At least 8GB RAM
Windows 10 or macOS 11 and above
Stable Internet Connection – Minimum speed of 25 Mbps (download/upload)
Wired (LAN) connection for stability is preferred
Backup internet source (e.g., pocket Wi-Fi or mobile hotspot) is a plus
Clear Audio Equipment –
Noise-cancelling headset with built-in microphone
Clear audio for calls and video meetings
Working Webcam – Required for virtual meetings and team check-ins
Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) or access to a backup power source
Especially important for areas prone to power outages
Up-to-date Antivirus or Security Software – To protect company and client data
Compensation Package
This role is for a long-term, full-time Independent Contractor with the following additional perks:
Philippine Regular Holidays: 100% pay if not worked; 200% pay if worked.
Philippine Special Non-Working Holidays: Additional 30% pay if worked.
Vacation Leave: 12 days per year, granted upon successful completion of the probation period.
Sick Leave: 6 days per year, available annually.
Health Insurance Allowance: ₱2,500 per month provided toward family health insurance after the probation period.
Flexible Work Environment: Fully remote, Monday to Friday, aligned with Australian business hours.
Print Logistics is based in Melbourne, Australia, thus the work hours will follow Melbourne time (GMT +10) with some flexibility.
How to Apply
For your application to be considered, please submit the following:
Your resume
A short cover letter outlining your suitability for this role. Your cover letter must include the word “CLARKE” in capital letters and a summary of your experience working as a full-time independent contractor or online freelancer.

title: Corporate Travel Coordinator
description:
Job Description
This position is based in our office in Pasig, Makati, Philippines You will be required to work Los Angeles, California USA business hours (PT) 7:00 AM PT to 4:00 PM PT. This position will report to senior marketing personnel based in Los Angeles.
The Corporate Travel Coordinator and Bookeeper role is responsible for cost effectively arranging, managing, and supervising the company's travel needs in accordance with corporate travel policy including obtaining necessary approvals, and communicating itineraries to employees and supervisors including maintaining accurate travel calendars. 
Ensures that travel expenditures are fully optimized to obtain the best quality for the price.
Ensures travelers reach their travel destinations on time and with the right accommodations within budget and company policy guidelines. This means researching destinations and available services; booking hotels, flights, and ground transportation; coordinating activities; and ensuring all necessary documentation is accurately completed and records are maintained for analysis.
Resolves scheduling conflicts and other issues including any problems with travel or accommodations and communicating with all relevant parties.
Ensure all travel details are accurately communicated and follow up with executives and other staff  about travel plans, making adjustments as needed.
Negotiate and manage contracts with travel service providers including coordinating the use of bonus miles and other rewards.
Suggest improvement and innovation in travel programs.
Assist marketing team by tracking marketing expenses and accurately entering them into QuickBooks when not working on travel. Training will be provided.
Works to guarantee that all expense receipts are reconciled in accordance with company accounting policies.
Qualifications
Fluency in written and spoken English is essential in this role.
Familiarity with booking travel within the United States and major US cities and airports, as well as travel to Philippines. El Salvador and other international destinations on occasion. An understanding of time zones is essential for success in this role.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with strong negotiation skills.
Attention to detail.
Critical thinker and problem solver with the ability to manage costs while meeting traveler needs.
College diploma required.
Professional travel training certification highly desirable.
3+ years’ experience in a travel agency with a focus on corporate service, or large corporate travel department(preferred.)
Computer proficiency required. Knowledge of Microsoft Office (MS-Word, Excel) necessary with a strong proficiency in the calendaring functions of Microsoft Outlook.
Knowledge of Concur Expense Management and Travel system a major plus.
Knowledge of Quickbooks a plus.
Experience booking travel with Internet Travel sites such as Expedia, Kayak, Hotels.com as well as directly on US Airline and hotel websites required.
Willing to work on graveyard shift.
Willing to work on site (Ortigas-Pasig)

title: B2B Manager
description:
Remote | Flexible Hours | High-Margin Product Line | Global Market Reach
About the Role
We’re looking for a strategic, resourceful, and results-driven B2B Manager to accelerate MONÉGASQUE’s international expansion across wholesale and corporate channels. This is a commission-only opportunity — ideal for a business-minded closer who wants to earn significantly from high-margin, fast-moving products with growing global demand.
You’ll oversee the entire B2B lifecycle — from prospecting and negotiation to account growth and reorders. The right person combines sales instinct, operational follow-through, and international business sense to build long-term, profitable partnerships.
If you thrive on independence, relationships, and turning opportunities into revenue, you’ll love this role.
About Us
MONÉGASQUE LLC is a U.S.-based company operating across the U.S., U.K., and Canada, specializing in premium edible decorations — glitter, luster dust, and other high-end culinary enhancers for bakeries, hospitality groups, beverage brands, and event professionals.
Our products are visually striking, food-safe, and high-margin, making them ideal for scalable B2B distribution. With a strong Amazon FBA foundation and expanding global operations, we’re now growing our wholesale and private-label partnerships worldwide.
Your Responsibilities
Lead Generation & Outreach
Identify and qualify B2B opportunities across target sectors (bakeries, distributors, hospitality, events, private-label partners).
Build and maintain a structured sales pipeline using research, outreach, and networking.
Develop personalized contact strategies through email, LinkedIn, and direct engagement.
Manage key accounts, ensuring satisfaction, loyalty, and consistent reorder volume.
Represent MONÉGASQUE at relevant trade events and industry forums.
Lead B2B sales initiatives for Amazon Business, wholesale channels, and export markets.

Catalog & Offer Management
Maintain and update product catalogs, B2B pricing sheets, and presentation decks.
Customize commercial proposals aligned with client goals and order volumes.
Collaborate with the marketing team to adapt visuals and messaging for different markets.
Deal Negotiation & Closing
Handle the entire sales cycle, from first contact to closing and onboarding.
Negotiate terms that maximize profitability while sustaining long-term partnerships.
Coordinate with logistics and operations for seamless order fulfillment.

Reporting & Strategy
Track and report weekly lead activity, pipeline health, and conversion metrics.
Identify market trends and new distribution opportunities across regions.
Work directly with leadership to refine pricing, packaging, and partnership strategy.
Who You Are
Degree in Business, Marketing, or International Trade (MBA a plus).
Proven experience in B2B sales, export, or corporate account management.
Skilled in negotiation, communication, and relationship management.
Comfortable working with minimal supervision and full accountability.
Experienced in using CRM tools, online prospecting, and productivity platforms.
Entrepreneurial mindset — motivated by performance and opportunity, not micromanagement.

Compensation
Commission-only with high earning potential due to our strong product margins.
Transparent structure: the more you close, the more you earn — no caps.
Bonus tiers for repeat clients, territory expansion, and large-volume partnerships.

Why MONÉGASQUE?
Partner directly with the founder and leadership team.
Represent a premium, high-margin product line with proven demand.
100% remote and flexible — results matter more than hours.
Be part of a fast-growing international brand redefining the edible decoration market.
Success in This Role Looks Like
Continuous growth in B2B sales volume and recurring client orders.
Established partnerships across key distribution and hospitality sectors.
Predictable revenue generated from long-term, high-margin accounts.
Founder focuses on strategic growth while you own the B2B engine.

title: Associate Recruiter - Onsite - Pasay
description:
Your potential has a place here with TTEC’s award-winning employment experience.  As an Associate Recruiter working onsite in Five Ecom, Pasay, Philippines, you’ll be a part of bringing humanity to business. #experienceTTEC
Our employees have spoken. Our purpose, team, and company culture are amazing and our Great Place to Work® certification in Philippines says it all!
What You’ll be Doing
Recruiting qualified talents to meet aggressive associate hiring requirements for specific clients. They handle level 3 associates and specialized profiles. This may include screening resumes and applications, conducting phone screens, administering TTEC-approved assessments, scheduling onsite/virtual interviews, conducting behavioral interviews, making offers, and completing the onboarding process for each hire. You will also implements sourcing tactics and often represents TTEC at job fairs and other community events. While they function as part of the Talent Acquisition team, they are responsible for aggressive individual recruiting goals which are monitored constantly. You must be able to quickly adapt plans and shift directions to meet changing client requirements. This is a challenging position that is suited for a high-energy individual who must be able to meet aggressive goals and timelines.
You’ll report to Manager, Talent Acquisition. In this role, you’ll impact the business through your recruitment initiatives. 
During a Typical Day, You’ll
· Assist with Taleo data entry (assessment scores, decline candidates, send assessment e-mails and other correspondence).
· Prepares recruitment weekly/monthly reports.
· Learn key business objectives, timeframes, legal issues, and requirements associated with each client. Understand the requirements for each client while strictly adhering to TTEC’s hiring policies.
· Ensures that the candidate meets all legal requirements, participates in all required assessments and that all information is accurately documented within Taleo and in paper or digital files when appropriate.
· Responsible for high-volume hiring needs often requiring screening, interviewing, and processing of hundreds of candidates each week. This requires tremendous focus, organization, and efficiency.
What You Bring to the Role
· Minimum of 2 years recruiting experience
· Attention to detail, with customer service skills and great interpersonal skills with candidates
· Creative thinking and innovation - constantly looking for opportunities to improve the current process and communicate their ideas to their TA Manager regularly.
· Influence & Persuasion - responsible for encouraging employees to recommend friends and colleagues for positions at TTEC.
· Friendly, helpful, positive demeanor, respectful, communication - Ensures a positive experience for every candidate. Maintain a positive, respectful, and caring attitude toward all candidates – even those that will not be offered a position at TeleTech.
· High level of integrity, judgment, and follow-through.
What You Can Expect 
·    Supportive of your career and professional development
·    An inclusive culture and community minded organization where giving back is encouraged
·    A global team of curious lifelong learners guided by our company values
·    Ask us about our paid time off (PTO) and wellness and healthcare benefits
·    And yes... a great compensation package and performance bonus opportunities, benefits you'd expect and maybe a few that would pleasantly surprise you (like tuition reimbursement)
Visit https://mybenefits.ttec.com/ for more information.
About TTEC
Our business is about making customers happy. That's all we do. Since 1982, we've helped companies build engaged, pleased, profitable customer experiences powered by our combination of humanity and technology. On behalf of many of the world's leading iconic and hypergrowth brands, we talk, message, text, and video chat with millions of customers every day. These exceptional customer experiences start with you.
