Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization
Standard government and Emapta benefits
Total of 20 annual leaves to be used at your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek
3-4+ years of full-cycle recruitment experience in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating success in proactive sourcing and strategic recruiting
Proven success recruiting across diverse departments and functions
Experience supporting hiring across multiple time zones and regions (NA, EMEA, APAC) while recruiting talent locally in the Philippines
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
Ability to maintain confidential company and candidate information
Familiarity with the ATS Workday platform
Desire to learn and advance in a fast-paced environment, using good judgment and discretion to achieve goals
A proactive, adaptable, and solutions-focused mindset
Preferred Attributes:
Experience working with third-party recruitment partners and managing contractor hiring
Knowledge of regional employment laws and compliance requirements
Ability to manage multiple requisitions across time zones with agility and professionalism
Passion for candidate experience and continuous improvement
Your Daily Tasks
Own the Process: Lead end-to-end recruitment across MRI business units
Customer Focus: Deliver exceptional service to candidates, hiring managers, and stakeholders, ensuring a positive hiring experience
Engage Talent: Build strong candidate pipelines and nurture relationships to enhance employer branding
Data & Compliance: Maintain accurate records in Workday and ensure compliance with regional employment regulations
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to global TA initiatives, including process optimization, diversity hiring, and analytics
Problem Solving & Initiative: Apply analytical skills, initiative, and sound judgment to achieve effective outcomes
Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Junior Admin Manager
company: Trinity Insurance and Reinsurance Brokers, Inc
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:
Trinity is a full-line insurance broker providing products and services in General Insurance and Employee Benefits. For more than three decades, Trinity has transformed the lives of its clients and customers, redefining what it means to be in the business of insurance by creating products and services that are customized, personalized, and cost-effective. At least 3–4 years of experience in administrative management or a related function.
Knowledge of government licensing and permit renewal processes.
Familiarity with procurement procedures and supplier accreditation.
Basic understanding of Occupational Health and Safety standards and compliance.
Strong organizational, coordination, communication, and documentation skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office or Google Workspace applications.
Detail-oriented, reliable, and able to manage multiple tasks effectively.
Able to report onsite in San Antonio, Makati

title: Compliance Officer
description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Regulatory Monitoring and Analysis: Continuously monitor and analyze new or amended laws, rules, and regulations in the Philippines that affect YMPH business operations including such as but not limited to, regulations from government bodies like SEC, PEZA, BIR, Board of Investments (BOI), and other relevant agencies.
Internal Compliance Oversight: Reviews and audits internal policies, procedures, and guidelines to ensure they align with Philippine laws and the parent company's global compliance standards. Be the expert who can flag potential discrepancies.
Risk Assessment and Mitigation: Identifies potential compliance risks within the company's processes and recommend corrective actions to mitigate them including development / implementation of a robust risk management framework.
Documentation and Linkage: Creates and maintains a comprehensive compliance database that links specific laws and regulations to our internal policies and parent company rules. This linkage will serve as a central reference point for all departments.
Training and Communication: Develops and delivers training sessions to employees on compliance topics, ensuring everyone understands their role in maintaining an ethical and compliant workplace.
Communicates key compliance updates to relevant stakeholders.
Audit and Reporting: Assists with internal and external audits. Prepares and submits regular compliance reports to senior management and the parent company.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's Degree in Legal Management, Accountancy, Business Administration, or equivalent courses.
At least 3-years of experience in a compliance, legal, or audit role.
Experience as a Document Controller of Legal or Compliance is advantage;
Knowledge of laws and regulations relevant to automotive industry is desirable;
Able to create new procedures and guidelines to adopt the applicable laws.

title: Admin Assistant
description:
Job Summary:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Admin Assistant to manage on-site records and oversee local canvassing and purchasing activities. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate records, sourcing materials, and handling local purchases for our office and vessels.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Act as the on-site records custodian, ensuring accurate management and safekeeping of documents.

Manage the receipt, distribution, and safekeeping of vessels’ trading certificates.
Maintain and track records of site personnel’s timekeeping, overtime (OTs), and leave records.
Submit monthly summary reports on PR/JO and inventories.
Conduct sourcing and canvassing of materials to be locally purchased.
Handle local purchasing of parts and materials required for office operations and vessels.
Coordinate with local suppliers, PGMC, and INC for billing and payments related to purchased services and materials.
Receive and distribute invoices/official receipts (OR), and keep copies for record-keeping.

At least 1 year of experience in administrative support, records management, purchasing coordination, or similar office-based role.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook)
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping
Experience with inventory management systems or procurement processes

title: Associate
description:

We also act as counsel in M&A transactions, equity investments, capital markets, financing, and corporate restructurings.
We are particularly active in the financial technology (fintech) industry where we have assisted clients in their licensing and compliance requirements as securities markets participants, payment systems, merchant acquirers, money service businesses, electronic money issuers (EMI), virtual asset service providers, and lending and financing companies.

title: Master Data Officer
company: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)
description:
PURPOSE
The Master Data Officer ensures master data is managed as per the global master data management policy. They also ensure the accuracy, integrity, and consistency of master data across the Supply Chain. The Officer provides support to internal customers in any MDM related requests and issues. They respect defined service levels and KPI.
RELATIONSHIPS
Internally, interacts with:  Logistics (transports and clearance, warehouse, supply chain, procurement, support, Data BI, medical logistics and logistics generalists), L&D, Finance, ICT and field Logisticians. 
Externally, interacts with counterparts within the Red Cross and Red Crescent Movements.
ACCOUNTABILITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform Master Data daily and regular checks: Data Quality and Consistency: Ensuring that master data (e.g., product information, customer records, etc.) is correct, complete, timely maintained and used consistently across all systems.
Perform Master Data quality and accuracy daily checks 
Perform other regular checks
Monitor the various Master Data interfaces (Item tree, Items to MDS, Recipient places from Location Manager.)
Master Data Objects Maintenance: ERP System Management: Managing master data within an ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system, which integrates core business processes like supply chain, Procurement, finance and operations.
Items creations, updates in the ERP
Ensure the item propagation to appropriate contexts based on pre-defined rules.
Manage phase-in / phase-out of items. (obsolescence analysis, maintain the replacement Cross reference table)
Maintain customers. (Delivery address, internal, external customers, inter site customers) in the ERP
Maintain other Master Data: Transport, procurement, warehousing, planning, MRP, BOM, new sites.
Support: Manage Incidents and service requests related to Master Data Management from internal customers.
Provide solutions to Master Data related incidents and requests. Perform root cause analysis.
Perform tests (User Acceptance, Non-regression, Computer System Validation…) periodically.
Data Analysis: Analyzing data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
Training: Educating teams on how to use and maintain data correctly, ensuring they adhere to data management best practices.
Give key-user trainings on master data related topics.
Give training to new logisticians on master data related topics.
Collaboration: Working with various departments (e.g., finance, operations, supply chain) to ensure data needs are met and that the information supports business decision-making.
Participate in assigned regular meetings, provide feedback and alerts to the Global Master Data Manager in case of potential impactive deviations.
Contribute to the creation of a shared knowledge base.
Contribute to implement new daily / Regular Master Data checks
Process Improvement: Identifying opportunities to improve data-related processes and workflows, ensuring they are efficient and scalable.
SELECTION REQUIREMENTS
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required.
At least 2-3 work experience preferably in Supply Chain Master Data is required.
Experience working in a humanitarian organization is an advantage.
High proficiency in MS Office Suite (focus on Excel), SQL studio manager is essential, certification is an asset. 
Requires the ability to analyse, interpret and communicate complex information, data sets, and procedural compliance from key stakeholders. 
High degree of attention to detail is necessary to spot minor errors, misstatements, or anomalies.
Excellent communication skills in English (oral and writing).
Ability to work remotely within a multi-cultural organization
Ability to manage priorities
WHAT WE OFFER
Diverse and humanitarian-minded workforce
An opportunity to contribute to institutional efforts to protect and assist conflict victims worldwide
Training opportunities
Flexible work schedule
HOW TO APPLY
Qualified applicants are requested to submit their comprehensive and updated resume along with their motivation letter to  https://careers.icrc.org/job-invite/27121/.
Only applications received through the career page link will be pre-screened/processed.
Deadline of application: 09 November 2025
Target Start Date: Immediately
Office Address: 32/F BDO Life Megaplaza, 358 Sen. Gil Puyat Ave., Makati City, Philippines
www.icrc.org
www.facebook.com/icrc
www.twitter.com/icrc
www.linkedin.com/company/icrc
 Only short-listed candidates will be notified.
This vacancy is open for Philippine residents only.

title: Workforce Scheduler | Las Piñas
description:
About TaskUs: TaskUs is a provider of outsourced digital services and next-generation customer experience to fast-growing technology companies, helping its clients represent, protect and grow their brands. Leveraging a cloud-based infrastructure, TaskUs serves clients in the fastest-growing sectors, including social media, e-commerce, gaming, streaming media, food delivery, ride-sharing, HiTech, FinTech, and HealthTech. 

The People First culture at TaskUs has enabled the company to expand its workforce to approximately 45,000 employees globally. Presently, we have a presence in twenty-three locations across twelve countries, which include the Philippines, India, and the United States.

It started with one ridiculously good idea to create a different breed of Business Processing Outsourcing (BPO)! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion, exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge at a moment’s notice, and mastering consistency in an ever-changing world.

What We Offer: At TaskUs, we prioritize our employees' well-being by offering competitive industry salaries and comprehensive benefits packages. Our commitment to a People First culture is reflected in the various departments we have established, including Total Rewards, Wellness, HR, and Diversity. We take pride in our inclusive environment and positive impact on the community. Moreover, we actively encourage internal mobility and professional growth at all stages of an employee's career within TaskUs. Join our team today and experience firsthand our dedication to supporting People First.


What does a Workforce Scheduler do? Think of yourself as the leader who ensures staff optimization by ensuring you have adequate resources to meet demand, and keep a close eye on and resolve concerns on schedule adherence, service levels, absenteeism, and other applicable service and efficiency metrics.

Duties
Monitor queue level performance and variance to forecast in real time
Report any significant variations from forecast to Operations and WFM Management
Provide recommendations for addressing and responding to variations from forecast
Monitor agent level schedule adherence
Report any significant inadherence to Operations and WFM Management in a proactive an urgent manner
Analyze variations to forecast and project impact for the remainder of the day
Compile and submit intraday reports with accuracy and timeliness as well as proactive recommendations for actions
Update schedules with real time attendance and exceptions
Approve/recommend alternatives for real time schedule exception requests
Other related duties as required

Skills and Competencies
High level of attention to detail
Good analytical skills including root cause analysis
Strong numerical literacy and a thorough understanding of contact centre and WFM metrics
Ability to communicate effectively to all levels of management, both written and verbal
Strong proactive decision making skills
Ability to read trends and project those trends into future forecasts
High degree of empathy for fellow workers
Ability to resolve differences with win-win solutions

Relationships
The position will report to the WFM Real Time Supervisor
The position will require frequent communication with Operations Management, Team Leaders, other WFM staff
The position will require regular communication and meetings with WFM Schedule/Planning staff

Do you have what it takes to become a Workforce Scheduler?

Here’s what we’re looking for: We are looking for someone with BPO Operations background and at least 2 years of experience in Workforce Planning - preferably with expertise in Forecasting, Planning and Scheduling, and Real Time Management. We need someone with high attention to detail, good analytical skills, and strong numerical literacy. Since the ultimate goal is having a balanced staffing, you should possess a thorough understanding of WFM efficiency metrics. Must be highly organized; and someone who can navigate your way well in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Powerpoint and other database generating applications. Possessing added knowledge and adeptness in using Google Suites is a definite plus!

We need someone who can communicate effectively with all levels of management (written and verbal). Someone who is proactive when it comes to making decisions, as well as solving problems. Someone who has the ability to read trends and project those into future forecasts;
utilize WFM centralized tools; and ensure that the database is regularly maintained.

How We Partner To Protect You: TaskUs will neither solicit money from you during your application process nor require any form of payment in order to proceed with your application. Kindly ensure that you are always in communication with only authorized recruiters of TaskUs.

DEI: In TaskUs we believe that innovation and higher performance are brought by people from all walks of life. We welcome applicants of different backgrounds, demographics, and circumstances. Inclusive and equitable practices are our responsibility as a business. TaskUs is committed to providing equal access to opportunities. If you need reasonable accommodations in any part of the hiring process, please let us know.

title: Data Analyst | Day Shift
description:
Discover your 100% YOU with MicroSourcing!

Position: Data Analyst
Location: Global One, Eastwood Avenue, Libis, Quezon City
Work setup & shift: Onsite | Day shift

Why join MicroSourcing?

You'll have:
Competitive Rewards: Enjoy above-market compensation, healthcare coverage on day one, plus one or more dependents, paid time-off with cash conversion, group life insurance, and performance bonuses
A Collaborative Spirit: Contribute to a positive and engaging work environment by participating in company-sponsored events and activities.
Work-Life Harmony: Enjoy the balance between work and life that suits you with flexible work arrangements.
Career Growth: Take advantage of opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.
Inclusive Teamwork: Be part of a team that celebrates diversity and fosters an inclusive culture.

Your Role:

As a Data Analyst, you will:

The Data Analyst is responsible for analysing and interpreting data; developing, delivering and reporting on data to share insights aimed at driving improvements to financial performance, ROI, Customer insights, pricing and trends. The ideal candidate will combine technical and Consumer data expertise, commercial acumen, and a solutions-focused mindset. With the ability to Interpret large data sets and turn it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions.

Responsible for developing, analysing and interpreting data; utilise your expertise to optimize business performance:
Collect, interpret and analyse data to improve the business; influence business decision making
Maintain an accurate data analytic structure for the business using multiple data bases
Create complex queries using multiple languages to retrieve, update, insert and manipulate data (SQL, Python, PowerShell, DAX)
Generate smart reporting to measure business key performance indicators using BI tools (Power BI)
Detect trends and sales opportunities by performing consumer buying behaviour analysis
Bring value to stakeholders by providing insightful reports using visualizations and statistical methodologies
Perform ad hoc analysis for the wider United Petroleum Group (fuel, shop sales)
Assist in developing comprehensive dashboards, reports with an end-to-end view
Ability to present clear and concise data to senior management, assist and influence decision making
Strong communication skills with a proven ability to build effective relationships with key internal stakeholders
Support the Fuel Pricing, Merchandise, Operations, leadership, property, Repairs and Maintenance on department and company wide data and analytics

What You Need:
Non-negotiables
5+ years experience in business intelligence/analytics
Highly proficient or must have advanced knowledge in Excel and PowerBI.
Nice-to-have: Experience with Tableau and SQL.
Experience in building dashboards, data visualization and presentation
Have worked with large data


About MicroSourcing

With over 9,000 professionals across 13 delivery centers, MicroSourcing is the pioneer and largest offshore provider of managed services in the Philippines.

Our commitment to 100% YOU

MicroSourcing firmly believes that our company's strength lies in our people's diversity and talent. We are proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces individuals of all races, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and backgrounds. We provide space for everyone, embracing different perspectives, and making room for opportunities for each individual to thrive.

At MicroSourcing, equality is not merely a slogan – it's our commitment. Our way of life. Here, we don't just accept your unique authentic self - we celebrate it, valuing every individual's contribution to our collective success and growth. Join us in celebrating YOU and your 100%!

For more information, visit https://www.microsourcing.com/

*Terms & conditions apply

title: Sales Specialist
description:
Sales Specialist (Philippines – Remote)
 Are you passionate about 12V systems, camping, and sales?
KickAss Products believes that adventure shouldn't come at the cost of comfort. Established in 2007, we operate in Australia, the USA, and China, specialising in innovative 12V power solutions for the 4x4, caravan, and camping industry. We manufacture high-quality battery systems and develop essential products and appliances — including charging systems, inverters, and solar solutions — to ensure a seamless off-grid experience.
As a rapidly growing company, we foster a fun and dynamic work environment, reflected in our diverse activities such as our own music festival and rally racing team. At KickAss Products, we empower your travels and adventures with the comforts of home, no matter where the road takes you. Join us as we make off-grid living an enjoyable reality!
 About the Role
This is a pure sales role, responsible for taking inbound and making outbound sales calls. You’ll be the voice of KickAss Australia — helping customers select the right products, closing sales opportunities, and delivering exceptional service at every touchpoint.
You’ll work closely with our Australian Head Office team and collaborate with other departments to develop expert knowledge of our 12V product range.
This is a work-from-home position, so you’ll need a dedicated quiet workspace, high-speed internet, and a professional computer setup capable of handling multiple systems and calls efficiently.
 Key Responsibilities
 Inbound Sales Calls
Handle inbound sales inquiries with confidence and professionalism.
Provide expert product advice tailored to customer needs.
Close sales effectively and accurately log interactions in our CRM (Gorgias).
Outbound Sales Calls
Proactively follow up with warm leads, past customers, and abandoned carts.
Upsell or cross-sell complementary products and promote new releases.
Customer Relationship Building
Build strong rapport with Australian customers by understanding their off-grid needs and providing practical, tailored solutions.
Product Knowledge
Maintain a deep understanding of KickAss products to provide accurate recommendations and technical information.
Sales Reporting
Record sales activities, call outcomes, and customer feedback within the CRM system to track performance and pipeline opportunities.
Customer Feedback & Reputation
Encourage happy customers to leave positive reviews and feedback, helping strengthen brand reputation.

Selection Criteria 
Essential
Minimum 2 years of inbound and outbound sales experience.
Strong knowledge of 12V power systems, 4WD setups, or camping gear.
Confident communicator with excellent English verbal and written skills.
Experience using CRM / eCommerce tools (e.g., Gorgias, Shopify, Zendesk, or similar).
Highly self-motivated, target-driven, and comfortable working autonomously.
Reliable home office setup - including high-speed internet, quiet environment, and professional-grade headset and computer.
Desirable
Engineering or technical degree.
Proven success in phone-based sales, ideally with an Australian customer base.
Knowledge or personal interest in the camping, 4WD, or off-grid lifestyle.
Experience selling technical products online or over the phone.

Why Join KickAss?
Be part of a fast-growing Australian brand known for quality, innovation, and adventure.
Work remotely while collaborating with a passionate international team.
Competitive salary plus sales incentives.
Ongoing product training and career development opportunities.
Make a real impact helping Aussies power their adventures off the grid!

title: Workforce Planner | Las Piñas
description:
About TaskUs: TaskUs is a provider of outsourced digital services and next-generation customer experience to fast-growing technology companies, helping its clients represent, protect and grow their brands. Leveraging a cloud-based infrastructure, TaskUs serves clients in the fastest-growing sectors, including social media, e-commerce, gaming, streaming media, food delivery, ride-sharing, HiTech, FinTech, and HealthTech. 

The People First culture at TaskUs has enabled the company to expand its workforce to approximately 45,000 employees globally. Presently, we have a presence in twenty-three locations across twelve countries, which include the Philippines, India, and the United States.

It started with one ridiculously good idea to create a different breed of Business Processing Outsourcing (BPO)! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion, exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge at a moment’s notice, and mastering consistency in an ever-changing world.

What We Offer: At TaskUs, we prioritize our employees' well-being by offering competitive industry salaries and comprehensive benefits packages. Our commitment to a People First culture is reflected in the various departments we have established, including Total Rewards, Wellness, HR, and Diversity. We take pride in our inclusive environment and positive impact on the community. Moreover, we actively encourage internal mobility and professional growth at all stages of an employee's career within TaskUs. Join our team today and experience firsthand our dedication to supporting People First.


What does a Workforce Planner do? Think of yourself as the leader who ensures staff optimization by ensuring you have adequate resources to meet demand, and keep a close eye and resolve concerns on schedule adherence, service levels, absenteeism, and other applicable service and efficiency metrics. You will have the foresight in preparing for voice and non-voice volume, seat occupancy, average handle time, and other factors that measure productivity and campaign performance. So not just anyone is qualified for this role. We make sure we get the best of the best, and ensure our employees are top-notch! So, it’s time to imagine what it’s like being a Workforce Planner.

Imagine that you’re an orchestrator, aligning with numerous programs to optimize employee productivity, coordinating with training and talent acquisition to forecast and manage staffing needs, and collaborating with IT to customize information systems, to help supervise the fiscal activities within your team. You will monitor the accuracy of billing procedures for all clients within the site, and identify strategies to improve campaign processes and opportunities to increase profitability. As you tackle your new tasks for the day, you know that it will lead to one thing: you must be effective in driving staffing forecasts that are best for our people and our business.

As a Workforce Planner, you will coordinate with operations, clients, and client services to be able to gather all the relevant data related to forecasting and calculation of program requirements (for capacity planning and for a scheduling standpoint). Along with this, you will be in charge of maintaining a roster of staff with accurate employee details which includes availability, preferences, and skills.

What else? You will publish over/under snapshots and create action plans that would either address any staffing gaps or minimize overages. You will be responsible for inputs in the online capacity plan tool and for ensuring that the seating plan is accurate and adequate to meet operational needs.

Do you have what it takes to become a Workforce Planner?

Here’s what we’re looking for: We are looking for someone with BPO Operations background and at least 2 years of experience in Workforce Planning - preferably with expertise in Forecasting, Planning and Scheduling, and Real Time Management. We need someone with high attention to detail, good analytical skills, and strong numerical literacy. Since the ultimate goal is having a balanced staffing, you should possess a thorough understanding of WFM efficiency metrics. Must be highly organized; and someone who can navigate your way well in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Powerpoint and other database generating applications. Possessing added knowledge and adeptness in using Google Suites is a definite plus!

We need someone who can communicate effectively with all levels of management (written and verbal). Someone who is proactive when it comes to making decisions, as well as solving problems. Someone who has the ability to read trends and project those into future forecasts; utilize WFM centralized tools; and ensure that the database is regularly maintained.

DEI: In TaskUs we believe that innovation and higher performance are brought by people from all walks of life. We welcome applicants of different backgrounds, demographics, and circumstances. Inclusive and equitable practices are our responsibility as a business. TaskUs is committed to providing equal access to opportunities. If you need reasonable accommodations in any part of the hiring process, please let us know.

title: Financial Planning & Analysis Lead
description:
Financial Planning & Analysis Lead
We are seeking a detail-oriented, highly analytical FP&A Lead to join our finance team. This role will be responsible for overseeing financial forecasting, budgeting, and analysis to support strategic decision-making across the organization. The ideal candidate will have strong financial modeling skills, a solid understanding of accounting principles, and excellent communication abilities.

Responsibilities
Manage and oversee the annual budgeting, forecasting, and long-range financial planning processes.
Develop and maintain complex financial models to support decision-making across the organization.
Analyze financial data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities for growth.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of financial plans with strategic objectives.
Lead the monthly financial reporting process, including variance analysis and management reporting.
Drive improvements in financial processes, systems, and reporting capabilities to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
Prepare ad-hoc financial analyses and reports as needed to support decision-making.
Developing, coordinating, and reporting budgets and forecasts for individual departments;
Partnering with departmental leaders to determine and support financial analysis needs;
Assist on managing financial aspects of special projects by determining key drivers, driving the right set of analyses and presenting the conclusions;
Responsible for complete, accurate and timely Billing Charges and work closely with Accounting Team on collections
Ensure Cost charges to servicing markets are allocated properly and supported by Servicing Agreements
Work closely with on shore markets related to cost charging
Mentor and develop FP&A team member, promoting a culture of continuous learning and professional growth.
 Qualifications
Candidates with audit firm experience highly preferred
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in financial planning and analysis or a similar role, with at least 2 years as supervisor
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) license is a plus but not necessary
Strong financial modeling and superior analytical skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial software applications, such as Table Manager1 tool.
Knowledge of accounting principles and financial statement analysis.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Self-starter with a good track record of working in a dynamic and self-sufficient environment
Proven ability to lead and develop high-performing teams.
Enthusiasm for solving problems and working collaboratively
Results focused and proactive,
Can do attitude with energy; pro-active and performance driven both as leader and individual contributor
Well organized and possess ability to prioritize, multi task and manage conflicts.
Accuracy and timeliness on delivery of required outputs.
Knowledge on using PowerPoint as presentation tool
Role model of integrity

title: Data Analyst
description:
Join Our Team as a Data Analyst (Digital Marketing & Sales Focus)
REQUIREMENT: FULL WORK ON SITE IN ORTIGAS, PASIG CITY
Are you a data-driven investigator who loves turning complex numbers into clear, actionable business strategy? Do you excel at wrangling data, crafting compelling visualizations, and diving deep into SQL to uncover the why behind performance?
We're looking for a sharp Data Analyst to play a critical role in optimizing our digital marketing spend and boosting overall business profitability. You won't just run reports—you'll be the expert who drives strategic decisions and helps us stay ahead of the curve.

On-Site Benefits:
Get the full experience of working together with passionate teammates at our Ortigas, Pasig office.
We believe in rewarding our employees comprehensively. Here's what you can expect:
Competitive Salary: We offer a competitive salary that recognizes your skills and contributions.
Comprehensive Benefits Package: Your well-being is important to us. Our benefits include:
Day 1 Health Insurance: Immediate coverage from your first day.
Free Dependent Upon Regularization: Extend your health benefits to a dependent once regularized.
De Minimis Benefits: To further enhance your take-home pay and well-being, we provide various tax-exempt de minimis benefits, such as: Rice allowance, Clothing allowance, Laundry allowance, Medical cash allowance, and Daily meal and transportation allowance for overtime work.
Retirement Benefit: Plan for your future with our service retirement program.
Christmas Bonus: We show our appreciation during the holiday season with a special Christmas bonus.
Generous Paid Time Off: Enjoy 24 days of paid time off annually (12 vacation leaves, 12 sick leaves).
Convertible Sick Leaves: Unused sick leaves are convertible to cash.
Tuition Assistance: We support your child’s education with tuition assistance of up to 75%.
Mandatory Government Benefits: SSS, Philhealth, Pag-IBIG Fund, 13th Month Pay
Quarterly Sponsored Company Events
What You'll Do: The Impact You'll Make
Digital Performance Detective: Extract and deeply analyze performance data from key digital marketing platforms, including Google Ads and Google Analytics, to measure initiative success and find optimization opportunities.
Profitability Partner: Utilize your expert SQL skills to query company databases, rigorously evaluate profitability, identify key business metrics, and provide insights that directly impact the bottom line.
Sales Integrity: Systematically investigate sales data from merchant accounts to pinpoint and resolve inconsistencies, ensuring data accuracy across the board.
Insight Storyteller: Develop powerful, clear data visualizations and presentations that translate complex findings into concise, actionable recommendations for leadership and various stakeholders.
Strategic Driver: Present your analysis and insights in a clear, compelling manner that supports critical business decision-making processes.

What You'll Bring: Core Skills & Expertise
SQL Mastery: A proven ability to write complex, efficient queries for data extraction and analysis.

title: Park Officer
description:

title: Traffic Operations Head
description:
POSITION TITLE: Head of Traffic Operations
DEPARTMENT: Traffic Management
REPORTS TO: VP for Operations
JOB SUMMARY:
The Head of Traffic Operations will lead and oversee all aspects of traffic management for the expressway. This includes ensuring safe, efficient, and smooth traffic flow, responding to incidents, and maintaining high service levels for motorists. The role requires strong leadership, extensive experience in traffic engineering and enforcement, and the ability to coordinate with government agencies and private sector partners. The successful candidate must demonstrate strong people management skills and a high level of professionalism and customer service.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead the Traffic Operations Division, overseeing a team of at least 500 personnel across multiple locations.
Develop and implement traffic management plans, incident response strategies, and patrol operations.
Monitor traffic conditions using real-time systems and adjust strategies to manage congestion, incidents, and emergencies.
Oversee traffic engineering projects to improve road safety and optimize expressway capacity.
Serve as the primary liaison with traffic-related government agencies (e.g., MMDA, PNP-HPG, DPWH, LGUs) and private organizations for permits, joint operations, and regulatory compliance.
Ensure strict implementation of traffic laws, internal protocols, and expressway rules.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives in patrol deployment, equipment usage, and digital traffic solutions.
Manage and coach field teams to ensure high-performance standards, discipline, and customer responsiveness.
Develop KPIs and submit regular reports on traffic flow, incident handling, and operational efficiency.
Represent the company in stakeholder meetings, emergency response coordination, and traffic-related media engagements, as needed.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Transportation Engineering, Criminology, Public Safety, or related fields; advanced degrees or certifications in traffic management or engineering is a plus.
At least 10 years of progressive experience in traffic operations or traffic law enforcement, with 5 years in a leadership or senior management role.
Proven ability to manage large teams (500+ personnel), ideally in a highway, expressway, or public safety setting.
Strong knowledge of traffic engineering principles and traffic control systems.
Experience in dealing with government agencies, law enforcement units, and regulatory bodies.
Background in traffic laws and enforcement procedures.
Excellent leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Strong crisis management and decision-making skills under pressure.
Customer-focused mindset with a proactive approach to service excellence.

title: Husbandry Global Agent/ Husbandry Agent
description:
We are looking for a Husbandry Agent/Global Agent to join our company.

In Wilhelmsen Port Services, we provide our customers with piece of mind while we handle their cargo, their vessels and their crew. We handle 75,000 port calls per year, which means that every 7 minutes, anywhere around the world, we send a ship safely out to sea again to fulfil its purpose. We match local expertise with strict global standards, making sure we consistently make our customers’ port calls as efficient and safe as possible.

This position reports to the Ships Agency Husbandry Centre Team Lead. The position works closely with Port Operations, the Commercial team, and Ships Agency Credit management functions.

What you will be doing:

Coordination with Account sales on matters related to the coordination and service performance of Husbandry port calls entering the area.
Respond and follow up on customer enquiries.
Ensure that all appointments are handled without delay and assigned correctly to responsible for service execution
Ensure advance funding is remitted correctly to local agent’s bank
Ensure pre-funding are received or the correct level of authority has approved any deviation, prior to performing the Port Call.
Coordinate port calls and services effectively, including proper monitoring of the vessel and attendance to any change requests in compliance with Ships Agency Standard Operating Procedures
Monitor and record expenses that arise during vessels’ port call.
For global port calls, monitor the execution of the port call and work closely with Operations to ensure that we meet customers’ expectations
Ensure Cash-in-Transit (Cash to Master) seamless transaction
Suggest process improvements based on efficiency, productivity or cost effectiveness gains.
Register and follow up complaints/non-compliances through improvement processes
Attend business review meetings with customers as required and interact with the relevant stakeholders
Who you are:
Experience from the marine industry, preferably ships agency operations
Ability to work independently and systematically
Able to meet deadlines through good time management and allocation of priorities
Ability and aptitude to learn is a must
Training can be provided to bring the candidate up to speed with the requisite knowledge to perform the job
Different language speaking individuals will be an advantage. (Cantonese, Japan, Korean) as the job requires to deal with native speaker from these countries
What we offer:

Working in Wilhelmsen can offer a culture and work environment of strong leadership, career development, work-life balance and a job that is both challenging and stimulating. Our organization thrives by using modern tools and is eager to utilize the business opportunities that arise with new digital tools and skills. Beyond this, we offer a generous and bespoke benefits package tailored to your specific Wilhelmsen HUB.

Work location: Manila

You may submit your application to the following contact: WPS.MNL.HR@wilhelmsen.com

#WPS

title: Program Coordinator
description:

title: TRAVEL CUSTOMER SUCCESS REPRESENTATIVE I
description:
TRAVEL CUSTOMER SUCCESS REPRESENTATIVE I
Job Type: Full Time
Location: Goway Travel Manila Office
Reporting to: Operations Manager
Job purpose:
This position requires a highly skilled and experienced professional to provide exceptional customer service within the travel industry. The Travel Customer Success Representative will be responsible for managing customer relationships, resolving inquiries and issues, and ensuring a positive customer experience throughout the travel process. This role demands strong communication, problem-solving, and organizational skills, as well as proficiency in relevant CRM and communication technologies. The successful candidate will possess a deep understanding of the travel industry and a commitment to delivering outstanding service.

What will be your key responsibilities?
Respond to inquiries, resolve issues, and proactively anticipate customer needs via phone, email, and chat.
Develop a deep understanding of customer needs and preferences to create personalized experiences.
Assist customers with booking changes, cancellations, and other travel arrangements.
Resolve customer concerns with empathy and efficiency.
Maintain knowledge of destinations, airlines, hotels, and other travel providers.
Leverage platforms such as HubSpot, Aircall, and Perseus to manage customer interactions and track performance.
Collaborate with other team members to ensure a consistent and positive customer experience.

What are we looking for?
2-3 years of experience in BPO Travel Account: Proven track record of providing exceptional customer service in the travel industry.
Strong communication skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to adapt to different communication styles.
Problem-solving skills: Ability to identify and resolve customer issues effectively and efficiently.
Organizational skills: Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively.
Technical proficiency: Experience with CRM platforms (HubSpot is a plus), communication tools (Aircall is a plus), and travel booking systems (Perseus is a plus).
Passion for travel: Genuine interest in the travel industry and a desire to create memorable experiences for customers.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in travel, business, or a related field.

What can you expect from Goway?
Imagine working for a company where your career feels like an adventure. At Goway, you’ll join a global community that supports one another:
We offer a competitive salary accompanied by performance incentives, and we place real importance on time away from work, such as paid personal days for when life calls for them and your birthday off each year.
Your future matters to us, so we match your RRSP contributions and provide comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage.
Our commitment to professional growth means you’ll have access to continuous learning and industry-leading training that keeps you at the forefront of travel innovation.
Travel is in our DNA, so you’ll enjoy exclusive perks and discounts on worldwide getaways.
Since we operate across Toronto, Vancouver, Los Angeles, Manila, Sydney, and beyond, you’ll collaborate across cultures and shape a career path that reflects your ambitions.
Goway is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate differences and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace for everyone. We appreciate every applicant’s interest. Please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

How to Apply:
If this role feels like your next step, click "Apply Now" to create your profile, upload your CV, and share a few details about yourself. Our talent team reviews every application, and if your experience aligns with our needs, we will reach out to set up the next step.

Recruitment scams & fraud warning:
Please be aware of any suspicious emails or WhatsApp activity from individuals pretending to be recruiters or senior personnel at Goway Travel. We will never ask you to install an app during the recruitment process. If you receive a message of this nature, please ignore it and report it to Goway.

About Goway
Founded in Toronto in 1970 by Australian economist Bruce Hodge, Goway has evolved from a one-person dream into a family-owned global leader in tailor-made travel. With our headquarters in Toronto and hubs in Vancouver, Los Angeles, Sydney, and Manila, our team of over 700 talented employees designs travel experiences in more than 115 countries across all seven continents. We’re united by a passion for travel and are committed to doing the right thing: supporting diversity, equity, inclusion, and sustainable tourism that enriches local communities. Whether working remotely or side by side in one of our offices, we operate as one forward-thinking team, transforming wanderlust into life-changing adventures for our fellow Globetrotters. Discover more at goway.com

title: Documents Analyst
description:
Noon Dalton invites all its employees to embrace our core values, living them every day, in every aspect of their role.
Empathy 
At Noon Dalton, being empathetic means being patient and understanding, both with Clients and with each other. We don’t make businesses conform to our requirements. We understand what they need and do our best to help them.
Simplification 
We’re not looking for artificial simplicity: things that look simple but aren’t well-thought-out. We strip down our processes until all that remains is useful and essential. We remove complications and complexity for both our customers and our employees.
Continuous Improvement 
We are always looking for ways to improve, both professionally and personally. Whether that means taking part in accent neutralization training, trying to better our public speaking, or evaluating our daily processes to see how we can do them faster and easier.
Job Description:
Learn to review and validate supply chain and trade compliance documents to ensure they meet international and regional guidelines.
Help maintain accurate records and track materials from their source to final production.

Work closely with the compliance and operations teams to improve document accuracy and workflow efficiency.
Use Mandarin to communicate with Chinese suppliers and partners for clarification of documents or process details (training and support provided).

Qualifications:
Possesses a process-oriented mindset, with a focus on accuracy and consistency.
Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills with excellent attention to detail.
Proficient in both written and verbal English, with the ability to communicate clearly and professionally.
Highly organized and efficient, capable of managing multiple tasks and meeting deadlines.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and able to handle high volumes of workload effectively.

Basic proficiency in Mandarin

Engagement activities
Annual appraisal
12 Days Leaves Annually

Fun working environment

title: Data Governance Analyst
description:
The Data Governance Analyst is responsible for enabling and governing the adoption of the data governance capabilities within the Azure Purview, Informatica CDGC and CDQ and beyond. In collaboration with the Platform Engineer Team, Advance Analytics Team, Business Stakeholders within US and globally, the incumbent must have a passion for how data can be trusted and accessed easily so it can be leveraged as a strategic asset for the consumers and producers.

Position Responsibilities:
Assist the Data Governance Director to achieve outcomes defined in the Book of Work and KPIs/OKRs assigned for our segment.
Support the technical deployment and enablement of the Azure Purview, Informatica CDGC and CDQ and work with vendor to prioritize features on the roadmap.
Support the Data Quality implementation including but not limited to data profiling, write data quality rules, tables mapping based on the critical data elements defined, data quality score and monitoring, DQ production deployment.
Contribute and provide practical guidance around data quality, metadata management, data access and security.
Ensure all data management processes conform to standard operating procedures and aligns with modern data architecture & enterprise technology standards and policies including the Global EDL standards.
Design, upgrade and implement innovative data workflows, automation, tools, and API integrations.
Work with DG Director and global counterparts to promote a data driven culture through data literacy programs and best practices.
Innovation and Continuous Improvement through evaluation and Proof of Concept of new data technologies and capabilities that are value-driven to the organization.

Required Qualifications:
5+ years professional experience in big data management including a university degree in Engineering, IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent program
Knowledgeable in data processing languages such as SQL, Python, Go, Java, or Scala.
Expert knowledge of data governance concepts, not limited to metadata, data quality, lineage, data protection and organizational accountability
Expertise in data technologies and the use of data to support software development, advanced analytics, and reporting
Extensive experience implementing data storage solutions, managing, and developing data processing, and optimizing data solutions (Azure)
Expertise in integrating, transforming, and consolidating data from structured and unstructured data systems suitable for analytics solutions
Understanding of parallel processing and data architecture patterns
Experience in building secure data processing pipelines using Azure data services. Knowledge of basic TCP/IP protocols, REST and RPC protocols
Familiar in developing code in IDE’s like VSCode, PyCharm etc. with knowledge of basic code versioning in GIT
Ability to work with minimal or no supervision; ability and initiative to organize various functions necessary to accomplish department activities or goals and be a strong team player

Preferred Qualifications:
Azure Storage Explorer/Data Studio, Synapse /Azure Data Factory/Databricks, Azure Data Lake Gen 2

When you join our team:
We’ll empower you to learn and grow the career you want.

As part of our global team, we’ll support you in shaping the future you want to see.

title: Public Relations & Reputation Management Assistant Manager
description:
GENERAL PURPOSEOF THE JOB:

The Public Relations and Reputation Management Assistant Manager is a strategic communicator responsible for enhancing brand visibility, safeguarding corporate reputation, and driving stakeholder engagement.

With a discerning eye for storytelling and a meticulous approach to execution, the role leads media relations, supports crisis response, contributes to CSR communications, and collaborates with external PR agencies. The position also tracks and evaluates campaign performance to ensure alignment with business objectives and commitment to brand excellence.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Public Relations and Reputation Management
Develops and implements PR and reputation-building strategies that reflect brand positioning and corporate priorities
Ensures consistent and aligned messaging across all external communications
Cultivates relationships with media outlets, journalists, and influencers to secure meaningful coverage
Manages PR campaigns end-to-end, including press releases, media kits, and public statements
Creates thought leadership content (e.g., op-eds, bylined articles) that positions the company and its executives as industry visionaries
Coordinates media interviews, press events, and executive visibility opportunities.
Collaborates with third-party PR agencies to ensure strategic alignment and high-impact execution
Evaluates media partnership opportunities and provide strategic recommendations.
Aligns PR efforts with broader marketing initiatives in coordination with Marketing and Sales Team
Ensures consistent, brand-aligned messaging across all external communications
Leads corporate award applications to reinforce credibility and industry leadership
Organizes and manages media events, press conferences, and promotional activities to boost the organization’s visibility and strengthen relationships with stakeholders

Crisis Communications
Assists in the development of crisis communication protocols and materials
Supports real-time response efforts during reputational threats or crises and manage media inquiries during challenging situations
Coordinates with internal stakeholders and external partners to ensure timely and accurate communication
Monitors and analyze media coverage, industry trends, and public sentiment to provide actionable insights to senior management
Participates in post-crisis reviews and integrate learnings into future planning

CSR Communications Support
Leads the communication strategy for CSR programs, showcasing the organization’s commitment to sustainability and community engagement
Creates compelling narratives and campaigns around CSR initiatives, demonstrating impact and fostering community partnerships
Identifies and engages with non-profit organizations and community stakeholders to enhance visibility and support for CSR efforts
Helps measure and report on the impact of CSR communications

Reporting and Evaluation
Prepares detailed reports on media coverage, impact of communication strategies, and CSR initiatives for stakeholders and senior management.
Evaluates public relations efforts and provide recommendations for continuous improvement.

Other tasks
Prepares and manages the annual PR budget, ensuring efficient use of resources


JOB PROFILE

Educational Background
Bachelor’s degree required - major in Communications, Advertising, Public Relations, Marketing or Journalism is strongly preferred

Professional Background
Must have at least 6-8 years of experience in real estate public relations; agency, luxury brand-oriented experience highly preferred
Strong media network in Metro Manila; global media and PR agency experience is a plus

Knowledge Requirements
Deep understanding of PR, corporate communications, and reputation management best practices and trends

Skills Requirements
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Proficient in PR tools and social media platforms
Proven track record in managing public relations on cross-functional teams developing strategies and tactics for integrated marketing plans
Proven track record in crisis communication and reputation management
Basic proficiency in design and editing tools such as Canva and Adobe Photoshop for visual content creation and enhancement


Ability Requirements
Strategic thinker with meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively across teams.
Creative and proactive mindset with a passion for excellence.

title: HR Employee Relations Specialist
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced HR Employee Relations Specialist to join our Human Resources team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for fostering a positive work environment by managing employee relations issues, ensuring compliance with labor laws, and supporting a culture of respect, fairness, and engagement. This role plays a key part in resolving workplace conflicts, conducting investigations, and advising management and staff on HR policies and procedures.
Key Responsibilities:
Serve as the primary point of contact for employee relations matters across the organization.
Provide guidance and coaching to managers and employees on HR policies, procedures, and employee relations issues.
Conduct prompt, thorough, and fair workplace investigations in response to employee complaints and concerns.
Collaborate with leadership to address and resolve employee issues in a manner that aligns with company values and compliance standards.
Maintain and update records of employee relations cases, investigations, and outcomes.
Analyze trends and metrics to develop proactive strategies that improve employee engagement and reduce turnover.
Support performance management processes, including disciplinary actions and terminations, ensuring legal compliance and consistency.
Assist with the development and delivery of training programs on employee relations topics such as harassment, conflict resolution, and workplace conduct.
Partner with Legal, Compliance, and HR teams to ensure company policies are aligned with employment laws and best practices.
Participate in HR projects and initiatives as assigned.
Qualifications:
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
3–5 years of experience in employee relations or generalist HR roles.
Experience conducting investigations and handling employee complaints.
HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, PHR, or SPHR) is a plus.
Skills & Competencies:
Strong knowledge of labor laws and employment regulations (local, state, and federal).
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and conflict resolution skills.
High emotional intelligence and ability to manage sensitive situations with empathy and confidentiality.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency in HRIS systems and Microsoft Office Suite.

title: Senior Operations Manager (Warehousing & Contract Logistics)
description:
Job Overview:
Responsible for leading and optimizing warehousing, distribution, and logistics operations to achieve efficiency, compliance, and customer satisfaction. Ensures alignment with company objectives and drives continuous improvement across all facilities. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of warehousing, distribution, inventory management, and logistics, combined with strong leadership skills to guide a growing team.

Job Responsibilities:
Develop and execute operational strategies in line with business goals.
Oversee daily warehouse and distribution operations, including inbound, outbound, and inventory management.
Monitor KPIs (accuracy, productivity, on-time delivery) and implement process improvements.
Lead resource planning, vendor management, and cost optimization initiatives.
Drive automation, process efficiency, and Lean/6S continuous improvement projects.
Collaborate with sales, finance, HR, and IT to ensure smooth operational support.
Lead, mentor, and develop the operations team; foster a culture of accountability and teamwork.
Manage operational budgets and ensure cost efficiency without compromising service quality.
Uphold compliance with company policies, safety, and regulatory standards.
Oversee operational projects and report progress to regional management.
Job Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Operations Management, or related field.
8–10 years of experience in warehousing, distribution, or logistics, with at least 5 years in leadership.
Strong leadership, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Proficient in WMS/ERP systems and continuous improvement methodologies.
Customer-focused mindset and proven ability to manage large-scale operations.

Full job details will be discussed during the interview.

title: Insurance Verification Specialist | Work from home (A-PEN)
description:
Position Summary
We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Insurance Verification Specialist to join our growing healthcare support team. This role is responsible for verifying patient insurance benefits, checking claim statuses, and ensuring accurate documentation of all verification activities. The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, and thrives in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.

Job Details:
Work from Home
Monday to Friday | 10:00 PM to 7:00 AM (Manila time)

Key Responsibilities
• Verify patient insurance benefits and eligibility by contacting insurance companies and reviewing online payer portals.
• Ensure all verification and eligibility details are accurate and complete within contracted timelines.
• Maintain a structured system for initial and subsequent benefit verifications.
• Prepare and update individual patient files and related documentation using a HIPAA-compliant system.
• Generate daily activity reports for verification of benefits (VOB) tasks.
• Collaborate with internal teams to resolve discrepancies and ensure data accuracy.
• Maintain confidentiality, integrity, and compliance with all HIPAA and HITECH standards.
• Perform other related or ad-hoc administrative duties as assigned.

Qualifications
• Working knowledge of Excel, Word, and Office 365.
• Strong background in Accounts Receivable, including follow-ups and appeals.
• Understanding of HCPCS and CPT codes.
• Experience with facility and laboratory billing (UB-04 and CMS-1500 forms).
• Familiarity with HIPAA and HITECH regulations.
• Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written.
• High attention to detail, accuracy, and professional integrity.

title: Sr. Executive Assistant
description:
JOB SUMMARY:
The Executive Assistant provides high-level administrative, operational, and strategic support to the President. This role ensures the President’s directives, priorities, and performance goals are executed efficiently by coordinating across departments, managing key documents and proposals, and driving productivity, compliance, and engagement initiatives.

Executive and Administrative Support
Manage the President’s calendar, meetings, travel, and communication flow.
Prepare and organize executive documents, reports, presentations, and correspondence.
Maintain confidentiality and professionalism in handling sensitive business matters.
Represent the President in internal meetings when delegated and provide concise debriefs.
Contract and Client Management
Prepare, review, monitor, and update new and existing client contracts, ensuring they are accurate, compliant, and submitted or renewed on time.
Maintain a central database or dashboard for all client agreements with alerts for renewals, expirations, and compliance requirements.
Coordinate with Legal, Finance, and Operations to ensure contract alignment with company policies and revenue goals.
Financial Proposal and Profitability Oversight
Assist in the preparation and review of client cost estimates and proposals, ensuring target profit margins and cost efficiencies are achieved.
Support the President in analyzing revenue and cost implications of new deals or renewals.
Track and document profitability performance across key accounts and projects.
Field Audits and Quality Compliance
Conduct field audits and quality checks on ongoing projects to ensure client KPIs, service standards, and contractual deliverables are met.
Prepare field reports and recommend corrective actions to concerned departments.
Coordinate with Project Managers and Leads to resolve performance gaps.
Organizational Productivity and Efficiency
Assess and improve productivity and workflow across departments through process mapping, system improvements, and performance tracking.
Assist the President in implementing dashboards or reporting tools for operational KPIs.
Promote interdepartmental collaboration and accountability to improve turnaround time and output quality.
Employee Engagement and Leadership Programs
Support President-led engagement and leadership development initiatives in coordination with HR and Training.
Help plan and execute Town Halls, Team Building, and Leadership Summits.
Monitor participation and effectiveness of engagement programs to ensure alignment with company culture and values.

title: Fully Remote - Corporate Finance Manager
description:
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The Corporate Finance Manager will be responsible for the following: 
Demonstrates strong expertise in financial modeling and financial analysis. Experience with the development and maintenance of financial models to support strategic initiatives across business units. 
Analyzes financial and operational data to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for improvement. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to gather relevant information and ensure alignment with organizational goals and reporting requirements. 
Supports Corporate Finance activities, including preparation of materials and analysis for Equity, Debt, and Compensation Committee meetings; coordination of Investor Relations (IR) deliverables and Board of Directors (BOD) presentations; financial guidance on sales contracts and commercial arrangements; and strategic risk assessment across geographies, processes, data, legal, and compliance. 

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
To perform this role successfully, the individual must be able to execute each essential function effectively. The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary for success. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions. 

Primary Responsibilities: Corporate Finance, Executive Support, and General Accounting 
Committee and Governance Support: Prepare materials and manage calendars for Equity, Debt, and Compensation Committees; track actions and follow-ups; coordinate Board/committee timelines and ensure compliant document retention. 
Investor Relations and Board Materials: Build executive-ready investor and Board packs (financial narratives, KPI dashboards, outlooks, and risk updates) and support Q&A preparation; align messages, metrics, and disclosures with leadership. 
Strategic Risk Assessment: Identify and assess enterprise risks (geo, process, data, legal, compliance); maintain a risk/mitigation register and integrate risk factors into plans, forecasts, and leadership updates. 
Client Communication and Engagement Leadership: Communicate issues and recommendations to clients; plan engagements (timelines, risk assessments, work programs) and lead smaller/non-complex workstreams. 
Other duties as assigned aligned with Corporate Finance, executive support, and general Finance responsibilities. 

Secondary Responsibilities: Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) 
Lead the collection, analysis, and interpretation of financial data to identify trends, variances, and areas for improvement. 
Prepare and present data visualizations and financial insights to key stakeholders to support strategic decision-making. 
Support monthly financial reporting, including management reports and performance dashboards. 
Provide ad-hoc financial analysis and reporting as needed. 
Perform tasks as outlined in client-specific “agreed upon procedures” and contribute to special projects as needed. 
Maintain confidentiality of all financial and operational data. 
Promote continuous improvement in planning, forecasting, and reporting processes by leveraging available tools and systems. 
Provide financial analytics to support project and program execution. 
Share expertise and mentor other members of the FP&A team. 
Perform other duties as assigned. 

QUALIFICATIONS: MINIMUM EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.  
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) designation is a strong advantage.  
5–10 years of progressive experience in financial planning & analysis, strategic finance and/or as a chief of staff.  
Solid understanding of financial modeling and project management of business initiatives.  
Demonstrated experience preparing executive-ready materials (Board decks, committee packs, investor or leadership presentations). 
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.  
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel.  
Working knowledge of accounting software and ERP systems.  
Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools and concepts, with the ability to apply AI-driven analytics and automation in financial processes.  
Willingness to work one of the following shifts, Tuesday to Saturday:
Mid Shift: 3:00 PM to 12:00 MN
Early Shift: 3:00 AM to 12:00 NN
Night Shift: 1:00 AM to 10:00 AM
TECHNICAL AND OTHER SKILLS:
Strong financial modeling and analytical skills.  
Deep understanding of accounting principles and financial statement analysis.  
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial software applications (e.g., Vareto).  
Familiarity with data visualization platforms such as Microsoft Power BI and Tableau is a plus.  
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present financial insights clearly.  
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  
High attention to detail and strong problem-solving capabilities.  
Ability to follow instructions, workflows, and process documentation accurately.  
Strong time management and organizational skills to handle multiple priorities effectively. 
Comfortable responding to questions and presenting information to supervisors and stakeholders. 

CORE COMPETENCIES
Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Interpersonal Skills - Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control.
Oral Communication - Listens and gets clarification.
Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.
Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses equipment and materials properly.
Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.
Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time; Ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; Available to work after normal business hours when required.
Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to Firm’s management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals. Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.
