title: Audit Officer - Business Process Documentation
description:
Specific Duties and Responsibilities

Specific Tasks
Document Control
(In the absence of a Document Controller) 
• Prepares and maintains the Document Control Policy which shall contain the policies and guidelines on the organizations’ policies and procedures manual (which might contain, but not exclusive to):
• Policies/Procedures/Guidelines/Work Instructions/ Forms template
• Document Control number
• Revision history
• Routing process to reviewers and signatories
• Protocols on use of controlled and uncontrolled copies
• Policy on requesting for copies
• Lost documents

Prepares and maintains the Policies and Procedures Manual document master list. 
Safekeep all original and signed copies of policies and procedures manual (original and revised) 
Ensure that all Departments have their corresponding copies of approved and updated Policies and Procedures manual

• Assists each Department with the preparation of their Policies and Procedures Manual by reviewing each policy draft to ensure that it is compliant to the provisions of the Document Control Policy, clear and concise, uses the correct template, etc.
Process Documentation 
Prepares and maintains the master list of all processes (concurred by each Dept Head) that will require written documentation, including the committed target deadline for the preparation of each.

Assists each Department with the preparation of their “as-is” Policies and Procedures Manual:
• Interview of each process owners regarding their respective processes
• Preparation of the process flowchart
• Preparation of the written draft of the policies and procedures

Prepares the process flowchart, routes it for approval, and maintains the signed file copies of the process flowchart ----updating as necessary.

Assists each Department with the updating of their respective Policies and Procedures Manual to reflect the changes based on the agreed-upon improved process.
Process Improvement 
Evaluate and assess the “as-is” process, to ensure that there’s sufficient control on the process while

Discuss the proposed process improvements with the Audit Department Head, before presenting to the respective Process Managers.

Prepare the improved process map, and route for signatures 
Ensure that the written policies and procedures manual are updated by each Process Owners to reflect the agreed process improvements.
Process Audit 
Prepares the annual process audit plan considering the risk-based approach, for review and approval of the Department Manager. 
Prepares the audit procedures for the process audit, presents the same for the review of the immediate superior/Department Head. 
Conduct the process audit engagement:
• Engagement planning
• Audit fieldwork (gathering of documents and data, audit testing, etc.)
• Initial report preparation
• Discussion of findings and recommendations
• Final report preparation

Monitors the committed actions and target deadlines of each Department related to the results of the Process Audit
Project Management 
Prepares and maintains listing of all the projects under BPD, updating as necessary.

Prepares individual project plans for long-term engagements, using Gantt Chart format, updating as necessary. 
Monitor the completion of each project and immediately update the Department Manager/Immediate Superior of any significant deviations from the plans.
Balanced Scorecards
(Within the Department) 
Assists the Department Head in the following:
• Identification of KPIs per section within the Department;
• Conduct evaluation and assessment of KPI performance;
• Maintain records of the KPI performance.
Department Admin 
Regularly prepare and submit planned tasks and accomplishment report to the Department Head/Immediate Superior

title: Technical Expert (Civil Engineer)
location: Matandang Balara, Quezon City, Metro Manila
description:
Job Description

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Performs structural peer-review of consultant-designed and in-house designed projects.
2. Takes the lead in the accurate and timely evaluations of bid proposals.
3. Ensures good quality of Technical Bidding Documents in terms of compliance, value engineering, transparency and accuracy.
4. Represent the Company at technical meetings, design reviews, and discussions with consultants, contractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders.
5. Provide necessary technical support to Maynilad such as risk assessments, investigations, and engineering studies to the project delivery and project management teams to address project related concerns. 
6. Assist in developing design concepts and scope development.
7. Provide technical review on structural analysis and design with his/her solid foundation in the fundamentals of structural engineering and knowledge on the design integration of civil/structural with other engineering discipline.
8. Exhibit a high level of attention to detail and quality control.
9. Prepare technical reports and reports to higher management or to both internal and external clients.
10. Develop operational procedures, method of statements and work instructions relevant to civil and structural design.
11. Participate in the development, review, and updating of the Maynilad Standards.
12. Provide structural engineering support to other units and other divisions of Maynilad.
13. Supervise and review the Seismic Management Program of all Maynilad existing structures.
14. Conducts structural investigation on site as required, and prepares investigation report with findings, comments, evaluation and recommendation.
15. Takes the lead in the review and checking of operational concerns through Technical Assessment Request (TAR).
16. Gathers data for presentation with regards to finished projects and obtain lessons learned and items for improvement.
17. Ensure the continuous knowledge, skill and work attitude development of the civil-structural design engineers.
18. Conduct and provide training plans for all civil-structural designers of engineering in the project delivery sections. 
19. Perform other related engineering and management tasks as may be assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS AND COMPETENCY
REQUIREMENTS MINIMUM EDUCATION
PRC Licensed Civil Engineer
With MS Degree in Structural Engineering

WORK EXPERIENCE
Must have at least seven (7) years of total working experience,
including five (5) years in a related industry in an equivalent position
and at least four (4) years of experience in supervision or management.
Preferably a member of the Association of Structural Engineers of the Philippines (ASEP) or a Structural Specialist of the Philippine Institute of Civil Engineers (PICE)

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ABILITIES
 Adept to local and international structural codes such as NSCP, NBCP, ACI, AISC and ASCE
Knowledgeable to international codes for environmental concrete structures such as ACI 350 and ACI 350-3 codes
Knowledgeable in FEMA 154, ATC 40, FEMA 356 and other seismic evaluation and rehabilitation guidelines
Background in the design and analysis of water and wastewater treatment plants
Capable of performing static and dynamic analysis of building structures
Proficient in Finite Element Modelling, analysis and design of underground and above-ground tank structures
Proficient in structural design software such as STAAD, ETABS/SAP2000, SAFE, Midas Gen & Design+
Capable of using computer aided design tools such as AutoCAD, Revit and other BIM software.
Proficient with MS Office Programs
Excellent problem solving and time management skills
Effective communication skills both in oral and written form
Risk assessment and value engineering skills

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES/ATTITUDES
Can lead people and demonstrate goal-oriented behavior and result driven
Can communicate effectively and clearly
Hardworking, can work under pressure and flexible
With a pleasant attitude and disposition.

WORKPLACE RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENT
EQUIPMENT/SOFTWARE USED
Computer
MS Office programs
STAAD, StructurePoint SPColumn, ETABS or SAP2000, SAFE, Midas Gen & Design+
AutoCAD, Revit and other BIM Software
Sketchup
Inspection Tools and Equipment
Personal Protective Equipment
 WORKING CONDITIONS and OCCUPATIONAL HAZARDS
Works in a normal environment
May require field work

title: Development Team Lead (PHP) | WFH | Dayshift
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
DEVELOPMENT TEAM LEADER
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN DEVELOPMENT TEAM LEADER?
We are a fast-growing internet service provider based in Melbourne Australia, dedicated to delivering lightning-fast, reliable internet with exceptional service experience for all customers.
At our organization, people come first. We value work-life balance, support each other, and are committed to delivering exceptional customer service. While meeting deadlines is important, we also care about personal well-being and strive to create a collaborative, positive work environment. Together, we aim to provide outstanding service and build strong connections with our customers.
We are proud to be a multinational team, with employees and contractors collaborating across Australia, Vietnam, and the Philippines. We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and included. We believe our diversity of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives makes us stronger, and we’re always excited to welcome new team members who bring fresh ideas and energy.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
The Development Team Leader reports directly to the Project Manager, with additional support from the CEO. This is a hands-on leadership role, responsible for guiding a team of skilled developers focused on maintaining and expanding both internal and customer-facing systems.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively between internal stakeholders and the development team are key. The role is accountable for ensuring projects are delivered on time, to a high standard, and in line with business requirements.
This role is expected to evolve alongside organizational’s growth, offering opportunities to shape team structure, technical standards, and project delivery practices. Initially, the focus will include:
Provide hands-on support to developers at the code level, offering guidance and troubleshooting assistance. Fostering the growth
Lead and manage the delivery of multiple complex development projects from design through to release.
Contribute to technical solutions, from initial design through to implementation.
Set up and manage:
Automated unit testing for existing systems.
CI/CD pipelines.
Documentation processes for systems and code, including legacy code.
Plan and implement system upgrades and replacements
Collaborate with the Project Manager and internal stakeholders to:
Produce accurate project specifications and delivery estimates.
Manage project phases, including activities, sub-activities, milestones, and documentation.
Ensure strong stakeholder involvement and maintain robust communication throughout project life cycles.
Provide regular progress updates and manage delivery risks and issues.
Align and coordinate with internal teams for seamless system implementation.
Participate in project reviews and post-implementation evaluations.
Support department capacity planning and resource scheduling.
Make key decisions to ensure the successful implementation of projects and initiatives.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Experience with the following tools (or similar) and a demonstrated ability to quickly learn new packages will be highly regarded:
Team leadership and mentoring
Solution design and implementation
MAMP (Linux experience is a plus)
PHP and Laravel
MySQL
API design and implementation
GitHub
JavaScript / jQuery
Agile development
JSON
Key Selection Criteria
To be considered for this role, you should be able to demonstrate:
Strong English language skills, both written and verbal.
Willingness to work in Melbourne (Australia) hours to align with company head office.
Bachelor’s Degree in an appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience.
5+ years’ experience in a senior development role, ideally within telecommunications.
2+ years’ experience in team leadership, including working with remote-based teams.
Strong understanding of PHP and GitHub.
Strong understanding of SQL queries.
Initiative to ‘roll up your sleeves’ and figure things out when necessary.
Ability to problem solve and work independently as well as part of the development team.

title: Onsite IT Support
description:
JOB TITLE: Onsite IT Support
Location: 7/F TWO E-COM CENTER Tower B,HARBOR DRIVE, PASAY CITY, METRO MANILA 1300
Position Type: Contract - 7 months
Work Set up:  On call/Remote support on weekends as per need basis
Schedule: Supporting US Time zone

Shift Timing 9:00 PM - 6:00 AM
Working Conditions
• This position may require occasional after-hours or weekend work to perform system maintenance or address critical issues.
• Ability to lift and carry computer equipment.
Salary Package: Php 32,640
Job Description:
We are seeking a motivated Junior IT Support Specialist to provide technical assistance and support for our internal clients. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, possess excellent problem-solving skills, and communicate effectively with internal clients and team members. This role involves troubleshooting hardware and software issues, installing and configuring computer systems, and ensuring the smooth operation of our IT infrastructure.
Key Responsibilities:
End-User Support:
Respond promptly to user inquiries and provide technical support in person, over the phone, or via remote assistance.
Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues.

Incident and management knowledge.

Problem analysis and solving skills.

Team player with strong planning and organizing skills.

Ability to lift and carry computer equipment.

title: Head of Transformation
description:
About the Role
We are seeking a visionary and results-driven Head of Transformation to lead and deliver strategic change initiatives across our region. This role is pivotal in shaping the future of our business, driving innovation, and ensuring we remain agile and competitive in a rapidly evolving market.
You will work closely with the executive team to set the direction and pace of transformation, ensuring alignment with global strategy while addressing regional nuances. This is a high-impact leadership role requiring exceptional strategic acumen, operational execution, and change management capability.

Key Responsibilities
Develop and Execute Strategy in Region: Create and lead a comprehensive transformation strategy aligned with the organisation’s long-term goals, with a focus on operational excellence, digital innovation, and cultural evolution.
Drive Regional and Functional Alignment:
Coordinate transformation efforts across multiple business units and geographies, ensuring coherence, alignment, and measurable impact.
Oversee Portfolio Governance:
Design and manage robust governance structures, ensuring transparency, accountability, and timely reporting of transformation progress to executive leadership.
Embed Change and Build Capabilities:
Ensure transformation outcomes are sustainable by embedding new ways of working into core operations, supported by process redesign, skills development, and leadership coaching.
Stakeholder Management:
Build strong relationships and influence at all levels, including Board, C-Suite, and external partners, to drive buy-in and momentum across the organisation.
Deliver Measurable Value:
Define and track clear business outcomes—customer experience, financial performance, employee engagement—and ensure benefit realisation from all transformation activities.
Monitor and Adapt to Market Trends:
Stay ahead of emerging technologies and market shifts to continuously inform and evolve the transformation agenda.
Risk & Interdependency Management:
Anticipate, assess, and mitigate strategic and delivery risks across the transformation portfolio.

Essential Skills & Experience
Extensive senior leadership experience in transformation or change roles within large, complex, and fast-paced environments.
Proven success in delivering enterprise-wide transformation programmes (digital, operational, and cultural).
Experience leading change across multiple countries or regions with diverse regulatory and cultural landscapes.
Outstanding leadership and team-building skills; able to inspire high-performing, cross-functional teams.
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with C-Suite and Board-level stakeholders.
Expertise in transformation portfolio and programme management, with knowledge of agile, Kanban, and OKR-based approaches.
Strong commercial and financial acumen, including business case development, budget management, and ROI tracking.
Analytical mindset with the ability to use data, KPIs, and dashboards to inform strategic decisions.
Experience embedding lasting change through change management methodologies (e.g., Prosci, Kotter, Lean Six Sigma).

Desirable Qualifications
Degree in Business, Management, Engineering, or a related field (MBA or equivalent preferred).
Professional certifications such as: Change Management: Prosci, ACMP, Programme Management: MSP, PgMP, PRINCE2, Lean/Agile: Lean Six Sigma, SAFe, Scrum Master, Strong digital literacy and awareness of enabling technologies (e.g., AI, automation, data platforms), Experience in leadership coaching or organisational development is a plus.

title: Urgent Hiring: Incident Manager - START ASAP
description:
Incident Manager – Data Analytics Focus (SME)
START ASAP
Work Set-Up: 

100% onsite set-up in McKinley Hill, Taguig City, Philippines | Graveyard Shift or Shifting Schedule 

About the Role: 

We are seeking a highly skilled Incident Manager with a strong background in data analytics to oversee and drive efficient incident management processes across the organization. This role requires a proactive leader who can manage high-priority incidents, perform data-driven root cause analyses, and deliver insights to improve operational performance and service quality. 

The ideal candidate combines ITIL-based incident management expertise with advanced analytical and visualization skills to enhance decision-making and prevent future disruptions. 

Key Responsibilities: 

• Lead and coordinate the end-to-end incident management process, ensuring timely resolution of critical and major incidents. 

• Serve as the primary point of escalation for high-impact incidents, ensuring communication and alignment across stakeholders. 

• Perform trend analysis and data-driven investigations to identify recurring incidents, root causes, and opportunities for service improvement. 

• Develop and maintain incident dashboards and reports using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent. 

• Collaborate with Problem Management, Change Management, and Technical Teams to ensure effective resolution and prevention strategies. 

• Drive post-incident reviews (PIRs) and produce comprehensive incident reports with actionable insights. 

• Establish and monitor incident KPIs and SLAs, leveraging analytics to measure efficiency and drive continuous improvement. 

• Use predictive analytics to anticipate incident risks and implement proactive measures. 

• Partner with IT Service Delivery and Operations teams to enhance process maturity and resilience through data insights. 

• Support the automation of reporting, escalation, and root-cause identification processes using analytical tools and scripting (e.g., Python, SQL, Power Automate). 

Qualifications: 

• Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred). 

• 5+ years of experience in IT Incident Management or Service Operations, preferably within large-scale or enterprise environments. 

• Proven experience in data analytics, data visualization, and reporting (Power BI, Tableau, Excel, SQL, or Python). 

• Strong understanding of ITIL framework (ITIL v4 certification preferred). 

• Demonstrated experience in handling major incidents and coordinating across multiple technical teams under pressure. 

• Exceptional analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills. 

• Ability to present complex data and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively. 

• Experience with ServiceNow, BMC Remedy, or other ITSM tools is highly desirable. 

Why Join Us? 

• Opportunity to drive meaningful impact through data-driven decision-making in IT operations. 

• Collaborative, innovative, and growth-focused work culture. 

• Exposure to modern technologies and enterprise-scale incident management frameworks. Job 

• Highly competitive and flexible package salary 

• HMO Benefits since Day 1 (including up to 3 dependents)

 To learn more about life at Lendi Group check out our blog: https://www.lendi.com.au/inspire/category/life-at-lendi/

Job Description
Join our Broker Admin Support Team, where you'll play a vital role in providing exceptional administrative assistance to our Brokers, ensuring seamless coordination with clients, brokers, and our Client Solutions team. As a key member, you'll manage critical support tasks for closing or settling deals, emphasizing efficiency and meticulous attention to detail. Be part of our journey to revolutionize the lending industry and positively impact people's lives. 
What you will be doing: 
Data Entry and Processing: Accurately inputting loan applications, borrower information, and relevant data into the system, ensuring the integrity of our records with meticulous attention to detail and precision. 
Document Management: Managing crucial loan documents is foundational to our operations. You'll organize, scan, file, and retrieve these documents in strict adherence to established procedures and regulatory requirements. 
Customer Communication: Engage with borrowers, internal stakeholders, and external partners to facilitate the loan application process, address inquiries, and uphold positive interactions. 
Administrative Support: Help keep things running smoothly by assisting Australian Brokers and stakeholders with tasks like scheduling appointments, coordinating meetings and preparing reports. You'll also provide general administrative support, including keeping an eye on emails for important actions and keeping everyone updated on application statuses. 
Appointment and Meeting Management: Oversee appointments and meetings for Australian businesses while maintaining accurate and up-to-date records of all loan applications and related documentation. 
Ad hoc tasks: May involve occasional monitoring and management of social media accounts, with the flexibility to respond to queries from clients and stakeholders as needed, to support a cohesive working environment. Additionally, it encompasses other ad hoc tasks as assigned. 

Qualifications
At least 1 year of experience in:
Mortgage Broker Admin
Real Estate VA
Loan Processing or Financial Services (e.g. lending, banking, credit, or compliance)
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal you’ll be dealing with clients and stakeholders.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).
Excellent organisation and time management skills.
Ability to work independently and within a team.
Experience with Australian mortgage processes or supporting AU-based clients is highly preferred.
Bonus if you’ve worked as:
Mortgage Broker Assistant (AU), Loan Processor, Mortgage Support/Admin VA, or similar roles

Additional information
Lendi Group teams operate across Australia and the Philippines. Bringing together diverse expertise, innovative technology and a customer-first approach, our teams work seamlessly to simplify the property journey, helping Australians find, buy and own property with confidence.

We support our people in a variety of ways, but a few of the benefits that our people rave about include:
A vibrant, relaxed, yet professional culture.
We offer a hybrid working arrangement designed to support work-life balance while fostering meaningful connection and collaboration, with a requirement to work from our Makati office at least once a month.
A holistic wellbeing programs offering 24/7 support to enable our team to thrive at home and work.
Comprehensive HMO coverage for you and one free dependent, along with life insurance starting from Day 1.
Access to 25 days of leave, made up of 20 vacation days and 5 sick days.
Monthly internet subsidy to help you stay productive at home
Access to ongoing training and clear pathways for growth and promotion as part of your career journey with us.
Access to all government-mandated benefits, including SSS, PhilHealth, and Pag-IBIG.
Our culture is guided by our three core values: We Are Stronger United; Act Like You Own It; and Keep Home Loans Human. These values are part of our DNA—helping us attract, engage, and grow the right talent while building best-in-class products. Together with our principles, they guide how we collaborate, support one another, and make decisions to drive progress with purpose.
We’re committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive community at Lendi Group. We believe that a team reflecting the world around us leads to greater innovation, stronger collaboration, and a more engaging workplace.
This is an opportunity to shape the future of a fast-growing, purpose-driven company that’s transforming the homeownership journey.

title: APAC Service Business Analyst (Project Management)
description:
Company Description
About Jobsdb by SEEK
SEEK operates market-leading online employment marketplaces, including Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia. SEEK has been helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helping organisations succeed for over 25 years.
Founded and headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, SEEK has grown into a multinational technology company with over 3,300 employees and is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange.
SEEK’s presence spans Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore and Thailand. Additionally, SEEK has minority investments in employment marketplaces in China, South Korea and Bangladesh.
SEEK develops and applies innovative data and technology tools to facilitate high-quality matching and improve reliability of marketplace information.
In 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, SEEK was recognised as one of Australia’s Top Ten Places to Work in Technology in the AFR BOSS Best Places to Work awards. SEEK was also named a 5-Star Employer of Choice by HRD Asia in 2024 and won four accolades at TalentCorp’s Life at Work Awards 2023 in Malaysia.
Job Description
About the Role
Working in the APAC Service team you will collaborate with various stakeholders across the business to operationalize business initiatives & projects.
Reporting to the APAC Operations Manager, you will be delivering detailed and accurate business analysis to support initiative objectives, be responsible for clearly documenting requirements & processes, facilitating effective communication with stakeholders to achieve a shared understanding & alignment throughout the initiatives, and identifying opportunities for process improvements that align with business goals.
Your role will also involve supporting delivery, mitigating risks, and ensuring the smooth implementation of new systems or processes, ultimately contributing to the success of the initiatives and business outcomes. 
Key responsibilities
Collaborate with key stakeholders to establish initiative scope, objectives, and deliverables, and contribute to validating requirements and gathering feedback throughout the lifecycle.
Work with stakeholders in the development and documentation of current (as is) and shaping of future state (to-be) business processes to support business initiatives.
Be the conduit between Product/Technology teams & the business to ensure accurate translation of business requirements & validation of proposed solution.
Work with stakeholders to analyse and prioritise requirements ensuring alignment with business value and objectives.
Identify and assess risks associated with initiatives.
Help in facilitating workshops and meetings with cross-functional teams to enhance communication, alignment, and decision-making among stakeholders.
Contribute to developing test cases, support in testing and verifying solutions to ensure they meet requirements and quality standards as needed.
Participate in the change management processes to ensure smooth transition and adoption of new systems or processes, including development of enablement materials such as training slides, user guides & FAQ as well as communicate changes to the business & users.
Help in delivering training to end users within the business.
Provide post implementation hyper care & BAU support.

Qualifications
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis (Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI)
Experience in process mapping, requirements gathering, and stakeholder management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex information to diverse audiences
Project management experience required
Comfort working with a degree of ambiguity and exercising judgement to make key decisions
Problem solving mindset with attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to respectfully challenge the status quo, influence and drive change
Technical expertise in relation to systems and domain knowledge related to products and service
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Information Systems, or related field
3-5 years of business analysis experience, preferably in service operations, BPO, contact center, or technology environments
Additional Information
At SEEK we offer:
Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible hybrid working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
SEEKer Support, a confidential service that offers employees up to six sessions with a mental health professional of your choice
Casual dress – every day
SEEK is committed to operating sustainably and is preparing for the impacts of climate change and the transition to a low-carbon future, and is working to minimise its environmental impacts which includes a long-term emissions reduction target of net zero by FY2050
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

title: IT Security - SOC Analyst
company: CITCO INTERNATIONAL SUPPORT SERVICES LIMITED-PHILIPPINE ROHQ
description:
About Citco
The Citco group of companies (Citco) is a network of independent companies worldwide for over 70 years, all of which are leading providers of asset-servicing solutions to the global alternative investment industry. With $1.8+ trillion in AuA and operations across 36 countries with over 50 office locations. For decades, industry publications have recognized our leadership in service and innovation. These accolades are a reflection of our drive to push ourselves and our industry forward.
With strategically positioned global offices ,we offer opportunities for graduates and seasoned professionals to work across the world. Careers at Citco can span continents.
For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com   

About the Business Line
The SOC Analyst’s primary responsibility is to determine what alerts or abnormal activity represents a real threat to Citco assets and data, by performing threat identification, containment, eradication, analysis and reporting. The SOC Analyst achieves this by working with threat protection solutions like: 
Security Incident and Event Management (SIEM)
Endpoint Protection (EPP)
Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) systems
Email Threat Protection (ETP) platforms
Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) platform
Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS) or NGFW’s
Others

The SOC Analyst is expected to understand fundamental networking and security principles as well as be familiar with common network and endpoint security threat protection solutions. A strong candidate will have a proven understanding of current cyber threats, threat intelligence and an understanding of attack trends relevant to an enterprise environment. 
Security Analysts work with and learn from experienced security team leaders and use the latest technology to detect, analyze and limit intrusions and security events. Candidates must be willing to work in a 24x7x365 SOC environment, demonstrate intuitive problem solving skills and allow for flexible scheduling. The SOC Analyst must be competent to work at a high technical level, have a good understanding of threat routes/pathways, identification of potential/active threats, and understand how threat vectors can impact the environment. 

Responsibilities
Monitors and analyzes Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS) and Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) to identify security issues for remediation
Performs network and endpoint security monitoring and incident response
Maintains records of security monitoring and incident response activities, utilizing case management and ticketing technologies
Creates, modifies, and updates Security Information Event Management (SIEM) rules
Escalates alerts regarding intrusions and compromises to the network infrastructure, applications and operating systems.
Assists with analysis of threat data obtained from proprietary and open source resources to provide indication and warnings of impending attacks against networks within the relevant vertical
Prepares briefings for SOC Manager and reports of analysis methodology and results
Creates and maintains standard operating procedures and other similar documentation
Generates end-of-shift reports for documentation and knowledge transfer to subsequent analysts on duty
Work independently with or without direction and/or supervision
Demonstrate effective teamwork and working relationships with others, both from CITCO and security vendors
Other projects and responsibilities, as assigned by direct supervisor

Qualifications
2 to 4 years of experience in an in-house Security Operations Center team, or in an Security Consulting firm with an understanding of networking principles in a global environment across multiple data centers
Candidates must be able to work a flexible schedule within a 24x7x365 Security Operations Center (SOC) environment, as well as may be expected to work holidays.
A strong candidate is expected to have some or all of the following traits: 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and interpersonal skills to interact with team members and upper management
An understanding of cyber security incident response and network security monitoring
Fundamental understanding of computer networking (TCP/IP), knowledge of windows, Linux and palo alto operating systems and information security principles
Knowledge of intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS) and SIEM technologies in an enterprise environment
Good knowledge of endpoint protection (EPP) and endpoint defense and response (EDR) solutions
Drive to learn and a desire and motivation to achieve IT security related certifications

title: Production Support Associate (Project Based-6mos Contract)Onsite-NightShift
description:
PRODUCTION SUPPORT ASSOCIATE (PROJECT BASED)
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN PRODUCTION SUPPORT ASSOCIATE (PROJECT BASED)?
We are looking for a high-performing, detail-oriented, and growth-minded Senior Production Support Associate (Sr. PSA) to join our Manila team, supporting global markets and some of the world’s top brands. As a key member of the team, the Sr. PSA is responsible for managing the end-to-end order process for complex/high- dollar value orders (25K and above), while also serving as a mentor and role model for other Production Support Associates.
This role requires an advanced level of operational expertise, the ability to guide and support new hires, and the willingness to contribute to process improvement initiatives. The Sr. PSA assists in training and onboarding new team members, supports system testing, creates job aids, and shares best practices. This position is ideal for candidates who want to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and take on additional leadership responsibilities within the team.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Process and manage complex, high-value sales orders (25K and above), ensuring accuracy and alignment with client expectations.
Generate purchase orders in Oracle EBS, manage updates based on order scope changes, and oversee quality checks, proof approvals, shipping, and tracking to ensure seamless order fulfillment.
Ensure timely invoicing within two business days of shipment completion.
Serve as a mentor to newly hired Production Support Associates by assisting with onboarding, sharing best practices, and providing ongoing support.
Lead or participate in training sessions for the team, including system testing, process walkthroughs, and knowledge sharing.
Develop and maintain job aids, process documentation, and training materials to support team efficiency.
Support process improvement initiatives by identifying opportunities to streamline workflows.
Proactively identify and resolve complex order-related issues, escalating as necessary to ensure customer satisfaction.
Provide clear and proactive communication on order status to Account Managers, Client Service Coordinators, and Clients.
Maintain accurate internal documentation and reports, including SSRM, C&R, and BE forms as required.
Model Core Values and serve as a role model for professionalism, customer service, and operational excellence.
Support account objectives by partnering with Account Managers and providing solutions for operational challenges.
Meet individual performance metrics and contribute to overall team success.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
3+ years in sales operations, order management, supply chain, or branded merchandising.
Experience managing complex orders and working with large-scale clients preferred.
Prior experience mentoring or training team members is an advantage.
4-year college degree preferred but not required.
Proficiency with industry tools, including Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams), Salesforce, Oracle EBS, Smartsheet, Canva, and other relevant tools is highly preferred.
Advanced understanding of sales order management processes.
Ability to manage and prioritize complex, high-value orders accurately.
Strong mentoring and coaching skills, with the ability to guide new team members and foster their development.
Experience in creating and updating job aids, processing documentation, and training materials.
Excellent project management skills, including multi-tasking, prioritization, and time management.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities, especially for escalated or complex issues.
Collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively across teams. High attention to detail and accuracy in documentation and data entry.
Excellent English communication skills (written, verbal, and interpersonal).

title: Real Estate Administrator / Agent Services Admin (Real Estate Exp Required)
description:
Company Description
Lendi Group is a market-leading digital platform business that is focused on revolutionising the entire property journey. It operates Lendi - Australia’s original and #1 digital mortgage brand - and the iconic Aussie franchise.
Powered by an advanced AI proprietary platform, a national network of 1,300 brokers, 230 retail stores, a team of experienced buyer’s agents, integrated property search and conveyancing, Aussie is supporting customers at every step of their property journey to find, buy and own with more confidence than ever before. Lendi Group’s loan book is more than $100b and it was named Australia’s Aggregator of the Year for 2024.
 Why Join Us?
Innovation at Our Core – We challenge the status quo and push boundaries to create better solutions.

Make an Impact – Contribute to meaningful projects that shape our business and the future of property finance.
Grow & Evolve – Develop your skills and advance your career in a fast-moving, purpose-driven environment.

Job Description
What is Aussie for Agents?
Aussie for Agents is an all-in-one platform that allows agents to market their off-market, pre-market and on-market listings under a VPA-free listing model while harnessing the Aussie brand, home of millions of customers growing by more than 800,000 a year.
We are looking for an Agent Service Admin to join our Agent Services division to work closely with our Business Development and Account Sales Managers in growing our registered agents within Aussie for Agents.
Responsibilities
Set up new agent and agency accounts in internal systems.
Verify company and real estate licence information for compliance.
Ensure accurate branding is applied at both agent and agency levels.
Manage and maintain property listing feed connections with agent CRM providers.
Liaise with agency principals and CRM providers to resolve listing feed issues.
Respond to agent customer service tickets as required.
Collaborate closely with Customer Service Managers to ensure smooth onboarding and support.

Qualifications
2 years administrative assistant, ideally in Real Estate environment
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and verification.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Effective administration and task coordination skills.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
Proactive and solutions-focused approach to resolving technical or process issues.\
Must be currently residing in the Greater Manila Area (Metro Manila + Neighbouring provinces)
Successful candidates must have a stable postpaid internet connection and a quiet, dedicated workspace at home with appropriate furniture (desk and office chair)

Additional information
Lendi Group teams operate across Australia and the Philippines. Bringing together diverse expertise, innovative technology and a customer-first approach, our teams work seamlessly to simplify the property journey, helping Australians find, buy and own property with confidence.
We support our people in a variety of ways, but a few of the benefits that our people rave about include:
A vibrant, relaxed, yet professional culture.
We offer a hybrid working arrangement designed to support work-life balance while fostering meaningful connection and collaboration, with a requirement to work from our Makati office at least once a month.
Holistic wellbeing programs offering 24/7 support
Comprehensive HMO coverage for you and one free dependent, along with life insurance starting from Day 1.
Access to 25 days of leave, made up of 20 vacation days and 5 sick days.
Monthly internet subsidy to help you stay productive at home.
Access to ongoing training and clear pathways for growth and promotion as part of your career journey with us.
Access to all government-mandated benefits, including SSS, PhilHealth, and Pag-IBIG.
Our culture is guided by our three core values: We Are Stronger United; Act Like You Own It; and Keep Home Loans Human. These values are part of our DNA—helping us attract, engage, and grow the right talent while building best-in-class products. Together with our principles, they guide how we collaborate, support one another, and make decisions to drive progress with purpose.
We’re committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive community at Lendi Group. We believe that a team reflecting the world around us leads to greater innovation, stronger collaboration, and a more engaging workplace.
This is an opportunity to shape the future of a fast-growing, purpose-driven company that’s transforming the homeownership journey.
Ready to contribute to Lendi Group’s next chapter? Apply now and be part of something big!

title: PRODUCT SUPPORT COORDINATOR
description:
PRODUCT SUPPORT COORDINATOR

Job Type: Full Time
Location: Hybrid 
Reporting to: Products Team Lead- Manila

Job purpose:
INA Prime Solutions is our BPO line of business in Manila, PH at Goway Travel Ltd. Our mission is to empower businesses through seamless outsourcing solutions, leveraging skilled workforce to drive operational excellence and client success.
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Product Loading Coordinator to join our dynamic team. The Product Support Coordinator is responsible for ensuring accuracy, quality and efficiency in product loading-related processes. This role supports the Products Team by managing product loading, updating supplier information, troubleshooting database issues, and coordinating with internal teams to resolve discrepancies. The coordinator acts as a key point of contact for product-related inquiries, ensuring timely responses, clear communication, and adherence to operational standards.
What will be your key responsibilities? 
Product Loading
Work various emails as assigned.
Work on various supplier contracts and allocations into the database as assigned.
Review terms and conditions of contracts, pinpoint any potential problem areas and handle them in a proactive manner.
Liaise with Product Managers where necessary.
Perform Quality Control on contracts to assure that all products are loaded in the database correctly.
Assist with other ad hoc tasks as needed.
Collaborate with internal departments to ensure smooth operations in Product Loading
If lean, assist in other operational tasks

What are we looking for?
Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's or a College Degree in Hospitality/Tourism/Hotel
Management or equivalent.
At least 3 years of relevant work experience in the travel industry, preferably in contract loading.
Must have at least 3 years hands-on experience in Tourplan.
Must work well independently in a team-oriented environment.
Excellent verbal & written English communication skills
Strong analytical, problem-solving and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration.
Strong prioritization skills in order to meet established deadlines
Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.
Proficiency in efficient time management and adept task prioritization
Ability to conduct internet research with demonstrated computer skills
Highly detail oriented with an ability to concentrate for an extended period of time.

What can you expect from Goway?
Imagine working for a company where your career feels like an adventure. At Goway, you’ll join a global community that supports one another:
We offer a competitive salary accompanied by performance incentives, and we place real importance on time away from work, such as paid personal days for when life calls for them and your birthday off each year.
Your future matters to us, so we match your RRSP contributions and provide comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage.
Our commitment to professional growth means you’ll have access to continuous learning and industry-leading training that keeps you at the forefront of travel innovation.
Travel is in our DNA, so you’ll enjoy exclusive perks and discounts on worldwide getaways.
Since we operate across Toronto, Vancouver, Los Angeles, Manila, Sydney, and beyond, you’ll collaborate across cultures and shape a career path that reflects your ambitions.
Goway is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate differences and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace for everyone. We appreciate every applicant’s interest. Please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

How to Apply:
If this role feels like your next step, open this link and click "Apply Now" to create your profile, upload your CV, and share a few details about yourself. Our talent team reviews every application, and if your experience aligns with our needs, we will reach out to set up the next step.
Recruitment scams & fraud warning:
Please be aware of any suspicious emails or WhatsApp activity from individuals pretending to be recruiters or senior personnel at Goway Travel. We will never ask you to install an app during the recruitment process. If you receive a message of this nature, please ignore it and report it to Goway.

About Goway
Founded in Toronto in 1970 by Australian economist Bruce Hodge, Goway has evolved from a one-person dream into a family-owned global leader in tailor-made travel. With our headquarters in Toronto and hubs in Vancouver, Los Angeles, Sydney, and Manila, our team of over 700 talented employees designs travel experiences in more than 115 countries across all seven continents. We’re united by a passion for travel and are committed to doing the right thing: supporting diversity, equity, inclusion, and sustainable tourism that enriches local communities. Whether working remotely or side by side in one of our offices, we operate as one forward-thinking team, transforming wanderlust into life-changing adventures for our fellow Globetrotters. Discover more at goway.com

title: Cybersecurity Consultant
description:
We have an exciting day shift, opportunity available for a Cybersecurity Consultant. Work from home or the office - you choose! 
 When you join Yempo, you’ll receive the following fantastic benefits: 
Highly competitive salary – paid weekly! 
HMO enrollment on commencement 
Additional HMO dependents added each year of service 
20 vacation days per year; 7 sick days 
Annual performance bonuses and incentives 
Annual salary reviews and increases

Company polo shirts provided 
Fantastic, bright and cheerful open-plan work environment  
Prestigious clients and highly professional and friendly co-workers 
 Our Client 
In this role, you will be assigned to our Australian-based client, a trusted cybersecurity partner helping organizations navigate the evolving cyber landscape with confidence. They specialize in delivering unified, native security solutions that protect workforce, data, cloud, and AI environments while simplifying complexity and maximizing the value of Microsoft Security investments. By combining zero-trust principles, AI-native security, and industry security frameworks with practical experience, we empower organizations to safely and efficiently embrace AI and modern technologies. They are also committed to building lasting partnerships with their customers, enabling them to operate smarter, safer, and more resiliently in an AI-driven world.  
 Your Responsibilities 
The primary role of a Cybersecurity Consultant is to deliver projects and has the following responsibilities:  
Be accountable for the deliverables within the Statement of Work, including implementation of security solutions  
Reviewing customer project deliverables and providing timely feedback to the project team  
Provide input and time estimation for Statements of Work  
Work as part of a team to deliver projects  
To work alongside the client PMO to determine work tasks, priorities, and schedules   
During an engagement to identify potential customer problems and suggest solutions   
Complete weekly project status reports

Identify pre-sales opportunities during the course of the engagement that could lead to further sales   
To conduct all activities in accordance with the clients policies and procedures  
Achieve assigned KPIs for your role 
 Your Background 
The primary skills and experience required of a Cybersecurity Consultant are:  
Possess level 300 skills and implementation knowledge, and hands-on experience in all or some of the following: 
Microsoft Azure 
Microsoft Security 
Microsoft Intune 
Microsoft Purview 
Microsoft Windows Client & Server 
Microsoft Office 365 
Microsoft Entra ID / Active Directory 
At least 2 years of experience delivering high-value customer projects in a technical delivery role  
At least one of Microsoft certifications SC-100, SC-200, SC-300, SC-400 or AZ-500 is preferred  
Experience authoring documentation for consumption by different stakeholder groups  
Ability to whiteboard and present technical concepts to a customer  
Familiarity and experience with Agile framework and project governance would be a plus  
Able to work autonomously and as part of a team  
Excellent collaboration skills, well-organised, flexible, proactive with a high attention to detail  
Solid documentation skills  
Strong time management skills – ability to multitask, set priorities and meet deadlines  
Great ability to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders  
Highly motivated and result-driven 
 Disclaimer for salary ranges. Yempo provides an indicative range of salary that we deem relevant for the advertised role. This may be adjusted for the skills and experience of the selected candidate.

title: Ecommerce Specialist
description:
Key Responsibilities
Product & Content Management
Own the end-to-end product creation, configuration, and enrichment process on Shopify, including titles, descriptions, specifications, pricing, imagery, tagging, HS codes, and SEO metadata.
Ensure product listings, inventory levels, and pricing are accurate and consistent across all platforms and marketplaces.
Manage product launches, previews, and promotional updates in line with the marketing and trade calendar.
Oversee homepage, collection pages, and site merchandising to align with ongoing campaigns and seasonal activities.
Maintain storefront accuracy by conducting regular housekeeping and updates to product data, collections, and landing pages.
Optimise product discoverability through SEO, cross-linking, and structured content updates.
Campaign & Marketing Coordination
Support digital marketing initiatives including SEO, SEM, email campaigns, and social media promotions to drive traffic and sales.
Create and manage discount codes, promotional offers, and seasonal sales, ensuring pricing accuracy and on-site readiness.
Collaborate with the marketing team to align campaign assets, on-site merchandising, and paid marketing efforts.
Assist with A/B testing and user acceptance testing (UAT) for new website features and enhancements.
Utilize AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT) to enhance product copywriting, streamline workflows, and improve campaign efficiency.
eCommerce Operations
Track and report on key performance metrics including product listing accuracy, site performance, conversion rates, and campaign effectiveness.
Monitor product availability daily; manage the archiving or relisting of sold-out and returned items.
Oversee integrations with third-party tools and plugins (e.g., Tapcart, Tolstoy, Search & Merchandising tools).
Coordinate with customer service, warehouse, and operations teams to ensure smooth order fulfilment and issue resolution.
Maintain and document eCommerce processes, workflows, and SOPs to improve efficiency and scalability.
Support audits and identify process improvements that enhance accuracy and operational performance.
Customer Experience & Insights
Monitor customer service KPIs (response time, CSAT, resolution rates) and share insights to guide content and merchandising decisions.
Conduct quality assurance checks to maintain consistent tone, accuracy, and brand alignment in customer interactions.
Update FAQ pages and internal documentation to support self-service and knowledge sharing.
Gather and analyse customer feedback to enhance the overall online shopping experience.
Qualifications & Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, eCommerce, or related field.
3–5+ years of experience in eCommerce operations or digital merchandising, ideally within fashion, retail, or consumer goods.
Proven hands-on experience with Shopify, including product uploads, configuration, and content optimisation.
Solid understanding of SEO, site merchandising, campaign management, and digital marketing principles.
Proficiency in Google Sheets/Excel for data analysis, reporting, and simple automation.
Familiarity with Google Analytics, Shopify Analytics, and marketplace integrations.
Strong written communication skills and exceptional attention to detail.
Experience with customer service tools (e.g., Gorgias, Zendesk) and third-party apps for ecommerce.
Basic design competency (e.g., Adobe Photoshop) preferred.
Confident using AI tools to enhance productivity and content quality.

description:
Reporting to: Field Marketing Zone Manager 
Duty Post: Legazpi, Albay
The Territory Consumer Lead (TCL) is under the Marketing function and is responsible for driving the business growth of their assigned territory through consumer acquisition and retention.
To achieve this, the incumbent needs to drive quality Retailer Distribution and Wholesale Volume through a consumer-centric approach mindset. Based on their assessment of the challenges and opportunities in the assigned territory, making use of available information and collaborating with Field Sales, they will develop the necessary short- and long-term strategies and programs that will address the needs of the business and support the delivery of the territory KPIs, growth inclusive.
This role will be tasked to lead the development and management (including monitoring and reporting) of relevant campaigns and/or programs, that are part of the overall regional and zone strategies covering various touchpoints such as General Trade Retailers and Wholesalers and Local Key Accounts where the overall objective is Consumer Acquisition and Retention in the assigned territory.
This role will also be tasked to do the following:
External (Nielsen) and Internal (Sales Data) Data Analysis
Conquer tools champion
Competitive Analysis
Budget Monitoring
Creation of internal documents such as contracts, project briefs, weekly reports, closure reports, presentations during business reviews
As the Territory Consumer Lead in the area of Marketing, you will:
Strategy & Campaign Development
Analyze data, competitive landscape, and insights to create strategic plans for JTI brands ensuring growth within assigned territories.
Oversee approval processes and operational requirements for campaign/program activation, coordinating with Marketing & Sales (M&S), agencies, procurement, suppliers, and commercial systems.
Ensure clear communication of campaigns to sales frontliners.
Implementation Leadership
Develop mechanics and guide field sales in program execution adhering to objectives, timelines, allocations, and compliance protocols.
Lead the deployment of brand and field marketing activities, including trade deals, incentives, bundling, sampling, and consumer activations.
Manage the full-year consumer acquisition calendar, optimize performance management, and resource deployment.
Program Evaluation
Conduct surveys to ensure execution compliance, address challenges promptly, and escalate issues as needed.
Evaluate performance against objectives, including volume, store participation, competitive response, and campaign spend efficiency.
Monitor and analyze execution success through post-program evaluations.
Territory Leadership
Support launches by building robust bottom-up campaigns, securing pipeline volumes, and ensuring distribution, merchandising, and pricing compliance.
Develop consumer campaigns to enhance brand reach in key territories/barangays.
Optimize route-to-consumer strategies for impactful campaign delivery.
Resource Management
Manage FM budgets and program tools/material deployment.
Enforce strict control and compliance for program enablers.
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree graduate, preferably of a Marketing / Business / Communications - related courses
At least 2 years’ experience in Sales, Marketing, and Trade Marketing. Field experience is an advantage
Good communication skills - Oral and Written (English, Filipino. Local dialect is an advantage)
Good understanding of digital tools, including usage of MS Office (Word, Excel & PowerPoint, Power BI)
Drivers’ license (B1 or higher). We have a program to support qualified women, who do not hold a drivers’ license

title: General Manager
description:
Key Responsibilities
Leadership & Organizational Management
Provide clear direction and leadership across all departments — Operations, Finance, Supply Chain, Logistics, and Franchise Support.
Ensure daily alignment between business priorities and company objectives through regular management meetings and reviews.
Strengthen organizational systems, enforce accountability, and ensure all departments work cohesively within approved structures and budgets.
Resolve operational issues promptly at the management level before escalation.
Operational Excellence & Accountability
Oversee day-to-day operations to ensure smooth, efficient, and profitable business performance.
Implement clear task tracking systems with defined timelines, outputs, and accountability.
Monitor KPIs across handled departments and ensure timely corrective actions are taken when necessary.
Maintain operational discipline to avoid overlap, bottlenecks, and inefficiencies.
Strategic Direction & Business Growth
Translate company goals into actionable plans and measurable results.
Lead and monitor strategic projects, including commissary optimization, digital systems rollout, marketing initiatives, and franchise expansion.
Identify business opportunities, streamline processes, and introduce innovations to improve profitability and customer experience.
Work closely with Top Management in planning for growth, market expansion, and long-term sustainability.
People Leadership & Motivation
Inspire and develop Department Heads to uphold a high-performance, team-oriented culture.
Maintain strong employee engagement through consistent communication, recognition, and leadership presence.
Build a culture of accountability, transparency, and results.
Reporting & Communication
Ensure timely and accurate reporting of daily performance summaries and key updates.
Provide the Chairman and Board with comprehensive operational insights, challenges, and recommendations.
Maintain open communication channels across all management levels to promote coordination and clarity.

title: Digital Marketing & Communications Specialist
description:
Join a Global Leader in Public Aquarium Design and Experiences
Join Advanced Aquarium Technologies (AAT) — a world leader in the design, construction, and operation of public aquariums — and help shape how our story is experienced online. From our headquarters in Australia to our operations in the USA, China, and the Philippines, AAT brings together marine biologists, engineers, designers, and construction experts to deliver some of the world’s most spectacular aquarium and zoo projects.
We’re looking for a Digital Marketing & Communications Specialist to manage and grow our digital presence across website, social media, and email platforms. In this role, you’ll combine creative storytelling with data-driven insight to connect global audiences to our extraordinary work.
What You’ll Do
1. Website & Digital Content Management
Maintain and update AAT’s corporate website using CMS tools (WordPress).
Coordinate updates to project portfolios, case studies, and news content.
Build and optimise landing pages for campaigns, ensuring high-quality presentation and performance.
2. Social Media & Campaign Execution
Collaborate with the Head of Marketing to plan, publish, and track content — particularly on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram.
Execute paid digital campaigns (Google Ads, LinkedIn) and monitor ROI.
Create short-form content and visuals (using Canva or Adobe Photoshop) to support campaign storytelling.
3. Email Marketing & CRM Integration
Develop and schedule email campaigns and automated lead-nurture workflows.
Ensure consistent brand messaging and engagement across all digital touchpoints.
Coordinate CRM-based communications and assist with data segmentation for campaigns.
4. Analytics, SEO, AI-Driven Discoverability & Performance Reporting
Implement SEO and SEM best practices to increase visibility, traffic, and lead quality.
Track and report on performance metrics (Google Analytics, social insights, campaign dashboards).
Generate actionable insights to inform content planning and optimize audience engagement.
Stay ahead of evolving digital search dynamics, including the integration of large language models (LLMs) and generative-AI search tools (e.g., Copilot, ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity).
Adapt AAT’s digital content to remain discoverable and authoritative as AI-powered platforms reshape how audiences find and consume information.
5. Internal Communications Support
Maintain and enhance content on AAT’s SharePoint-based intranet to support employee engagement and communication across global offices.
What You’ll Bring
3–5 years’ hands-on experience in digital marketing, web content, or communications — ideally with exposure to SEO, CRM platforms, and analytics.
Strong grasp of SEO, SEM, and social media marketing (especially LinkedIn).
Experience with CMS platforms (WordPress or equivalent).
Familiarity with marketing-CRM integration platforms such as HubSpot or Microsoft Dynamics 365, including campaign automation, contact segmentation, and analytics.
Solid data interpretation skills — comfortable turning analytics into action.
Basic graphic design skills for resizing or creating campaign visuals (Adobe CS, Photoshop).
Experience supporting or managing internal communication tools (e.g., SharePoint) is a plus.
Excellent English writing and editing skills; attention to visual and verbal detail.
Who You Are
You’re a hands-on digital storyteller who loves variety — managing content, coordinating campaigns, and tracking what works. You’re as comfortable writing a LinkedIn post as you are interpreting Google Analytics. You thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment where every day brings new challenges and new stories to tell.
You’ll work closely with our Head of Marketing & Communications and collaborate with talented teams across Australia, the Philippines, and beyond.
Who This Role Suits
This role may particularly appeal to digital marketers with agency-side experience who want to move into a client-side environment where they can see the direct impact of their work — managing campaigns end-to-end, shaping messaging, and tracking results in real time.
It’s equally suited to client-side professionals seeking to apply their skills in a creative, globally connected, and purpose-driven industry, where every project contributes to inspiring public understanding of marine life and environmental sustainability.
Why Join AAT
Work with an international brand known for creativity, innovation, and excellence.
Contribute to global projects that inspire millions of visitors to connect with marine life.
Gain experience across diverse digital platforms and campaigns.
Be part of a collaborative, supportive, and growing team.
How to Apply
To apply, please upload your resume and cover letter as a single document outlining:
Why you’re excited about this opportunity, and
How your experience aligns with the responsibilities listed above.
Candidates are encouraged to include links or samples of past digital work (social content, websites, campaigns, etc.).
About AAT
Advanced Aquarium Technologies (AAT) is a global leader in public aquarium design, construction, and operations, with projects spanning Australia, the USA, China, the Philippines, and beyond. Our team of 150+ specialists works across disciplines — from engineering and fabrication to animal care and exhibit design — to deliver innovative, sustainable aquatic environments that inspire and educate.

title: Recruitment & Mobilisation Coordinator
description:
Primary Role Purpose
To provide highly effective, efficient recruitment, onboarding and mobilisation support in line with and client/site processes for new employees to the Caledonia Group. Whilst each R&M Coordinator will have their own dedicated clients/sites typically within one state, you will be required to provide inter-divisional/interstate support during peak periods.
Key Accountabilities
Ensure employees are onboarded and mobilised to site in line with Client's onboarding process and the relevant client/sites processes including updating the Teams mobilisation spreadsheet, forms/paperwork are completed, tickets/licenses are provided, client contacts are communicated with, flights and accommodation are organised (where relevant) and portals are updated.
Ensure high levels of vigilance at all times when onboarding employees to ensure all steps and processes are closely followed for not only Client's onboarding processes but the relevant client/sites (which will all be different).
Work closely with your State Manager and relevant Supervisor(s) to help organise, plan and prepare for upcoming works (local/metro, maintenance, shutdowns and adhoc project works) including updating rosters and manning sheets as required.
Proactively manage and update candidates (Talent Pipeline) in FastTrack to ensure candidate details are accurate and update at all times.
Demonstrate proficiency in utilising FastTrack system for candidate management and pipeline updates.
Proactively and accurately ensure all Job Orders are entered into FastTrack, candidates and employees are moved through the Job Referral stages and Job Orders are filled/cancelled in a timely manner.
Onboard new employees through Onboarded, New Employee Onboarding Register and relevant client portals as appropriate.
End-to-end recruitment process including writing ads, screening candidates, conducting phone screening, organising interviews, conducting reference checks and booking medicals.
Coordinate letters of offer and provide pay and site terms and conditions to employees.
Confirm status of working rights and conduct VEVO checks where relevant.
Possess working knowledge of Australian work rights and VEVO system for verification processes.
Verify and ensure new and existing employees complete the relevant site inductions and hold the required tickets/licenses.
Act as a primary point of contact for clients and develop positive working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.
Ticket/License management: Closely review employee tickets/licenses as they come through Onboarded to ensure they are up-t0-date and relevant for position/site. On Occasion, assist with ticket expiry management as required and escalate any non-compliance issues with relevant State Manager.
Ensure no employee commences without full compliance to Caledonia's onboarding processes (i.e. all employees have a signed LOO, have completed their onboarding and induction modules, have passed a minimum of a drug & alcohol screen etc).
Ensure employee files on the k: drive are updated as appropriate including candidate records in FastTrack.
Assisting with general enquiries with staff (payroll, terms and conditions of employment, site details, PPE, drafting letters etc).
Provide general human resources administration support to the Human Resources Manager as required.
Distribute PPE as required.
Assist with booking flights and accommodation for employees as required.
General administration as required (i.e. assist with answering phonecalls, greeting visitors, generating purchase orders etc).
Qualifications
Graduate of BS Psychology, BSBA or other related courses.
Previous experience in a recruitment and mobilisation or Human Resources administration role at least 3 years and above.
Experience as a Recruitment & Mobilisation Coordinator handling Australian clients is required.
Demonstrated experience handling Australian construction and mining clients in a recruitment and mobilisation capacity.
Previous experience in construction, mining or resources (highly desirable).
Ability to foster and maintain positive relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.
Exceptional attention to detail, Proactive, Initiative, Effective team player, flexible and adaptable.
Excellent communication skills and strong customer orientation.
Can work onsite for 3 months and hybrid afterwards at least 2x a week WFH.

title: Senior Benefits Analyst | Work from Office
description:
We’re Hiring: Senior Benefits Analyst!

Looking for a role that fosters collaboration, creativity and career growth in a vibrant office environment? We got you covered!

We are currently on the lookout for a Senior Benefits Analyst to join our team at Cloudstaff, the #1 workplace everywhere! Think you qualify for the role? Attach a 1-2 minute video intro and introduce yourself to us so we can meet you virtually. Attach this together with your updated CV to become a priority applicant!

Role: Senior Benefits Analyst
Work Arrangement: Work from Office
Location: Philippines - Makati
Schedule: Night shift

Job Description:
We are currently on the lookout for a new Senior Benefits Analyst to join our team at Cloudstaff, the #1 workplace everywhere!

Provide call monitoring, mentoring, training, and support for benefit team members and analysts

Endless opportunities for career advancement

Annual Performance Review with Salary Increase  
We set you up for success with a company-provided PC/Laptop and fiber internet connection  
Look forward to weekly office perks for work from office staff – Free Coffee, Meals and Beer Fridays!  
Top notch workplace with first class VIP lounge and game rooms  
Child friendly spaces to cater to the needs of employees with children, enhancing work-life balance  
Participate and join our CS Social Clubs and Special Interest Groups to connect with colleagues  
International career growth and connections  
Unlimited cash incentives for hired referrals  
Mental Wellness Employee Assistance program through Lifeworks  
In-house psychiatrist available to support employees' well-being  
Become part of the Employee Share Units program  
Cloudstaff Dream Points - To be used for bidding useful items like appliances, kitchenettes etc.

Cloudstaff : Build Your Career, Anywhere
Established in 2005, Cloudstaff is a leading outsourcing company that empowers businesses to thrive through smarter talent solutions. We're passionate about creating a work environment that fosters your professional growth and overall well-being.

Why Cloudstaff is the #1 Workplace?
