**To become a priority applicant, please share a 1-2 minute video introduction detailing you experience in this specific role. You can upload your video to the CSJobs platforms. Please use a clean, distraction-free background and speak clearly and articulately.**

title: Healthcare Sales Development Representative
description:
Do you enjoy connecting with potential partners and turning outreach into meaningful relationships? Want a role where your communication drives real impact and growth? You'll have the flexibility to work remotely, support a growing team, and contribute to a mission that makes a difference in people’s lives. If you're organized, proactive, and thrive in a relationship-driven role, this opportunity could be a perfect fit for you.
Our Story Starts with People Like You
The two founders, best friends, were running businesses that needed great talent fast. So, they started building remote teams across countries like the Philippines, Colombia, and India. Not only did it work, it thrived. They realized that talent isn’t limited by geography. With today’s technology and high-speed internet, we’re able to build high-performing global teams that support businesses across the U.S. So ClearDesk was born.
Today, ClearDesk helps U.S. businesses grow by building world-class remote teams. We don’t just connect talent; we manage the entire experience, from recruiting to retention. And while we help clients thrive, we also stay deeply committed to helping our remote team members build real, lasting careers that support their lives and their families.
That’s where you come in.
The Role: Healthcare Sales Development Representative
Imagine being the first person a potential partner or referral source hears from. You’re not just making cold calls or sending generic emails. You’re building connections, creating opportunities, and guiding partners from curiosity to collaboration. When a new lead comes in, you’re on it. When a referral partner goes quiet, you’re following up. When a client finds the right care, you know part of that journey began with you.
You don’t just track data, you create momentum. Behind every call, every follow-up, there’s a real person or business that needs support, whether it’s a company seeking partners or a family in need of care. You’ll ensure no opportunity slips through the cracks, maintain relationships, and drive meaningful results. And when things are quieter? You’ll assist with social media or admin tasks, making sure every day counts.
What Your Days Might Look Like:
Conduct targeted research to identify high-value referral sources and potential partners within the company’s niche — focusing on businesses serving affluent clients with significant in-home care needs
Perform outbound cold calls to referral sources, facilities, and professionals, aiming to schedule warm, in-person meetings for the owner
Manage CRM data entry (Zoho or alternative), ensuring all outreach, follow-ups, and meeting details are accurately documented
Track referral sources, contact history, and meeting outcomes to create a clear picture of marketing effectiveness
Coordinate email follow-ups with contacts, referral partners, and leads to maintain engagement and nurture relationships
Monitor and update limited social media presence (primarily for awareness), posting relevant community and industry content as needed
Maintain professional, relationship-focused communication that reflects the company’s mission and values
Adjust outreach strategies based on results, offering suggestions to improve lead generation and meeting conversion rates
Work closely with the owner to align outreach priorities with high-value marketing opportunities
Who We Think Will Thrive in This Role:
You have experience in sales, outreach, or customer service (healthcare experience a plus)
You’re a strong communicator, skilled at purposeful follow-ups and building relationships
You’re highly organized and ensure outreach is tracked and managed effectively
You’re comfortable using CRMs like Zoho or similar tracking tools
You’re calm under pressure and can handle multiple tasks simultaneously
You love creating structure and keeping conversations moving
You’re reliable, responsive, and proactive in taking initiative
You enjoy collaborating and thriving in a remote team environment
You are willing to work in a US time zone schedule.
You can secure the required technical setup, including:
At least a 720p HD webcam
A noise-canceling headset
A primary internet connection of at least 25 Mbps
A backup laptop, backup internet device, and backup power source
A main computer with at least Intel Core i5 (or equivalent) and 8 GB RAM
A backup computer with at least Intel Core i3 and 4 GB RAM
Why ClearDesk?
Because we believe work should be meaningful, even from home.
At ClearDesk, you’ll work with clients who respect your time and value your skills. You’ll join a remote-first team that genuinely supports you, and you’ll see the impact of your work in real, tangible ways that matter to the people you work with.
We don’t just want you to do your job. We want you to grow with us, stay with us, and feel proud of the difference you’re making.
Here’s what you can expect from us:
We pay you fairly and on time
We provide prepaid HMO coverage for your peace of mind
We help you grow with tools, training, and honest feedback
We celebrate your wins
And above all, we actually care
Ready to be part of something that matters?
Apply now and start your journey with ClearDesk. 

Important Reminder: ClearDesk does not ask for any monetary payments or fees as part of our employment process. If you encounter any request for payment, please disregard it and report it to us immediately. For your security, please ensure that all communications are conducted through emails originating from (@cleardesk.com or @cleardeskteam.com).
Disclaimer: Candidates who apply for this position may be re-profiled to similar roles depending on their qualifications, experience, and current market demand.

title: Analyst - Order to Cash (Bahasa Indonesia)
description:

The role supports Subject Matter Expert and Team Leader in delivering efficient credit control, billing, cash application, and collections processes, and plays a key part in maintaining positive customer relationships.

Job role and responsibilities:

People

Partnership
Respond promptly and professionally to internal and customer queries.
Coordinate with Procure to Pay, Record to Report, and market finance teams to resolve process issues.
Operational
Process invoices, receipts, and payments within agreed timelines.
Apply cash to customer accounts accurately.
Monitor overdue balances and perform follow-up actions.
Support dispute resolution and maintain documentation.

Other

Customer service mindset and solid problem-solving/analytical ability.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficient in Bahasa Indonesia (Both spoken and written)

title: Prior Authorization Specialist (Start on January with Sign-On Bonus)
description:
What Customer Service Operations contributes to Cardinal Health

Customer Service is responsible for establishing, maintaining and enhancing customer business through contract administration, customer orders, and problem resolution.

Responsible for providing outsourced services to customers relating to medical billing, medical reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.

Job Summary

The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations is responsible for providing outstanding customer service and managing accounts while providing sales support to field sales representatives. This job establishes, maintains and enhances customer service via appropriate contract administration, timely order fulfillment, and providing exemplary customer support including managing accounts and providing sales support to field sales representatives. The job is also responsible for tracking demand and backorders, complaint and incident reporting and supporting post-sales issue resolutions. The job works directly with customers to strengthen Cardinal Health’s operational performance, strengthen existing customer relationships and assists with the prospecting of new business opportunities. The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations collaborates cross functionally with Commercial, Finance, Supply Chain and Operations teams to ensure customer account needs are meet, and operational performance is optimized to enhance customer experience.

Responsibilities
Provides outstanding customer service and supports improvements in operational execution to ensure service levels are achieved and exceeded.
Manages customer account activity including, but are not limited to; customer order fulfillment, customer backorders/substitutes, product change requests, new/lost business submissions and coordinating any customer questions / issues that may arise.
Provides outsourced services to customers relating to invoicing, reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.
Collects and reviews customer feedback, complaints, recalls and product returns, working closely with Quality and Regulatory teams.
Identifies customer trends and challenges/opportunities to develop potential alternatives to support business, operational efficiency and develop new customer opportunities.
Supports process improvement initiatives, including but not limited to opportunities for optimizing inventory levels, suppliers and operational performance, cost control and profitability and ultimately customer service.
Builds strong relationships with key business stakeholders (Supply Chain, Finance, Operations, Marketing and Commercial) to work in collaborative approach for improved customer service.
Communicates with customers regarding their needs, questions, and concerns and helps trouble shoot equipment issues as necessary.
Manages cases regarding reporting, backorders, customer complaints, and pricing and processes product complaint and incident reports.
Supports general sales by analyzing account histories, and coordinating internal resources to resolve customer needs.
Investigates and reports on anomalies and discrepancies in point of sales systems, website ordering, and general customer complaint issues.
Redirects customers to applicable in-house resources as necessary.
Supports general post-sales issues resolutions as necessary.

What is expected of you and others at this level
Effectively applies knowledge of job and company policies and procedures to complete a variety of assignments
In-depth knowledge in technical or specialty area
Applies advanced skills to resolve complex problems independently
May modify process to resolve situations
Works independently within established procedures; may receive general guidance on new assignments
May provide general guidance or technical assistance to less experienced team members

title: Accounts, Marketing, and Customer Service
description:

Client Services & Administration Officer (Work From

Home – Full Time)

What We’re Looking For
Exceptional attention to detail in written tasks and document review

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO (US Exec Support - Night Shift)
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Executive Administrative Assistant to provide comprehensive administrative support to senior executives. This role involves managing a wide range of business and personal administrative tasks, ensuring seamless operations, and maintaining confidentiality. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, adaptable, and capable of handling multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities
Administrative Support:
Manage executive calendars, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
Coordinate and prepare materials for meetings, presentations, and reports, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence, including emails, phone calls, and written communications, prioritizing as needed.
Business Administration:
Organize and maintain confidential business documents, contracts, and records.
Assist with project coordination, tracking deadlines, and ensuring deliverables are met.
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to facilitate communication and follow-ups on behalf of executives.
Personal Administration:
Manage personal tasks for executives, such as arranging personal appointments, travel, or event planning as required.
Handle personal correspondence and errands discreetly and efficiently.
Coordinate with household staff or vendors for personal-related tasks when necessary.
Event and Travel Coordination:
Plan and execute corporate events, meetings, or team offsites, including logistics and vendor coordination.
Arrange complex domestic and international travel itineraries, including flights, accommodations, and transportation.
Confidentiality and Discretion:
Maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive business and personal information.
Handle sensitive matters with professionalism and discretion.

title: BIM MODELER
description:
JOB SUMMARY:
The BIM Modeler/ BIM Engineer uses Building Information Modeling (BIM) Software to perform basic to advance drawing and modeling work tasks in compliance with the company guidelines. Reports to the BIM Team Leader and perform assigned tasks. Must have the ability to suggest solutions within the scope of the tasks assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Graduate of 4-year Technical degree course, preferably Civil Engineering or Architecture.
At least 2 years of experience in the same capacity.
Must be able to create Structural and Architectural drawings using REVIT.
Knowledge of other BIM Concepts and Software (Lumion, Enscape, AutoCAD, Dynamo, Solibri, BIM360) is an advantage.
Knowledgeable and experience in creating and checking Architectural, Structural and Construction drawings is an advantage.
Knowledge of Japanese design, construction and drawings is an advantage.
Providing Portfolio (drawings and perspective) of past works is an advantage.
Above average Communication Skills (oral & written)
Willing to travel to Japan and perform assigned duties as necessary.
Willing to study Japanese Language.
Willing to work overtime and on weekends and holidays if necessary.
A good team player, able to express himself well and communicate with others; can foster good working relationship with colleagues.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Building Information Modeling
Create Architectural and Structural Revit models and drawings as well as Construction drawings.
Create and improve Revit families and templates.
Create detailed model to be used in the design and construction phase of projects.
Execute clash check between Architectural, Structural and Mechanical models.
Acquire quantities of materials and other required information from the design model.
Create dynamo code to reduce work time, use dynamo in drawing and model creation.
Collaborate with other BIM team to create architectural, structural and construction models.
Any other items to be developed through BIM.
Create models in compliance with Japanese Building Code and JFE Civil design requirements.
Learn Japanese Language to communicate with our Japanese counterparts.
Actively participate in developing the use of BIM software in the company.

title: UK Bookkeeper (Hybrid)
description:
We’re looking for a Bookkeeper to support our UK-based client’s management accounting and payroll teams!
You’ll take client submitted documents from DEXT into Xero/QuickBooks, keep ledgers tidy and reconciled, and run client payrolls in BrightPay/Sage. You’ll start with close guidance from their Payroll Administrator and Management Accountants and as you demonstrate quality and reliability, you’ll liaise directly with their clients and help scale their offshore team.
 Duties and Responsibilities:
Report to the Management Accountants, ensuring fully reconciled bookkeeping is delivered and ready for management accounts. Tasks include:
Processing purchase invoices and expenses uploaded by clients via DEXT by publishing to Xero/QuickBooks with correct supplier, nominal, tax codes, projects, and tracking.
Performing timely bank and credit card reconciliations, matching payments to purchase invoices and receipts to sales invoices (usually raised by clients in their accounting system).
Maintaining clean AP/AR ledgers: chasing missing documents, resolving duplicates, allocating credits, and clearing suspense items.
Posting journals as directed (payroll journals and depreciation).
Preparing period-end bookkeeping packs for handover to the Management Accountants (reconciliation summaries, aged AP/AR, and unresolved queries).
Support payroll processing, beginning with guidance from the Payroll Administrator before moving on to handle client interactions directly. This covers:
Processing weekly/monthly client payrolls using BrightPay and Sage (starters/leavers, variable pay, and statutory payments).
Preparing pay runs, reports, and employee documents (payslips and summaries), ensuring RTI submissions/pension files are ready for the UK payroll administrator to approve and file.
Maintaining payroll checklists, calendars, and control totals, including reconciling payroll to accounting and post-payroll journals.
Managing a tidy query log, including escalating variances, unusual trends, or compliance flags promptly.
Develop working knowledge and mastery of the following tools: DEXT (data capture), Xero and QuickBooks Online (accounting), BrightPay and Sage (payroll), Microsoft 365 (Excel, Outlook, and Teams), and Practice Management Software (currently IRIS, but transitioning to FYI).
  Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree in Accountancy or any accounting related field
Minimum of 1 year of relevant work experience is required for this position
Understanding of UK VAT basics (rates, coding, and digital links) and payroll terminology (RTI, auto-enrolment, and statutory pay)
Certification or proficiency in DEXT, Xero, QuickBooks, BrightPay, or Sage is desirable
Excellent organizational and time management abilities
Clear written and spoken English for confident and professional client and team communication
High attention to detail, ownership mindset, and ability to follow documented SOPs
 Exciting Perks Await!
Prime office location
Competitive compensation package
HMO coverage for you and your dependent on Day 1
Full training provided via vendors’ online certifications (DEXT, Xero, QuickBooks, BrightPay, and Sage) and internal “Bookkeeping 101” onboarding
Clear skills matrix and progression path to Senior Bookkeeper/Payroll Lead with quarterly appraisals with the firm’s management team
Opportunity to help build, train, and manage a growing offshore team
Longer-term routes into management accounting, statutory year-end accounts work, and corporate tax for interested high performers

Location: Global One Building, Eastwood, Libis, Quezon City
Schedule: UK (3:30 PM to 11:30 PM MNL)
Work Arrangement: Hybrid (Onsite daily during training, then will transition to a hybrid setup after training.)
 Join Frontline Accounting and be part of our team to Embrace the Future Ahead: Where Possibilities Begin!

title: 3D Animator (Forensic Visualization) | Hybrid at Eastwood Libis
description:

Shift: Mondays to Fridays, 9pm to 6am (Nightshift)
Duties and Responsibilities:
We are looking for candidates with moderate experience in 3D production, who are enthusiastic to apply these skills in the forensic world. Forensic animation requires project management skills, swift development, and persuasive storytelling to visualize what happened during critical incidents. Our client’s team strives to be collaborative, goal-oriented and supportive of one another.

Work closely with Case Leads to complete assigned tasks in a timely and organized manner
Maintain clear communication across platforms (email, project management tools, internal systems)
Track project progress, log accurate hours, and organize incoming/outgoing client materials
Assist in post-processing of scanned data (laser scans, drones) and manage digital assets as needed
Receive and apply feedback from Production Leads to refine deliverables
Qualification:
Bachelor’s degree in Animation, 3D Art, Digital Media, or a related field
1-3 years of experience in 3D production (studio, freelance, or academic)
Proficiency in 3D Studio Max, Adobe After Effects, and Photoshop
Solid understanding of modeling, texturing, and camera tracking
Strong attention to detail and ability to follow strict visual and technical guidelines
Basic math/science skills to support technical visualizations (e.g., motion physics, measurement accuracy)
Excellent communication skills (written and spoken English)
Ability to handle sensitive or potentially distressing case content with discretion
Exposure to forensic, legal, or scientific animation is a plus
Familiarity with Unreal Engine, immersive tech, UI/UX design, or scientific disciplines is a bonus
About Intelassist
Established in 2007, Intelassist is a remote staffing organization that originated from a collaboration between US-based industry professionals and an experienced operational team in Manila, Philippines. Our US team brings over 20 years of experience in engineering, manufacturing, IT, finance, and high-level operations, while our Manila-based team offers over 15 years of experience in delivering exceptional support to global enterprises.
Our coast-to-coast US offices, in collaboration with our dedicated employees in the Philippines, enable us to deliver results to clients in various markets and for a wide range of roles. With over 15 years of experience in the BPO industry, Intelassist places a strong emphasis on organizational resilience and social stewardship to foster lasting, meaningful partnerships within our team and with our clients.
At the core of our business lie our people. Our ability to recruit, train, and, most importantly, retain exceptional team members is not only what enables Intelassist to attract the region’s finest talent but also what bestows stability upon our clients through reduced turnover and tangible outcomes.
With a workforce of slightly over 1,000 employees, we strike a balance – substantial enough to possess profound insight into the Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) industry, yet intimate enough to maintain the family-like, high-energy work atmosphere that our candidates seek.
At Intelassist, we specialize in sourcing, training, and retaining top-tier talent, each exclusively dedicated to meeting our clients’ unique needs. Our proven track record and local presence ensure that Intelassist clients enjoy increased productivity, reduced staff turnover, and significant cost savings
WHY INTELASSIST?
We grow together. We value your effort. We aim to empower you.

title: Distribution Specialist
description:
Reporting to: Logistics Operations Manager
Duty Post: Taguig

The main objective is to have continuous supply of products to all distribution channels. The person will be responsible for fulfilling supply plans and/or sales orders by booking transportation in time for the required delivery dates. This role has to closely coordinate with GBS O2C, warehouse, sales and vendor/s. This position may also perform tasks that may form part of logistics requirements such as Market Returns, Bad Order Disposal, Non-FG, etc. The monitoring of bookings / deliveries will be part of the daily tasks. This shall be the basis of billings from vendor/s which will be reviewed and recognized as expense by performing GR postings in SAP.         

As the Distribution Specialist, you will:
Coordinate with GBS O2C, Warehouse, and Vendors to ensure timely fulfillment of sales orders.
Ensure zero incidence of non-booked or missed shipments.
Liaise with the Sales team as needed, particularly for new accounts or unique customer requirements.
Monitor all booked shipments to ensure on-time and in-full (OTIF) deliveries to customers.
Review vendor billings to verify alignment with approved contract rates.
Perform Goods Receipt (GR) postings in SAP to accurately record logistics expenses.
File and manage claims to vendors as necessary, ensuring proper documentation and resolution tracking.
Manage and consolidate Proof of Delivery (POD) reports for documentation and tracking purposes.
Recruit, motivate, and support the professional development of direct and indirect team members.
Provide oversight and performance management for third-party logistics partners, including any in-house personnel assigned to JTIP.

What we look for:
Possesses a Degree in BS Industrial / Management Engineering or Business Administration preferably under Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Finance or equivalent.
College Graduate or equivalent years of experience in Supply Chain (end to end) or Transport Management is an advantage.
Minimum 4 years experience in logistics / warehousing and transportation or supply chain (end to end) in a sales and distribution environment of a FMCG industry. 
Experience in Third Party Logistics is an advantage.
An employee of a principal company, working with 3PL, working with Truckers, Forwarders and Port Operators is an advantage.        
Knowledge in warehousing or logistics operations.
Must be computer literate (excel, word and powerpoint at the least).
SAP knowledge would be advantageous.

title: Data Analytics Manager
company: National Data and Surveying Services Inc
description:
Work Schedule: 9 PM - 6 AM PH Time
Work Location: 19th Floor, Octagon Centre, San Miguel Avenue, Ortigas Center, Pasig City
Job Description
Build and lead NDS’s PH analytics function to transform traffic sensors, video/vision counts, GPS/GIS, and survey datasets into decision-ready insights for public agencies and engineering partners. You’ll own the analytics roadmap, reliability (tests/SLAs), and delivery to U.S. stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities
Strategy & Leadership
Own the analytics vision, OKRs, and roadmap; hire and mentor a PH team (Analysts, Analytics Engineer).
Establish data governance: metric dictionary, lineage, access policies, and quality SLAs (freshness, completeness, accuracy).
Data Platform & Quality
Design and maintain the warehouse + dbt models with automated tests; implement orchestration (Airflow/Dagster/Prefect).
Build robust ingest for traffic counters/video, GPS/GIS, and client files; manage schema evolution and cost/performance.
Implement monitoring for model tests, anomalies, and data drift; publish runbooks for incident response.
Analytics & Decision Support
Ship executive & client dashboards (volume, speed, O-D, before/after studies) and standardize KPI definitions.
Lead time-series/forecasting and experiment readouts; deliver QC analytics for field-collected data.
Partner with U.S. PMs/Ops/Engineering for scope, SLAs, and delivery windows aligned to the night shift.
Security & Compliance
Enforce privacy for any video/PII and manage access controls, audit trails, and compliance.

Skills & Qualifications
8+ years in analytics/data science/analytics engineering; 3+ years leading a team.
Expert SQL (window functions, tuning) and strong Python (pandas/NumPy).
Hands-on with dbt and a cloud DWH (BigQuery/Snowflake/Redshift).
Time-series & anomaly detection; strong BI (Looker/Power BI/Metabase).
Geo/GIS exposure (PostGIS, BigQuery GIS, QGIS) and experience with sensor/video or large telemetry datasets.
Nice-to-Haves
Computer-vision pipeline familiarity (video counting/QA), Amplitude/Mixpanel, Spark/Databricks, or ML forecasting (Prophet/ARIMA).
Transportation/traffic domain experience; client-facing delivery with public agencies.

title: Remote HR Operations Generalist (US Operations)
description:
Thumbtack helps millions of people confidently care for their homes.
Thumbtack is the one app you need to take care of and improve your home — from personalized guidance to AI tools and a best-in-class hiring experience. Every day in every county of the U.S., people turn to Thumbtack to complete urgent repairs, seasonal maintenance and bigger improvements. We help homeowners know which projects to do, when to do them and who to hire from our growing community of 300,000 local service businesses. If making an impact inspires you, join us. Imagine what we’ll build together.
About the People Team
Our People Team is at the forefront of building a world-class virtual-first company and being a leader in the Future of Work. Our People team believes in the power of our people. We craft an employee experience that starts with hiring incredible people, investing in their career development, and providing a holistic approach to benefits and wellness. 
About the Role
The People Operations Generalist will play a key role in delivering exceptional support to Thumbtack employees, with a primary focus on our North America team, while also providing support for the Philippines team as needed. You'll manage and resolve a wide range of employee requests with accuracy, discretion, and care, ensuring that every Thumbtacker can stay focused on doing their best work for our customers and pros. This role goes beyond routine task completion, driving proactive problem-solving and leading process improvements. In this role, you'll help streamline and improve core People Ops processes while identifying opportunities to scale and enhance our support model. A mindset of continuous improvement, both individually and operationally, is essential. Occasional flexibility in working hours may be required to attend cross-time zone meetings or support high-priority initiatives.
What you’ll do
This role serves as the first line of support for the People Team—triaging tickets and managing key People Ops processes, including onboarding, offboarding, job changes, employment verifications, and Workday transactions for team members in North America and the Philippines. As the initial point of contact for internal and external inquiries, you’ll work to resolve issues directly or guide them to the right resource, enabling our employees to stay focused on serving Thumbtack’s customers and pros.
Execute employee data updates (e.g., headcount planning, onboarding, offboarding, employment verification, unemployment processing) with minimal guidance, escalating exceptions. 
Manage and triage the People Operations ticket queue, answering questions, processing transactions, redirecting, and escalating or assigning more complex requests as appropriate. 
Provide employees with accurate and useful direction, resources, or support as needed to their queries in the quickest and most effective channel (email, ticket, or Slack message). 
Work cross-functionally to improve operational efficiency and the employee experience by identifying opportunities for automation, process and policy changes, and improved communications and documentation. This includes leading smaller-scale projects focused on enhancing People Ops processes.
Assist in the completion of special and ad-hoc People projects. 
Run reports and audits to identify when potential or actual issues exist in the HRIS system. 
Assist in reviewing and updating HR policies to align with operational needs.
Serve as a backup for TPH-related People Operations tasks as needed. 
Contribute as a team member by engaging in team meetings, team-building activities, and other team and company events.
In order to be successful, you must bring
5+ years Human Resources experience, with a 3+ years of direct experience in HR delivery
or shared services in the US regions
Solid understanding of US Human Resources processes, including onboarding/offboarding,
employee data management, benefits administration, and compliance
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and projects in a fast-paced, high-volume
environment
Proven track record in ticketing, mailbox logic, and workflow oversight using HRIS platforms
and ticketing/case management systems (e.g., JIRA, Zendesk)
Experience working with SLAs, audit standards, and compliance metrics
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; capable of working effectively across
cultures and geographies
Comfortable working in a fast-paced tech environment where processes are still being
defined.
Ability to triage and prioritize work from multiple channels, exercising independent judgment
to manage competing demands.
Familiarity with Workday, and/or Greenhouse.
Knowledge of Philippine Labor Laws and Statutory Benefits

title: Order Management Coordinator | Work Onsite-Nightshift (Project based)
description:
ORDER MANAGEMENT COORDINATOR
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/ANORDER MANAGEMENT COORDINATOR?
We are looking for a high-performing, detail-oriented, and growth-minded Senior Production Support Associate (Sr. PSA) to join our Manila team, supporting global markets and some of the world’s top brands. As a key member of the team, the Sr. PSA is responsible for managing the end-to-end order process for complex/high- dollar value orders (25K and above), while also serving as a mentor and role model for other Production Support Associates.
This role requires an advanced level of operational expertise, the ability to guide and support new hires, and the willingness to contribute to process improvement initiatives. The Sr. PSA assists in training and onboarding new team members, supports system testing, creates job aids, and shares best practices. This position is ideal for candidates who want to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and take on additional leadership responsibilities within the team.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Process and manage complex, high-value sales orders (25K and above), ensuring accuracy and alignment with client expectations.
Generate purchase orders in Oracle EBS, manage updates based on order scope changes, and oversee quality checks, proof approvals, shipping, and tracking to ensure seamless order fulfillment.
Ensure timely invoicing within two business days of shipment completion.
Serve as a mentor to newly hired Production Support Associates by assisting with onboarding, sharing best practices, and providing ongoing support. Lead or participate in training sessions for the team, including system testing, process walkthroughs, and knowledge sharing.
Develop and maintain job aids, process documentation, and training materials to support team efficiency.
Support process improvement initiatives by identifying opportunities to streamline workflows.
Proactively identify and resolve complex order-related issues, escalating as necessary to ensure customer satisfaction.
Provide clear and proactive communication on order status to Account Managers, Client Service Coordinators, and Clients.
Maintain accurate internal documentation and reports, including SSRM, C&R, and BE forms as required.
Model Core Values and serve as a role model for professionalism, customer service, and operational excellence.
Support account objectives by partnering with Account Managers and providing solutions for operational challenges.
Meet individual performance metrics and contribute to overall team success.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
3+ years in sales operations, order management, supply chain, or branded merchandising.
Experience managing complex orders and working with large-scale clients preferred.
Prior experience mentoring or training team members is an advantage.
4-year college degree preferred but not required.
Proficiency with industry tools, including Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams), Salesforce, Oracle EBS, Smartsheet, Canva, and other relevant tools is highly preferred.
Advanced understanding of sales order management processes.
Ability to manage and prioritize complex, high-value orders accurately.
Strong mentoring and coaching skills, with the ability to guide new team members and foster their development.
Experience in creating and updating job aids, processing documentation, and training materials.
Excellent project management skills, including multi-tasking, prioritization, and time management.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities, especially for escalated or complex issues.
Collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively across teams. High attention to detail and accuracy in documentation and data entry.
Excellent English communication skills (written, verbal, and interpersonal).

title: Innovation Planning Manager (Packaging Development)
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
Reporting to: Supply Chain Planning Manager
Duty Post: Head Office – BGC, Taguig City
Application Duration: This job posting will remain open until the vacancy is filled. 

Innovation Planning Manager (Packaging Development)

As the Innovation Planning Manager, you will lead the development and execution of projects related to quality, new products & packaging innovation, and  governance of CBU-related bundles in Distributor Sales Offices that are not covered by the PLM process managed by NPD Team, GPS, Brand, and FMZM. The objective of this role is to plan and execute projects following company policies catering unique requirement of local Philippine Market with the aim to ensure advancement of JTI products in the market. This role will work closely with Brand, Supply Planner, Demand Planner, Entity Finance, Sales Finance, FMZM, GIP, Warehouse, Legal, Toll packers and Packaging Material Suppliers to ensure all initiatives will be implemented with excellence.

As an Innovation Planning Manager, you will:

As Center of Excellence for Innovations and Subcontracting PO, this role will perform end to end project management and technical packaging development in relation to New Product Development not covered by PLM process.
Organize and lead projects' kick-off meetings under the responsibility of Project Manager role including tracking of project timelines against plan and ensuring that key stakeholders including Brand, Supply Chain Planners, Global Indirect Procurement, Warehouse, Finance, Legal, Tollpacker, and Material Supplier have visibility on the status update and potential issues.
Conduct feasibility study and assessment with Tollpacker on the machine capability and readiness. This includes driving and managing trials, testing, and development of mock-up materials and packaging with Material Supplier. This involves, but is not limited to, analyzing and managing VMC to ensure acceptable Gross Margin.
As a contract owner for Tollpacker and Materials Supplier, this role will work closely with Legal, GIP, and vendors to align and create contract terms and agreement, review contract compliance, and manage amendment of contracts as needed to ensure that contracts are upheld and supplier obligations are met.
Collaborate closely with the Field Marketing Zone Manager, National Warehouse Manager, and Branch Warehouse Supervisor to design and execute processes related to Value-Added Services (VAS) within JTIP DSO. This involves, but is not limited to, managing the governance of CBU Bundles while spearheading cross-functional teams to conduct discussions, evaluations, and testing in SAP QA Environment or in TME for projects related to product innovation.
Ensure adherence to Quality Standards to safeguard product integrity and promote continuous improvement. This encompasses embedding Quality at every stage of the product lifecycle, including development, manufacturing processes such as supplier and Tollpacker qualification, the creation of QA policies, and extending to product distribution.
Guide and develop team members (if applicable), and manage ad hoc tasks and projects as assigned by leadership.

Who are we looking for:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Finance, or a related field.
Work Experience: At least 10 years of experience in supply chain, packaging development and project management in the FMCG industry.
Language Skills: Proficient in English, with strong communication skills for cross-functional collaboration.
Technical Skills:
Proficient in SAP, especially for project and supply chain processes
Skilled in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and project management tool
Functional & Leadership Skills:
Strong project management and stakeholder coordination skills
Experience in contract management and supplier negotiations
Ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple initiatives
Analytical mindset with a focus on process improvement and execution excellence
Familiarity with local market dynamics and regulatory requirements in the Philippines

title: Business Development Manager | Enterprise | Uncapped Commission
description:
Are you driven, strategic, and hungry to close complex deals?
With 17,000+ retailers and restaurants in over 15 countries, StoreHub is on a mission to enable everyone, big or small, to build successful businesses. At StoreHub, we're building a dream team where every colleague is extraordinary at what they do and highly effective at collaborating.
It’s in such a team that you learn the most, perform your best work, improve the fastest, and have the most fun.
If this sounds like a journey you’d like to embark on, keep reading!
In this Business Development Manager - Enterprise role, you’ll be at the forefront of driving StoreHub’s expansion into the mid-market and enterprise segments. You’ll own the full sales cycle—from identifying key target accounts and executing outbound strategies, to engaging C-level decision-makers and closing high-value, complex deals.
This role is for someone who’s independent, strategic, and obsessed with impact—a consultative seller who thrives on challenges, takes pride in building relationships, and knows how to turn conversations into partnerships.
What you will do:
Strategic Account Targeting: Identify, segment, and maintain a dynamic enterprise hit list based on verticals, deal size, and growth potential.
Outbound Prospecting: Execute structured outbound campaigns and account-based strategies to engage senior decision-makers.
Consultative Selling: Understand the client’s business challenges and tailor StoreHub’s solutions to align with their strategic goals.
Pipeline Ownership: Manage the full enterprise sales process including qualification, demo, proposal, negotiation, and closure.
Stakeholder Navigation: Build internal champions and navigate complex buying environments to accelerate deal velocity.
Deal Execution: Lead negotiations with multiple stakeholders while maintaining pricing integrity and profitability.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with Solutions Engineers, Onboarding, and Customer Success to ensure seamless post-sale execution.
Revenue Growth: Drive revenue across Software, Hardware, and Value-Added Services to ensure a balanced enterprise portfolio.
Data & Insights: Track and analyze sales metrics to improve forecasting accuracy and execution.
Customer Relationship Management: Build long-term partnerships with enterprise customers as their trusted advisor.

How you will need to be:
Independent & Self-Driven: You manage your own strategy, time, and pipeline effectively.
Gritty & Motivated: You push through rejections and long sales cycles with resilience and self-reflection.
Consultative & Strategic: Skilled at influencing stakeholders and managing champions within organizations.
Emotionally Intelligent: Adept at navigating complex relationships and decision-making environments.
Analytical & Insight-Driven: You use data to guide conversations and decisions.
Adaptable & Agile: You pivot easily based on client needs and market shifts.
Relationship-Oriented: You believe in building long-term partnerships, not just closing transactions.
Organized & Disciplined: You maintain clean CRM hygiene and structured follow-ups.

What you need to have:
Proven experience in B2B or enterprise sales with a track record of closing high-value deals.
Strong communication and negotiation skills with senior executives.
Experience in SaaS or tech industry is a plus.
Prior consulting or advisory experience is advantageous.

What makes working at StoreHub awesome (and refreshing!):
Our people - for real! StoreHubbers are some of the smartest and most interesting people you can work with. Expect to do a lot of peer-learning.
Culture of Candour.We embrace directness, hate bureaucracy, and move fast. If you're tired of 'corporate nonsense' you'll feel right at home.
Cutting edge tools. If something can be automated, we'll make it happen. You will be introduced to many different tools we use that support everyday tasks, so that we can focus our minds on the kind of work that matters.
Impact not just effort. We recognize that results are not tied to the number of hours worked. There's no reward for long hours with poor results and no penalty for leaving on time if your work is excellent. To be great, most of us have to put in considerable effort, but we don't measure contribution by hard work or long hours.
CHANGE. Our core values are super important to us. The more you resonate with them, the more you'll find yourself a good fit.

Communicate for Clarity
Humble and Hungry
Authentic but not an *sshole
Nimble and Quick
Growth Mindset
Efficiency and Excellence
  We do have all the other cool perks too:

Apple Macbooks for everyone
Fully stocked fridge and pantry - Coffee, snacks, and more yums
Cutting edge tools. If something can be automated, we'll make it happen
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at StoreHub. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Sales Specialist(Healthcare/Diagnostics (preferably in IVD)
description:

7.) Ensure distributor compliances to adhere closely to all internal and external requirements
What we're looking for
1.) Education – Degree in Science and preferably with business qualification
2.) Experience – Minimum of 3 years commercial management experience in Healthcare/Diagnostics (preferably in IVD); distributor management experience a plus
3. Required Skill – Strong understanding of customer and market dynamics in the Philippines market.
4.) Ability to demonstrate top-tier business development and distributor handling skills. Illustrate strong presentation, communication and be able to make strategic influences.
5.) Possess strong language proficiency in English.
6.) Preferred Skills – Monitor, analyze and evaluate market trends, adjust business strategies accordingly and liaise with other functional and operational area managers to ensure that business strategies and activities are integrated with other parts of the business and align with overall SEA objectives. Lead, motivate and drive dealers to achieve established sales and profit goals on sustainable
What we offer

At Business Trends Philippines, we believe in creating a collaborative and supportive work environment that empowers our employees to thrive. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for professional development and career advancement. We also prioritize the well-being of our employees, with a range of health and wellness initiatives to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.
About us

Business Trends Philippines is a leading provider of innovative healthcare and diagnostic solutions. With a strong focus on customer satisfaction, we work closely with our clients to deliver tailored products and services that address their unique needs. Our mission is to drive positive change in the healthcare industry and improve patient outcomes through the power of technology and data-driven insights.

We’re looking for passionate professionals ready to grow and make an impact.

title: Staff Accountant / Bookkeeper | Work From Home
description:
Looking to join a dynamic team where your accounting skills make a real impact? We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Staff Accountant / Bookkeeper with at least 3 years of experience to help us streamline financial operations and support our fast-growing US-based team. 3+ years of experience in accounting/bookkeeping.
Proficient in QuickBooks Online and Bill.com.
Experience with accounts payable and expense coding.
Strong attention to detail and excellent time management skills.
Ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks.
Problem-solving mindset and proactive approach.
Willingness to work EST Time Zone hours.
Preferred / Nice-to-Have Skills:
Experience with 1099 preparation.
Experience with merchant account reconciliations.

title: Healthcare Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
Join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact in the healthcare industry. You'll play a pivotal role in ensuring accurate claims processing while advancing your career in a supportive and innovative environment. Enjoy competitive benefits upon hire, ongoing professional development, and the satisfaction of helping others every day. Take the next step in your career with Med-Metrix!
Experience these exceptional benefits when you join Med-Metrix!
8-Hour Shifts, Fixed Weekends Off
Day 1 HMO with 2 of your dependents covered for FREE
Medical Cash Allowance
Rice Allowance
Clothing Allowance
Free Lunch Daily
Paid Time Off
Training and Staff Development
Employee Engagement Activities
Opportunities for Internal Mobility

Job Purpose
The Healthcare Accounts Receivable Specialist is responsible for collections, account follow up, billing and allowance posting for the accounts assigned to them.
Duties and Responsibilities
Follow-up with payers to ensure timely resolution of all outstanding claims, via phone, emails, fax or websites
Meets and maintains daily productivity/quality standards established in departmental policies
Uses the workflow system, client host system and other tools available to them to collect payments and resolve accounts
Adheres to the policies and procedures established for the client/team
Knowledge of timely filing deadlines for each designated payer
Performs research regarding payer specific billing guidelines as needed
Ability to analyze, identify and resolve issues causing payer payment delays
Ability to analyze, identify and trend claims issues to proactively reduce denials
Communicates to management any issues and/or trends identified
Initiate appeals when necessary
Ability to identify and correct medical billing errors
Send appropriate appeals, accurate requesting information, supporting documentation, and effective communication to complete recovery process
Understanding of under or over payments and credit balance processes
Assist with special A/R projects as needed. Analytical skills and the ability to communicate results are required
Act cooperatively and courteously with patients, visitors, co-workers, management and clients
Work independently from assigned work queues
Maintain confidentiality at all times
Maintain a professional attitude
Other duties as assigned by the management team
Use, protect and disclose patients’ protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards
Understand and comply with Information Security and HIPAA policies and procedures at all times
Limit viewing of PHI to the absolute minimum as necessary to perform assigned duties
Qualifications
1 year of experience in the BPO healthcare insurance industry, with hands on experience on Accounts Receivable (AR) follow-up
Proficient in processing health and medical insurance claims from end to end with an understanding of payer-specific requirements and denials management and processing.
Experienced on medical billing/ AR Collections
In-depth knowledge on claims payments processing, claims status and tracking, Medical Billing, AR Follow ups, Denials and Appeals-outbound healthcare providers.
Familiar with key healthcare and insurance terminologies including copay, coinsurance, and deductibles.
Amenable to handling a mixture of 70% back-office support and 30% outbound call support
Background in calling insurance (Payer) to verify claim status and payment dispute
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to communicate well at all levels of the organization
Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses
High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results oriented 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required
Gracious and welcoming personality for customer service interaction
Working Conditions
Must be amenable to work night shifts
Must be willing to work onsite
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to move around the work area; Sit; perform manual tasks; operate tools and other office equipment such as computer, computer peripherals and telephones; extend arms; kneel; talk and hear.
Mental Demands: The employee must be able to follow directions, collaborate with others, and handle stress.
Work Environment: The noise level in the work environment is usually minimal.
Med-Metrix will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, gender(including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, veteran status, other non-merit based factors, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Marketing Executive [ Hybrid, Philippines ]
description:
Job Summary:
We are looking for a Game Marketing Executive to support and execute marketing campaigns, influencer partnerships, and community engagement initiatives to drive awareness and player acquisition. This role requires a passionate gamer with strong digital marketing skills who can contribute to marketing strategies, collaborate with teams, and take ownership of key marketing activities.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter who takes initiative, is solution-oriented, and is accountable for delivering results.
Job Scope:
Marketing Campaign Execution
Assist in planning and executing localized marketing campaigns to promote games.
Implement user acquisition, engagement, and retention strategies across multiple channels.
Support digital marketing initiatives, including social media, influencer marketing, paid ads, and content creation.
Work with internal teams to ensure consistent messaging and branding across all marketing channels.
Community & Influencer Engagement
Identify and engage with local gaming communities, content creators, and influencers.
Support KOL (Key Opinion Leader) partnerships by coordinating content campaigns and collaborations.
Actively monitor, engage, and grow social media platforms, responding to player inquiries and feedback.
Propose creative engagement strategies to increase community interaction.
Event & Campaign Support
Assist in organizing offline and online gaming events, including tournaments, launch events, and promotional activities.
Work with partners to execute giveaways, special in-game events, and co-branded activations.
Support media partnerships, sponsorships, and local gaming initiatives to boost brand presence.
Performance Monitoring & Optimization
Track and analyze marketing campaign results, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Use marketing analytics tools to measure engagement, conversion rates, and campaign effectiveness.
Stay updated on industry trends, competitor strategies, and gaming market insights.
Cross-functional Collaboration
Work closely with regional marketing, creative, and game publishing teams to align on marketing strategies.
Collaborate with advertising agencies, PR firms, and external partners to execute marketing plans.
Ensure that all marketing materials, campaigns, and initiatives adhere to brand guidelines.
Qualifications:
Must-Have:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in marketing, preferably in the gaming or digital entertainment industry.
Strong knowledge of local gaming culture, communities, and industry trends.
Experience in social media management, digital marketing, or influencer partnerships.
Proficiency in social media platforms, content marketing, and digital advertising tools.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in [local language] and English.
Passion for gaming and esports.
Soft Skills & Mindset:
Self-starter – Takes initiative and ownership of projects without needing constant supervision.
Proactive & Initiative-Driven – Always looking for new opportunities and ways to enhance marketing efforts.
Accountability – Responsible for assigned tasks and ensures quality execution.
Solution-oriented – Able to identify challenges and propose effective solutions.
Results-driven – Focused on achieving marketing goals and delivering measurable impact.
Team Player – Works well with cross-functional teams and external partners.
Nice-to-Have:
Experience in MMORPG or hardcore gaming communities.
Familiarity with game publishing, esports marketing, or mobile game promotion.
Basic skills in graphic design, video editing, or content creation.
Knowledge of SEO, paid ads, and user acquisition strategies.
Why Join Us?
Work on exciting game marketing campaigns and expand your expertise in the gaming industry.
Gain hands-on experience in community building, influencer collaborations, and event marketing.
Be part of a passionate and dynamic gaming team.
Career growth opportunities in regional marketing and leadership roles.

title: Customer Success Manager (For Talent Pipelining)
description:
The Deltek Customer Success team plays a key role in helping our customers maximize the value for their solutions. As a member of our team, you are the customer’s advocate to help them find answers to their questions and support the renewal and growth of their business. If you thrive in a collaborative environment, where learning and development are encouraged, consider Deltek as the next step in your career.

The Customer Success Manager (CSM) is responsible for building and maintaining strong customer relationships to ensure the successful adoption of Deltek’s SaaS products. This role includes renewing existing SaaS contracts, identifying new business and expansion opportunities, meeting or exceeding quotas for both renewals and expansions, and providing responsive support for customer requests, inquiries, and training needs. The CSM also escalates customer issues to Support and other relevant teams at Deltek. Reporting to a Team Lead, the CSM is expected to be proficient in using AI tools to streamline tasks and enhance productivity.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
2+ years of experience in sales, customer service field, or equivalent experience.
Strong, proven sales skills.
Excellent customer service and relationship development skills.
Strong verbal/telephone and written/electronic communication skills.
Excellent time management and organizational skills.
Enthusiastic, hard-working, and pleasant attitude.
Demonstrated industry knowledge in the Federal IT Government market.
Strong computer and internet skills, including MS Office, and internet research.
Able to work extended hours (to cover various US time zones)
Strong sales and listening skills for the purpose of obtaining the maximum information from customers, generating customer interest, and closing sales.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to adapt to varying situations and personalities.
Self-motivated and proactive team member who will utilize time efficiently, share knowledge, and be receptive to others’ ideas.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, that will enable the remote sale of products and services, as well as internal information-sharing.
Organizational skills and computer competency that will facilitate customer and business tracking, follow-up, and team coverage.
Must be knowledgeable in and utilize AI tools to help streamline tasks
For Talent Pipelining (For Future Hiring)

title: Senior Financial Accountant – Client Fund Administration & Registry | HYBRID
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
SENIOR FINANCIAL ACCOUNTANT (Client Fund Administration & Registry)
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN SENIOR FINANCIAL ACCOUNTANT (Client Fund Administration & Registry)?
This role is responsible for managing the fund administration and investor registry functions across Rawlings Bolton’s client funds. The position ensures accurate, timely, and compliant reporting for a growing portfolio of funds (currently 12 and expanding), including unit pricing, investor reporting, and audit support. The role operates in close collaboration with the Senior Financial Accountant focused on internal corporate accounting, with both roles cross-trained to provide coverage and flexibility across the finance function.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Fund Accounting & Unit Pricing
1. Prepare and review monthly fund accounting records.
2. Prepare and review unit pricing and fund NAV for managed investment schemes, ensuring
accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements and client agreements.
3. Maintain investor registry and process subscriptions, redemptions, and distributions.
4. Perform reconciliations of fund assets, liabilities, income, and expenses.
5. Prepare valuation of investments, accruals, and allocations.
6. Prepare distribution reconciliations and investor reporting (monthly and quarterly).
7. Liaise with fund managers, trustees and auditors to ensure timely and accurate reporting.
8. Ensure compliance with fund mandates, AFSL obligations, and regulatory requirements.
Collaboration & Coverage
1. Cross-train with the Senior Financial Accountant focused on internal corporate accounting
to ensure mutual coverage and support.
2. Participate in continuous improvement initiatives and automation/AI projects.
3. Provide technical guidance to junior team members (if applicable).
Compliance & Audit
1. Ensure all fund and corporate reporting deadlines are met.
2. Prepare audit workpapers and support annual audits for both client funds and the business.
3. Maintain documentation and strong internal controls and contribute to compliance with
ASIC and other regulators.
Client Service & Team Support
1. Act as a key point of contact for clients on fund accounting and reporting matters.
2. Provide technical support and mentoring to junior accountants (where applicable)
3. Work closely with internal stakeholders (operations, compliance, investment teams) to
ensure smooth delivery of services. 
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Essential:
 CPA or CA qualified.
 Bachelor's degree in accounting, Finance, or related discipline.
 Minimum 5 years’ experience in fund accounting, investor registry, corporate accounting,
or financial reporting
 Strong knowledge of fund accounting and unit pricing methodologies.
 Solid understanding of Australian Accounting Standards, tax, and ASIC compliance
requirements.
 Strong reconciliation, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
 Advanced Excel skills and experience with accounting/fund administration systems.
 Strong communication skills and ability to manage client and stakeholder relationships.
Desirable:
 Experience in Xero will be highly regarded
 Experience with fund administration or unit registry systems (e.g. Registry Direct, Paxus)
 Exposure to both managed investment schemes and corporate entity accounting.
 Experience in mid-sized or boutique financial services firms.
Key Attributes
 High attention to detail and accuracy.
 Client-focused with a proactive approach and solutions orientated.
 Able to manage multiple priorities and meet strict deadlines.
 Collaborative Team player with mentoring abilities.
 Continuous improvement mindset and tech savvy.

title: Trade Marketing Lead (Pagbilao, Quezon)
description:
Reporting to: Field Marketing Zone Manager 
Duty Post: Pagbilao, Quezon
The Territory Consumer Lead (TCL) is under the Marketing function and is responsible for driving the business growth of their assigned territory through consumer acquisition and retention.
To achieve this, the incumbent needs to drive quality Retailer Distribution and Wholesale Volume through a consumer-centric approach mindset. Based on their assessment of the challenges and opportunities in the assigned territory, making use of available information and collaborating with Field Sales, they will develop the necessary short- and long-term strategies and programs that will address the needs of the business and support the delivery of the territory KPIs, growth inclusive.
This role will be tasked to lead the development and management (including monitoring and reporting) of relevant campaigns and/or programs, that are part of the overall regional and zone strategies covering various touchpoints such as General Trade Retailers and Wholesalers and Local Key Accounts where the overall objective is Consumer Acquisition and Retention in the assigned territory.
This role will also be tasked to do the following:
External (Nielsen) and Internal (Sales Data) Data Analysis
Conquer tools champion
Competitive Analysis
Budget Monitoring
Creation of internal documents such as contracts, project briefs, weekly reports, closure reports, presentations during business reviews
As the Territory Consumer Lead in the area of Marketing, you will:
Strategy & Campaign Development
Analyze data, competitive landscape, and insights to create strategic plans for JTI brands ensuring growth within assigned territories.
Oversee approval processes and operational requirements for campaign/program activation, coordinating with Marketing & Sales (M&S), agencies, procurement, suppliers, and commercial systems.
Ensure clear communication of campaigns to sales frontliners.
Implementation Leadership
Develop mechanics and guide field sales in program execution adhering to objectives, timelines, allocations, and compliance protocols.
Lead the deployment of brand and field marketing activities, including trade deals, incentives, bundling, sampling, and consumer activations.
Manage the full-year consumer acquisition calendar, optimize performance management, and resource deployment.
Program Evaluation
Conduct surveys to ensure execution compliance, address challenges promptly, and escalate issues as needed.
Evaluate performance against objectives, including volume, store participation, competitive response, and campaign spend efficiency.
Monitor and analyze execution success through post-program evaluations.
Territory Leadership
Support launches by building robust bottom-up campaigns, securing pipeline volumes, and ensuring distribution, merchandising, and pricing compliance.
Develop consumer campaigns to enhance brand reach in key territories/barangays.
Optimize route-to-consumer strategies for impactful campaign delivery.
Resource Management
Manage FM budgets and program tools/material deployment.
Enforce strict control and compliance for program enablers.
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree graduate, preferably of a Marketing / Business / Communications - related courses
At least 2 years’ experience in Sales, Marketing, and Trade Marketing. Field experience is an advantage
Good communication skills - Oral and Written (English, Filipino. Local dialect is an advantage)
Good understanding of digital tools, including usage of MS Office (Word, Excel & PowerPoint, Power BI)
Drivers’ license (B1 or higher). We have a program to support qualified women, who do not hold a drivers’ license

title: Loan Processing Officer | AU Client
description:
Overview
Do you have 1 - 2 years of experience in the Australian mortgage industry? We're looking for a driven and detail-oriented Loan Processing Officer to join our fast-paced, supportive team!

Perks You’ll Enjoy If Hired
• Competitive salary package
• 25 days of paid leave
• HMO coverage from Day 1

title: Data and AI Associate Director
description:
EY GDS Philippines is looking for a dynamic, visionary and highly motivated Associate Director to lead our growing AI & Data team. In this role, you will build and lead a team of experts to deliver cutting-edge AI & Data solutions that transform our customer’s business and accelerate their growth. You will be responsible for shaping the practice’s direction, building client relationships, and ensuring the successful implementation of complex AI and data programs. If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for AI & Data, this is the perfect opportunity to lead and innovate at the forefront of the industry.
Responsibilities:
This leadership role has multiple dimensions and is a combination of the following:
Lead and significantly scale up the AI & Data practice of GDS Philippines
Lead and manage end-to-end AI & Data projects for clients, including problem definition, data acquisition, model development, validation, deployment and monitoring
Work with client and internal teams to solution/architect complex /large transformative deals in technology
Own and anchor key accounts in the region and grow the GDS involvement in large numbers for GDS Consulting.
Demonstrate thought leadership by active participation in AI & Data forums locally and even globally
Represent GDS AI & Data team to various stakeholders in the country (e.g. community, educational partners, etc.)
Collaborate with client facing and internal teams to prepare Point of Views, Position Papers
Drive skilling programs in current team, including training programs, certifications & POCs.
Coaching and Mentoring – Coaches Managers, Senior consultants, etc. within structured leadership training programs.
Should be responsible for grooming next generation leaders, including women leaders
Budget and Planning - Responsible for preparing budgetary outlay and its management during the budget cycle
Qualifications:
A university degree or Master’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or a related field
At least 12 years of experience in data engineering, analytics, or artificial intelligence related modelling in the industry
Demonstrate strong consulting experience, in-depth business knowledge in Data Engineering, AI and Automation areas of the business
Ability to sell and deliver large scale consulting engagements with distributed delivery mindset.
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and other data analysis tools and platforms
High expertise in next generation technologies such as cloud, big data, AI/ML, etc.
Strong knowledge of analytical modelling required for fields such as logistics & distribution, inventory management, stock policy, optimization, catalogue health etc.
Experience in architecting and working on end-to-end analytics project lifecycle, including data acquisition, model development, validation, deployment and monitoring
Proven leadership skills, having led medium to large scale data teams and practices
Ability to manage clients and stakeholders effectively and build strong relationships

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
TSA is an Australian-owned business specializing in helping companies acquire, retain and grow their consumer customer bases. We represent some of the country's largest brands, across eight call centres in Australia and internationally.
We're a purpose driven business and our mission is clear. We endeavor to create experiences that people love, by revolutionizing the way they connect and communicate with brands.


About Us
At TSA Group, we design and deliver contact centre solutions for some of the world's leading brands. We create experiences that people love, by revolutionising the way they connect with brands. Our work spans multiple industries, including telco, logistics, insurance, automotive, travel, and government. With over 5,000 dedicated professionals across Australia, New Zealand, and the Philippines, we ensure that every interaction is meaningful and impactful.

We have a team of talented technology experts and customer experience consultants that work hand in hand to create this seamless and genuinely enjoyable customer journey. Our technology experts build the tech that enables our clients to deliver great experiences for their customers, and our consultants work to provide a tailored and considered approach to customer service and sales.
Company Description
TSA is an Australian-owned business specializing in helping companies acquire, retain and grow their consumer customer bases. We represent some of the country's largest brands, across eight call centres in Australia and internationally.
We're a purpose driven business and our mission is clear. We endeavor to create experiences that people love, by revolutionizing the way they connect and communicate with brands.
Job Responsibilities
What will your normal day look like:
The Marketing Specialist is responsible for the delivery of TSA's marketing campaigns. This role involves working closely with the Group Manager - Marketing & Growth to develop and implement TSA's marketing strategy, ensuring all activities are delivered consistently, on schedule, and to a high standard.
The Marketing Specialist excels in organisational and communication skills, engaging both internal and external stakeholders for content contribution, from the TSA Executive Leadership Team to external agency partners. They take ownership of content planning and creation, manage digital campaigns, and bring strong product and content marketing skills to the role. Working closely with the Internal Communications Coordinator, Senior Graphic Designer, and Marketing & Communications Coordinator, they ensure campaigns are integrated, on brand, and continuously improved through data analysis.
Qualifications
What you'll do:
Essential
3-5+ years of relevant experience in digital marketing, content, and campaign management (client-side or agency).
2+ years' hands-on experience with HubSpot (or equivalent marketing automation/CRM platforms)
Strong experience in content creation and planning
Proven track record running SEO and digital ad campaigns
Experience designing and delivering lifecycle or inbound marketing campaigns
Proficiency with analytics tools (e.g. GA4)
Ability to balance creativity with data-driven decision making
Excellent written and verbal communication skills — able to confidently liaise with agencies and internal stakeholders
Strong organisational skills and attention to detail
Additional Information
Want to know more? Check out our social media pages:

Website: https://tsagroup.com.au/
Instagram: tsa_group_
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/tsa-group-australia/

TSA Group is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and building a workforce that reflects the diverse communities we serve. We provide equal opportunities to all, regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, or life stage. Join us and be part of a team that values and respects every individual's unique contributions.
Stay vigilant against fraudulent job offers. We never ask for financial details during our recruitment process and legitimate communication will come from official TSA Group email addresses (e.g. @tsagroup.com.au). Your safety matters. If you receive a suspicious job offer, do not respond and report it to tsatalent@tsagroup.com.au.

title: Crewing Officer
description:
Leadership in Crew Management: Lead and coordinate crew assignments, travel arrangements, and effective
communication with crew members. Provide strategic oversight to the crewing team, ensuring alignment
with organizational objectives.
• Crew Coordination: Collaborate with scheduling teams to ensure crew assignments align with vessel
schedules. Communicate any changes in crew assignments promptly to both crew members and scheduling
departments.
• Dispatch and Documentation Excellence: Oversee the completeness and accuracy of crew dispatch
documentation, including embarkation forms, visas, and travel permits. Ensure the timely submission of all
necessary documentation for crew dispatch.
• Engagement Proposal Generation: Prepare engagement proposals for crew members. Ensures that
engagement proposals align with the company's policies, industry regulations, and any relevant collective
bargaining agreements.
• Visa and OKTB Management: Initiate and manage the process of requesting and obtaining OKTB and visa
requirements for crew members based on their assigned voyages and destinations.
• Port and Travel Agent Communication: Establish and maintain communication with port authorities to
facilitate seamless crew embarkation and disembarkation processes and liaise with travel agents to
coordinate travel arrangements for crew members.
• Medical Renewal Process: Coordinate with medical facilities for crew member medical examinations and
renewals in compliance with industry standards and Schedule and follow up on medical appointments for
crew members to ensure timely completion of required medical examinations.
• Efficient Crew Database Management: Lead the regular update and maintenance of the crew database,
ensuring accuracy of personal details, certifications, and contact information.
• Strategic Leadership and Oversight: Provide leadership and oversight to an assistant crewing analyst, guiding
them in their daily tasks, prioritizing workload, and ensuring alignment with departmental goals.
• Proactive Problem Solving: Act as a proactive point of contact for the team, offering guidance and support in
addressing complex issues and challenges in crewing operations.
Page 2
JOB DESCRIPTION
• Training and Development Champion: Champion the training and development of the crewing team,
ensuring continuous improvement and acquisition of necessary skills.
• Reporting and Analytics: Generate and present comprehensive reports and analytics from the crew database
as required by management and other relevant departments.

description:
