title: Medical Claims Analyst (Blended Account)
description:
Join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact in the healthcare industry. You'll play a pivotal role in ensuring accurate claims processing while advancing your career in a supportive and innovative environment. Enjoy competitive benefits upon hire, ongoing professional development, and the satisfaction of helping others every day. Take the next step in your career with Med-Metrix!
Experience these exceptional benefits when you join Med-Metrix!
8-Hour Shifts, Fixed Weekends Off
Day 1 HMO with 2 of your dependents covered for FREE
Medical Cash Allowance
Rice Allowance
Clothing Allowance
Free Lunch Daily
Paid Time Off
Training and Staff Development
Employee Engagement Activities
Opportunities for Internal Mobility

Job Purpose
The Healthcare Accounts Receivable Specialist is responsible for collections, account follow up, billing and allowance posting for the accounts assigned to them.
Duties and Responsibilities
Follow-up with payers to ensure timely resolution of all outstanding claims, via phone, emails, fax or websites
Meets and maintains daily productivity/quality standards established in departmental policies
Uses the workflow system, client host system and other tools available to them to collect payments and resolve accounts
Adheres to the policies and procedures established for the client/team
Knowledge of timely filing deadlines for each designated payer
Performs research regarding payer specific billing guidelines as needed
Ability to analyze, identify and resolve issues causing payer payment delays
Ability to analyze, identify and trend claims issues to proactively reduce denials
Communicates to management any issues and/or trends identified
Initiate appeals when necessary
Ability to identify and correct medical billing errors
Send appropriate appeals, accurate requesting information, supporting documentation, and effective communication to complete recovery process
Understanding of under or over payments and credit balance processes
Assist with special A/R projects as needed. Analytical skills and the ability to communicate results are required
Act cooperatively and courteously with patients, visitors, co-workers, management and clients
Work independently from assigned work queues
Maintain confidentiality at all times
Maintain a professional attitude
Other duties as assigned by the management team
Use, protect and disclose patients’ protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards
Understand and comply with Information Security and HIPAA policies and procedures at all times
Limit viewing of PHI to the absolute minimum as necessary to perform assigned duties
Qualifications
1 year of experience in the BPO healthcare insurance industry, with hands on experience on Accounts Receivable (AR) follow-up
Proficient in processing health and medical insurance claims from end to end with an understanding of payer-specific requirements and denials management and processing.
Experienced on medical billing/ AR Collections
In-depth knowledge on claims payments processing, claims status and tracking, Medical Billing, AR Follow ups, Denials and Appeals-outbound healthcare providers.
Familiar with key healthcare and insurance terminologies including copay, coinsurance, and deductibles.
Amenable to handling a mixture of 70% back-office support and 30% outbound call support
Background in calling insurance (Payer) to verify claim status and payment dispute
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to communicate well at all levels of the organization
Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses
High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results oriented 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required
Gracious and welcoming personality for customer service interaction
Working Conditions
Must be amenable to work night shifts
Must be willing to work onsite
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to move around the work area; Sit; perform manual tasks; operate tools and other office equipment such as computer, computer peripherals and telephones; extend arms; kneel; talk and hear.
Mental Demands: The employee must be able to follow directions, collaborate with others, and handle stress.
Work Environment: The noise level in the work environment is usually minimal.
Med-Metrix will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, gender(including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, veteran status, other non-merit based factors, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Service Desk Engineer
description:
As a Service Desk Engineer, you will act as the first point of contact for ANTlabs' customers to report issues and faults relating to our products for support and services. 
The primary objective of the role is to provide first time resolution. This will be achieved by troubleshooting, diagnosing and resolved problems at the first point of contact and/or escalating the fault to one of our 2nd line specialist teams to investigate and resolve. 
Throughout this process, you will remain the single point of contact with the customers during your shift, maintaining ownership and the main point of contact between the customers and ANTlabs, providing timely updates and ensuring the fault is given the correct level of priority and attention.
This is a position which calls for excellent customer service skills, the ability to articulate resolutions clearly and confidently to customers and a good level of technical knowledge of ANTlabs products. 

Responsibilities: 
Involve in providing customers and partners with in-depth technical assistance in the use of ANTlabs' products and solutions
Cooperate with clients, sales and professional services teams to ensure ongoing customer success and satisfaction
Form part of an on-call rotation in order to guarantee 24x7x365 support to customers in shifts
Participate in the maintenance of support documentations 

Requirements: 
Has experience working with Linux OS (1-2yrs)
Experience in UNIX scripting is a plus
Networking experience exposure or CCNA certified is a plus
Have prior knowledge and experience in troubleshooting, configuring gateway appliance, or network appliance
Resourceful with good analytical skills and ability to perform systematic troubleshooting techniques 
Good customer handling and communication skills
Comfortable in handling customers over the phone
Good and clear communication skills (oral and written)
Knowledge in PMS, basic HTML / PHP is a plus

Personal: 
Collaborative team player
Self-motivated, highly responsible
Able to work well under pressure
Responsible and good work ethics

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Job Title: Executive Assistant
Location: Remote (must reside in the Philippines)
Employment Type: Full-time or part-time
Company Overview: Superpowers is dedicated to empowering entrepreneurs to achieve extraordinary freedom and growth by providing them with elite-level Executive Assistants. We believe the right Executive Assistant is not merely an assistant but a proactive partner who anticipates the entrepreneur’s needs, manages their professional and personal life, and helps them operate consistently in their unique abilities. At Superpowers, you’re not just part of a team—you’re part of a community that offers robust coaching, continuous learning, and an environment that celebrates your successes.

You will act as their proxy, deeply understand their goals, anticipate their needs, and proactively manage their time, energy, and focus. Your role is crucial to creating freedom, enabling growth, and ensuring they operate within their unique abilities.

title: Account Manager - Ecommerce Marketplaces | Up to PHP160K
salary: Up to PHP160,000 + Weekends Off + Day 1 HMO
description:
Lead Global Ecommerce Growth for Trusted Wellness Brands
Drive performance, strategy, and success across the world's biggest ecommerce platforms-where data meets creativity and your ideas turn into measurable growth.
Job Description
As an Account Manager - Marketplaces, you'll own ecommerce strategy and account performance across Amazon and Walmart. Manage listings, pricing, inventory, and campaigns to drive visibility, conversion, and profitability while collaborating with digital marketing and supply-chain teams.
Job Overview
Employment type: Full-time
Shift: Night Shift, Weekends Off
Work setup: Onsite (Megatower, Ortigas)
Exciting Perks Await!
Day 1 HMO coverage with free dependent
Competitive Salary Package
Night differential pay to maximize your earnings
Prime office location in Ortigas (Easy access to MRT stations, restaurants, and banks)
Fixed weekends off
Salary Advance Program through our banking partner (Eligibility and approval subject to bank assessment. Available to account holders with minimum of 6 months company tenure.)
Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization
Standard government and Emapta benefits
Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek
Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Ecommerce, or related field
3+ years of experience managing ecommerce marketplace accounts (Amazon Seller Central/Vendor Central, Walmart Marketplace, etc.)
Proven track record of driving revenue growth and optimizing account performance in a fast-paced digital commerce environment
Strong knowledge of ecommerce platforms, digital merchandising, and online marketing strategies
Knowledge of AI-powered keyword research tools (e.g., Helium 10, Jungle Scout, Perpetua)
Analytical mindset with proficiency in Excel, Google Analytics, and marketplace reporting tools
Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship-building skills
Detail-oriented with strong project management abilities
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building AI-enhanced dashboards in Power BI, Looker, or Tableau
Skilled in using LLMs (e.g., ChatGPT, Jasper, Copy.ai) for reporting and content generation
Familiarity with AI chat agents or workflow tools for automating marketplace tasks
Knowledge of AI-driven review sentiment analysis tools to interpret customer feedback
Your Daily Tasks
Marketplace Strategy & Growth
Develop and execute marketplace account strategies to achieve revenue, profitability, and market share targets
Monitor competitor activity and marketplace trends to identify opportunities for growth
Collaborate with digital marketing teams to plan and execute paid search, sponsored product, and promotional campaigns
Account & Relationship Management
Serve as the primary contact for marketplace account managers and platform representatives
Manage joint business planning, negotiate terms, and track performance against KPIs
Build strong relationships with external partners to secure merchandising opportunities and enhance visibility
Product Content & Optimization
Ensure listings are SEO-optimized with compelling titles, bullet points, images, A+ content, and brand store enhancements
Maintain product catalog accuracy, manage variations, and oversee detail page improvements
Collaborate with creative teams for brand-aligned visuals and video content
Oversee brand registry, IP protection, and review strategies
Inventory, Pricing & Operations
Partner with supply chain and inventory teams to forecast demand and prevent stockouts
Plan and execute promotions, coupons, and seasonal campaigns (Prime Day, Black Friday, Cyber Monday)
Monitor fulfillment methods (FBA, FBM, WFS) and optimize for profitability
Ensure compliance with marketplace requirements and maintain pricing strategies
Coordinate with operations and 3PL partners for seamless fulfillment
Analytics & Reporting
Utilize tools like Amazon Business Reports, Helium 10, PacVue, and Seller Board to track KPIs
Provide regular reports on sales, traffic, conversion, and ROI
Identify and resolve risks such as suppressed listings or Buy Box loss
Present actionable insights to leadership and cross-functional teams
KPIs:
Total sales revenue (per marketplace, category, and SKU level)
% of optimized listings (SEO, A+ content, brand store updates)
Buy Box ownership percentage
In-stock rate across top SKUs
Required Competencies
Executes on Strategic Direction
Supports strategic initiatives across teams, vendors, and customers
Identifies and addresses challenges proactively
Adapts to shifting priorities while maintaining focus on company success
Collaborates effectively to achieve shared objectives
Energizes the Organization
Acts in alignment with company Vision, Purpose, and Values
Takes initiative and inspires others through action
Guides teams through change and builds confidence in success
Shares expertise and fosters collaboration
Drives & Delivers Results
Aligns performance goals and fosters accountability
Collaborates across functions to optimize resources
Anticipates risks and drives proactive solutions
Consistently meets or exceeds targets with high-quality outcomes
Builds Organizational Capabilities
Seeks continuous improvement and development
Acts as an ambassador for the organization, attracting and nurturing talent
Builds trust through emotional intelligence and awareness of internal dynamics
Demonstrates self-awareness and adaptability to achieve success
Welcome to Emapta Philippines!
Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Civil Engineer (With Civil 3D Experience) | US Based Client Experience
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time Employment
Work Setup: Onsite onboarding for two weeks, followed by a transition to a remote setup.
Work Schedule: Night Shift (Following U.S. Time Zone)
Location: Eastwood, Libis, Quezon City
Salary Package: 50,000 PHP to 70,000 PHP/Monthly
About the Civil Engineer position
We are seeking a highly skilled Civil Engineer with strong proficiency in Civil 3D to join our team. The ideal candidate will have excellent coordination abilities and a sharp eye for detail, ensuring that all design and drafting outputs meet the highest quality standards. This role requires someone who can work independently, take initiative, and communicate effectively with both internal teams and clients.
Civil Engineer responsibilities are:
Produce and manage high-quality designs and drawings using Civil 3D.
Perform thorough quality checks, including spelling, labels, annotations, and identification of layer overlaps or inconsistencies.
Visualize projects in their entirety and create comprehensive lists of identified errors, along with documented corrections.
Prepare and deliver clear, professional reports on findings and project status.
Apply proper self-checking methods and drafting error prevention processes.
Collaborate and communicate effectively with internal teams and clients to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Job Requirements:
Licensed Civil Engineer preferred
Atleast 4 years of work experience in Civil Engineer.
Proficient in CAD Drafting and Design.
Ability to utilize AutoDesk Civil 3D for design and Drawing Production.
Experience working with US based client is a plus.
Knowledge of drafting standards and ability to adapt to our company drafting structure and style.
Needs to have an eye for graphic quality and drafting standards for conceptual and construction-level drawings.
Ability to understand the effort level and product quality desired based on a short zoom call or phone conversation.
Good communication skills with project manager, able to meet project deadlines.
Ability to perform site layout design, conceptual grading design, and storm/utility layouts with direction from engineer.
Engineering skills could be gradually used more and more as the project manager is comfortable with it.
About Intelassist
Established in 2007, Intelassist is a remote staffing organization that originated from a collaboration between US-based industry professionals and an experienced operational team in Manila, Philippines. Our US team brings over 20 years of experience in engineering, manufacturing, IT, finance, and high-level operations, while our Manila-based team offers over 15 years of experience in delivering exceptional support to global enterprises.
 Our coast-to-coast US offices, in collaboration with our dedicated employees in the Philippines, enable us to deliver results to clients in various markets and for a wide range of roles. With over 15 years of experience in the BPO industry, Intelassist places a strong emphasis on organizational resilience and social stewardship to foster lasting, meaningful partnerships within our team and with our clients.
 At the core of our business lie our people. Our ability to recruit, train, and, most importantly, retain exceptional team members is not only what enables Intelassist to attract the region’s finest talent but also what bestows stability upon our clients through reduced turnover and tangible outcomes.
 With a workforce of slightly over 1,000 employees, we strike a balance – substantial enough to possess profound insight into the Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) industry, yet intimate enough to maintain the family-like, high-energy work atmosphere that our candidates seek.
 At Intelassist, we specialize in sourcing, training, and retaining top-tier talent, each exclusively dedicated to meeting our clients’ unique needs. Our proven track record and local presence ensure that Intelassist clients enjoy increased productivity, reduced staff turnover, and significant cost savings.
WHY INTELASSIST?
We grow together. We value your effort. We aim to empower you.

title: Sign on Bonus! January Start! Healthcare Specialist (Prior Authorization)
description:
What Customer Service Operations contributes to Cardinal Health

Customer Service is responsible for establishing, maintaining and enhancing customer business through contract administration, customer orders, and problem resolution.

Responsible for providing outsourced services to customers relating to medical billing, medical reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.

Job Summary

The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations is responsible for providing outstanding customer service and managing accounts while providing sales support to field sales representatives. This job establishes, maintains and enhances customer service via appropriate contract administration, timely order fulfillment, and providing exemplary customer support including managing accounts and providing sales support to field sales representatives. The job is also responsible for tracking demand and backorders, complaint and incident reporting and supporting post-sales issue resolutions. The job works directly with customers to strengthen Cardinal Health’s operational performance, strengthen existing customer relationships and assists with the prospecting of new business opportunities. The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations collaborates cross functionally with Commercial, Finance, Supply Chain and Operations teams to ensure customer account needs are meet, and operational performance is optimized to enhance customer experience.

Responsibilities
Provides outstanding customer service and supports improvements in operational execution to ensure service levels are achieved and exceeded.
Manages customer account activity including, but are not limited to; customer order fulfillment, customer backorders/substitutes, product change requests, new/lost business submissions and coordinating any customer questions / issues that may arise.
Provides outsourced services to customers relating to invoicing, reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.
Collects and reviews customer feedback, complaints, recalls and product returns, working closely with Quality and Regulatory teams.
Identifies customer trends and challenges/opportunities to develop potential alternatives to support business, operational efficiency and develop new customer opportunities.
Supports process improvement initiatives, including but not limited to opportunities for optimizing inventory levels, suppliers and operational performance, cost control and profitability and ultimately customer service.
Builds strong relationships with key business stakeholders (Supply Chain, Finance, Operations, Marketing and Commercial) to work in collaborative approach for improved customer service.
Communicates with customers regarding their needs, questions, and concerns and helps trouble shoot equipment issues as necessary.
Manages cases regarding reporting, backorders, customer complaints, and pricing and processes product complaint and incident reports.
Supports general sales by analyzing account histories, and coordinating internal resources to resolve customer needs.
Investigates and reports on anomalies and discrepancies in point of sales systems, website ordering, and general customer complaint issues.
Redirects customers to applicable in-house resources as necessary.
Supports general post-sales issues resolutions as necessary.

What is expected of you and others at this level
Effectively applies knowledge of job and company policies and procedures to complete a variety of assignments
In-depth knowledge in technical or specialty area
Applies advanced skills to resolve complex problems independently
May modify process to resolve situations
Works independently within established procedures; may receive general guidance on new assignments
May provide general guidance or technical assistance to less experienced team members

title: Financial Planning and Analysis Specialist
company: GUS Education Business Process Solutions and Services Philippines, Inc.
description:
Join an expanding Finance team in a high-impact FP&A role where your work will directly support the Sales, Marketing and IT groups across the GUS global network. Reporting to the Finance Business Partner Commercial & IT, you will own the budgeting and forecasting process for these vital stakeholder groups, produce management reporting and KPIs, and deliver business intelligence that empowers commercial and technical teams to make faster, smarter decisions. If you are an FP&A Specialist who enjoys close stakeholder engagement, turning data into strategy, and influencing performance at scale,  this is a role where your insights will be visible and valued internationally.


Key Activities and Responsibilities
Support the Finance Business Partner in working with the Commercial and IT management teams on the production of the Commercial and IT budgets, from liaising across the full international breadth of the Commercial team to confirm student recruitment targets for each group institution and the cost to deliver them, through to working with the Commercial and IT management teams to produce right-sized budgets agreed with the institutions in accordance with the Group timetable
Support the Finance Business Partner and Commercial and IT management teams in presenting the Commercial budget proposal to each group institution. Respond to queries and challenges to achieve an agreed final budget
Manage the monthly process of recharging the institutions for Commercial and IT services, liaising with the stakeholders within Commercial, the institutions and the respective finance teams
Produce the monthly financial performance presentations, supporting the business in understanding drivers behind key variances
Support the production of the forecast for Commercial and IT cost centres, working closely with Commercial and IT management teams to identify risks and opportunities and ensure they are managed appropriately and reflected in the forecast
Gather data from disparate sources to support the provision of insight and analysis to the IBD management team on absolute performance against financial and recruitment targets, and relative performance between institutions
Support the Commercial and IT management team in the preparation of business cases to assess the benefit of new projects and initiatives
Support the Finance Business Partner and the Commercial team on ad hoc matters as required

Requirements for the Role
3+ years of experience in a similar role within a large, complex international business, including financial analysis, business partnering, financial modeling, budgeting and forecasting
CPA qualification is desired 
Strong attention to detail, able to produce and review financial data to ensure accuracy
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to identify issues, develop solutions, and drive implementation
Ability to critically analyse complex financial data, identify patterns, and draw meaningful conclusions
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic & global environment and adapt to changing priorities
Highly motivated, driven, and self-directed individual
Skill in presenting financial information visually through charts, graphs, and reports
Strong communication and relationship-building skills; the ability to explain complex financial concepts to non-finance management, and the ability to provide support and productive challenge to management in order to achieve positive outcomes

Work Arrangement
Work Schedule: 8AM UK time (4:00 PM to 1:00 AM)
Work Location: Robinsons Zeta Tower, C5 Road, Ugong Norte, Quezon City. The area is beside Opus Mall and across Tiendesitas and IPI Pasig. It is accessible from Ortigas CBD, Eastwood, C5 Road, and Rizal areas
This is an on-site position for 4 months, with the option to transition to a hybrid work set up of once a week after successfully passing the 3rd month performance review.

title: Admin Assistant
description:
To provide full administrative support to the Head of Department and the rest of the team. This role plays a key part in ensuring smooth day-to-day operations and supporting the department’s initiatives.
What You’ll Do

title: Assistant Brand Manager
description:
About the role

We are seeking an enthusiastic and driven Assistant Brand Manager to join our dynamic marketing team. In this full-time role based in Quezon City, Metro Manila, you will play a crucial part in driving the success of our renowned brands, contributing to their strategic growth and development.
What you'll be doing
Assist the Brand Manager in the development and implementation of brand strategies and marketing plans
Conduct market research and analysis to identify consumer insights and trends to inform brand decisions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create compelling brand content and campaigns
Monitor and report on brand performance metrics to measure the effectiveness of marketing initiatives
Provide administrative support to the Brand Manager or Marketing Director, including budget management and project coordination
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities for brand differentiation
What we're looking for
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field
3-5 years of experience in a brand management or marketing assistant role, preferably within the FMCG or alcohol beverage industry
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret market data and consumer insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Creativity and problem-solving skills to develop innovative brand strategies
Passion for brand building and a keen interest in consumer trends and behaviour
If you are passionate about brand management and eager to contribute to the success of our iconic brands, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Click the "Apply now" button to submit your application.

title: Marketing Analyst P/T or F/T Contractor (WFH) - advanced Excel, mid level SQL
description:
MARKETING ANALYST CONTRACTOR (Part-time or Full-time)
Join a growing and evolving eCommerce company
We are looking for a Marketing Analyst who will play a key role in shaping the marketing strategies and establishing the best practices for analytics. He/she will be responsible for helping to drive traffic by reviewing data, developing new analytics, looking for insights and helping to deliver recommendations on how to continually improve our marketing campaigns. This role will support the consumer life cycle, including online conversion analytics, product profitability and pricing, customer behavior analysis and segmentation.
What You Will Be Responsible For
· Prepare ad-hoc KPI, pricing reports and product performance reports
· Monitor, Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
· Review and analyze all marketing efforts including performance by individual ad, media, and campaign to identify successful elements and work to continuously improve ad performance
· Develop actionable insights and help formulate strategic direction of marketing efforts
· Identify customer trends and recommend data-driven responses to help guide strategy and decision making within the Marketing organization
· Conduct quantitative analysis and statistical modeling to support marketing decision making
· Make strategic recommendations backed up by data and analyzed trends
· Work closely with functional groups across the company – print product, product, and marketing – to grow revenue, and maximize margins
· Perform other duties as assigned
What We’d Like You To Have
· Bachelor Degree in a quantitative or analytical field (math, science, economics, finance, engineering) required. Master’s preferred
· 2+ years of relevant work experience in an analytical role
· Should be comfortable working with large data sets
· Advanced quantitative and qualitative problem-solving skills
· Creative and innovative thinker with an ability to translate complex ideas, sophisticated analyses and metrics into a simple, actionable marketing strategy
· Hands on experience with advanced Excel and SQL
· Development experience in scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)
· Experience manipulating large data sets and statistical modeling through R or Python
· Strong math, statistics, and data mining skills
· Experience with classification and clustering technique is a plus
· Experience with Tableau, MicroStrategy and other BI tools is a plus
· Experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager is a plus
· Display high-level of professional discipline and service leadership
· Articulate in both written and verbal English communication
What You Will Get
· Competitive Salary DOE
· Opportunities to work and collaborate with top executives directly
· Enjoy being a vocal member of a diverse, collaborative and evolving digital marketing team
· Make a difference in a trusted company that is a leader in its industry
· Ability to have significant UX input and contribute to strategy
Get to Know Us
Digital Room is an eCommerce company that helps our US-based small and medium-sized business customers (SMBs) succeed by providing and manufacturing customized marketing and branding products. As a vertically integrated, multi-brand business, Digital Room has eight manufacturing facilities, and over 15 different brands. Our focus on providing excellent custom products on time at a fair price has built an extremely loyal customer base, and consistent industry-leading growth and profitability. Established 25 years ago in Los Angeles, Digital Room is a private equity backed company.
We have built a strong company culture rooted in our core values: Dedication & Collaboration, Quality Driven, Data Driven Mindset, Customer Driven Drive to Succeed and Professionalism & Integrity.
We offer a broad array of customized marketing and branding products within the categories of Marketing Essentials, Signs & Banners, Stickers & Labels, Packaging and Promotional Products. We combine great technology with our talented global employee base of over 2,000 people to deliver millions of orders each year.
Digital Room PH, established 15 years ago, has offices in Mandaluyong, Metro Manila and Clark, Pampanga which includes team members in every part of our business. Our seasoned marketing team is data-driven, collaborative and proactive. You will work side by side/virtually with marketing experts in the U.S. and the Philippines. Enjoy applying your skills and learning new ones at the forefront of digital marketing in a supportive, friendly, and fast-paced environment.
Join Us!
Are you ready to make a difference? This is an excellent opportunity to join an amazing team in a fast-growing company. We are all about developing and training our employees to reach their career potential and inspiring teamwork! Please send in your resume (cover letter optional) and tell us why we should pick you.
We accept applicants across Philippines. Our workweek is Tuesday to Saturday with an early AM shift.
We are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Medical Claims Analyst (AR Follow Up)
description:
Join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact in the healthcare industry. As a Medical Claims Analyst, you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring accurate claims processing while advancing your career in a supportive and innovative environment. Enjoy competitive benefits upon hire, ongoing professional development, and the satisfaction of helping others every day. Take the next step in your career with Med-Metrix!
Experience these exceptional benefits when you join Med-Metrix!
8-Hour Shifts, Fixed Weekends Off
Day 1 HMO with 2 of your dependents covered for FREE
Medical Cash Allowance
Rice Allowance
Clothing Allowance
Free Lunch Daily
Paid Time Off
Training and Staff Development
Employee Engagement Activities
Opportunities for Internal Mobility
Job Purpose
The Medical Claims Analyst is responsible for collections, account follow up, billing and allowance posting for the accounts assigned to them.
Duties and Responsibilities
Follow-up with payers to ensure timely resolution of all outstanding claims, via phone, emails, fax or websites
Meets and maintains daily productivity/quality standards established in departmental policies
Uses the workflow system, client host system and other tools available to them to collect payments and resolve accounts
Adheres to the policies and procedures established for the client/team
Knowledge of timely filing deadlines for each designated payer
Performs research regarding payer specific billing guidelines as needed
Ability to analyze, identify and resolve issues causing payer payment delays
Ability to analyze, identify and trend claims issues to proactively reduce denials
Communicates to management any issues and/or trends identified
Initiate appeals when necessary
Ability to identify and correct medical billing errors
Send appropriate appeals, accurate requesting information, supporting documentation, and effective communication to complete recovery process
Understanding of under or over payments and credit balance processes
Assist with special A/R projects as needed. Analytical skills and the ability to communicate results are required
Act cooperatively and courteously with patients, visitors, co-workers, management and clients
Work independently from assigned work queues
Maintain confidentiality at all times
Maintain a professional attitude
Other duties as assigned by the management team
Use, protect and disclose patients’ protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards
Understand and comply with Information Security and HIPAA policies and procedures at all times
Limit viewing of PHI to the absolute minimum as necessary to perform assigned duties
Qualifications
Minimum 1 year of Healthcare Account Receivable/Collections in a BPO setting or environment (claims payments processing, claims status and tracking, Medical Billing, AR Follow ups, Denials and Appeals-outbound healthcare providers) and at least 1 year US healthcare - Medical/Healthcare Insurance experience.
Amenable to handling a mixture of 70% back-office support and 30% outbound call support
Experienced on medical billing/ AR Collections
Must have an experience processing workers compensation benefits.
Background in calling insurance (Payer) to verify claim status and payment dispute
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to communicate well at all levels of the organization
Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses
High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results oriented 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required
Gracious and welcoming personality for customer service interaction
Working Conditions
Must be amenable to work night shifts
Must be willing to work onsite
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to move around the work area; Sit; perform manual tasks; operate tools and other office equipment such as computer, computer peripherals and telephones; extend arms; kneel; talk and hear.
Mental Demands: The employee must be able to follow directions, collaborate with others, and handle stress.
Work Environment: The noise level in the work environment is usually minimal.
Med-Metrix will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, gender(including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, veteran status, other non-merit based factors, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Property Administrator (Accounts Receivable)
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
Property Administrator (Accounts Receivable)
BGC, Taguig | Onsite
Competitive salary package | HMO Day 1 coverage (plus free dependent)
 Why Join Us
HMO Day 1 coverage for you and your dependent
Permanent day shift – 6 AM to 3 PM, no night work or rotating shifts
Onsite role in BGC, Taguig – 4 days onsite and 1 day WFH after training in a collaborative environment
Global exposure – work with Australian property and finance teams
Career development – training provided with pathways to advance in accounting and property finance operations
Supportive culture – join a team that values accuracy, collaboration, and continuous improvement
 About the Role
The Property Administrator (Accounts Receivable) plays a key role in managing tenant billing, lease data, and receivables to ensure timely and accurate financial transactions.
This role supports our Australian property client portfolio and contributes to maintaining data integrity, accurate invoicing, and minimal aged debtor balances.
 Key Responsibilities
Manage tenant billing for rent roll (monthly and revised)
Perform lease data updates in the property management system, including contact and bank guarantee information
Handle receipting and allocation of payments (EFT and cheques) in accordance with company procedures
Prepare tenant reconciliations to assist with debt collection
Process corporate recharges, including payroll and credit card transactions
Review and process refunds, write-offs, and ad hoc invoices as required
 About You
Minimum 3 years’ experience in Accounts Receivable or Credit Management
Background in BPO or international company preferred
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficient in ERP systems and Microsoft Office Suite
Strong attention to detail, time management, and stakeholder engagement skills
Experience supporting Australian accounts or property clients is an advantage
 If you’re ready to join a collaborative and high-performing finance operations team with exposure to global property clients, apply now and be part of MA Financial Group’s growing Manila office.
 About MA Financial Group
MA Financial Group is a global alternative asset manager specialising in private credit, real estate, and hospitality. We lend to property, corporate, and specialty finance sectors and provide corporate advice.
We manage $12.7 billion¹ of assets, $155 billion in loans, and have advised on over $125 billion in transactions (as at 30 June 2025). Our team of more than 800 professionals works across Australia, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, the Philippines, and the United States.
MA Financial Group is a place of opportunity and unlimited potential — where collaboration, innovation, and growth thrive.

title: Community Mgmt. & Events Coordinator | Hybrid | Day 1 HMO
description:
Connecting Purpose Through Technology

Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

title: Pricing Specialist
company: CBRE GWS BUSINESS SUPPORT SERVICES PHILIPPINES, INC.
description:
About the Role:CBRE seeks an analytical, innovative, and driven Pricing Specialist to join the Team in Makati. This role will report to the Account Lead and provide commercial and pricing support to the Pricing & Risk Team.


What You'll Do
Review pricing and costing inputs for regional/global pursuits.
Actively communicate with country representatives for pricing and costing information inputs.
Drive and coordinate global pricing strategies on new and renewal RFPs with the support of sales and client solution and the account pricing support team to develop accurate, complete and market competitive pricing.
Understand client commercials and pricing requirements, bridge and analyze client RFP information, remain engaged throughout the RFP process with the sales and client solution teams and develop pricing assumptions key to the client proposal.
Develop sound commercial strategies aligned to client objectives and build profit and loss statement assessing deal profitability ensuring the deal meets relevant business targets.
Help reinforce and ensure proper governance procedures were in place for deal sign off.
Work with business leaders/ local SMEs/ sales and client solutions team on pricing and any other commercial related queries or issues.
Ensure accurate translation of deal economics to contract terms and handover to transition and operational teams to ensure smooth transfer of knowledge and enablement of tracking actual performance against deal terms.
Develop in-depth understanding of country specific labor costing and overhead allocations.
Be a thought leader and contribute to the overall success of the account.
Review gaps and identifies process improvement opportunities within the team.



What You'll Need:

2 - 5 years' experience on Commercial/Pricing/Contract Management preferably in the Facility Management industry
Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field preferred
Highly detail-oriented and capable of analyzing data with creative and innovation in mind
Extremely organized and methodical in your approach to work and the ability to deliver high-quality work under pressure and on time
Excellent analytical skills, able to handle high volume of data with ability to articulate complex business issues and encompass problem identification, evaluation, and resolution.
Ability to respond effectively on most sensitive issues
Ability to write report, manuals, framework, processes
Ability to make effective and persuasive presentations on complex topics to clients, top management, stakeholders.
Ability to motivate and negotiate effectively with key employees, clients, top management to take action.
Can work on APAC shift 8AM - 5PM.

Company Perks and Benefits:

Above salary market offers
Government Mandated Benefits
Work onsite setup
Paid Leaves (15 SL and 15 VL annually)
HMO with up to three free dependents
Life Insurance
Annual Performance Bonus
Annual Merit Increase
Regularization bonus (10% of Annual compensation and 13th month)



Why CBRE

When you join CBRE, you become part of the global leader in commercial real estate services and investment that helps businesses and people thrive. We are dynamic problem solvers and forward-thinking professionals who create significant impact. Our collaborative culture is built on our shared values - respect, integrity, service and excellence - and we value the diverse perspectives, backgrounds and skillsets of our people. At CBRE, you have the opportunity to chart your own course and realize your potential. We welcome all applicants.



Applicant AI Use Disclosure

We value human interaction to understand each candidate's unique experience, skills and aspirations. We do not use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to make hiring decisions, and we ask that candidates disclose any use of AI in the application and interview process.

title: Programmatic Manager /Ad Ops Manager (SSP and PMP Deals)| Work from Home
description:
Zigzag is looking for a Programmatic Manager/Ad Ops Manager to join our team! 
 About the Role
As our go-anywhere Technical Account Manager, you’ll own the full lifecycle of the client's curated-audience campaigns—from decoding client briefs into live PMP deals to mastering every layer of the tech stack (tags, pixels, SSP/DSP integrations) and continually fine-tuning performance to hit both KPIs and margin targets. Your deep expertise in leading SSPs and DSPs, combined with a big-picture understanding of the ever-evolving programmatic ecosystem, will ensure each activation launches smoothly, scales efficiently, and delivers standout results.

Key Responsibilities
• Deal Setup & Audience Build
Build audience segments in ONE (our AI platform) based on client specifications
Generate and name PMP Deal IDs automatically
Curate inventory packages aligned to target segments

Technical Configuration & QA
Implement and verify ad tags, pixels, and tracking URLs across platforms
Execute campaign QA checklists and secure internal sign-off
 Platform Deployment & Troubleshooting (SSP/DSP)
Configure, test, and troubleshoot SSP integrations and inventory feeds
Deploy deals into DSP seats and monitor for setup errors
Troubleshoot integration issues across DSPs (DV360, The Trade Desk, Amazon) and SSPs (OpenX, PubMatic, Index Exchange)
 Performance Monitoring & Optimization
Monitor live campaign metrics daily and produce performance reports
Identify under-delivery or sub-optimal win-rates and adjust bids, caps, and inventory mix accordingly
 Margin Management
Track campaign margin versus target and propose optimizations to protect profitability
 Client Escalations & Support
Serve as first-line technical support for delivery issues, escalating complex cases to Engineering
 Continuous Improvement & Knowledge Sharing
Research, document, and publish new curation and optimization techniques into the TAM Handbook
Share best practices and train peers on emerging programmatic technologies


What You Bring
At least 5+ years of hands-on Technical Account Management or Programmatic Trading experience
Deep expertise with DSPs (DV360, The Trade Desk, Amazon) and SSPs (OpenX, PubMatic, Index Exchange)
Proficiency in ad tags, pixels, tracking URLs, bid strategies, and campaign QA processes
Strong troubleshooting skills across the full programmatic ecosystem
Commercial acumen—balancing performance optimization with margin protection
Excellent communication—able to translate technical concepts for clients and cross-functional teams

Attitude & Character Profile
Passionate About Programmatic: You live and breathe programmatic media and love the craft.
Marginal Gains Mindset: Constantly hunting small performance uplifts to drive overall campaign success.
Pride in Craftsmanship: You take ownership of your work and hold yourself to high standards.
Career-Driven: You see TAM as your long-term vocation and are committed to continual growth.
Curious Troubleshooter: You take initiative, own issues end-to-end, and solve problems independently.
Get-Things-Done Mentality: You roll up your sleeves and drive tasks to completion, no matter the obstacle.
Experimental Spirit: You’re always testing new approaches and iterating based on real-world results.

ZigZag is committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We believe that talent knows no borders, and we welcome individuals from all backgrounds to help us shape the future of work. Guided by transparency and agility, we foster an environment where everyone is valued and empowered to thrive.

title: Import and Logistics Specialist
description:
About Us:
Konvy, Thailand’s largest vertical beauty conglomerate, is expanding its operations in the Philippines. We are looking for a proactive Import and Logistics Specialist to support our growing Supply Chain Team. The role is responsible for managing import documentation, coordinating with suppliers and brokers, and ensuring smooth customs clearance and timely delivery of goods. If you are detail-oriented, organized, and experienced in international trade and logistics operations, we’d love to have you on board.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Prepare, review, and organize importation documents (commercial invoices, packing lists, bill of lading/air waybill, certificate of origin, FDA permits, etc.).
Coordinate closely with customs brokers, freight forwarders, and overseas suppliers to track shipments, facilitate timely customs clearance, and resolve any import-related issues.
Monitor and update shipment status from origin to warehouse, manage delivery schedules, and work with internal teams to ensure smooth logistics flow.
Verify, record, and analyze import-related costs such as freight, duties, taxes, and brokerage fees.
Provide support in various supply chain and warehouse activities as needed.
Qualifications:
Must haves:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Customs Administration, Business Administration, or any related field.
Experience: Minimum 1 year of experience in importation, logistics coordination, or customs documentation, preferably within FMCG, retail, or trading industries.
Tools: Familiarity in Microsoft Excel and ERP/WMS systems.
Willingness to work 100% onsite at the Pasig City warehouse, with occasional field visits to warehouses, ports, or customs offices as required.
Nice to haves:
PRC-licensed Customs Broker (an advantage but not a strict requirement)
Experience in retail or trading import companies, handling suppliers from China, South Korea, and Thailand

Why Join Us:
Be a part of Thailand's largest vertical beauty conglomerate expanding to the Philippines.
Join as a pioneer member with growth opportunities.
Enjoy hybrid, flexishift, HMO, and 30 leave credits annually.
Submit your application now; successful candidates will start their journey in November 2025.

title: Facade Draftsperson (Revit) - WFH / Dayshift
salary: Up to PHP 90K + HMO and government benefits
description:
We are seeking a skilled Draftsperson to support a range of residential, commercial, and industrial projects. This role involves preparing façade details, 3D isometric views, and drafting solutions using Revit, AutoCAD, and related tools. You will collaborate closely with design and remedial teams, contribute to BIM coordination, and play an active role in improving drafting workflows. This is an excellent opportunity to join a forward-thinking consultancy and grow your expertise in technical design.
  Draft comprehensive façade details and waterproofing solutions across residential, commercial, and industrial projects.
Produce 3D isometric views for different interfaces between elements.
Utilize drafting software to create and modify drawings according to project requirements.
Create plans from photographs and site maps.
Manage internal Revit procedures.
Participate in BIM coordination meetings and provide input for clash detection.
Collaborate with the design and remedial teams to ensure timely project delivery.
Actively contribute to brainstorming sessions and discussions to identify areas for process improvement within the drafting and design workflow.
Perform other position-level duties as required.


Requirements

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in architecture, engineering, or a related field.
5+ years of drafting experience.
Proficiency in drafting software such as Revit, AutoCAD, and Bluebeam, with exposure to residential and commercial developments.
Ability to model in 3D; Rhino preferred.
Strong understanding of waterproofing systems and their integration into design.
Working knowledge of NCC, Australian Standards, and best engineering practices.
Positive, can-do attitude with a collaborative team approach.
Approachable and professional communication style.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong time management skills.
Ability to remain calm and effective in a fast-paced environment.
Passion for process improvement and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Note: The official title of this role is Facade Draftsperson.


Benefits

Why Join Twoconnect?
We offer more than just a job — we offer a supportive and rewarding career experience. Here’s what you can expect from this opportunity:
Work from home
Monday to Friday 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM or 7:00 AM - 4:00 PM PHT (adjustments will be made for AU daylight saving time
HMO with 1 free dependent and other medical reimbursements
20 annual leaves + 1 birthday leave
Work from home allowances
Government-mandated benefits
Opportunities to work with leading companies in Australia and beyond
Training programmes for career development
Engaging company outings, team activities and wellness sessions
Supportive, inclusive culture
Dedicated managers focused on your growth and success
We’re not your typical BPO — we’re a Managed Service Provider (MSP) centered on people and their success. Get the chance to work directly with leading clients in Australia, New Zealand, and now the UK as part of their team.

We offer a people-first culture where you're valued, not just counted.

title: Revit Drafter
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
Job Description

At Realcognita, we are dedicated to solving some of the most pressing challenges in building administration and empowering builders with technologically advanced tools and resources. As a partner to some of the world’s largest and most prominent residential building companies, we help them scale up, reduce costs, and deliver projects on time and within budget.
We are an experienced global team of builders, industry leaders, and professionals based in North America, Australia, the Philippines, and Singapore. Together, we are on a mission to empower visionary builders to lead the way in an ever-evolving industry.

Job Requirements

Prepare Detailed Architectural Drawings
Can use Revit and BIM workflows to produce accurate complex architectural documentation/drafts.
Interpret and produce detailed master plan, floor plans, elevations, sections, site plans, and construction details and variation orders.
Create different Revit project templates, create and develop different Revit families and model groups and detail libraries.
Used Revit to develop and produce detailed technical documentation including floor plans, elevations, sections, details, and 3D models
 
Commitment to Learning and Applying Relevant Standards
Must be committed to learning and applying both Australian Standards and U.S. Standards.
Stay up to date with changes in building codes, accessibility requirements, and drafting standards in both jurisdictions.
Ensure all plans comply with the applicable standards based on project location or client requirements.
 
Maintain High-Quality Drafting Standards
Perform self-checking of work to eliminate errors before submission.
Actively incorporate feedback from seniors, managers, and clients to refine and improve outputs.
Manage and prioritize multiple project tasks to meet deadlines and milestones
 
Collaborate with Department Teams and Stakeholders
Communicate clearly with internal teams and external stakeholders to resolve design or documentation issues.
Support the project team in meeting deadlines and ensuring all documentation aligns with client expectations and project goals.


Job Responsibilities

A bachelor/college degree in Architecture or equivalent drafting course is desirable but not mandatory.
Must have at least 1 to 3 years of working experienced using REVIT drafting programs/software.
With minimum of 6 months 1 year experience in residential drafting using REVIT.
An understanding & knowledge of NCC, Australian standard and/or US standards would be advantageous but not essential.


Job Benefits

Salary: Open (based on experience and skillsets)
Work Set-up: Onsite @ BGC Taguig
Vacation Leave/Sick Leave
Mandatory Government Benefits/13th Month Pay
Annual Appraisal
Birthday cash gift
Monthly food supplies and weekly Friday treats
HMO upon hire

description:

title: Warranty Renewal & Procurement Coordinator
description:
Job Title: Warranty Renewal & Procurement Coordinator
Company: Movate Philippines, Inc.
Location: McKinley, Taguig (On-site)
About Movate Philippines, Inc.:
Movate is a global technology services company delivering digital business support, IT operations, and customer experience solutions to clients worldwide. At Movate, we empower our teams to drive innovation, deliver operational excellence, and create exceptional client experiences.
Position Overview:
Movate is seeking a highly organized and proactive Warranty Renewal & Procurement Coordinator to join our team in McKinley, Taguig. This role is vital in ensuring seamless coordination of warranty renewals and procurement activities. You will manage the full lifecycle of warranty contracts, coordinate with vendors, and ensure timely, accurate processing of renewals and procurement requests.
Key Responsibilities:
Warranty Renewal Management
Manage assigned portfolios of warranty renewals, ensuring proactive follow-up and timely processing.
Monitor renewal schedules using internal tools and systems to avoid lapses in service coverage.
Maintain accurate documentation for all renewal actions and communications.
Vendor & Procurement Coordination
Request and secure competitive quotes from vendors, ensuring accuracy in asset and coverage details.
Work closely with the procurement team to prepare and submit quotes for internal approvals.
Negotiate pricing and terms with vendors when needed to achieve cost-effective solutions.
Client & Stakeholder Communication
Deliver approved renewal quotes and documentation to internal and external stakeholders in a timely and professional manner.
Act as a liaison between clients, internal teams, and vendors to ensure clarity and consistency throughout the renewal and procurement process.
Provide status updates and address inquiries promptly.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain, IT, or a related field.
At least 1–3 years of experience in procurement, contract management, or a related administrative function.
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple deadlines.
Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
Proficiency in MS Office tools; experience with procurement or CRM systems is a plus.

description:
DHL Global Forwarding (Philippines), Inc. is seeking a seasoned Operations Manager with expertise in Airfreight Export Operations. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of three years of leadership experience, demonstrating strong capabilities in team management and operational excellence.
Key qualifications include:
Exceptional oral and written communication skills
Proven people management and interpersonal abilities
A motivational leadership style that fosters team engagement and performance
Strong analytical, strategic thinking, and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in conflict resolution and decision-making in a dynamic environment
This role offers an exciting opportunity to lead a high-performing team within a fast-paced, global logistics organization.

Overall Role Purpose
Manage end-to-end export shipments from booking origin to delivery of cargo.
Promote continuous improvement approach to the processes striving towards operations excellence.
Develop people to their highest potential through necessary training and performance management.
Escalation point for complaints and exception handling resolution; and implementation of corrective and preventive action.
Provide high level customer relations and services and ensure compliance with DHL policies and procedures.
Build network of relationships within DHL network and suppliers.

Key Activities
Organizes, splits and plans day-to-day work of export operators and customer relations specialists.
Ensures that proper implementation of customer process has been conducted before Operations starts regular business services.
Drives Global Target Operating Model within the team to utilize tools on a day-to-day basis.
Close monitoring of shipment status from planning, booking, pick-up from customer premise, hand-over to airlines, arrival to destination.
Ensures handling of required export documents according to regulations and internal procedures.
Supports Customer Service in the incident and exception management resolution. First Escalation point of customers.
Creates, builds and maintains excellent relationships with key suppliers.
Continuously monitors supplier performance and develops improvement plan when required.
Identifies training needs and opportunities to develop a highly skilled functional department.
Creates, builds and maintains relationships with other internal functions (e.g. Destination countries, Capacity Management, Airfreight Commercial and Capacity, Sales, Customs, Cartage) and acts as subject matter expert for ad hoc operational questions with regards to accounts which are being service.
Interacts with Bureau of Customs, Global Service Center if required.
Workloads are equally distributed, and back-up are in place.
Customer SOPs must be in place and everyone within the team knows where to find it.
Use of Station Metrics, LCM and PD Analysis tools are utilized by the team.
Delivering Service Promise.
Export documentations are in compliance to the regulations.
Provide CAPA and 8D report as required by customer.
Regular supplier business/performance review conducted.

title: Regulatory Associate | Onsite | Ortigas | Night Shift

The Qualifications We Seek

Responsibilities include providing administrative support and managing communications (including calls) for international clients in the EU, US, Canada, and other regions
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data analysis tools
Highly analytical with a sharp eye for detail

ASQ or other regulatory certification

Your Daily Tasks

title: In-House Counsel (Confidential Principal)
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
We are looking for an outstanding Lawyer to take on the role of Personal Legal Counsel to a confidential UHNW Principal based in Rockwell, Makati. The position will involve providing in-house legal support for the Principal’s personal investments (including a significant local real estate holding), philanthropic endeavours, family office setup, tax planning and family law, among other personal areas. In addition, the Principal is also the owner of a local cosmetics company and his media production company has a branch office in the Philippines that often requires legal support for contracts and other matters related to high-profile Netflix TV shows and movies. None of these positions individually require full-time, in-house counsel, but combined they constitute a full-time role.
We do not mind much about number of years of experience – the salary on offer (250k PHP) applies whether there are 5 years of experience or 20. We are more than open to someone who will grow with the role. We are looking for a candidate that is hungry to make a name for themselves and jump start their career and have both a significant budget and ample opportunities for helping to enable the right person to excel. We are avoidant of someone with significant experience that is simply trying to “rest and vest”, but we are open to someone with that experience who is still driven to excel. 
The Principal has extensive experience working with lawyers in many jurisdictions and is specifically looking for someone who can strike the right balance between making things happen and ensuring he is fully protected legally. He is looking for someone with an interest in expanding in their role, always available to step up to operate as an interim executive at a company if there is a need and to assist in the hiring process of top executives.
This person should also act as a trusted adviser. For example, when it comes to contract review, rather than just nitpicking over legalese, we are looking for someone that can offer an opinion about the substance of the contract: “This contract might not make sense as a starting point, regardless of any changes we make to it” or “The terms of this agreement are not as favorable to you as they could be. We could counteroffer with an interest rate of X% and these additional terms instead.”
This is a rare opportunity for the right candidate, ideally a Bar Exam Topnotcher or among the top passers, to work directly with a business leader and gain exposure to both personal and corporate legal matters at an early stage of their career. The role offers a monthly salary of ₱250,000.
Key Responsibilities
Provide legal advice on personal, family office, tax, and business matters.
Draft, review, and negotiate contracts across commercial, vendor, and media production agreements.
Ensure compliance with governance, regulatory, and intellectual property requirements.
Conduct legal research and due diligence for investments, ventures, and private transactions.
Handle confidential and sensitive legal issues with professionalism and discretion.
Candidate Profile
Recently passed the Philippine Bar Exam (within 5 years).
Bar Exam Topnotcher or among the top passers strongly preferred.
Graduate of Ateneo, De La Salle, or UP, or another leading institution.
Strong legal research, drafting, and communication skills in English and Tagalog.
Discreet, organized, adaptable, and comfortable working in a fast paced environment.
Proactive, detail oriented, and ready to take on broad responsibilities from the start.
Strong can-do attitude, exhibiting high agency and taking full ownership of tasks.
Innovative and creative in approach, finding a way to make things happen rather than just saying what cannot be done.
Location
Rockwell, Makati City (majority on site presence required)
Salary and Benefits
₱250,000 per month. 13 months.
Annual performance bonus.
15 paid vacation leaves and 15 sick leaves.
Private healthcare
Coverage of BAR dues and training
Budget for best tech and legal tools
Free on site parking.
Full private gym and sauna/cold plunge access (one of the best gyms in the country)
Unique career development opportunity to work closely with a high profile Principal, with exposure to family office operations and hands on legal work in the cosmetics, media, and investment sectors.

title: Service Desk Engineer
description:
SERVICE DESK ENGINEER
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN SERVICE DESK ENGINEER?
The Service Desk Engineer will act as the first point of contact for technical support, providing timely and effective solutions to internal users across our US or Australian teams. This role is critical for ensuring smooth day-to-day operations and requires excellent communication skills and a customer-service-oriented mindset, honed in a global support environment.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Provide first-line technical support via phone, email, and chat, resolving IT issues related to hardware, software, and network.
Log, track, and manage incidents and service requests using an IT Service Management (ITSM) tool like Jira Service Management or Zendesk.
Escalate complex issues to L2/L3 support teams while maintaining ownership of the ticket and communication with the user.
Perform user account management (e.g., onboarding, offboarding, password resets) in Active Directory or Azure AD.
Assist with the setup, configuration, and troubleshooting of desktops, laptops, and peripheral devices.
Document solutions and contribute to the internal knowledge base.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in a Service Desk or IT Helpdesk role, preferably supporting international users in a multinational/BPO setting.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows OS, Microsoft 365 Suite, and common desktop applications.
Basic understanding of network troubleshooting (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN).
Experience with a ticketing system and familiarity with ITIL foundations is a plus.
Exceptional customer service, communication, and problem-solving skills.
Willingness to work in a 24/7 shifting schedule to support Australian business hours.

title: Partner Success Manager (Remote work - US Shift)
description:

title: Director for Marketing (Hotel & Leisure)
description:
Be Part of Something New — Director for Marketing (Pre-Opening & Operations Phase)
Makati City, Philippines — Head Office-based role overseeing the pre-opening and operations of the Batangas resort and future DMCIHomes Hotel & Leisure properties.
A new resort destination is rising in Batangas — the first of several planned condotel resorts designed to redefine what a resort experience can be. As we prepare to open our flagship property, we’re building a visionary leadership team that will shape not just one resort, but a brand that will grow across future destinations.
We’re looking for a Director for Marketing — a creative and strategic leader who can turn a destination into a brand and a brand into a must-visit experience.
Your Role
You’ll lead the full marketing journey — from concept to launch to long-term growth. In the pre-opening phase, you’ll drive the brand development process, create the resort’s identity, visual style, and tone of voice, and lead all pre-opening marketing, PR, and digital campaigns.
Once operational, you’ll manage integrated marketing efforts across digital, PR, social, and traditional channels to keep the resort top of mind and drive bookings and engagement.
Beyond the first resort, you’ll play a key role in shaping the marketing framework and brand standards for future condotel resorts under the same group.
You’ll Thrive Here If You:
Are passionate about creating and launching new brands
Have a keen sense for storytelling, design, and digital strategy
Can lead both strategy and execution — from creative direction to performance analytics
Enjoy collaborating across teams to make big ideas come to life
What You Bring
At least 10 years’ experience in marketing or communications for hotels, resorts, or lifestyle brands
Proven pre-opening experience and strong creative direction skills
Solid expertise in digital marketing, PR, and brand management
Exceptional communication and leadership abilities
If you’ve ever dreamed of shaping a new resort brand from day one — this is your moment.
Join us in building the first of many resort destinations — and help define the future of condotel hospitality.

Job Summary

The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations is responsible for providing outstanding customer service and managing accounts while providing sales support to field sales representatives. This job establishes, maintains and enhances customer service via appropriate contract administration, timely order fulfillment, and providing exemplary customer support including managing accounts and providing sales support to field sales representatives. The job is also responsible for tracking demand and backorders, complaint and incident reporting and supporting post-sales issue resolutions. The job works directly with customers to strengthen Cardinal Health’s operational performance, strengthen existing customer relationships and assists with the prospecting of new business opportunities. The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations collaborates cross functionally with Commercial, Finance, Supply Chain and Operations teams to ensure customer account needs are meet, and operational performance is optimized to enhance customer experience.

Responsibilities
Provides outstanding customer service and supports improvements in operational execution to ensure service levels are achieved and exceeded.
Manages customer account activity including, but are not limited to; customer order fulfillment, customer backorders/substitutes, product change requests, new/lost business submissions and coordinating any customer questions / issues that may arise.
Provides outsourced services to customers relating to invoicing, reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.
Collects and reviews customer feedback, complaints, recalls and product returns, working closely with Quality and Regulatory teams.
Identifies customer trends and challenges/opportunities to develop potential alternatives to support business, operational efficiency and develop new customer opportunities.
Supports process improvement initiatives, including but not limited to opportunities for optimizing inventory levels, suppliers and operational performance, cost control and profitability and ultimately customer service.
Builds strong relationships with key business stakeholders (Supply Chain, Finance, Operations, Marketing and Commercial) to work in collaborative approach for improved customer service.
Communicates with customers regarding their needs, questions, and concerns and helps trouble shoot equipment issues as necessary.
Manages cases regarding reporting, backorders, customer complaints, and pricing and processes product complaint and incident reports.
Supports general sales by analyzing account histories, and coordinating internal resources to resolve customer needs.
Investigates and reports on anomalies and discrepancies in point of sales systems, website ordering, and general customer complaint issues.
Redirects customers to applicable in-house resources as necessary.
Supports general post-sales issues resolutions as necessary.

What is expected of you and others at this level
Effectively applies knowledge of job and company policies and procedures to complete a variety of assignments
In-depth knowledge in technical or specialty area
Applies advanced skills to resolve complex problems independently
May modify process to resolve situations
Works independently within established procedures; may receive general guidance on new assignments
May provide general guidance or technical assistance to less experienced team members

title: Business Development Specialist
description:
Job Overview
The Business Development Specialist will play a pivotal role in bridging sales, marketing, and technical teams to create compelling proposals, marketing materials, and market insights. This role requires a blend of creativity, analytical thinking, and cross-functional collaboration to position our products effectively in the land-based casino, integrated resort (IR), and online gaming markets.

Key Responsibilities
1.     Sales Support & Proposal Development
-       Collaborate with the sales and marketing team to prepare customized proposals, presentations, and pitch decks for clients (casinos, IRs and online operators).
-       Ensure all proposals align with client needs, regulatory requirements, and company capabilities.
2.     Cross-Department Coordination
-       Act as a liaison between Marketing, IT, and Technical teams to gather product updates, technical specifications, and marketing assets.
-       Facilitate smooth communication between regional offices (e.g., Macau, Manila) to ensure consistent messaging.
3.     Marketing Collateral Development
-       Create and update product brochures, datasheets, demo videos, and graphics to support sales and branding efforts.
-       Work with designers and content teams to produce high-quality, engaging marketing materials.
4.     Market Research & Competitive Analysis
-       Conduct research on IRs, casinos, online gaming operators, and gaming trends in the Philippines and Southeast Asia.
-       Analyze competitor products, pricing, and marketing strategies to identify opportunities.
5.     Event & Campaign Support
-       Assist in organizing and executing events, trade shows (e.g., G2E Asia), roadshows, and showroom visits.
-       Coordinate logistics, promotional materials, and post-event follow-ups to maximize lead generation.
6.     Digital & Social Media Engagement
-       Support digital marketing efforts, including website updates, social media content, and email campaigns.
-       Monitor industry trends and leverage digital platforms to enhance brand visibility.

Qualifications
-       Education: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
･       3+ years in business development, marketing, or sales support, preferably in gaming, technology, or B2B industries.
･         Experience in market research, proposal writing, and event coordination.
･         Proficiency in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, PPT), Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop), or Canva.
･         Strong analytical skills to interpret market data and trends.
･         Excellent written and verbal communication in English (Tagalog or Mandarin is a plus).
･         Highly organized with strong project management abilities.
･         Creative thinker with an eye for design and branding.
･         Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple stakeholders.
･         A good team player, responsible and detail minded.
･         Fresh graduates are welcome.


Preferred Qualifications
-       Familiarity with gaming industry trends (land-based casinos, online gaming, IRs).
-       Strong aesthetic sense
-       Experience in event management (trade shows, product launches).
-       Knowledge of SEO, social media marketing, or CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
