title: DevOps Coordinator - Software Development | Remote
description:
Role Highlights
Fun working environment and culture
Work From Home
Fixed Day Shift schedule
5-day work week - Weekends Off
HMO package with dependent/s
Full-time, regular employment

Role Overview

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Development Operations Coordinator to join our fast-paced and collaborative development team. This critical role ensures the smooth and efficient operation of our development processes—from project inception through release and into ongoing support.
As a Development Operations Coordinator, you will help streamline workflows, improve communication across teams, and coordinate development and release schedules to help us maintain high-quality standards and productivity. If you thrive in dynamic environments, love problem-solving, and have a knack for keeping things running like a well-oiled machine, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities
Team Leadership & Day-to-Day Operations:
Oversee the daily operations of Developers, QAs, and System Analysts, ensuring smooth execution of tasks.
Provide continuous support and guidance to staff, addressing questions and queries related to ongoing projects.
Develop and monitor Quantitative and Qualitative KPIs for the team, ensuring all team members meet their individual and collective performance indicators
Monitor team workloads, manage leave schedules, and ensure an equitable distribution of tasks to maintain productivity.
Support team members through project challenges, fostering a collaborative and problem-solving environment across teams.
Facilitate and lead regular team meetings, stand-ups, and planning sessions.
Contribute to team decision-making and problem-solving initiatives.
Workflow, Project & Process Management:
Manage and prioritise project pipelines, client requests, and provide clear project status reporting to stakeholders.
Oversee and continually review ticketing system processes, ensuring efficiency and accuracy.
Coordinate all aspects of release management and deployment planning, including rollback strategies.
Support Information Security projects and ensure compliance with relevant requirements.
Assist in identifying and implementing AI and automation initiatives to enhance team productivity and efficiency.
Coordination:
Act as the primary communication bridge, fostering clear and effective dialogue between technical teams, administrative staff, product owners, and business leaders.
Facilitate daily stand-ups, planning sessions, reviews, and urgent calls as required.
Champion transparent communication across all teams to minimise gaps and ensure alignment.
Requirements
Required Qualifications
Proven experience in team coordination, operations, or similar roles within a development or technology environment.
At least 3 years of experience leading a development team
At least 5 years of experience on frontend and backend development using C#, .NET Core, MySQL, HTML, CSS, JQuery
Has strong understanding of API, MVC, Entity Framework and development standard practices
Experience working with Generative AI, Agent, MCP is a big plus
Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal.
Familiarity with development lifecycles, Agile methodologies, and CI/CD practices.
Ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.
Detail-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to identifying and solving problems.
Preferred Qualifications
Background in software development and leading dev team
Familiarity with Git, and other version control systems.
Basic understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, etc.) and deployment pipelines.
Experience working in a remote team environment.

Benefits
What's In It For You?
Permanent work-from-home
6 AM to 7 AM shift start time 
No night shifts & weekend work
Fast career growth & development with our internal promotion
Annual Pay Reviews
PHP 100,000 medical coverage for 2 dependents
Dental and optical benefits
Company-provided equipment
Virtual games, events, and lunch outs

title: Healthcare Call Center Representative
description:
What Customer Service Operations contributes to Cardinal Health

Customer Service is responsible for establishing, maintaining and enhancing customer business through contract administration, customer orders, and problem resolution.

Responsible for providing outsourced services to customers relating to medical billing, medical reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.

Job Summary

The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations is responsible for providing outstanding customer service and managing accounts while providing sales support to field sales representatives. This job establishes, maintains and enhances customer service via appropriate contract administration, timely order fulfillment, and providing exemplary customer support including managing accounts and providing sales support to field sales representatives. The job is also responsible for tracking demand and backorders, complaint and incident reporting and supporting post-sales issue resolutions. The job works directly with customers to strengthen Cardinal Health’s operational performance, strengthen existing customer relationships and assists with the prospecting of new business opportunities. The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations collaborates cross functionally with Commercial, Finance, Supply Chain and Operations teams to ensure customer account needs are meet, and operational performance is optimized to enhance customer experience.

Responsibilities
Provides outstanding customer service and supports improvements in operational execution to ensure service levels are achieved and exceeded.
Manages customer account activity including, but are not limited to; customer order fulfillment, customer backorders/substitutes, product change requests, new/lost business submissions and coordinating any customer questions / issues that may arise.
Provides outsourced services to customers relating to invoicing, reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.
Collects and reviews customer feedback, complaints, recalls and product returns, working closely with Quality and Regulatory teams.
Identifies customer trends and challenges/opportunities to develop potential alternatives to support business, operational efficiency and develop new customer opportunities.
Supports process improvement initiatives, including but not limited to opportunities for optimizing inventory levels, suppliers and operational performance, cost control and profitability and ultimately customer service.
Builds strong relationships with key business stakeholders (Supply Chain, Finance, Operations, Marketing and Commercial) to work in collaborative approach for improved customer service.
Communicates with customers regarding their needs, questions, and concerns and helps trouble shoot equipment issues as necessary.
Manages cases regarding reporting, backorders, customer complaints, and pricing and processes product complaint and incident reports.
Supports general sales by analyzing account histories, and coordinating internal resources to resolve customer needs.
Investigates and reports on anomalies and discrepancies in point of sales systems, website ordering, and general customer complaint issues.
Redirects customers to applicable in-house resources as necessary.
Supports general post-sales issues resolutions as necessary.

What is expected of you and others at this level
Effectively applies knowledge of job and company policies and procedures to complete a variety of assignments
In-depth knowledge in technical or specialty area
Applies advanced skills to resolve complex problems independently
May modify process to resolve situations
Works independently within established procedures; may receive general guidance on new assignments
May provide general guidance or technical assistance to less experienced team members

title: Auction Compliance Coordinator (US Based Client)
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time Employment
Work Setup: Onsite onboarding for two to four weeks, followed by a transition to a remote setup.
Work Schedule: Night Shift (Following U.S. Eastern Time Zone)
Location: Eastwood, Libis, Quezon City
Salary Package: 50,000 PHP to 60,000 PHP/Monthly
Position Overview:
We are seeking a detail-oriented Auction Drafts and Compliance Coordinator to ensure the seamless and compliant execution of our auction lifecycle. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for the end-to-end setup and preparation of auctions, meticulously reviewing all listings to guarantee they meet regulatory and company standards.
Your key duties will include managing auction documentation and timelines, proactively mitigating customer risks, and collaborating with internal teams to resolve issues. The ideal candidate is highly organized, possesses a strong compliance mindset, and thrives in a fast-paced, operational environment where accuracy and timeliness are paramount. You will play a critical role in maintaining the integrity of our auctions and ensuring a flawless client experience
Responsibilities
Auction Setup and Preparation: Assisting with auction setup, configuration, and troubleshooting. Coordinate the upload and management of photos, documents, and other digital assets within the compliance software platform.
Compliance Review: Maintain account manager success by ensuring customer accounts are compliant and on time and in the right phase. This includes reviewing the processes and the platforms to make sure the information is accurate and report any bugs if found. Ensure all auctions and listings comply with regulatory and company standards. Assist in preparing compliance reports and audit documentation as needed.
Team Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams to resolve client issues and optimize service delivery.
Documentation and Record Management: Maintain accurate records of auction drafts, proofs and launches in auction and ops trackers. Monitor auction timelines, deadlines, and client deliverables to ensure smooth operations.
Daily Control on Customer Risks: Maintain oversight of account statuses, addressing potential issues proactively and participating in weekly operational reviews to ensure customer satisfaction. Proactively identify opportunities to improve client experience and platform usability.
Operational Support and Special Projects: Assist in the development, implementation, and maintenance of operational processes and procedures. Provide day-to-day support to ensure smooth and efficient operations across different departments. Participate in special projects and ensure operation and customer activities comply with standards to ensure impeccable service delivery.
Job Requirements:
At least 3+ years of experience in account coordination, client support, or operations, preferably in SaaS, compliance, or auction-related industries.
Familiarity with compliance regulations (e.g., financial, legal, or asset management sectors) is a plus.
Strong technical aptitude; experience with compliance software, auction platforms, or digital asset management tools is desirable.
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with a client-focused approach.
Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
Proficiency in Zendesk, Microsoft Office Excel, and collaboration tools (e.g., Slack, Zoom).
Problem-solving mindset and ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Have a professional and reliable connection and working environment.
Experience in the auction, self-storage, real estate, or financial services industry is preferred
Experience with working in a start-up environment is highly preferred
About Intelassist
Established in 2007, Intelassist is a remote staffing organization that originated from a collaboration between US-based industry professionals and an experienced operational team in Manila, Philippines. Our US team brings over 20 years of experience in engineering, manufacturing, IT, finance, and high-level operations, while our Manila-based team offers over 15 years of experience in delivering exceptional support to global enterprises.
 Our coast-to-coast US offices, in collaboration with our dedicated employees in the Philippines, enable us to deliver results to clients in various markets and for a wide range of roles. With over 15 years of experience in the BPO industry, Intelassist places a strong emphasis on organizational resilience and social stewardship to foster lasting, meaningful partnerships within our team and with our clients.
 At the core of our business lie our people. Our ability to recruit, train, and, most importantly, retain exceptional team members is not only what enables Intelassist to attract the region’s finest talent but also what bestows stability upon our clients through reduced turnover and tangible outcomes.
 With a workforce of slightly over 1,000 employees, we strike a balance – substantial enough to possess profound insight into the Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) industry, yet intimate enough to maintain the family-like, high-energy work atmosphere that our candidates seek.
 At Intelassist, we specialize in sourcing, training, and retaining top-tier talent, each exclusively dedicated to meeting our clients’ unique needs. Our proven track record and local presence ensure that Intelassist clients enjoy increased productivity, reduced staff turnover, and significant cost savings.
What benefits await you by joining Intelassist?
Global career advancement and networking opportunities.
Access to both virtual and on-site intensive courses for career and personal development enhancement.
Monetary rewards for successful referrals that are hired.
Guaranteed weekends off and a total of 20 paid leave days upon regularization.
Collaborative work environment
Eligibility for Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) coverage starting from the first month of employment, with coverage of up to 100,000 PHP per illness.

WHY INTELASSIST?
We grow together. We value your effort. We aim to empower you.

title: Specialist, Payroll (US)
company: Boehringer Ingelheim Business Services Philippines, Inc.
description:
In this role, you will be responsible for processing payroll transactions in alignment with company policies and procedures. You will monitor the Payroll Service Mailbox to ensure timely and accurate entry of payments and deductions into the payroll or vendor system. Your responsibilities also include conducting audits and data analysis, issuing final pay, addressing employee inquiries, and maintaining payroll records. Additionally, you will handle off-cycle payments when needed and provide backup support to the payroll team. Join us and bring your payroll expertise to where it matters most!

Process payroll inputs according to payroll schedule and checklists.
Process semi-monthly and/or biweekly payrolls according to country schedule and checklists and general ledger postings.
Handle final pay calculations and pay adjustments (off cycles) as needed/ requested.
Banking activities / TIS: including communication with bank re: receipt of direct deposit file, positive pay upload for checks and daily banking activities for rejects, incorrect account numbers or stop payments.
Provide backup support for fellow Payroll team members.
Manage MyServices and Payroll mailbox.  Includes responding to employee inquires and business/cross functional partner inquiries.
Work directly with HR Direct and Employee Central in resolving payroll issues (simple-moderate).
Year end uploads, testing and reconciliations processes.
About our Future Employee
This role requires strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Academic degree in business or equivalent
3+ years US payroll processing experience performing all functions of end to end payroll
Experience with payroll software platforms such as SAP HR, ECP (Employee Central Payroll), and MyServices ticketing system is preferred
Proficiency with Excel and other Microsoft Office programs is required
Licensure or certification: CPP or FPC preferred

Ability to work independently with excellent time management skills
Excellent problem solving skills along with keen attention to details
Strong written/verbal communication, interpersonal and relationship building skills
Strong client relationship skills
Amenable to work night shift

title: Data Scientist - Conversational AI
description:
Do you have a passion for data, AI, and creating smarter solutions?
Were looking for a Conversational AI Data Scientist who can design, train, and optimize AI-driven systems that make interactions more human-like, impactful, and seamless.
Role Overview:
We are seeking a Data Scientist to serve as our "proof of value" champion - turning our AI capabilities into demonstrable business outcomes. In this role, you will work closely with our product, engineering, and client success teams to design and execute experiments that demonstrate the measurable benefits of our software for call center agents and clients. You will become an expert in our data pipeline, understand the data we collect, identify gaps, and help define what additional data is needed to prove product value.
What Youll Do:
Core Analytics & Experimentation (60%)
- Design and execute rigorous experiments (A/B tests, pre/post analyses, causal inference studies) to quantify the impact of ProtoCall AI on agent performance, customer satisfaction, and business KPIs.
- Analyze experimental and operational data using advanced statistical methods to draw actionable insights.
- Develop and maintain key metrics that demonstrate product value to clients and internal stakeholders.
- Create predictive models to identify which clients will benefit most from specific features.
Data Infrastructure & Pipeline (20%)
- Master our data pipeline, understanding streaming call data, real-time metrics, and agent interaction patterns.
- Identify data gaps and collaborate with engineering to improve data collection and instrumentation.
- Ensure compliance with data governance and privacy requirements for sensitive call recordings.
- Write complex SQL queries to extract insights from our multi-tenant data warehouse.
Stakeholder Communication & Impact (20%)
- Build executive-ready dashboards and automated reporting for the client success team
- Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences
- Create client-facing analytics reports that clearly demonstrate ROI
- Work with AI engineering to define model performance metrics and create feedback loops for continuous improvement
Preferred Skills:
Experience with streaming data and real-time analytics systems
Familiarity with call center operations, customer service workflows, or conversational AI
Knowledge of cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience with experimentation platforms (Optimizely, Split.io, or similar)
Background in B2B SaaS analytics and client success metrics
JavaScript experience for building custom analytics dashboards
Experience with data privacy regulations and compliance

title: Project Lead
description:
Job Responsibilities
Leads and manages the end-to-end execution of project management deliverables according to the CBSP Delivery Model for Projects and Transitions.

title: Analyst, People Systems

location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
The Analyst, People Systems will provide support in the delivery of People Systems function and be responsible for implementing and maintaining the Human Resource information systems of the Firm.
Main responsibilities: 
Design all custom ad hoc reports, resolve all queries, ensure accuracy, prepare all business documents, provide upgrades if required and monitor HRIS systems, and maintain the integrity of all data
Design and maintain all codes and tables, and prepare reports for all HR systems and applications, and analyze systems to resolve all issues and escalate all customer issues to management to provide efficient resolution
Prepare all high-quality documents for all system configurations and processes, prepare required course materials for all employees, and analyze customer requirements to prepare required dashboards and metrics

Analyze all human resource data, recommend appropriate solutions to all production issues, analyze all data according to IT specifications, and participate in all system tests to ensure compatibility of production design with functional design
Manage and provide responses to all HRIS issues and ensure compliance with the timeframe, provide efficient feedback to all system enhancements, and provide training for all annual system processes

Establish and maintain working relationships with peers in HR at Corporate and in all Businesses, especially the BPOs (Business Process Owners)
Assist Local Talent Management staff in identifying and resolving problems by providing analysis and troubleshooting of configuration or data issues
Accountable for the successful completion of assigned HRIS project tasks and ongoing responsibilities. Measurable factors include adherence to set timelines, achievement of work activities, and successfully identifying system and data issues, and client/user satisfaction
Ensure the availability of accurate and timely HRIS information from SAP by developing and deploying user communications, data audit reports, data correction procedures, and standard reports from all platforms and tools
Keep People Systems leadership informed as to the status of all ongoing responsibilities and project functions
Maintain a proactive customer focus. Quickly develop proficiency using HR’s systems and leverage this proficiency to guide users on best practices
Demonstrate the ongoing ability and willingness to track down answers to users’ questions and foster their understanding of systems and tools to make them more efficient and effective in their roles
Perform other duties as assigned
Skills and experience: 
A bachelor's degree in HR or Information Management with some relevant experience in HRIS/IS, or equivalent experience
Strong math/analytical aptitude and strong skills in data mining, manipulation, and analysis
Strong computer skills; proficient in Microsoft Excel (with extensive experience in and knowledge of formulas and functions, VLOOKUP, pivot tables, and charts)
Able to work independently as well as work in a collaborative team environment and take direction from senior departmental staff
Able to troubleshoot technical problems and make recommendations on appropriate solutions
Strong project management, organization, and prioritization skills with the ability to handle multiple projects and shift priorities
Able to handle sensitive matters and maintain confidentiality
Able to work well in a demanding and fast-paced environment
Effective communicator, good written and oral communication
Strong customer service skills and ability to deal courteously/effectively with others

title: Accountant
description:
JCC Asia Back Office Inc. is seeking a highly motivated individual with proven mid-level accounting capabilities to fulfil the above new role based in Makati, Philippines. The role will support the existing team within our Finance department and the Atlas Board in delivering on its Company objectives through ongoing effective oversight and management of the day-to-day operations of JCC Asia Back Office Inc.
1. Support the Director Finance Services in the daily management and processes of the organisation.
2. Providing financial information to the CEO via the Director of Finance by researching and analysing accounting data; preparing reports.
3. Preparing invoices, perform bookkeeping, and generate financial reports for a diverse portfolio of clients' services by an Australian bookkeeping firm, including but not limited to corporate, small business, and individual accounts.

4. Prepares payments by verifying documentation and requesting disbursements.
5. Documents financial transactions by entering account information.
6. Recommends financial actions to the Director Finance by analysing accounting options.
7. Substantiates financial transactions by auditing documents.
8. Maintains accounting controls by preparing and recommending policies and procedures.
9. Reconciles financial discrepancies by collecting and analysing account information.
10. Maintains financial security by following internal policy controls.
11. Prepares special financial reports by collecting, analysing, and summarizing account information and trends.
12. Maintains customer confidence and protects operations by keeping financial information confidential.
Successful candidates must demonstrate the following key selection criteria:
- Knowledge in generally accepted accounting practices and principles.
- Competent English communication skills (verbal & written) with strong interpersonal skills.
- Willing and able to learn the use of industry specific software and operating systems.
- Competent computer skills - familiarity with Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel.
- Ability to multi-task, manage time and the ability to prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.
- Accuracy and attention to detail.
- Aptitude for numbers and quantitative skills.
- Able to demonstrate a good work ethic by being loyal and punctual.
- Ability to work independently in a team environment.
- Willingness to work within the Australian (Victorian) Public Holiday calendar.
- Bachelor's Degree or College Degree in appropriate financial / accounting field of study.
- Candidates living far distances (1.5 hours or more travel time) from Makati will be required to relocate closer to the office, with generous relocation allowance payable monthly by the company.

Schedule – 8.00 am – 5.00 pm Mon-Fri
Reporting to – Director of Finance

title: SME - HR Operations (Mobility)
description:
About the Team
The Global Mobility Team is the ultimate cross-functional team. Every day we work with key stakeholders across the organization to ensure we are able to bring the best talent into different locations. We also liaise with our immigration, tax and relocation vendor to ensure they are meeting their SLAs and that each case is handled with the care and consistency in line with our policies. We focus on guiding our employees as they navigate moving themselves and their families across borders in the most efficient and compliant way.

What You’ll Do
Provide immigration support to employees, consultation to managers, and case management in connection with external immigration vendor.
Work closely with HR teams in EMEA, APAC, and AMER to effectively coordinate all aspects of employment sponsored immigration applications.
Run regular reports from our internal HRIS system to track visa expiration dates across all global regions.
Manage end to end immigration process for global new hires and visa renewals.
Serve as primary point of contact for employees regarding all immigration renewal matters, proactively communicate updates with internal stakeholders, and resolve issues in a timely and sensitive manner.
Coordinate with our external vendor to initiate new immigration cases as appropriate.
Ensure compliance for leavers so that our external vendor can report cancellations to authorities.
Ensures any exceptions to the global immigration policy can be looked at and reviewed.
Monitor our email and ticketing system and triage incoming queries.
Review and audit immigration compliance documents.
Assist in the development and implementation of company policies and procedures.
May perform other duties as assigned including special projects and other Global Mobility administrative responsibilities.

What You’ll Need
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience,
At least 2+ years of global immigration work experience, ideally in-house or consultancy
Knowledge of US immigration processes and matters is a plus
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Project management knowledge
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint would be an asset
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and a team player mindset
Fluent written and verbal English

title: HR Generalist
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
Job Description:
1. Developing HR policies: responsible for creating, reviewing and updating HR policies and procedures to ensure they comply with legal requirements and meet the needs of the organization and its employees.
2. Communicating policies: must effectively communicate HR policies and procedures to employees, ensuring they understand the policies and their importance. This may involve developing training materials, conduct training sessions, and providing guidance and support to managers.
3. Ensuring compliance: responsible for ensuring that the organization is in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations related to HR policies and practices. Must stay up-to-date on changes to laws and regulations and make updates to policies and procedures as needed.
4. Implementing policies: Must ensure that policies and procedures are effectively implemented across the organization. This may involve working closely with managers to ensure they understand and follow policies, as well as monitoring compliance and addressing any issues that arise.
5. Evaluating policies: Must regularly evaluate the effectiveness of HR policies and procedures and make recommendations for improvements as needed. This may involve gathering feedback from employees, reviewing HR metrics.
Qualifications:
Graduate of Bachelor's degree in Human Resource or any related field.
1-3 years of experience in HR or related field.
Strong knowledge of HR policies and procedures, employment law, and compliance regulations.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong organizational and time-management skills.
Proficient in Microsoft office and HR software applications.
Willing to work onsite, 5 days a week, Monday to Friday and holidays.
Willing to work in Makati City

Our client is a leading global marketplace for environmental commodities and energy solutions. Through advanced technology, they connect companies, developers, and investors to accelerate the transition to a clean energy economy. Their innovative systems bring transparency, efficiency, and trust to the renewable energy markets worldwide.

Job Description

Be part of our client's team as a Client Success - Renewables Specialist, managing client services and onboarding new clients/assets to ensure accurate payments through company systems. Collaborate cross-functionally to deliver timely, error-free results while translating complex data into clear insights. Strong communication and precision are key to success.

Job Overview

Employment Type: Full-time
Shift: Night Shift, Consecutive Off
Work Setup: Onsite, Makati

Exciting Perks Await!
Day 1 HMO coverage with free dependent
Competitive Salary Package
Night differential pay to maximize your earnings
Prime office location in Makati (easy access to MRT stations, restaurants, and banks)
Salary Advance Program through our banking partner (Eligibility and approval subject to bank assessment. Available to account holders with minimum of 6 months company tenure.)
Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses
(Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives
Standard government and Emapta benefits
20 annual leaves (5 convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek
Exceptional attention to detail.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and PDF programs.
Excellent written communication skills and a client-friendly demeanor.
High School Diploma or equivalent certification.
Availability to work 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM in the client's time zone.
Preferred Skills:
1-3 years of experience in a high-volume client service environment.
Experience using Salesforce or other CRM systems.
Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage ad hoc responsibilities.
Bachelor's degree preferred.
Your Daily Tasks
Develop knowledge and understanding of SREC, REC, AEC, and other renewable energy markets for one or more of the following: District of Columbia, Delaware, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia, and other future states.
Learn the complex state solar and renewable energy certification rules and procedures.
Understand how Managed Solutions provides services to system owners (clients) and solar installers/project developers (partners) within each state's market framework.
Process incoming renewable energy project applications accurately and in a timely manner.
Review application materials and correspond with clients and partners via email for any outstanding information.
Assist in the state certification process of solar and other renewable systems to ensure participation in renewable energy programs.
Coordinate the registration of state-certified systems in the appropriate tracking registries.
Provide prompt, accurate, and excellent daily client service via email.
Assist in the new client onboarding process, including describing the application process and the company's services.
Facilitate client understanding and usage of online accounts.
Provide solutions to client and partner inquiries related to applications, account creation, account status, and transactions.
Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: TEAM LEAD - Financial Statement Reporting - Open for non-CPAs
company: CITCO INTERNATIONAL SUPPORT SERVICES LIMITED-PHILIPPINE ROHQ
description:
About Citco
The Citco group of companies (Citco) is a network of independent companies worldwide for over 70 years, all of which are leading providers of asset-servicing solutions to the global alternative investment industry. With $1.8+ trillion in AuA and operations across 36 countries with over 50 office locations.
For decades, industry publications have recognized our leadership in service and innovation. These accolades are a reflection of our drive to push ourselves and our industry forward.
With strategically positioned global offices ,we offer opportunities for graduates and seasoned professionals to work across the world. Careers at Citco can span continents.
For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com.     

About the Team & Business Line: 
Fund Administration is Citco’s core business, and our alternative asset and accounting service is one of the industry’s most respected. Our continuous investment in learning and technology solutions means our people are equipped to deliver a seamless client experience. 
As a core member of our Financial Reporting team, you will be working with some of the industry’s most accomplished professionals to deliver award-winning services for complex fund structures that our clients can depend upon. 

We offer: 
A challenging job in an international company. There is the opportunity to expand your business knowledge with excellent prospects for a further international career in one of our worldwide offices. We also offer a competitive benefits package, a minimum of 3 weeks’ vacation and a generous compensation package. 
The person will completely have a freedom to speak out and contribute and get acknowledged new ideas for. It could be with the work process, improvement, team collaboration, etc.
Opportunity to work with global systems, customers from throughout the Philippines and colleagues from different sites/regions/countries. Employees in general have the opportunity to shape their own career by achieving expertise and learning on the job.

Purpose
Manage the preparation and coordination of financial statement reporting in compliance with U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS). Effectively manage client and auditor relationships throughout engagements.

Main Job Functions/Responsibilities
Under limited supervision, prepare and review annual, semi-annual and quarterly financial statements in accordance with GAAP or IFRS, as required.
Lead assigned engagements including planning, budgeting, and client relationship management and delegating to staff.  Monitor and report out-of-scope time.
Ensure accuracy of footnote disclosures in accordance with accounting, reporting, and regulatory standards. Review legal documents governing the fund to ensure appropriate financial statement disclosure structure.
Present to or exchange information internally, with clients and outside auditors.  Coordinate year-end financial statement process. Contribute to identifying, researching, and communicating recent authoritative pronouncements to CFS offices globally.
Identify errors or problems and independently investigate; recommend solutions to team members or managers.
Writing and/or reviewing various reports related to engagements.  Prepare adhoc reports for the client upon request.  Troubleshoot Fund Accounting issues.  Attend meetings and training to enhance knowledge to be passed down to the Financial Reporting Staff and Senior Accountants.
Recognize and communicate potential opportunities for new clients as well as value added service enhancements for existing clients and management. Assist manager in preparing Request for Proposals for prospective clients.
Provide guidance to team members to motivate and help strengthen specific knowledge areas needed to accomplish team goals.

Education, Qualifications and Experience
Must be CPA.
Concrete experience on US GAAP, IFRS, Asset Management, Hedge Fund, Financial Reporting in a Supervisory/Assistant Manager capacity
At least 4+ years of working experience in either an Audit Firm, Hedge Fund, Hedge Fund Administrator or other financial institution where the accountant has gained financial products knowledge.
At least 1+ years of experience in handling/managing a team.
Previous Financial Statement review and/or preparation experience
Advanced knowledge in complex derivatives
Good communication and writing skills.
Proficient in using Microsoft Office Excel.
Amenable to work in our Makati Office (OneAyala) or Alabang (Northgate Cyber Zone)
Amenable to work in a Hybrid set up (2 days' onsite)
Amenable to work on shifting schedules (AM or Mid-shift)

Our Benefits
Your well-being is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location. 
We embrace diversity, prioritizing the hiring of people from diverse backgrounds. Our inclusive culture is a source of pride and strength, fostering innovation and mutual respect.
Citco welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection.

Reminders
Please be informed that we are in the midst of processing the applications and shall get in touch with you again if you are selected/shortlisted for an interview. 
Please check your e-mail regularly for any correspondence regarding the status of your application.

title: Site Administration Supervisor
description:
Job Summary:
Responsible for providing administrative support to the assigned project. He is required to collaborate with different departments and help the Operations team to run the projects smoothly by performing assigned tasks. Prepares documents at each stage of the project's schedule and checks the quality of the construction work to produce reports. Site administrators must also supervise adherence to operations and safety regulations.

Key Responsibilities:
1. Facilities Management
Responsible for the implementation of a facility management program which includes preventive maintenance and the development of a safe and work environment to provide support to the operations continuously;
Supervise maintenance and repair of facilities and equipment;
Plan and manage facility services such as visitor management, housekeeping, reception, and waste management.
Provide prompt responses to requests and issues from the operations;
Ensure that all company general utility expenses are controlled and monitored properly.
Responsible for the overall control of site administrative support such as visitor accommodation, staff house management, etc.

2. Property and Asset Management
Ensure that all property and company assets are properly accounted for and controlled.
Ensure that all company properties are in good working condition and that they serve their purpose and use.

3. Site Admin Supply and Consumable Management
Ensure the completeness of all supplies needed by Site Operations and Administration.
Ensure that all supplies are properly accounted for and utilized.
Coordinate with the head office to procure, purchase, and replenish supplies and materials.

4. Local Compliances
Ensure the timely application, submission, and renewal of all permits and licenses.
Keep and update the list of Legal and Regulatory requirements

5. Environment, Health and Safety
Duly appointed as Safety Officer of the company
Responsible for the implementation of the Environment, Health, and Safety Program of the company;
Act as the company’s representative to government audits and inspections related to EHS compliances;
Responsible for the monitoring and maintenance of EHS legal and regulatory requirements;
6. Security Management
Responsible for the overall control and management of the company’s security personnel;
Develop and enforce security policies to ensure the safety of employees and visitors and the protection of the company’s physical assets against theft or damage.
Closely coordinate with the security agency to conduct regular security assessments for the continuous improvement of security measures and programs.
7. Others
Timekeeping
Employee Records Administration

Qualifications
Graduate of any related course
With a minimum of 5 years of work experience in Site Administration preferably in Power Plant or Construction
Above-average communication skills, both oral and written.
Must have completed the Basic Safety training courses.
Highly organized, results-driven, ability to handle multiple tasks and adhere to deadlines
Accommodation and Meals will be provided
Work location: Fort Bonifacio (Temporary) and Polillo Group of Island, Quezon Province.

title: Remote Assistant (Permanent Work from Home Set Up)
description:
Job Role: Cyberbacker

Join Cyberbacker – Build Strong Relationships, Elevate Your Career!

About Cyberbacker:
Cyberbacker bridges the gap between time and money, creating opportunities for both clients and virtual professionals to achieve success. Our clients partner with world-class Cyberbackers at competitive rates, while Cyberbackers gain clients who help them earn and save more than ever before.

We’re more than a service provider—we’re a support system that keeps businesses thriving. By offering guidance, tools, and fair practices, we build mutually beneficial relationships that empower clients and Cyberbackers to succeed together.

At Cyberbacker, we believe in fairness. Underpaid, overworked virtual assistants and clients who overpay for subpar service are problems we strive to eliminate. Instead, we focus on uniting entrepreneurs and Cyberbackers to achieve shared success.

Why Cyberbacker?
At the core of Cyberbacker is a commitment to relationships. By nurturing meaningful partnerships, we empower our team and clients to deliver exceptional results.

As a Cyberbacker, you will:
Transcription: Capturing key points during live or recorded calls.
Call Preparation: Organizing daily call lists and agendas to ensure seamless client interactions.
Schedule Coordination: Managing meeting schedules, including adjustments, cancellations, and time zone considerations.
Report Management: Compiling insightful reports on key metrics and performance indicators.
Virtual File Management: Keeping virtual files organized and accessible.
Administrative Support: Managing email correspondence, calendar appointments, and other operational tasks efficiently.

What You Bring:
Relationship Skills: A natural ability to connect, collaborate, and foster trust.
Work Ethic: A proactive attitude, strong organizational skills, and the ability to work independently.
Technical Setup:
Intel Core i3 (6th-12th gen), i5, i7, or AMD equivalent.
8GB RAM, 60GB free hard disk space.
Windows or Mac operating system.
10 Mbps DSL/Fiber Internet connection (signal-based or wireless not allowed).

Why Join Cyberbacker?
Benefits That Care for You:
Medical Assistance Program: Includes dental, vision, maternity, burial assistance, and dependent coverage for tenured Cyberbackers.
Gift & Rewards Program: Celebrate milestones like birthdays, work anniversaries, and personal achievements with thoughtful gifts.
Life Insurance for tenured Cyberbackers
Career Growth Opportunities:
Promotions to headbacker or leadership roles with leadership training, domestic and international travel, and speaking opportunities.
Over 100 exclusive complimentary classes monthly, conducted by experienced team members.
Counter Work-Life Balance:
Paid time off (PTO) credits, paid holidays, and permanent work-from-home setup.
Foodpanda discounts and exciting contests with prizes.
Financial Security:
Profit Share Program: lets you earn a share of the company’s success. After five years, it becomes a retirement plan, providing monthly payments even after you leave—a lasting reward for your commitment.
Cybercapital: Loans for home or car purchases at competitive rates.
Community Rewards and Recognition:
Access to a supportive community on multiple channels.
Exclusive invite to in-person events
Travel opportunities for top performers, weekly meetings with company leadership, and a virtual year-end party.
Job Security & Training:
Assurance of service fees for completed work, even if clients default.
Paid training and access to the Transition Hub for Cyberbackers needing temporary workspaces.
How to Apply:
Complete our online application form and Values Assessment
Attend your initial interview, where we’ll discuss how you can make a meaningful impact.

Let’s Build Relationships That Last!
Take the first step toward a fulfilling career with Cyberbacker. Join a team that values you and empowers you to thrive. Apply now!

title: E-Commerce Operations Supervisor (Lazada, Shopee, Tiktok, Shopify)
description:
We are looking for a skilled and detail-oriented E-commerce Operations Specialist to join our e-commerce team. The E-commerce Operations Specialist will play a vital role in ensuring smooth and efficient e-commerce operations, optimizing the online shopping experience, and contributing to the overall success of our digital retail platform.
Responsibilities:
A.      Order Management:
-          Monitor and manage online orders, ensuring timely processing, shipping, and delivery to customers.
-          Collaborate with the warehouse and fulfillment teams to maintain accurate inventory levels and manage order fulfillment efficiently.
-          Address and resolve any order-related issues or customer inquiries promptly and professionally.
 B.      Product Catalog Management:
-          Update and maintain the product catalog on the e-commerce platform, including product descriptions, images, pricing, and availability.
-          Ensure that product information is accurate, up-to-date, and presented in an engaging manner to drive sales and conversions.
 C.       Digital Storefront Maintenance:
-          Work closely with the web development and design teams to oversee website/storefront updates, ensuring a seamless user experience and adherence to brand guidelines
-          Conduct regular audits to identify and fix any website issues, such as broken links or loading errors.
 D.      Analytics and Reporting:
-          Monitor and analyze key performance metrics, such as website traffic, conversion rates, and sales figures.
-          Generate regular reports on e-commerce performance and present actionable insights to optimize operations and drive business growth.
 E.       E-commerce Platform Maintenance:
-          Collaborate with the IT team and e-commerce platform providers to maintain the platform's functionality, security, and performance.
-          Stay updated with the latest e-commerce trends and technologies to propose enhancements to the existing platform.

Requirements:
·       Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, E-commerce, or a related field.
·       At least 1-year experience in e-commerce operations, preferably within a retail or online sales environment.
·       Strong understanding of e-commerce platforms, order management systems, and inventory management tools.
·       Excellent organizational and multitasking skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
·       Detail-oriented mindset and a commitment to maintaining high-quality standards.
·       Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills for effective customer interactions.
·       Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools to derive insights for decision-making.
·       Knowledge of online payment processing systems and security measures.
·       Familiarity with SEO and web analytics to optimize website performance (preferred but not required).
·       Join our dynamic team and contribute your expertise to the exciting world of e-commerce. If you are passionate about delivering a seamless online shopping experience and driving customer satisfaction, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Patient Care Coordinator
description:
Company Overview:
We are a company built on trust and loyalty. MBVA 24/7 started in 2018 and has continuously fostered skilled and talented Virtual Assistants for many clients. Our team of virtual assistants provides services all over the US, and we sure won’t be stopping there! Our main office is located in Arizona and Manila. We have a legion of virtual assistants all over the Philippines who work directly with our clients. 
Our clientele ranges from doctor's offices to publishing companies. We make sure that our Virtual Assistants get all the training they need for a seamless partnership with our clients. MBVA 24/7 is committed to providing only the best to our partners.
We are here for you. Our purpose is to help you in succeeding in the medical and business virtual world and we won’t stop until you get there!
Position Overview:
The Patient Accounts Coordinator plays a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of the billing, collections, and patient account management processes. This position requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and a customer service-oriented mindset to address patient inquiries, resolve billing discrepancies, and maintain compliance with healthcare regulations.
Job Responsibilities:
Review daily reports of pending patient statements for accuracy.
Communicate directly with front office staff to resolve discrepancies
Answer incoming patient calls through a designated extension line.
Review and listen to voicemails on the ext. line.
Return patient calls within 24 hours, excluding weekends.

title: Dialler Analyst - W/ SQL & Data visualization tools experience
description:
CreditCorp Inc. Australia’s leading provider of responsible financial services in the credit-impaired consumer segment is currently looking for Dialler Analyst (12-month project-based) to join our rapidly growing Company that spans across Australia, New Zealand, USA and Philippines. This role shall support our US line of business under Credit Corp Solutions.
 Be part of Team Philippines today and pioneer in this region
As a Dialler Analyst your primary role is to maximize performance of dialler campaigns by analysing data trends, creating and managing dialler campaigns, create reporting to support analysis, daily reporting.  Maintain a detailed understanding of Credit Corp’s contact strategy and work with senior operational leaders to successfully deliver on an agreed program. 

Your goal & role in a nutshell:
Create, update, assess, troubleshoot, problem solve, collaborate and improve dialler campaign account selections using SQL, including table joins, CTEs, and stored procedures 
Complete end to end testing for any new campaign builds
Maximise dialler contact attempts within the constraints of compliance limits
Assist in maintaining compliance controls through account selection and digital campaign strategy
Review digital campaigns and log any issues or opportunities for improvement
Identify and document issues and opportunities within digital campaigns that will lead to improvements in asset performance, operational performance, productivity, efficiency or effectiveness through business or process improvement
Configure, monitor, and optimize outbound and blended dialler campaigns (e.g., predictive, preview, progressive).
Maintain dialler lists, rules, filters, pacing, and call routing logic.
Monitor real-time dialler performance and proactively resolve issues to ensure minimal downtime.
Analyze campaign data and dialler metrics to provide actionable insights and performance reports.
Collaborate with operations, compliance, IT, and workforce planning teams to align dialling strategies with business objectives.
Ensure all dialler activities comply with regulatory requirements
Manage and maintain Do Not Call (DNC) lists and suppression files.
Identify and escalate system issues to vendors or IT support as needed.
Test and implement new dialler features or updates in coordination with vendors.
Provide end-user training and support on dialler functionalities.
Continually enhance the accuracy and relevance of the campaign reporting provided to the business 
Provide relevant insights to business leaders relating to campaign effectiveness 

What are we looking for?
Advanced SQL capability 
Proficient in Tableau or other relevant experience in creating graphs & visualising data
Advanced computer and internet skills
Ability to work with minimal supervision and produce quality and timely results 
Numerate with the ability to interpret large quantities of performance data 
Exceptional time management and organisational skills 
Lateral thinking and superior problem solving skills 
Exceptional attention to detail 
Sound written and literacy skills 
Good command in English in both oral and written communication

What's in it for you?
20% Night differential 
Regular PH and US holidays observed
Competitive salary package, incentives with yearly performance appraisals
Free self-development training and career pathways
Retirement package for your future
Free life insurance on day 1 (Be insured while working at Credit Corp).
HMO coverage on day 1 plus free dependents upon tenure.
Free fresh fruits weekly.
Free meals
Awarding ceremonies (Get recognized and rewarded for your hard work even on your first few months with us).
Exciting Company events. 
Work-life balance in a culture-friendly environment

Very easy access to:
EDSA main road from Ayala Makati.
Just next to One Ayala public transportation terminal
Ayala Malls department stores, restaurants & supermarkets
MRT Ayala train station

Everything is very accessible!
 If you have these particular set of skills, then we’d love to hear from you. Make it happen! Join us today and experience the Credit Corp difference.

title: HR Executive (Recruitment)
description:
We are seeking a full-time HR Executive (Recruitment) based in the Philippines to support our Singapore HR team. This role focuses recruitment activities and general HR support. You will manage end-to-end hiring processes, partner with Singapore hiring managers, and contribute to HR operations, onboarding, and employee engagement initiatives. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proactive, and willing to travel to Singapore for a 6-month on-site assignment to gain hands-on regional experience and strengthen collaboration with the team.
Key Responsibilities
Recruitment
• Partner with Singapore hiring managers to plan and execute recruitment strategies.
• Manage end-to-end recruitment, including job postings, sourcing, screening,
interviews, offers, and pre-employment coordination.
• Conduct proactive sourcing and talent mapping through online platforms and
professional networks.
• Maintain accurate recruitment records, data, and reports for tracking and analytics.
• Support employer branding initiatives and recruitment campaigns across Asia.
• Coordinate onboarding processes and ensure a seamless candidate experience.
General HR Support
• Assist in HR administration, maintaining employee records and HR databases.
• Support engagement programs, HR projects, and process improvements.
• Coordinate training logistics and performance review activities.
• Contribute to HR reporting and project coordination with the Singapore team.
Key Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
• 2–4 years of recruitment experience, preferably in in-house or shared services roles supporting regional operations.
• Familiarity with Singapore employment practices is advantageous.
• Proficient in Microsoft Office; experience with HRIS/ATS systems is preferred.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills; organised, adaptable, and able to work independently across time zones.
• Willing to travel to Singapore for up to 6 months as part of the role.

title: Senior Bookkeeper (US based Client) | WFH
description:
EOR: One Workforce Global
Employment Type: Full-Time Employment
Work Setup: Onsite onboarding for 1-2 days, followed by a transition to a remote setup.
Work schedule: Night Shift (Following Pacific Time Zone)
Salary Package: 50,000 PHP to 80,000 PHP/Monthly
The Role:
Our client is looking for a Senior Bookkeeper who will maintain accurate financial records, process transactions, and support financial reporting.
Essential Functions:
Record daily financial transactions including purchases, receipts, payments and journal entries
Record and track company fixed assets, additions and disposals
Reconcile inventory balances and work with operations to maintain accuracy
Ensure purchases and receipts are categorized in correct GL accounts to support the budget
Review expense reports for accuracy and compliance
Track status of purchase orders, AP invoices and expense reports to ensure timely processing
Full cycle accounts receivable: create and send accurate invoices to customers, post payments, monitor accounts for non-payments, send reminders on past due balances.
Full cycle accounts payable: receive, verify and enter bills, schedule timely payment of bills, reconcile statements, file bills in online storage such as Bill.com, Google, One Drive, prepare annual 1099s
Verify contracts, orders, and vouchers, and prepare reports to substantiate individual transactions before settlement
Perform reconciliations on monthly bank, merchant, digital wallets, peer-to-peer payment services and credit card accounts. Investigate outstanding transactions
Record prepaid expenses, amortize transactions and maintain monthly reconciliation schedules
Record accrued expenses, amortize transactions and maintain monthly reconciliation schedules
Record routine journal entries
Provide support for audits by external entities, prepare supporting schedules, gather information, and provide analysis as requested
Ability to work independently without receiving a list of daily tasks
Detail and customer focus oriented
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to respond to emails about accounts payable and accounts receivable
Participate in special projects and complete ad hoc tasks and research
Qualifications: 
A Bachelor’s degree in the related field is preferred 
5+ years of full charge bookkeeper/staff accountant experience including account reconciliation and work paper preparation experience
Experience with QuickBooks, QuickBooks Online, and NetSuite is a plus.  
Experience with Bill.com is plus
Intermediate Excel skills  
Excellent attention to detail  
Experience in a multi-client environment 
Strong organization, oral and written communication skills 
Aptitude in data management, analytics, reporting preparation 
Ability to function in an autonomous environment—independent worker, self-directed 
About Intelassist
Established in 2007, Intelassist is a remote staffing organization that originated from a collaboration between US-based industry professionals and an experienced operational team in Manila, Philippines. Our US team brings over 20 years of experience in engineering, manufacturing, IT, finance, and high-level operations, while our Manila-based team offers over 15 years of experience in delivering exceptional support to global enterprises.
Our coast-to-coast US offices, in collaboration with our dedicated employees in the Philippines, enable us to deliver results to clients in various markets and for a wide range of roles. With over 15 years of experience in the BPO industry, Intelassist places a strong emphasis on organizational resilience and social stewardship to foster lasting, meaningful partnerships within our team and with our clients.
At the core of our business lie our people. Our ability to recruit, train, and, most importantly, retain exceptional team members is not only what enables Intelassist to attract the region’s finest talent but also what bestows stability upon our clients through reduced turnover and tangible outcomes.
With a workforce of slightly over 1,000 employees, we strike a balance – substantial enough to possess profound insight into the Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) industry, yet intimate enough to maintain the family-like, high-energy work atmosphere that our candidates seek.
At Intelassist, we specialize in sourcing, training, and retaining top-tier talent, each exclusively dedicated to meeting our clients’ unique needs. Our proven track record and local presence ensure that Intelassist clients enjoy increased productivity, reduced staff turnover, and significant cost savings
WHY INTELASSIST?
We grow together. We value your effort. We aim to empower you.

title: Transport Supervisor
description:

title: Field Junior Training Officer (Luzon)
description:
Job Overview:
The Field Junior Training Officer is responsible for implementing and delivering sales capability programs to frontliners in the field. The role involves facilitating training sessions, coaching sales representatives, identifying skill gaps, and aligning training interventions with sales objectives. This position requires independence, field leadership, and strong collaboration with area sales teams.
Area of Assignment: 
LUZON DCs - ISA/PAN/GMA/MEY/PQE/LIP. Reports to the nearest DC when not in field.

Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct interviews with applicants for entry level positions.
Facilitate in-field sales capability training and coach frontliners on selling techniques, customer engagement, and execution standards.
Collaborate with Field sales managers to identify development needs and customize interventions.
Monitor and evaluate post-training performance in assigned territories.
Lead onboarding field immersion programs for newly hired sales representatives.
Provide feedback and insights to the Training group for continuous improvement of learning materials.
Report on field training activities, participation, effectiveness, and outcomes.
Serve as the point person for capability-building efforts in assigned regions.

Qualifications and Skills:
A graduate of any 4-year course.
At least 3-5 years of experience in sales, field execution, or training roles (preferably in FMCG).
Field Sales experience is a plus.
Strong exposure to frontline sales environment.
Experience in conducting coaching or facilitation is required.
Excellent communication, facilitation and coaching skills.
Strong relationship-building and field presence.
Ability to assess training needs based on performance data and behaviors.
Proactive and resourceful with minimal supervision.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
Tech-savvy: can easily learn and adapt to technological advancements.
Willingness to travel frequently and work in field conditions.
Preferably with a valid motorcycle license and able to drive a motorcycle for field visits OR able to ride a motorcycle for field visits when necessary.
Can based in Metro Manila but willing to travel to different sales locations / go on field (at least 4x a week) and support field teams in Luzon DCs - ISA/PAN/GMA/MEY/PQE/LIP. Reports to the nearest DC when not in field.

title: Junior System Engineer (Hybrid)
description:
Job Description
We are looking to hire a Junior Systems Engineer with strong background in Linux administration to join our Global Systems Engineering Team. You will be part of the team that implement, maintain and consolidate of our global server infrastructure hosted in datacenters worldwide, acting directly on client facing systems. You will oversee the day-to-day operations as well as work on challenging projects aimed towards continuous improvement and evolution of our technology environment.

The infrastructure itself represents a motivating challenge: Open-source platforms and proprietary platforms spread across more than 1,000 servers located in 25+ data centers worldwide. The system infrastructure consists of multiple server platforms, SAN and NAS storage.

Responsibilities include:
Engineering, implementation, and maintenance of Operating Systems and monitoring tools
Daily administration of systems infrastructure
Analysis and resolution of system related incidents
Coordinate the deployment of new hardware to meet client expectations
Develop and enhance system policies, procedures, and controls
Ensure adherence to Information Security guidelines
Continuous improvement in the quality and uptime of the environment

The technology integral to our operating environments include:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux, CentOS (Microsoft Windows is a plus)
Scripting in Shell, Perl, Python
Basic Networking Skills

Requirements
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Minimum 3 to 5 years' experience as a Systems Engineer
Administration of Linux systems on Dell, HP blades and/or Cisco UCS hardware
Motivated, hardworking, and exceptional attention to detail
Good understanding of the risks and potential impact of working on a 24/7 live environment

title: Payroll Officer
description:
Our Payroll Officer is responsible for managing and processing the payroll functions this includes ensuring that employees are paid accurately and on time, calculating wages, salaries, bonuses, and deductions, and complying with tax laws and employment regulations.

Maintain accurate payroll records, including files, tax reports, and voluntary deduction documentation.
Administer payroll processes, policies, and procedures.
Ensure the accuracy of payroll and benefit codes.
Research and process payroll and benefit adjustment entries.

Ensure compliance with payroll statutory and regulatory requirements.
Follow up with employees and managers to ensure timely submission of attendance and schedules.
Maintain a professional and customer-service-oriented approach when interacting with employees and managers.
Train new employees and managers on payroll policies and timekeeping systems.
Proactively research and resolve payroll-related issues.
Ensure the accuracy of data in timekeeping systems
Perform other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Knowledge of Philippine payroll and statutory requirements.
A minimum of 7 years of experience in end-to-end payroll processing.
Knowledgeable in payroll systems such as ADP and NetSuite.
Strong analytical skills and advanced MS Excel skills.
Experience in handling high-volume transactions.
Ability to analyze and resolve queries effectively.
Knowledge of basic accounting concepts.
Good communication skills both written and verbal and must be able to address inquiries efficiently
Bachelors Degree  holder major in Accounting or Finance preferred

title: Warehouse Officer - Bagumbayan Taguig
description:
The Warehouse Officer is responsible for safe and efficient management of Sales Order fulfillment. This role supports and assist the day-to-day operation of fulfillment and picking preparations, coordination to customer service level workgroup, determine the issues and concerns and recommend strategic resolutions of the problems encountered. He is responsible to report and oversee along with the team lead and supervisor the daily status of fulfillment, stocks availability, storage and dispatch of finished products; to ensure productivity targets are achieved and that all warehouse processes are running smoothly and promptly.

JOB SUMMARY:
System administrator of Warehouse Management System (WMS)
Monitors transactions in the WMS, ensures efficiency and maximizers use of the WMS system
Coordinate work flow for successful warehouse operations.
Monthly monitoring on warehouse expenses.
Real time monitoring on sample for Quality Assurance
Process owner of Reverse Logistic (RTV, Redeliver and Cancelled)
Process owner of Receiving Processes (Distributed and Inter-branch)
Process owner of Ingress (Item preparation) to egress (Reverse Logistic)
Able to use and understand the process of WMS
To process order fulfillment, replenishment, picking, loading, and checking before dispatching of orders
Ensuring the accuracy of inventory on hand vs systems
Sending notification to stakeholders (SMPD and CSL) the status of orders, availability of stocks and concerns.
Monitoring and execute reverse logistics making sure to implement the best practice of returns, checking of DTR and tagging the concern department.
Ensures that all incoming FG's are correct and in good condition.
Ensure all documents are duly signed and piled accordingly as part of documentation and traceability.

Keen attention to detail with strong analytical and critical thinking
Knowledgeable in Warehouse Management System or any relevant tool
Willing to render shifting schedule (day shift-night shift)
Willing to work onsite in Bagumbayan, Taguig City from Monday to Saturday

title: Community Manager
description:
We are hiring for a Community Manager with AI fluency. This is a non-technical role, but candidates must be highly familiar with AI tools, trends, and workflows. They should be capable of engaging with an audience that’s AI-curious and building an active community across platforms.

To engage and activate YFS’s mentor and student communities, ensuring vibrant participation across courses and internships. This role ensures students experience multiple touchpoints along the continuum and that mentors are effectively mobilized.

Key Responsibilities
Manage mentor onboarding, engagement, and progression (facilitator ? trainer ? gold star).
Build student community engagement, ensuring students remain connected from
courses to internships.
Partner closely with SDRs (supply/demand generation) and Operations (program execution) to ensure a smooth flow from recruitment to delivery.
Organise recognition, events, and communication campaigns.
Monitor community health metrics (activation, retention, satisfaction).
--------

Testing Framework
Part A: Engagement Simulation
? Scenario: 20% of onboarded mentors are not taking up opportunities.

? Tasks:
? Draft interventions to activate these mentors.
? Design a 3-month mentor and student engagement campaign.
? Propose recognition and progression initiatives.

Part B: Community Operations
? Scenario: SDRs have secured 10 new partners providing mentors. Ops is struggling to
integrate them into live programs. How would you work across both teams to ensure
smooth mentor activation?

Deliverable: 5–6 slides or 2 page write-up.
Evaluation Criteria
? Engagement Strategy.
? Operational Collaboration.
? Startup Mindset.
? Communication.


Requirements
3–5 years of experience in community management, volunteer coordination, or student engagement.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience building and managing online communities
Demonstrated passion for and usage of AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Midjourney, Zapier, etc. - Not just ChatGPT)
Experience in education, edtech, or working with learners is a strong plus
Comfortable with automation, prompt engineering, or basic AI workflows
Open to non-traditional backgrounds, provided AI literacy is high
Strong people skills and empathy.
Organised and comfortable managing multiple moving parts across global time zones.
Equipped with a conducive work-from-home setup and a stable high-speed (fiber) internet connection for uninterrupted operations.
Amenable to work 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM BST 


Benefits

? Holistic employee experience
? Rewards and incentives
? Monthly engagement activities
? Career advancement opportunities
? Paid referral program

title: Compensation & Benefits Asst. Manager
description:
About The Job Compensation & Benefits Assistant Manager
The Compensation and Benefits Assistant Manager is responsible for overseeing payroll, benefits administration, and employee records management to ensure compliance with company policies and government regulations. This role supervises day-to-day operations, provides guidance to the team, and supports process improvements to enhance employee satisfaction and operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities
Payroll Operations
Manage the end-to-end payroll cycle, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and timely salary disbursement.
Supervise and validate timekeeping data, including hours worked, overtime, and deductions.
Analyze payroll metrics to identify discrepancies and recommend process improvements.
Ensure compliance with tax regulations and labor laws in all payroll practices.
Coordinate with the Finance team for payroll reconciliation and audits.
Benefits Administration
Administer and monitor employee benefits, including HMO, group life insurance, retirement plans, and government-mandated benefits.
Ensure timely processing of SSS, PhilHealth, and Pag-IBIG remittances.
Coordinate with external providers on enrollments, renewals, and claims.
Review and recommend improvements to benefits programs to support employee satisfaction and retention.
Provide expert guidance to employees on benefits inquiries and claims resolution.
Employee Records Management & Data Privacy
Oversee employee records in the HRIS, ensuring accuracy and compliance with labor laws.
Supervise new hire entries and deactivation of separated employees.
Maintain strict data privacy standards in handling sensitive information.
Generate and analyze HRIS reports for management and regulatory compliance.
Communication & Employee Experience Support
Communicate compensation and benefits policy changes clearly to employees.
Provide feedback and guidance to the C&B team to support continuous improvement.
Prepare and submit reports to regulatory agencies and internal stakeholders.
Address employee concerns regarding compensation and benefits with professionalism.
Collaborate with internal teams and vendors to resolve issues and improve service delivery.
Gather and analyze employee feedback to propose actionable improvements.

Job Requirements
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
Experience: Minimum of 5-8 years in compensation and benefits administration or HR operations.
Skills & Competencies
Strong knowledge of payroll, compensation, benefits structures, and compliance regulations.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel; skilled in Microsoft Office and HRIS systems.
Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
Proven ability to manage confidential information with discretion.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate across all organizational levels.
Preferably with experience in DARWIN BOX.

Working Arrangement: On-site (Marikina/Eastwood), Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM. May be required to work weekends or holidays during payroll cutoffs, with flexibility for shifting schedules as needed.
