title: Client Implementation Specialist | Onboarding
description:
Are you driven, results-oriented and a team player?
With 17,000 customers in over 15 countries, StoreHub's mission is to make business awesome for everyone by providing retail and restaurant businesses the technology and services they need to succeed.
At StoreHub, we believe that technology is essential for businesses to survive and thrive in today's fast-changing world. We also believe that equal access to technology is a fundamental right. That's why we’re committed to bridging this gap and making technology accessible to all, regardless of their background. By focusing on serving needs, not just profit, we level the playing field for those who have been marginalized. Our customers trust us with the success of their businesses, and we play to win by enabling everyone to build successful businesses.
At StoreHub we model ourselves on a pro-sports team whereby all of your colleagues are extraordinary at what they do and are highly effective collaborators. 
On a team like this, you learn the most, perform your best work, improve the fastest, and feel most fulfilled professionally.
If this is a journey you’d like to embark on, keep reading!

In this role, you’d be responsible for driving the success of our customers through using the StoreHub platform effectively and maximizing on our robust features to guarantee they get the most value.
You don’t need to be an expert or know everything about our industry. But the work is challenging, fast-paced, and always on the bleeding edge. So, we’re looking for someone with a curious mind, a strong drive to make things happen, and a passion to keep improving yourself.
What you will do:
Work with merchants to drive revenue and ensure operational excellence in their business
Educate merchants on StoreHub features, promotional campaigns, and market insights
Build long-lasting relationships and trust with merchants to understand more about their business and their key success factors
Negotiate deals with merchants and work with the marketing team to develop matching initiatives to boost revenue
Manage multiple projects at a time, delivering outcomes according to deadlines, while ensuring excellent quality standards are met
Be the focal point for merchant inquiries and take ownership of their requests/issues by working with different departments i.e. customer care, onboarding, and product to ensure satisfaction and merchant retention
Share challenges and ideas openly to ensure that the team is up to date-and constantly improving performance
What you'll need to have:
Experience of 1 to 3 years in roles related to Key Account, Merchandising, Retail Business, Business Development, Project Management
A BIG passion for helping small businesses
Lots of self-drive with the motivation and desire to succeed
Tenacity to develop ideas independently and thrive in a fast-paced startup environment
Strong conversational and rapport-building skills
Logical thinking and strong problem-solving skills
Ability to interact with a broad set of businesses and stakeholders while presenting both over the phone and in person
Knowledge using G-suite and basic Excel
Must be willing to work on-site in Makati City.
What makes working at StoreHub awesome (and refreshing!):
Our people - for real! StoreHubbers are some of the smartest and most interesting people you can work with. Expect to do a lot of peer-learning.
Culture of Candour.We embrace directness, hate bureaucracy, and move fast. If you're tired of 'corporate nonsense' you'll feel right at home.
Cutting edge tools. If something can be automated, we'll make it happen. You will be introduced to many different tools we use that support everyday tasks, so that we can focus our minds on the kind of work that matters.
Impact not just effort. We recognize that results are not tied to the number of hours worked. There's no reward for long hours with poor results and no penalty for leaving on time if your work is excellent. To be great, most of us have to put in considerable effort, but we don't measure contribution by hard work or long hours.
CHANGE. Our core values are super important to us. The more you resonate with them, the more you'll find yourself a good fit.
Communicate for Clarity
Humble and Hungry
Authentic but not an *sshole
Nimble and Quick
Growth Mindset
Efficiency and Excellence
  We do have all the other cool perks too:
Apple MacBooks for everyone to help you do your best work
Comprehensive healthcare benefits with our HMO Plan
Career development and mentorship
Cutting edge tools. You will be introduced to over 20 different tools we use that support basic tasks, so that we can focus our minds on the kind of work that matters.
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at StoreHub. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Sales Account Manager (B2B Telesales)
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
Company Description
About SEEK
At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and to help organisations succeed.
By joining us, you’ll be part of a multi-national technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it’s where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.
Why join us?
Be part of a multi-national tech company with strong core values to help us solve complex challenges for our customers while building a flexible, exciting career – one that could take you anywhere.
We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment.
As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multi-lingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region.
Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.
Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences and courses while you work alongside seasoned experts.
Job Description
About the role
We’re looking for a Sales Executive to help grow our SME portfolio by driving outbound sales. This role focuses on high-volume calling to connect with potential clients, offer recruitment solutions and close deals. While mostly phone-based, you’ll also attend client meetings in person when needed. If you thrive in fast-paced sales environments and enjoy building relationships, this could be a great fit for you.
Responsibilities
Drive outbound sales by making high-volume phone calls (~100 calls per day) to engage and convert leads into long-term clients
Manage your sales pipeline via CRM – track proposals, update statuses and ensure timely follow-through across all opportunities
Tailor proposals using market insights to deliver standout solutions that meet each client’s unique needs
Stay across industry trends, competitors and emerging opportunities to help position SEEK as the go-to recruitment partner
Skills and experience
Strong experience in outbound telephone or inside sales in high-volume environments (up to 100 calls per day)
Background in inside sales, SaaS/tech, or recruitment-related services is preferred
CRM-savvy and comfortable juggling multiple leads at different sales stages
Resilient, detail-oriented and outcome-driven – with a genuine passion for helping people and businesses succeed
Strong communicator – both verbal and written; being able to speak Bisaya is a bonus!
Bachelor’s degree in any field
Candidates with recruitment sourcing background are encouraged to apply
Additional Information
At SEEK we offer:
•        Hybrid set up
•        A commitment to operating sustainably, a certified carbon neutral business operation, with the target of 100% renewable energy by 2025, and net zero by 2030
•        Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Day
•        The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
•        SEEKer Support, a confidential service that offers employees access to free quality counselling sessions with a mental health professional of choice [DEI]
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

title: .NET Developer | Permanent WFH | Day Shift | Day 1 HMO
description:
Build the Tech Behind Bold Advertising Ideas

In the fast-paced world of advertising and marketing, every great campaign needs code that performs as brilliantly as the idea behind it. Here, creativity meets clean architecture. You'll craft the engines behind bold digital stories, collaborating with global innovators to turn data, design, and development into captivating brand experiences.

Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)

20 annual leaves (5 convertible to cash)
Fun employee engagement activities
Mentorship and global team exposure
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive workplace
What You'll Bring
3-5 years of professional experience with C# and the .NET stack
Proven experience in SQL Server-backed applications
Proficiency in modern frontend frameworks (React, Angular, or Vue)
Experience handling complex data models and multi-step workflows
Strong understanding of secure authentication and role-based permissions
Skilled in file uploads, data parsing, and API integrations
Experience with legacy system migration or Drupal data
Knowledge of multi-tenancy architecture and scaling strategies
Familiarity with ASX or financial data APIs
Experience in document generation or PDF tools
Highly Desirable:
SQL Server, React, GitHub, Teams, and Asana
Preferred:
Experience in financial or equity-based systems
Familiarity with ATO ESS reporting tools and data formatting
Your Impact in Action
Lead the rebuild of a complex participant management portal
Develop clean, secure, and scalable backend services using .NET and SQL Server
Rebuild frontend interfaces using React or Angular
Translate Drupal functionality into efficient .NET logic
Develop custom modules for share vesting, tranche management, and tax reporting
Implement and manage role-based access controls
Build and support API endpoints for scalability
Create a bulk import/export engine for data management
Integrate delayed ASX price feeds into dashboards
Support report generation and custom exports
Collaborate with the dev and PM team for architecture and QA
Maintain documentation and handover guides
About the Client

Our client is a leading Australian creative agency built on the belief that boring never changed anything. They specialize in bold, insight-driven advertising, marketing strategy, and content creation that moves audiences and builds brands. With deep respect for culture and language, they craft campaigns that connect people, spark emotion, and inspire action-proving that creativity and technology can transform how the world communicates.

Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Risk Procurement Team Lead
description:
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets.
We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.
Role accountabilities:
Individual accountabilities:
Supplier Risk & Due Diligence 
Work cross-functionally to ensure suppliers undergo a robust screening process that mitigates risks to the organisation. 
Conduct compliance risk assessments and due diligence on high-risk vendors through research, data analysis, and investigation. 
Assist in drafting due diligence reports, including proposed actions to mitigate identified risks. 
Identify and flag any attempts to bypass risk management and procurement governance. 
Advise project managers and business leads on supplier screening outcomes and recommended mitigation measures. 
Conduct supplier audits and support internal procurement audits as directed by the Procurement Manager.
Maintain and support effective risk management and compliance programs, including scorecards and monitoring tools. 
Escalate emerging or actual compliance risks to the Procurement Manager for resolution. 
Utilize evaluative judgment to assess risk and drive adherence to Arcadis third-party governance policies.
Vendor Master Data & P2P Compliance
Maintain and update vendor records in compliance with internal controls and audit requirements.
Communicate with suppliers and internal stakeholders to support accurate and timely vendor setup. 
Create and maintain documentation, workflows, and standard work instructions to support the P2P and supplier due diligence process. 
Collaborate with Procurement, Finance, and Accounts Payable to support consistent and compliant procurement execution. 
Respond to enquiries, manage complaints professionally, and provide quality service to Arcadians.
Team Leadership & Line Management
Lead by example by actively participating in the team’s day to day operational tasks, ensuring alignment with service standards and process requirements. 
Manage the daily workload, task allocation, and performance of a procurement support team. 
Plan and define SMART goals and ensure delivery of KPIs across procurement risk and data areas. 
Support recruitment activities by participating in interviews and providing candidate feedback. 
Conduct regular check-ins and contribute to formal performance reviews (e.g., GPS development planning).
Provide coaching and task-level support; escalate performance or conduct issues to the Procurement Manager as appropriate. 
Promote continuous learning by supporting professional development and upskilling within the team. 
Foster a collaborative, inclusive, and inspiring team culture that values diversity and wellbeing. 
Promote and model Health, Safety, and work–life balance practices. 
Continuous Improvement & Collaboration
Evaluate current processes and recommend improvements to drive standardisation, efficiency, and risk reduction. 
Build strong working relationships with Procurement, AP, Supplier Data, and other internal teams. 
Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure consistency, share knowledge, and promote best practices. 
Support Sustainable Procurement, Direct and Indirect Procurement teams in maintaining compliance controls. 
Lead by example in conduct, professionalism, and adherence to Arcadis values
Qualifications & Experience:
Demonstrates capability and the ability to collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams around a common purpose.
Strong analytical, organizational and project management skills, with ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously. 
At least 2 years risk management, operational risk, compliance, audits and controls, and third-party management 
Proficient computer skills with a focus on Microsoft Office application · Experience in ERP preferred 
Ability to resolve issues in a timely manner 
Highly motivated
Effective time management skills 
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication 
Procurement qualification (or equivalent by experience) highly desirable

title: Business Systems & Power Platform Specialist | Hybrid
description:
If you love solving puzzles with tech — automating the boring stuff, fixing what’s broken, and helping people actually use the tools they have — you’ll fit right in.
We’re looking for a Business Systems & Power Platform Specialist to support multiple Australian clients from our First Focus Philippines team. You’ll build automations, streamline systems, and help people work smarter — not harder.
What You’ll Be Doing
Build & Automate
Use Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI to design solutions that make real-world work simpler.
Improve existing systems and turn repetitive manual tasks into smooth, automated processes.
Work with clients to understand what they need — and then actually deliver it.
Support & Administer
Keep Microsoft 365 tools like SharePoint, Teams, and OneDrive running smoothly.
Manage permissions, migrations, and integrations across client environments.
Help users understand and get more out of their systems (and maybe stop them breaking things).
Collaborate & Improve
Manage requests and incidents through ManageEngine, ServiceNow, or similar ITIL-based tools.
Jump in on system improvement projects and help shape better processes across platforms like DevOps or IFS.
Support cross-system integration and make sure data stays accurate and reliable.
Requirements
Deep experience with Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with Microsoft 365 and SharePoint administration.
Familiarity with Connectwise and other ticketing tools.
A practical, curious mindset — you like figuring things out.
That steady mix of teamwork, patience, and diskarte that gets things done.
Benefits
Hybrid work setup — because we trust you to deliver.
1 paid study day per month (that’s 10 a year for your growth).
Comprehensive HMO coverage for you and a dependent from Day 1.
Paid certifications and ongoing training.
Performance bonuses and loyalty profit share (conditions apply)
Mental health support and team events that don’t feel like forced fun.
Referral bonuses for bringing other awesome humans aboard.
Flexible leave and genuinely good work-life balance.

Who We Are
First Focus is Australia’s most awarded Managed Service Provider, with teams in Australia, New Zealand, and the Philippines.
We’re known for being friendly, professional, and proudly geeky — a bunch of people who enjoy solving tricky problems and helping our clients thrive. The Philippines team keeps that standard high with brains, heart, and a sense of humour that keeps the workday lighter.
Neurodiverse? We’ve Got You.
We welcome neurodiverse candidates and encourage disclosure so we can tailor the experience to showcase your strengths. Ask for our Neurodiversity Statement — we’d love to support you.

title: Human Resources Officer (Central Eastern Visayas - Lapu-Lapu City-based)
description:
Note: Must be willing to work Monday to Saturday due to the nature of business operations.

The Human Resources Officer is responsible for providing support in the various human resource functions, which include recruitment, placement, training and development, conflict resolution, employee counseling and separation. As the Company’s strategic business partner, the Human Resource Officer also provides advice and assistance to all employees, supervisors and top management. This may include information on training needs and learning opportunities, employee engagement activities, performance appraisals, and implementation policies of the Company enabling and maintaining a strength-based and high performance organization.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
(The listed duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following key areas and performance indicators)

Workforce Planning
Partners with Managers to ensure that accurate job descriptions and job profiles are in place
Provides assistance with writing job descriptions
Works closely with various departments, assisting line managers to understand and implement policies and procedures especially regarding Talent Acquisition
Initiates a role brief discussion with the Managers to understand the hiring requirements

Employee Onboarding & Record Management 
Supports the candidates’ journey before joining SCPA in a close coordination with the Managers and the team
Discuss onboarding pre-employment requirements
Provides assistances and follow up with candidates as necessary, collection of all required documents, coordinate with other departments to ensure all documents and access to systems are complete
Provides aid to the candidates in questions related to recruitment and onboarding process
Prepares necessary onboarding materials, and documents for employee onboarding 
Ensures accurate entry of employee personal and professional details in the HRIS, completeness and accuracy of employee contract, non-compete agreement, bank ATM forms and etc.
Conducts the induction program and company orientation to newly hired employees

Talent Acquisition
Provides advice and assistance to supervisors on staff recruitment 
Coordinates with the agency to request for third party workers needed 
Helps assess and interview third party workers for deployment, if the need arises.
Coordinates staff recruitment and selection process in order to ensure a timely organized and comprehensive procedures used to hire employees 
Coordinates with the head office regarding the selection process to efficiently hire employees fit for the job 
Facilitates recruitment of staff that includes developing job descriptions and person specifications, preparing job advertisements, checking application forms, shortlisting, interviewing and selecting candidates 
Advertises staff vacancies, assesses applications, interviews applicants, prepares reports and makes recommendations to management 
Prepares notices and advertisements for vacant staff positions 
Schedules, organizes interviews and participates in applicant interviews 
Conducts reference checks on possible candidates and informs unsuccessful applicants 

Employee Engagement, Learning, and Development
Organizes  training sessions, workshops and activities  and accesses funding for training and write proposals 
Provides support to supervisors and management to develop the skills and capabilities of employees 
Identifies training and development needs within the organization through job analysis 
Coordinates with the head office for training and development needs and proposals 
Designs and expand training and development programs based on the needs of the organization and the individual 
Manages the delivery of training and development programmes  
Evaluates training and development programs 
Keeps up-to-date with developments in training by reading relevant journals, going to meetings and attending relevant courses and seminar 
Come up with innovative and creative ideas for activities and events that align with the interests and preferences of the employees
Manage the budget allocated for employee activities and events effectively, ensuring that resources are used efficiently
Effectively communicate event details to employees, including date, time, location, agenda, and any specific requirements or preparations.

HR Analytics
Ensures proper update of the weekly scorecards and departmental key performance indicators 
Determines staffing numbers, skills and needs to meet the organization objectives
Acquire data from HRIS and conduct needed analysis
Provides monthly HR activity and worker inventory report and analysis
Monitors the number and movement of employees through regular updates of the plantilla.
Develops and implements data collection system and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Creates report to illustrate data in a pleasant, concise and comprehensible manner

Performance Management & Employee Relations
Facilitates the evaluation of employee performance and ensures the consolidation of scores.
Monitors employee performance through proper documentation and record-keeping.
Conducts check-in conversations with staff who have performance-related issues.
Updates performance form metrics, including necessary KPIs and KSAOs, as reflected in individual job descriptions.
Assists managers in reinforcing the employee discipline process for individuals with performance concerns.
Executes comprehensive investigations into workplace issues, conflicts, or policy violations.
Maintains proper documentation of employees' records in performance incident reports.
Participates in the preparation and execution of the Twin Notice Rule (i.e., Notice to Explain and Notice of Decision) for workers with disciplinary concerns.
Partners with the manager to create performance development or improvement plans for an employee.
Monitors the progression and effectiveness of disciplinary measures being executed in the company.

Strategic Planning 
Interprets departmental data/scorecards, conducts market research, SWOT analysis, risk assessment, assesses industry trends, evaluates competitors, and analyzes internal and external factors that can influence the organization's success and recommends action steps and/or programs aligned to organization need and direction.
Assists in creating departmental strategies and translates strategies into a comprehensive strategic plan which includes outlining the action steps, timelines, resource allocation, and programs to leverage on strengths, address weaknesses, seize opportunities, mitigate threats and contribute to organization goals.
Helps establish a system to track the implementation of the strategic plan and measure progress towards the defined goals
Assists in effectively communicating the strategic plan to key stakeholders across the organization and supports in building relationships with external partners and/or, stakeholders as needed.

title: Business Development Executive | Hybrid | Makati | Night Shift
description:
Delivering Global Logistics Solutions with Speed, Precision, and Care.

Our client is an international logistics and supply chain innovator providing comprehensive, end-to-end shipping, fulfillment, and transport management services. With a strong reputation for reliability, scalability, and customer-focused service, they help businesses move products efficiently across borders and markets. Through cutting-edge technology, tailored solutions, and a commitment to operational excellence, our client continues to redefine global logistics-creating smarter, faster, and more connected supply chains worldwide.

Job Description

As a Business Development Executive, you'll lead efforts to expand global partnerships and strengthen client relationships in the outsourcing and logistics space. You'll design strategies that fuel business growth, align client needs with tailored BPO solutions, and contribute to scaling operations worldwide.

Job Overview

Employment type: Full-time
Shift: Night Shift, Weekends Off
Work setup: Hybrid, Makati

Exciting Perks Await!
Competitive Salary Package
Night differential pay to maximize your earnings
HMO coverage with free dependent upon regularization
Hybrid work arrangement
Prime office location in Makati (Easy access to MRT stations, restaurants, and banks)
Fixed weekends off
Salary Advance Program through our banking partner (Eligibility and approval subject to bank assessment. Available to account holders with minimum of 6 months company tenure.)
Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization
Standard government and Emapta benefits
Total of 20 annual leaves to be used at your discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek

Experience:
Minimum of 3+ years in Business Development with a proven track record in outsourcing or BPO sales.
Market Knowledge:
Strong understanding of the outsourcing industry, particularly customer service and support functions.
International Exposure:
Experience working with clients in international markets, particularly North America.
Sales Skills:
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills with a strategic, consultative approach.
Motivation & Drive:
Self-starter who is target-driven and thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.
Tools:
Proficient with CRM systems and other business development tools.
Important:
Candidates without experience selling outsourcing or BPO services will not be considered.
Your Daily Tasks

New Business Generation:
Proactively identify and pursue new business opportunities, focusing on expanding outsourcing and BPO presence, especially in customer service functions across international markets (particularly North America).
Client Relationship Management:
Build, maintain, and grow long-term relationships with both new and existing clients, offering tailored BPO solutions aligned with their operational goals.
Sales Strategy & Execution:
Develop and execute strategic sales plans to meet and exceed revenue targets.
Provide input on positioning and messaging to ensure alignment with client needs and market demands.
Contract Negotiation:
Lead contract discussions and negotiations, ensuring mutual benefit and alignment with client requirements and company capabilities.
Internal Collaboration:
Coordinate with marketing, operations, and delivery teams to ensure a seamless transition from sales to service delivery and maintain a high level of client satisfaction.
Market Intelligence & Reporting:
Monitor market trends and competitor activities.
Provide regular reports and sales forecasts to leadership to support data-driven decisions.
Work Setup Flexibility:
Work both onsite and in a hybrid capacity depending on business needs and performance metrics.
Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Support Engineer (Remote)
description:
Key Responsibilities
Monitor security and service alerts from Cloudflare and other sources using the Sumo Logic SIEM platform, including:
WAF rule triggers
Zero Trust policy violations
DDoS or rate-limiting events
Suspicious DNS/cache behaviors
Review email-based alerts for predefined fault conditions (e.g., agent offline, backup failure, endpoint disconnection, login anomalies).
Triage and respond to L1 alerts:
Classify severity and potential impact
Cross-check with threat intelligence tools
Correlate events with known IoCs
Log incidents and support requests in the ITSM system (e.g., ManageEngine), including full context and timestamps.
Escalate qualified incidents to L2/L3 engineers or the global support team with enriched notes, logs, and timeline data.
Respond to customer tickets related to:
Cloudflare WAF false positives or blocked IPs
DNS resolution or routing issues
Exabeam agent health, telemetry gaps, or connection issues
Endpoint alert triage or status checks
Maintain accurate shift handovers, including:
Summary of ongoing incidents
Alert patterns or trends
Pending escalations and follow-ups
Adhere to standard operating procedures (SOPs), runbooks, and response workflows.
Contribute to the ongoing improvement of alert handling documentation and first-response playbooks.

Minimum Requirements
Diploma or Degree in IT, Computer Science, or Cybersecurity
1–2 years experience in:
L1 IT support or SOC/NOC operations
Email-based alert triage and SIEM monitoring
Working knowledge of:
Cloudflare (WAF, DNS, Zero Trust)
Sumo Logic or other SIEM platforms (Splunk, Sentinel, Wazuh, etc.)
Cybersecurity concepts (endpoint protection, phishing, MFA, patching)
Networking fundamentals (IP, DNS, traceroute, firewall basics)
Comfortable working night shift (typically 9PM–6AM SGT) in a remote 24x7 team environment
Clear and concise documentation and incident communication skills
Desirable Skills
Prior exposure to:
Cloudflare Dashboard or API logs
Exabeam or similar UEBA/XDR tools
Threat intelligence feeds (AbuseIPDB, GreyNoise)
Experience with:
ManageEngine, ServiceNow, or other ITSM platforms
Endpoint detection tools (e.g., CrowdStrike, SentinelOne)
Basic scripting or log parsing (e.g., PowerShell, Bash, Python)
Certifications (preferred but not required):
ITIL v4 Foundation
CompTIA Security+, Network+
Cloudflare Specialist Badges (WAF, Zero Trust)

title: Branch Finance Associate - Pampanga (Temporary)
description:
Reporting to: Branch Finance Supervisor
Duty Post: San Fernando, Pampanga
Contract Duration: 6 months
Work Arrangement: Monday to Saturday, 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM
This job posting will remain open until the vacancy is filled. 

Branch Finance Associate

The Branch Finance Associate collaborates proactively with field partners to provide timely support on branch operations, ensuring accurate review, recording, and reconciliation of transactions. They drive compliance with company policies, validate customer transactions and data, and lead operational improvements, cascades, and implementation of new initiatives.

As the BFA in the area of Taytay, you will: 
Work with Different Teams – Join branch activities, attend events, and coordinate with field teams to solve operational issues.
Handle Branch Transactions – Check and record branch financial transactions like check clearing, payment validations, customer documents, and route settlements.
Monitor Branch Performance – Track key performance indicators (important metrics), follow company policies, manage credit limits, and ensure compliance with regulations.
Review and Analyze Data – Check financial reports for errors, investigate overdue accounts, and provide updates to branch partners.
Keep Records Organized – Make sure all customer changes and approvals are accurately recorded and saved in the system.
Support Projects and Training – Help train team members and assist with other tasks assigned by the manager.

Who are we looking for:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
Work Experience: At least 3 years of relevant experience with a focus on accounts receivables and credit management. Experience in FMCG industry is a plus
Language Skills: Fluent in English and Tagalog (knowledge of the local dialect in the assigned area is a plus).
Technical Skills: Knowledge of credit management policies and procedures, integrated systems (e.g., ERP), and MS Excel (functions and formulas).
Other Skills: Strong communication and analytical skills, high attention to detail, and ability to stay flexible, proactive, and well-organized.

title: Marketing Communications Manager
description:

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Are you highly organized, detail-driven, and ready to support a fast-paced legal team? At ClearDesk, you’ll enjoy the stability of long-term placement, the flexibility of remote work, and the opportunity to play a pivotal role in ensuring smooth court scheduling and administrative operations. In this remote position, you'll be an essential part of managing court dates, resolving scheduling conflicts, and maintaining constant communication with lawyers, court personnel, and clients.
Our Story Starts with People Like You
The two founders, best friends, were running businesses that needed great talent fast. So, they started building remote teams across countries like the Philippines, Colombia, and India. Not only did it work, it thrived. They realized that talent isn’t limited by geography. With today’s technology and high-speed internet, we’re able to build high-performing global teams that support businesses across the U.S. So ClearDesk was born.
Today, ClearDesk helps U.S. businesses grow by building world-class remote teams. We don’t just connect talent; we manage the entire experience, from recruiting to retention. And while we help clients thrive, we also stay deeply committed to helping our remote team members build real, lasting careers that support their lives and their families.
That’s where you come in.
The Role: Legal Executive Assistant
Imagine being the go-to person who keeps the firm’s calendars running seamlessly, reviewing incoming court events, filings, and hearings while promptly identifying any conflicts. You’ll be responsible for updating the calendar, communicating with defense counsel, and filing necessary paperwork with the court. On top of that, you’ll be a key player in handling phone communications, maintaining documents, and supporting various administrative tasks that keep the firm’s operations flowing smoothly.
Whether you're coordinating hearings, preparing case documents, or supporting internal team communications, you'll ensure that no detail is overlooked. The best part? You’ll have the flexibility to do it all remotely, supporting a high-performing legal team with precision, professionalism, and attention to detail.
What Your Days Might Look Like:
Manage the firm’s e-services inbox through the Connecticut Judicial Branch website, reviewing and organizing all incoming items (typically around 19 per day).
Add new court events, filings, and hearings to the firm calendar, ensuring all details are accurate and conflicts are identified promptly.
Review existing calendar entries to check for potential scheduling overlaps, rescheduled events, or cancellations, and resolve conflicts by coordinating directly with defense counsel or other involved parties.
File necessary paperwork or requests with the court to formally resolve scheduling conflicts or confirm updated hearing dates.
Maintain constant communication with attorneys and team members to ensure everyone is aware of upcoming cases, deadlines, and court appearances.
Manage general scheduling support, including attorney conferences, client calls, and internal team meetings.
Handle professional phone communications via RingCentral — including answering and returning calls, leaving personalized outgoing messages, and assisting with client inquiries when needed.
Collaborate with the team through MS Teams and WhatsApp for updates, quick check-ins, and escalation of time-sensitive matters.
Organize, label, and store case documents using Filevine, Microsoft Workspace, and OneDrive to ensure easy access and version control.
Support filing, document preparation, and general administrative duties to help streamline the office’s daily workflow.
Take on special projects or administrative initiatives as assigned, helping to improve internal systems or assist with firm growth initiatives.
Follow up with attorneys to confirm availability and ensure all court or client commitments are properly reflected in the shared calendar.
Communicate professionally with court personnel or opposing counsel when clarification or coordination is required.
Report directly to Kali for administrative tasks and escalate issues or scheduling concerns to Matthew as needed.
Use VPN access securely to manage activities on the Connecticut Judicial Branch’s website and other court-related platforms.
Who We Think Will Thrive in This Role:
You have experience in legal support, court scheduling, or administrative coordination
You’re confident using tools like Microsoft Suite, MS Teams, OneDrive, or legal platforms such as Filevine or court-related websites.
You communicate clearly and professionally with lawyers, court personnel, opposing counsel, and clients via email, phone, and messaging platforms like RingCentral and WhatsApp.
You’re self-managed, tech-savvy, and excel at working remotely while staying organized and meeting deadlines.
You’re detail-oriented, proactive, and thrive at managing multiple calendars, resolving scheduling conflicts, and ensuring all court dates and filings are accurate.
You’re a problem-solver who can handle time-sensitive matters, prepare documents, and provide key administrative support to streamline team operations.
You are willing to work in a US time zone schedule.
You can secure the required technical setup, including:
At least a 720p HD webcam
A noise-canceling headset
A primary internet connection of at least 25 Mbps
A backup laptop, backup internet device, and backup power source
A main computer with at least Intel Core i5 (or equivalent) and 8 GB RAM
A backup computer with at least Intel Core i3 and 4 GB RAM
Why ClearDesk?
Because we believe work should be meaningful, even from home.
At ClearDesk, you’ll work with clients who respect your time and value your skills. You’ll join a remote-first team that genuinely supports you, and you’ll see the impact of your work in real, tangible ways that matter to the people you work with.
We don’t just want you to do your job. We want you to grow with us, stay with us, and feel proud of the difference you’re making.
Here’s what you can expect from us:
We pay you fairly and on time
We provide prepaid HMO coverage for your peace of mind
We help you grow with tools, training, and honest feedback
We celebrate your wins
And above all, we actually care
Ready to be part of something that matters?
Apply now and start your journey with ClearDesk. 
Important Reminder: ClearDesk does not ask for any monetary payments or fees as part of our employment process. If you encounter any request for payment, please disregard it and report it to us immediately. For your security, please ensure that all communications are conducted through emails originating from (@cleardesk.com or @cleardeskteam.com).
Disclaimer: Candidates who apply for this position may be re-profiled to similar roles depending on their qualifications, experience, and current market demand.

title: Social Media Marketing Specialist
description:
REQUIREMENT: FULL WORK ON SITE IN ORTIGAS CITY
We're looking for a passionate and creative Social Media Specialist to join our growing team! As a Software as a Service (SaaS) company, we're dedicated to helping businesses grow with innovative and user-friendly solutions.
In this role, you'll be the voice of our brand online. You will play a key role in developing and implementing social media strategies that elevate our brand presence, engage our target audience, and drive business growth. If you have a proven track record of creating compelling content, building online communities, and staying ahead of social media trends, we want to hear from you.
On-Site Benefits:
Get the full experience of working together with passionate teammates at our Ortigas, Pasig office.
We believe in rewarding our employees comprehensively. Here's what you can expect:
Competitive Salary: We offer a competitive salary that recognizes your skills and contributions.
Comprehensive Benefits Package: Your well-being is important to us. Our benefits include:
Day 1 Health Insurance: Immediate coverage from your first day.
Free Dependent Upon Regularization: Extend your health benefits to a dependent once regularized.
De Minimis Benefits: To further enhance your take-home pay and well-being, we provide various tax-exempt de minimis benefits, such as: Rice allowance, Clothing allowance, Laundry allowance, Medical cash allowance, and Daily meal and transportation allowance for overtime work.
Retirement Benefit: Plan for your future with our service retirement program.
Christmas Bonus: We show our appreciation during the holiday season with a special Christmas bonus.
Generous Paid Time Off: Enjoy 24 days of paid time off annually (12 vacation leaves, 12 sick leaves).
Convertible Sick Leaves: Unused sick leaves are convertible to cash.
Tuition Assistance: We support your child’s education with tuition assistance of up to 75%.
Mandatory Government Benefits: SSS, Philhealth, Pag-IBIG Fund, 13th Month Pay
Quarterly Sponsored Company Events
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute a comprehensive social media strategy across all relevant platforms, including but not limited to LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
Create, curate, and manage engaging and relevant content that resonates with our target audience. This includes graphics, videos, articles, and blog posts.
Monitor social media channels for industry trends, customer feedback, and competitor activity.
Engage with our online community by responding to comments, messages, and mentions in a timely and professional manner.
Analyze social media data and metrics to measure the success of campaigns and optimize future strategies.
Collaborate with the marketing, sales, and product teams to ensure brand consistency and support key business initiatives.
Stay up-to-date with the latest social media best practices, tools, and technologies.
Qualifications:
Proven experience as a Social Media Specialist or similar role, preferably within a SaaS or tech company.
Strong understanding of social media platforms, their respective best practices, and social media paid ads management.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficiency in social media management tools like Buffer, Hootsuite, or Sprout Social.
Experience with Canva, Adobe Photoshop, or other graphic design tools.
A data-driven mindset and experience with social media analytics.

title: Estimator | Work from Home (A-FSL)
description:
Position Summary: 
We are looking for a detail-oriented and reliable Estimator to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing high-level pricing and feasibility estimates during early project stages. This includes the ability to assess construction requirements, associated infrastructure, and appropriate contingencies. 
The role will span across all business sectors and will report directly to the Commercial Manager. 
Job Details: 
Work from Home 
Monday to Friday | 6:30 AM - 3:30 PM (Manila time) 
Following Holidays – To be advised 
Key Responsibilities: 
Estimating incoming tenders, contract administration and negotiation, including submission of timely payment claims, invoices and collection of monies due. 
Entering of subcontractor’s quotations into our system and other data entry tasks. 
Aim to increase the margin on a project by 2% once the tender has been awarded. 
Complete value engineering with clients and subcontractors/suppliers. 
Negotiate contracts with subcontractors. 
Preparing and completing comprehensive project handover to the Project team once a tender has been awarded. 
Management of variations and ensuring final accounts are rendered on a timely basis. 
Fostering relationships with key industry stakeholders, contractors and internal staff to ensure effective management and communication. 
Proactively supporting your team with upskilling in estimating, tendering and quoting for contracts. 
Prepare material take-off based on plans and specifications and apply appropriate material and labor rates. 
Procurement and sub-contractor agreements. 
Monitoring and maintaining profitability on all contracts. 
Progress payments to clients, on time and provided to meet the contractual terms of agreement. 
Reviewing contractual documents and providing the CEO with visibility of any abnormal terms or conditions prior to engaging in untenable conditions. 
Sourcing and forming new relationships with Subcontractors. As this sector is new to the business, sourcing base build sub-contractors and vetting them will form an important role. 
Project Cash flow, negotiating terms that suit the business. Ensuring sub-contractor payments are in line with client payments. Minimizing the business risk by managing the cash flow. 
Providing visibility to any risk items discovered within tender documentation. This could be Asbestos, lack of detail, missing consultant reports etc.  
Preparing monthly reports on live projects, where they sit cost wise, procurement risk, and variations to date. 
Qualifications: 
Strong background in construction estimating and cost analysis. 
Experience with tender preparation, contract negotiation, and project costing. 
Proficiency in estimating or project management software. 
Good understanding of procurement and subcontractor coordination. 
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. 
Excellent communication and negotiation abilities.

title: Logistic Staff
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
I. Department Overview
The Logistics Department is responsible for the efficient movement, control, and coordination of materials, equipment, and deliveries between warehouse, sites, suppliers, and head office.
Its goal is to ensure that all materials and resources are delivered accurately, on time, and in good condition, supporting the smooth operations of all projects.
II. Key Responsibilities
1. Material Handling and Delivery
Plan, schedule, and monitor all deliveries and pull-outs of materials and equipment to and from sites.
Ensure trip tickets, delivery receipts, and documentation are complete before dispatch.
Coordinate with Purchasing, Warehouse, and Site Engineers to confirm quantities, specifications, and delivery schedules.
Inspect delivery vehicles to ensure materials are properly loaded, secured, and protected during transport.
Track and update the status of deliveries in the Delivery GC (Group Chat) or internal system.
2. Coordination and Communication
Serve as the main communication link between warehouse, purchasing, and site teams.
Ensure Importation/Warehouse is informed of all approved dispatches and item movements.
Maintain updated logistics schedules for monitoring of active and upcoming deliveries.
Immediately report any delays, shortages, or damages to the Logistics Head and Purchasing Department.
3. Vehicle and Driver Management
Supervise and schedule company drivers and delivery vehicles for efficiency.
Ensure all vehicles are registered, well-maintained, and roadworthy.
Monitor fuel consumption, mileage, and maintenance records.
Ensure drivers follow proper delivery routes and safety protocols.
4. Documentation and Reporting
Maintain complete records of:
Trip tickets, gate passes, delivery receipts, and pull-out forms.
Incoming and outgoing material logs and any discrepancies noted.
Submit a daily and weekly logistics report to the Head Office (HR/Admin/Purchasing).
Ensure all documents are endorsed to Accounting and Warehouse as required.
5. Compliance and Safety
Ensure compliance with company policies on delivery, handling, and safety.
Ensure that all loading/unloading operations are done safely and properly.
Immediately report any incident, accident, or material loss/damage.
III. Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, or Business Administration or any equivalent.
At least 1-2 years of experience in logistics, warehouse, or supply coordination.
Strong organizational, communication, and coordination skills.
Knowledge in inventory systems, delivery management, and documentation.
Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word) and familiar with group chat coordination tools (e.g., Viber, GC updates).
IV. Reporting Line
Reports directly to the Logistics Head or Operations Manager.
Works closely with:
Warehouseman / Importation
Purchasing Department
Site Engineers / Project In-Charge
Accounting Department
V. Performance Indicators
Timely and accurate delivery of materials.
Zero missing or damaged items upon delivery.
Proper documentation and reporting.
Coordination efficiency with other departments.
Compliance with company safety and logistics policies.
VI. Benefits
13th Month Pay
Overtime Pay
SSS, Pag-ibig and Philhealth

title: Senior Manager, Payroll
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
Job Description
The Sr Manager of Payroll is responsible for leading the daily operations of Asurion’s payroll processing and timekeeping primarily for the Philippines but also for Australia, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan and Thailand. The position will ensure payroll processing is compliant with all applicable in country requirements as well as company rules and regulations. Leader is responsible for managing, coaching and developing a team of ~20 payroll and timekeeping employees. Position must actively drive extensive process improvement both with internal processes and our vendor. The leader must also establish and maintain effective working relationships and partnerships with internal customers, other support functions (such as HR, IT, Legal, Accounting), and third-party vendors. Leader will create the vision and corresponding strategies, systems, processes, resources and metrics for payroll processing and timekeeping in these regions.
Responsibilities include the following:
Lead and oversee processing of payrolls and time across the Philippines, Australia, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan and Thailand
Ensure all payrolls are processed in compliance with all applicable regulatory requirements
Ensure accuracy, efficiency and timeliness in the payroll processes
Proactively monitor and maintain internal controls
Oversee payroll processing of complex transactions such as stock option activity, numerous bonus programs, and other specialized transactions
Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of year-end tax processing, including reconciliation and completion of the BIR forms.
Identify and implement controls to improve and standardize payroll processes. Partner with HR, IT (HRIS), Tax, Legal, and other business units to address new opportunities and challenges
Maintain knowledge of and implement appropriate payroll best practices in all regions
Champion and support various process improvement initiatives and innovations, including major system implementations, vendor selection and innovative cross-functional solutions
Prioritize projects and initiatives based on internal control risks, pay back/savings, resources and other deliverables 
Ensure the team is responding to inquiries and resolving pay and time issues in a timely manner, with quality and excellent customer service. Ensure tracking, reporting, and readouts are in place.
Implement new company offerings, benefit enrollment, and support various data gathering requirements (compensation statements, bonus cycle, workers' compensation insurance audits, etc.).  Manage changes to update payroll accordingly and provide feedback to ensure appropriate recording and reporting.
Lead a large team of ~20 employees across payroll and timekeeping. Provide direct leadership/feedback/coaching, set clear and measurable objectives, support career development and cross-skilling, make hiring decisions, and ensure the highest levels of quality.
Managing deliverables and meetings across multiple time zones in the Philippines, East Asia and the United States

Qualifications Required:
Experience:
8+ years of managing the payroll function and processes in the Philippines in an exempt/non-exempt environment (includes taxes, garnishments, benefit withholdings, skill-based premiums, differentials, gross-ups, relocation, stock options, etc.) 
8+ years managing a large payroll processing team, with responsibility for establishing goals and performance review, defining work distribution, growth and development, and training of the team 
Implementation of new systems or making major upgrades (including vendor analysis, resource planning and management, and task leadership) preferred 
Cross-cultural communication: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with U.S. counterparts and East Asia teams.
Experience with managing timekeeping preferred

Skills: 
Proven ability to manage a large team, including developing and implementing strategies to motivate personnel, building a supportive culture base, and providing development and advancement opportunities 
Extensive experience and knowledge of the Philippines payroll process and ideally timekeeping
Project management and vendor management skill
Extensive experience driving process improvement
Superior analytical skills 
Strong interpersonal and oral/written communication skills 
Fluent in Tagalog and business English.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills for professional interactions across global teams.
Proficient with MS Office suite 
Education/Certifications: 
BA/BS in Accounting or Business, or equivalent experience, a plus 
Payroll certification/specialization a plus

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Senior Data Analyst
Work setup: We operate in a hybrid work environment, and we encourage applicants who are open to working in the office two days a week to apply.
Work schedule: Monday to Friday, 3PM to 11PM Manila time, overlaps with UK operating hours
Employment type: Permanent
Location: Makati City, Metro Manila
Pay range: We value transparency and want to ensure a good fit for both parties. We encourage applicants who are comfortable within the salary range of Php 55,000 to 75,000 to apply.
 Discover a world of endless possibilities with Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a distinguished global academic publisher and assessment organization proudly affiliated with the prestigious University of Cambridge.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst with a passion for working with data and strong numerical skills to join the Assessment Measurement department of Cambridge Assessment English. The Senior Data Analyst will provide data analysis and psychometric support for a variety of English language tests.

Why Cambridge?
Cambridge University Press & Assessment is a world-renowned not-for-profit academic publisher and assessment organisation, proudly part of the prestigious University of Cambridge. With a legacy rooted in over 800 years of educational excellence, we are dedicated to unlocking the potential of learners and educators across the globe.
Joining Cambridge's second largest global office in the Philippines —operating for over 22 years with 1,300+ colleagues— means becoming a part of an extraordinary institution renowned worldwide. We are recognised as a Great Place to Work® for three consecutive years, reflecting our inclusive culture, strong sense of purpose, and commitment to the professional growth and well-being of our people. At Cambridge, we don't just publish books or deliver tests—we empower progress, inspire curiosity, and champion the pursuit of knowledge.
 What can you get from Cambridge?
At Cambridge, you'll become a part of a vibrant and forward-thinking community that transcends tradition, fostering a culture of continuous growth and personal development. Here, we provide the right environment for you to thrive, supporting your professional journey and empowering you to reach your highest potential, that is why our pay philosophy is intricately tied to your skills and competencies, ensuring that your compensation aligns with the unique value you bring to the role you are applying for.
The organization offers a wide range of benefits and opportunities including:
Regular Employment on Day 1
HMO Coverage and Life Insurance on Day 1
Paid Annual Leaves (Vacation, Well-being, Flexible, Holiday, and Volunteering leaves)
Vesting/Retirement package
Opportunities for career growth and development
Access to well-being programs
Flexible schedule, hybrid work arrangement and work-life balance
Opportunity to collaborate with colleagues from diverse branches that will expand your horizons and enrich your understanding of different cultures

What will you do as a Senior Data Analyst? 
Reporting to the Senior Data & Analytics Manager, your accountabilities will include:
Carry out and interpret the results of core operational data analysis for Cambridge English Exams. Analysis includes standard and ad-hoc processes around trialling, marking, grading, malpractice detection and post exam evaluation.
Identify innovative solutions to improve the processes and systems used for data analytics: designing, developing and testing new analysis and data processing routines for departmental use.
Conduct small scale research projects and provide analysis for larger research activities to ensure that specific processes and technology areas support the quality of Cambridge English products.
Provide data analysis and interpretation to support projects and new business initiatives.

Please review the attached job description for further details on the role. 
 What makes you the ideal candidate for this role?
An ideal candidate has the following qualities:
 
Essential:
A degree, or equivalent qualification, in statistics, mathematics, computing, psychology, language testing, educational measurement, or social sciences with a strong analytical focus.
Ability to program in an analytical language (e.g. SAS, Python, R, SQL).
Familiarity with research methods and statistical analysis procedures
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and influencing skills; able to communicate data insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
The ability to work as part of a team

Desirable:
Knowledge of statistical methods used in assessment and educational measurement

Are you driven by desire to be part of a globally renowned institution that celebrates innovation, embraces inclusion, and empowers learners? Then, we invite you to Pursue your Potential with us.

Applications received through the system will be reviewed on a rolling basis and may close the vacancy once sufficient applications are received. Therefore, if you are interested, tailor-fit your CV (advantageous if you submit one with a Cover Letter) and submit as early as possible.

title: Video Editor | Night Shift
description:

title: HR Systems and Analytics Specialist
description:
The HR Systems and Analytics Specialist is responsible for the effective administration of the HR information system, ensuring the integrity and accuracy of data, and providing technical support to HR staff and employees. This role involves data management, reporting, system maintenance, and continuous improvement of HR processes through the use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

1. **System Administration**
  - Maintain and update the HRIS with employee information, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
  - Manage system configurations, security roles, and user access.
  - Troubleshoot and resolve HRIS issues, escalating to vendors or IT support when necessary.

2. **Data Management**
  - Ensure accurate and timely entry of employee data into the HRIS.
  - Conduct regular data audits to maintain data quality and compliance with policies.
  - Manage data migration and integration from other systems.

3. **Reporting and Analysis**
  - Generate regular and ad hoc reports for HR and management.
  - Analyze HR data to identify trends and support decision-making.
  - Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
  - Develop and maintain dashboards  using PowerBI to visualize key HR metrics and performance indicators.
  - Ensure that all reporting complies with legal requirements and organizational standards.

4. **Training and Support**
  - Train HR staff and employees on the use of the HRIS.
  - Develop user guides and training materials.
  - Provide ongoing technical support and assistance to users.

5. **Process Improvement**
  - Identify opportunities to improve HR processes through automation and system enhancements.
  - Collaborate with HR and IT teams to implement new HRIS features and functionalities.
  - Stay updated on HR technology trends and best practices.

6. **Compliance and Security**
  - Ensure HRIS compliance with data protection and privacy regulations.
  - Implement and monitor security measures to protect HR data.
  - Conduct regular reviews and updates of HRIS policies and procedures.
Qualifications

- **Education**: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
- **Experience**: Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in HRIS administration or a similar role.
- **Technical Skills**: Proficiency in HRIS software (e.g., SAP SuccessFactors, Workday, Oracle HCM), MS Office Suite (especially Excel), and data management tools.
- **Analytical Skills**: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
- **Communication Skills**: Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- **Attention to Detail**: High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
- **Organizational Skills**: Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.

Preferred Skills

- Experience with SQL or other database query languages; experience in Power BI
- Knowledge of HR processes and best practices.
- Certification in HRIS or related field is a plus.

title: Finance Transformation Officer / Manager
description:

Reporting to: Finance Director
Employment Type: Full-Time
About the Role
As our Finance Transformation Officer / Manager, you will lead the transformation of Hive Health’s finance function into a high-performing, data-driven, and strategically aligned powerhouse. You will lead strategic initiatives across people, processes, systems to ensure our finance operations are data-driven, tech-enabled, and ready to support Hive's rapid growth. .

Key Responsibilities
Drive Finance Modernization

Conduct assessments and gap analyses to identify opportunities and action plans for cost reduction, speed, and better insights.
Redesign Core Finance Processes
Redesign and optimize core finance processes across Procure-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash, Record-to-Report, and Budget-to-Report cycles.
Simplify policies, minimize manual interventions, and ensure regulatory and control compliance.
Lead Systems Implementation and Digital Tools
Evaluate and deploy finance technologies including ERP, FP&A tools, automation solutions (RPA, workflow systems), and analytics platforms.
Partner with data and engineering teams to ensure data availability, integrity, and governance.
Improve Service Delivery and Governance
Redesign the finance operating model, including potential use of shared services, centers of excellence, outsourcing, or agile pods.
Define governance and service standards across decentralized or scaled teams.
Strengthen Risk & Controls Framework

Ensure continuity, auditability, and compliance within transformed environments.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Industrial Engineering, or related fields; CPA or MBA/MS Finance is a plus.

title: Talent Sourcing Specialist
description:
About TaskUs: TaskUs is a provider of outsourced digital services and next-generation customer experience to fast-growing technology companies, helping its clients represent, protect and grow their brands. Leveraging a cloud-based infrastructure, TaskUs serves clients in the fastest-growing sectors, including social media, e-commerce, gaming, streaming media, food delivery, ride-sharing, HiTech, FinTech, and HealthTech. 

The People First culture at TaskUs has enabled the company to expand its workforce to approximately 45,000 employees globally. Presently, we have a presence in twenty-three locations across twelve countries, which include the Philippines, India, and the United States.

It started with one ridiculously good idea to create a different breed of Business Processing Outsourcing (BPO)! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion, exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge at a moment’s notice, and mastering consistency in an ever-changing world.

What We Offer: At TaskUs, we prioritize our employees' well-being by offering competitive industry salaries and comprehensive benefits packages. Our commitment to a People First culture is reflected in the various departments we have established, including Total Rewards, Wellness, HR, and Diversity. We take pride in our inclusive environment and positive impact on the community. Moreover, we actively encourage internal mobility and professional growth at all stages of an employee's career within TaskUs. Join our team today and experience firsthand our dedication to supporting People First.



What does a Sourcing Specialist really do? Think of yourself as the one responsible for attracting the best possible talents, so not just anyone is qualified for this role! We make sure we get the best of the best, after all, we are a ridiculously good company so we make sure our employees are top notch. Now we need your full concentration because it’s time to imagine what it’s like being a Sourcing Specialist.

Imagine yourself going to work with one thing on your mind: that you want to help in when it comes to boosting the hiring strategies for TaskUs. As you tackle your new tasks for the day, you know that it comes down to one thing: that you will conceptualize, develop and implement creative, “out-of-the-box” sourcing strategies and hiring plans to fill the FTE requirements.

As a Sourcing Specialist, you will build strong business knowledge and integrate into sourcing talent attraction strategies. You will also maintain accurate internal and external candidate data in real time in staffing systems. You will contribute as a positive member of the staffing team, supporting team members and assisting others in their success. What else? Well, as a Sourcing Specialist, you will handle the company’s Employee Referral Program, vendor management, and another external branding, marketing and sourcing activities that will help attract top talent.

Do you have what it takes to become a Sourcing Specialist?

What is it we’re looking for? Well, since this is a specialist post we need someone who has at least a Bachelor’s Degree or College Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Studies/Administration/Management, Marketing, Psychology or equivalent. You also need the experience so if you have at least 2 years of working experience in Sourcing/Marketing for Recruitment -- then you’re qualified. What other experience is a plus? Well, experience in non-traditional sourcing and marketing activities and in events coordination.

Now, let’s get a bit technical. We need someone who can navigate his/her way in Google and Microsoft applications. Someone who can communicate well in English, someone who has excellent interpersonal skill, and someone who has amazing organizational skills. We also need someone who’s good in database management and record keeping. What else? You must be flexible and should be able to easily adapt to any changing trends in Marketing/Recruitment.

How We Partner To Protect You: TaskUs will neither solicit money from you during your application process nor require any form of payment in order to proceed with your application. Kindly ensure that you are always in communication with only authorized recruiters of TaskUs.

DEI: In TaskUs we believe that innovation and higher performance are brought by people from all walks of life. We welcome applicants of different backgrounds, demographics, and circumstances. Inclusive and equitable practices are our responsibility as a business. TaskUs is committed to providing equal access to opportunities. If you need reasonable accommodations in any part of the hiring process, please let us know.

description:

Discover a world of endless possibilities with Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a distinguished global academic publisher and assessment organisation proudly affiliated with the prestigious University of Cambridge.

We are seeking a Legal and Business Affairs Associate to join our Legal Operations team. As a valued member of the team, your primary objective will be to enhance the operational effectiveness of the Legal & Business Affairs function. You will contribute to the delivery of ethical, compliant, and efficient legal support by managing financial processes, maintaining data integrity, supporting due diligence and privacy workflows, and driving continuous improvement across systems and procedures.

Why Cambridge?
Cambridge University Press & Assessment is a world-renowned not-for-profit academic publisher and assessment organisation, proudly part of the prestigious University of Cambridge. With a legacy rooted in over 800 years of educational excellence, we are dedicated to unlocking the potential of learners and educators across the globe.
Joining Cambridge's second largest global office in the Philippines —operating for over 22 years with 1,300+ colleagues— means becoming a part of an extraordinary institution renowned worldwide. We are recognised as a Great Place to Work® for three consecutive years, reflecting our inclusive culture, strong sense of purpose, and commitment to the professional growth and well-being of our people. At Cambridge, we don't just publish books or deliver tests—we empower progress, inspire curiosity, and champion the pursuit of knowledge.
 What can you get from Cambridge?
At Cambridge, you'll become a part of a vibrant and forward-thinking community that transcends tradition, fostering a culture of continuous growth and personal development. Here, we provide the right environment for you to thrive, supporting your professional journey and empowering you to reach your highest potential, that is why our pay philosophy is intricately tied to your skills and competencies, ensuring that your compensation aligns with the unique value you bring to the role you are applying for.
The organization offers a wide range of benefits and opportunities, including:
Regular Employment on Day 1
HMO Coverage and Life Insurance on Day 1

Vesting/Retirement package
Opportunities for career growth and development
Access to well-being programs
Flexible schedule, hybrid work arrangement and work-life balance
Opportunity to collaborate with colleagues from diverse branches that will expand your horizons and enrich your understanding of different cultures

What will you do as a Legal & Business Affairs Associate?
As part of the Legal & Business Affairs team, you'll support operational excellence and help drive ethical, informed decision-making across the organization. Your key responsibilities include:
Support financial operations through purchase orders, reporting, accruals, and budget coordination.
Use legal and compliance platforms (e.g., OneTrust, SAP, Ironclad) to implement programs and respond to queries.
Maintain and analyze data using SharePoint, Power BI, and Microsoft 365 tools.
Conduct due diligence checks and support data privacy processes.
Collaborate with the Legal Operations team to improve processes and share best practices.
Please review the attached job description for further details on the role.
 What makes you the ideal candidate in this role?
Over two years of hands-on experience in legal operations, compliance, and finance support within complex, cross-functional environments.
Proven ability to collaborate effectively across Legal, Finance, and IT teams, driving operational efficiency and alignment.
Demonstrated expertise in managing sensitive and confidential information with discretion and professionalism.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel and Outlook, as well as SharePoint for data management and collaboration.
Highly organized and adaptable, with a track record of managing multiple priorities and delivering results under pressure.
A committed team player with excellent interpersonal skills and a strong sense of professional integrity.
Naturally curious and proactive, with a solutions-oriented mindset and a passion for continuous learning and process improvement.

Are you driven by desire to be part of a globally renowned institution that celebrates innovation, embraces inclusion, and empowers learners? Then, we invite you to Pursue your Potential with us.

Applications received through the system will be reviewed on a rolling basis and may close the vacancy once sufficient applications are received. Therefore, if you are interested, tailor-fit your CV (advantageous if you submit one with a Cover Letter) and submit as early as possible.
