title: Marketing admin assistant (Remote)
description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and passionate Admin Assistant with Hubspot CRM experience and strong English language skills to join our growing team and help us to continue creating compelling content for our audiences.

How will you contribute?
As an integral part of our Marketing Team, you will be an experienced admin assistant with strong English language skills . Your focus will be on helping with management of our Hubspot CRM, social media channels, scheduling weekly newsletters and publishing regular client case studies.

About Greenspan
Solving architectural and engineering problems isn’t just what we do.
It’s who we are.
From humble beginnings in 1976, we’ve become pioneers of PreCrafted buildings, tirelessly evolving our products in the quest for superior modularity, elegance and strength.
We create spaces that bring joy and precious memories to families. We provide additional room for inter-generational harmony. We give busy professionals a more productive place to work. We build calm sanctuaries where artists can think and create. We can even turn homeowners into occasional hoteliers.
In doing all this, we add considerably to the value of people’s property. Yet because each building is PreCrafted in our workshops, then assembled on site in a matter of hours, the transformation happens with almost no disruption to their living environment or lives.

What’s it like to work here?
Greenspan is a family business in every sense.
The entire team – from the founders and designers to the craftspeople on the workshop floor – believe they are making Australia a better place, one PreCrafted building at a time. This shared sense of purpose creates a kinship which bonds the team and enables an open and honest working environment. It empowers people to challenge standard practices and find better solutions. It also creates a positive and supportive culture.
 And because there is no ‘us and them’, it allows for more relaxed relationships in which humour and humility can thrive.  At Greenspan we pride ourselves in our Can-Do attitude to developing solutions for our client’s needs. Our clients value our innovative business solutions and local expertise in design, implementation, and support.

What our Filipino team members say about working at Greenspan:
"Proud jud ko to be working in Greenspan. We deliver beautiful, functional, and exceptional products. Ganahan pud ko kay ang work environment relax ra and we work as a collaborative team. Kanindot na naga work sa kumpanya where you are valued as a person, mu-grow mu together as a team, and kung mag bonding mura ra jud pamilya"
"Working sa Greenspan, parang pamilya talaga. Lahat chill at willing tumulong, kaya ang dali matuto at mag-grow. Solid yung teamwork at respectful lahat kaya ganado kaming magtrabaho araw-araw."
"What I truly enjoy is being part of an incredible team that supports you every step of the way. The collaboration is seamless, the atmosphere is kind and professional, and from the moment I joined, I felt a genuine sense of connection. I'm constantly grateful for the encouragement and support this team provides, it makes all the difference."

What’s in it for you?
At Greenspan we believe in transforming the lives of both our clients and our team members.
We strive to engage and grow our people so they can become a master in their role.
Work autonomously in a great team environment with a great culture
Master the art of marketing while helping to transform family living space and lifestyles
₱30,000 – ₱40,000 per month
Paid leaves
13th month salary
HMO (Employee + Dependents)
Remote/work from home role

What do you need?
You will align with and live our family organisation values of Solutioneering, Thoughtfulness and Precision.
Must have:
Sense of humour
Proficient English language skills
Reliable power and internet connection
Demonstrated Hubspot CRM experience
Excellent communication skills
Digital marketing experience
If you enjoy a stimulating and challenging work environment where you will be putting your technical skills to the test and become part of an exciting growth journey, then this is the opportunity you have been looking for. Apply now.

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
Are you tech-savvy, organized, and curious about renewable energy? Do you enjoy digging into data, solving problems, and keeping systems running smoothly behind the scenes? In this remote role, you’ll support solar operations by ensuring systems are set up correctly, monitored effectively, and well-documented. You’ll play a key role in making sure solar systems across homes and businesses are activated, tracked, and performing at their best.
Our Story Starts with People Like You
The two founders, best friends, were running businesses that needed great talent fast. So, they started building remote teams across countries like the Philippines, Colombia, and India. Not only did it work, it thrived. They realized that talent isn’t limited by geography. With today’s technology and high-speed internet, we’re able to build high-performing global teams that support businesses across the U.S. So ClearDesk was born.
Today, ClearDesk helps U.S. businesses grow by building world-class remote teams. We don’t just connect talent; we manage the entire experience, from recruiting to retention. And while we help clients thrive, we also stay deeply committed to helping our remote team members build real, lasting careers that support their lives and their families.
That’s where you come in.
The Role: Technical Support Specialist/Monitoring Support Specialist
Imagine being the key player behind the scenes, making sure everything runs smoothly across solar system operations from activation and monitoring to reporting and case management. From configuring systems on platforms like Enphase and SolarEdge to tracking performance issues and updating customer records, you're the one keeping everything accurate, organized, and moving forward.
Need to investigate a sudden drop in solar production? You’ve already spotted the alert, checked the reports, and flagged it for action. Setting up a brand-new solar install? You’ve mapped the system, created login info for the customer, and ensured everything is ready for monitoring. Behind every system activation, report, and support case, you’re the trusted collaborator handling details, maintaining data, and ensuring no issue goes unresolved.
You’re the person who keeps the process running clearly, efficiently, and without stress. And the best part? You get to do it all remotely, as an essential part of a high-performing, clean energy support team based in the U.S.
What Your Days Might Look Like:
System Monitoring & Reporting: 
Activate solar systems for homes and businesses, making sure they are approved and ready to operate.
Keep an eye on how the systems are performing and look into any problems by checking alerts and reports from platforms like Enphase and SolarEdge.
Create and review reports to track performance issues, production drops, and other system concerns.
Maintain lists of systems that need further investigation or are being watched for issues.
System Setup & Configuration:
Help map out new solar system setups on Enphase and SolarEdge.
Assist with creating login sheets and setup info for customer systems.
Set up accounts for a specific report system (Know True-Up or KTU) and manage those reports.
Help with setting up subcontractor accounts (limited tasks).
Map systems once they’ve passed inspections.
Case Management & Record Updates:
Keep track of customer issues in the system, making sure cases are updated and followed up on
Clean up old or duplicate records to keep things accurate.
Update customer details (like name and contact info) when needed.
Help with cases where funding might have been rejected.
General Administrative & Support Tasks: 
Clean up and maintain data in monitoring systems.
Ensure all systems are tagged properly for easy tracking.
Work closely with other team members to solve problems and improve system performance.
Who We Think Will Thrive in This Role:
You’re detail-oriented and experienced with data or systems monitoring
You’re confident using platforms like Enphase, SolarEdge, or similar tools
You’re comfortable updating customer records and managing case details
You enjoy solving technical issues and improving workflows
You’re proactive, organized, and able to juggle multiple tasks
You work well remotely and communicate clearly with your team
You’re excited to support clean energy and sustainable solutions
You are willing to work in a US time zone schedule.
You can secure the required technical setup, including:
At least a 720p HD webcam
A noise-canceling headset
A primary internet connection of at least 25 Mbps
A backup laptop, backup internet device, and backup power source
A main computer with at least Intel Core i5 (or equivalent) and 8 GB RAM
A backup computer with at least Intel Core i3 and 4 GB RAM
Why ClearDesk?
Because we believe work should be meaningful, even from home.
At ClearDesk, you’ll work with clients who respect your time and value your skills. You’ll join a remote-first team that genuinely supports you, and you’ll see the impact of your work in real, tangible ways that matter to the people you work with.
We don’t just want you to do your job. We want you to grow with us, stay with us, and feel proud of the difference you’re making.
Here’s what you can expect from us:
We pay you fairly and on time
We provide prepaid HMO coverage for your peace of mind
We help you grow with tools, training, and honest feedback
We celebrate your wins
And above all, we actually care
Ready to be part of something that matters?
Apply now and start your journey with ClearDesk. 
Important Reminder: ClearDesk does not ask for any monetary payments or fees as part of our employment process. If you encounter any request for payment, please disregard it and report it to us immediately. For your security, please ensure that all communications are conducted through emails originating from (@cleardesk.com or @cleardeskteam.com).
Disclaimer: Candidates who apply for this position may be re-profiled to similar roles depending on their qualifications, experience, and current market demand.

title: Mechanical Engineer - BIM Modeler
description:
JOB SUMMARY:
The BIM Modeler/ Engineer II uses Building Information Modeling (BIM) Software to perform basic to advance drawing and modeling work tasks in compliance with the company guidelines. Reports to the BIM Team Leader and perform assigned tasks. Must have the ability to suggest solutions within the scope of the tasks assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Graduate of 4-year Technical degree course, preferably Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering or Architecture.
At least 3 years of experience in the same capacity.
Must be able to create Mechanical, Structural and Architectural drawings using REVIT.
Knowledge of other BIM Concepts and Software (Lumion, Enscape, AutoCAD, Dynamo, Solibri, BIM360) is an advantage.
Knowledgeable and experience in creating and checking Mechanical, Architectural, Structural and Construction drawings is an advantage.
Knowledge of Japanese design, construction and drawings is an advantage.
Providing Portfolio (drawings and perspective) of past works is an advantage.
Above average Communication Skills (oral & written)
Willing to travel to Japan and perform assigned duties as necessary.
Willing to study Japanese Language.
Willing to work overtime and on weekends and holidays if necessary.
A good team player, able to express himself well and communicate with others; can foster good working relationship with colleagues.]
Willing to be dispatched in Japan immediately for minimum of 2 years.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Building Information Modeling
Create Mechanical, Architectural and Structural Revit models and drawings as well as Construction drawings.
Create and improve Revit families and templates.
Create detailed model to be used in the design and construction phase of projects.
Execute clash check between Architectural, Structural and Mechanical models.
Acquire quantities of materials and other required information from the design model.
Create dynamo code to reduce work time, use dynamo in drawing and model creation.
Collaborate with other BIM team to create mechanical, architectural, structural and construction models.
Any other items to be developed through BIM.
Create models in compliance with Japanese Building Code and JFE Civil design requirements.
Learn Japanese Language to communicate with our Japanese counterparts.
Actively participate in developing the use of BIM software in the company.

title: SEO and GEO Manager
description:
About AvePoint: 
Beyond Secure. AvePoint is the global leader in data security, governance, and resilience, going beyond traditional solutions to ensure a robust data foundation and enable organizations everywhere to collaborate with confidence. Over 25,000 customers worldwide rely on the AvePoint Confidence Platform to prepare, secure, and optimize their critical data across Microsoft, Google, Salesforce, and other collaboration environments. AvePoint’s global channel partner program includes approximately 5,000 managed service providers, value-added resellers, and systems integrators, with our solutions available in more than 100 cloud marketplaces. To learn more, visit www.avepoint.com. 
At AvePoint, we are committed to investing in our people. Agility, passion and teamwork set us up to do our best work and foster a culture where you are empowered to craft your career, make an impact, and own (y)our future. Unleash the power of you! 
About the role:
AvePoint, a global leader in SaaS and data management solutions, is seeking a strategic and hands-on SEO and GEO Manager for our Manila office. This role will guide SEO efforts spanning technical, onpage, online, and semantic optimization, driving strong organic growth in an era transformed by generative AI (GEO). The successful candidate will leverage data-driven insights, cross-functional partnerships, and team leadership to maximize search visibility, optimize content, and convert targeted traffic throughout the customer journey
Key responsibilities:
Strategy & Leadership: Lead the development and execution of integrated SEO and GEO strategies, while managing and mentoring a high-performing team.
GEO Innovation: Monitor and adapt to generative AI trends to optimize visibility in AI-powered search and conversational experiences.
Technical SEO: Oversee site architecture, crawlability, speed, mobile optimization, and structured data to ensure technical excellence.
Onpage Optimization: Enhance content structure, metadata, internal linking, and UX to improve rankings and engagement.
Semantic & Entity SEO: Leverage NLP, entity optimization, and topical authority to align with evolving AI search algorithms.
Content Collaboration: Partner with content teams to create and optimize high-impact, search-intent-driven content across the funnel.
Keyword & Market Intelligence: Conduct keyword research and competitive analysis to inform strategy and capture emerging search behaviors.
Offpage & Local SEO: Build a strong backlink profile, manage online reputation, and implement local SEO best practices.
Customer Journey Optimization: Align SEO and GEO efforts with each stage of the customer journey to drive traffic, engagement, and conversions.
Cross-Channel Integration: Collaborate with paid media and marketing teams to unify organic and paid strategies for maximum impact.
Analytics & Reporting: Define KPIs, track performance, and deliver actionable insights to stakeholders.
Continuous Improvement: Stay ahead of SEO/GEO trends and tools, continuously testing and refining strategies.
Team Development: Coach and develop team members, fostering a culture of growth, innovation, and accountability.
Resource Planning: Assess team needs and partner with HR to recruit and retain top SEO and GEO talent. 
The ideal candidate has:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Computer Science, or related field.
5+ years of hands-on SEO management experience, ideally in SaaS, B2B tech, or high-growth digital environments.
Proven experience in leading and managing SEO teams, including mentoring, performance management, and fostering a collaborative, high-performing work environment.
Demonstrated expertise in technical, onpage, online, and semantic SEO, with proven results in organic growth.
Proficiency in SEO tools (SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, Google Analytics, etc.).
Strong understanding of generative AI’s impact on search (GEO) and agility in adapting to search innovation.
Exceptional analytical and strategic thinking skills, with deep experience in keyword research and market analysis.
Proven ability to collaborate across content, marketing, and paid media teams within global organizations.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Self-motivated, adaptable, and results-oriented.
What’s in it for you?
HMO coverage from day 1 of employment (plus 2 free dependents)
Group life insurance (upon regularization)
Paid annual and sick leaves (convertible into cash)
Paid compassionate leave (5 days)
Employee Dedication Award (years of service)
Employee Referral Bonus Program
Promoting diversity and inclusion
Business Travel Opportunity (Top Performers)
Hybrid Working Arrangement
Competitive compensation package,
Performance bonuses/incentives
Career growth & advancement opportunities
*Terms and conditions apply
AvePoint is proud to employ talent from many different backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that diversity and inclusion drive our success and is at the core of how we hire, communicate, and collaborate to deliver value and excellence. We are committed to fostering an environment where people can bring their whole selves to work and feel a sense of belonging, and we continue to work toward creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our customers and communities.

title: Service Desk Trainer | McKinley Hills, Taguig
description:
About the role
HCL Technologies Philippines Inc. is seeking an exceptional Service Desk Trainer to join our dynamic team.

Job Type: Permanent
Schedule: Shifting Schedule
Work Setup: 100% Onsite
Work Location: McKinley Hills, Taguig


Preferred Skills
· Experience designing technical course material
· BS in information technology, computer science or relevant field.
· Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical terms plainly.
· In-depth knowledge of service desk operations and customer care.
· Excellent communications skills both verbal and written.
· Strong coaching and mentoring abilities.
· Analytical and problem-solving skills
· Ability to work independently with excellent organizational and time management skills.
· Flexibility to adapt training programs to meet the changing needs of business.

Job Description
Develop, maintain, and manage customer training programs. 
Determine requirements, requisitions, and reporting materials used in training program. 
Monitor progress of training. 
Coordinate training activities and scheduling according to training program. 
Manage multiple training projects simultaneously involving successfully organizing, planning, and executing large-scale training projects from vision through implementation. 
Design training materials that can be used by multiple teams, tracks, or customers. 
Establish a project training plan including audience, approach, design, and list of deliverables. 
Use independent & consulted decision-making to design and develop training materials, reference materials, presentation materials and job aids. 
Ensure all materials are clear, concise, instructionally sound, and directly support learning objectives. 
Work with learning management system administrator to assign training and upload computer-based training, track training completions and report metrics. Provide support for coordinating, developing, and delivering computer-related training to the user community. 
Provide second level support and coordinate training with help desks. 
Provide standards, services, and guidance on IT related training programs that are designed to enable Service desk personnel to use information technologies and systems more productively. Services include the development, delivery, and/or coordination of training courses and materials that address specific team / department needs. 
Conduct the research necessary to develop and revise training courses. 
Develop and revise courses and prepare appropriate training catalogs. 
Prepare student materials (course manuals, workbooks, handouts, completion certificates, and course critique forms). 
Train personnel by conducting formal classroom courses, workshops, and seminars. 
Prepare reports and monitor training tasks in support of the goals of the Project / account / team using standard training standards and software and hardware programs. 
Provide input to the Account Managers and the Service Delivery Manager on which decisions for training validation and or modifications of specified items or systems can be corrected. 
Work on all the assigned duties by the management.

title: Virtual Assistant (Office-Based/Onsite) - Open to Fresh Graduates
description:
IMPORTANT REMINDER:
Interviews conducted via ZOOM
APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO GO TO OUR MAKATI OFFICE TO WORK. THIS IS NOT A WORK FORM HOME POSITION.
 Overview:
Well respected and recognized Australian Company
Above industry average salary packages
Performance based career development opportunities.
Health and Dental benefits
Provision of 2-week on the job training and professional development to ensure your future success in career aspirations whilst receiving full remuneration.
Supportive, friendly work environment and organizational culture
Paid sick and vacation leave.
Easily accessible central work location

Job Description:
Opportunities Await You! Come join our vibrant and energetic team in a rapidly expanding company whose focus is building your success. We are currently seeking highly motivated Individuals who hold a strong desire to work in a supportive team and develop new skills within our fast-paced Australian owned and operated outsource financial planning business.
As a Virtual Assistant you will be fully trained to provide ongoing administrative support to various financial advisers while working remotely from the Makati Office. Our 2-week comprehensive training program will arm you with the required level of skills to perform the various administrative tasks, inclusive of but not limited to, conducting phone research and follow ups, insurance and investment comparisons, data entry on various forms and lodgment of applications.
The positions are full-time, regular hours, Monday to Friday, in a very spacious modern office right in the heart of Makati - close to local transport.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
· Prepare client reports.
· Arrange client appointments and collate files for reviews.
· Completion and submission of relevant forms
· Assist in gathering client information on behalf of our corporate clients.
· Research and analyze financial products, including investments, insurance, and retirement plans.
· Prepare Strategy Papers / reports and presentations for clients and advisers.
· Preparing and reviewing existing client positions.
· Ensuring that all deadlines are met, especially if conflicting.
· Managing workflow and multiple tasks given that requests may come from a number of sources in accordance with the practice’s service standards.
· Maintain client files and ensure all information is up-to-date and accurate.
· Collaborate with adviser to ensure compliance with industry regulations.

Successful candidates must demonstrate the following key selection criteria:
· Bachelor's Degree or College Degree.
· Willing and able to learn the use of industry specific software and operating systems.
· Willingness to undergo the company’s comprehensive 2-weeks training program.
· Demonstrated previous knowledge of corporate professionalism as it relates to procedures, practices, and services inclusive of confidentiality.
· Proven performance in reporting skills and producing high-level and accurate reporting documents.
· Excellent English communication skills (verbal & written) with strong interpersonal skills.
· Excellent attention to detail, problem solving, and analytical skills.
· Ability to multi-task, manage time and the ability to prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.
· Ability to work independently in a team environment.
· Willingness to work within the Australian (Victorian) Public Holiday calendar.
· Comprehensive computer skills - familiarity with Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel
· Proven performance in delivering high level work ethic.

Personal Qualifications:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a collaborative and persuasive style
High level competency in Microsoft Word and Excel
Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Holding strong capacity to multitask, have an immense work ethic and attitude.
You are a quick learner and like a role that offers diversity with direct client contact.
Your core focus is to continue to advance your skill sets in a fast-paced environment.
You are career orientated and driven to attain success.
Robust organizational skills and ability to prioritize.
Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team.
Capacity to always hold a positive and professional attitude.
You hold a strong desire to learn and willingness to undergo the company’s 2-week training program to prepare skill sets required for this role.
Willing to work around the Australian holiday Calendar
Candidates living far distances (1.5 hours or more travel time) from Makati will be required to relocate closer to the office, with generous relocation allowance payable monthly by the company.

Please Note: All applicants will undergo pre-selection testing as part of the recruitment process.

title: Customer Care Center, Resolutions
description:
About the role

Join our vibrant Customer Care Center team at PHH Mortgage Corporation as a Customer Care Center, Resolutions professional. In this full-time role based in Pasay City, Metro Manila, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service, resolving inquiries, and ensuring the satisfaction of our valued clients. Your expertise in call center operations and your strong communication skills will be instrumental in driving the success of our resolutions-focused team.
What you'll be doing
Display effective collection techniques, call handling skills, and negotiate with confidence to obtain delinquency resolution.
Provide accurate and relevant information to the customer.
Inbound and outbound calls for loans current month owing through foreclosure (Customer Service and Collection Calls in English).
Effectively provide prompt, accurate and professional responses to customer inquiries.
Successfully resolve routine inquiries regarding payments, escrow, loan terms etc.
Document loan activity on MSP
Actively collect on past due payments
Establish payment arrangements and determine strategies to resolve delinquency
Resolving foreclosure questions and concerns
Determine the reason for default.
Counsel customers about consequences of delinquency.
Maintaining service levels and call center performance metrics - Schedule Adherence, Average Call Handle Time, Attendance / Availability.
Payment Collection and Deal Production.
What we're looking for
Proven experience in a customer service or call center environment, preferably within the mortgage or financial services industry
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with customers and internal stakeholders
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to research and identify appropriate solutions
Proficient in using customer relationship management (CRM) systems and computer applications
Commitment to providing exceptional customer service and a genuine interest in helping others
Flexible and adaptable, with the ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
What we offer

At PHH Mortgage Corporation, we are dedicated to supporting our employees' growth and development. You will have access to comprehensive training, opportunities for career advancement, and a range of competitive benefits, including:
Attractive salary and bonus incentives
Comprehensive health insurance coverage
Professional development and training programs
Collaborative and inclusive work culture

About us

PHH Mortgage Corporation is a leading provider of mortgage services, with a strong focus on customer satisfaction and innovation. Our mission is to empower individuals and families to achieve their homeownership dreams through exceptional service and tailored financial solutions. Join our dynamic team and be a part of our continued growth and success.
Apply now to begin your journey with PHH Mortgage Corporation!

title: Port Coordinator - SPX Express (Caticlan)
description:
Job Description:
Develop and maintain schedules for linehaul operations, including assigning routes and vehicles based on factors such as delivery lead time, vehicle capacity/ truck productivity, and driver availability.
Coordinate with dispatchers, drivers, and other personnel to ensure smooth execution of scheduled routes and address any issues or delays that arise.
Monitor and analyze route performance data to identify opportunities for improvement in efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and service quality.
Collaborate and communicate effectively with other departments, such as regional center, last mile, Midmile to provide updates on schedule changes, delays, or other relevant information.
Assist in the development and implementation of policies, procedures, and guidelines to improve the effectiveness of linehaul scheduling processes.
Monitor pre-booking linehaul requirements for assigned ports to Hub, RTS, and intra VisMin requirements.
Ensure updates on the status of shipments upon transporting until they reach every Hub.
Conduct regular performance reviews per trucker to ensure adherence to company standards and efficiency in operations.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
Proven experience in transportation logistics, with a focus on linehaul operations in ports
Strong understanding of transportation management systems or any data dashboards.
Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
Effective communication skills, with the ability to collaborate and coordinate with internal teams, truckers, and drivers.
Analytical mindset with the ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities and deadlines.
Knowledge of transportation regulations and compliance requirements.
Amenable to travel or relocate near Caticlan, Aklan

title: Payroll Officer | AU law (related to payroll) Exp | Onsite-Ortigas
description:
PAYROLL OFFICER
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN PAYROLL OFFICER?
The Payroll Officer, reporting to the Group Manager – Pharmacy Services is responsible for processing pays.
The position also provides support to the Payroll Team.
The purpose of the position is to ensure that all employee details are complete and up to date so that pays (and  all the other related processes) run efficiently and effectively, meeting or exceeding Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Technical Work 
1. Payroll. The following are the key areas of responsibility:
- Setting up new permanent and casual employees (including Short Term
Casuals)
- Processing payroll for multiple entities from service members payroll
software into their nominated accounting software (currently
Deputy/Wageloch to GreenTree/Xero).
- Uploading bank files for authorisation.
- Processing ad-hoc/backpay adjustments.
- Processing & maintaining employee terminations/
- Maintaining Short Term Casual employees as instructed by Pharmacy
Owners.
- Updating employee details and rates, as instructed.
- Processing Paid Parental Leave.
- Processing Long Service Leave.
- Investigating queries and providing resolution in accordance with best
practices.
- Provide assistance in completing Audits/reviews to meet service delivery
standards.
Administration
2. Payroll. The following are the key areas of responsibility:
- Post payroll tasks: Email Payslips to relevant employees via approved
software, Single Touch Payroll (STP) lodgement, uploading of reports to
Sharepoint/Filing.
- Generate reports as required to meet service delivery and as requested by
Pharmacy Owners.
3. Other/ad-hoc Tasks:
- Super/IRESS Maintenance.
- Monthly Superannuation Submission.
- Update of STP configuration and action.
- Provider Digital Access (PRODA) account maintenance (including
correspondence & filing of letters).
- Relationship Authorisation Manager (RAM) account maintenance
(including correspondence & filing of letters)
- Action assigned tickets in Freshdesk as per SLA.
- Payroll Tax
- Electronic record keeping meeting agreed document management
protocols
4. End of Month Reports: Leave Accruals, Superannuation, Birthday Rate
amendments.
5. End of Financial Year Reports: General Ledger, Transaction Summary, HR
payment by pay date, Saving CSV files.
6. End of Financial Year Tasks:
- STP Reconciliation (review configuration, reconcile STP to Payroll, STP
year-end lodgement).
- Payroll to GL reconciliation
- New Financial Year (FY) posting period maintenance.
- Changes to Owner Superannuation top up percentage.
Stakeholder/Client Engagement(work & behaviours expected to be provided to clients)

7. Payroll.
- Liaise and communicate with Pharmacy Owners/Managers to meet
service level agreement (SLA) standards.
- Liaise and communicate with service providers (ex. GT) regarding system
requirements.
8. Workers Compensation Insurance. Liaise with workers’ compensation
insurance providers with regard to Pharmacies’ Wages Declaration.
As the above involve collaboration, interfacing with both internal teams and external
contacts, behaviours in each transaction must reflect professionalism, respect,
understanding, inclusivity, accountability and responsibility.
Team Performance & Development (work & behaviours required to achieve goals
and development of own team)

9. Payroll: Assist the payroll team in performing their duties to meet/exceed
SLAs.
10. Other Tasks: Attend meetings and action assigned tasks.
The above entails working/collaborating with the team. Therefore, behaviours need
to reflect professionalism, respect, care, clear communication, stepping in to
support activities and individuals, and encouraging personal and professional
growth.
Behavioural Expectations (pre-filled area)

11. Ensure that both personal and professional representation, conduct/behaviours
reflect the values of the Organisation.
12. Perform all work in accordance with Company Policies, Procedures, Systems
and Standards.
13. Adhere to the confidentiality agreement to ensure all Pharmacy 777 Company
information will be held strictly confidential outside the Company.
14. Information relating to all databases within POS are kept confidential.
15. Information relating to Industry contacts, Patients, Carers, Colleagues, or the
business may only be divulged to authorised external persons subject to the
approval of the Managing Director or the General Manager, and in accordance
with branch Policies and Procedures relating to confidentiality and protection of
personal and sensitive data.
16. MIM (Major Incident Management). It is an expectation that should a major
incident occur, you will respond when called upon to participate in the
Company’s management of the incident.
OH&S (pre-filled area) 17. Have a good understanding and comply with Pharmacy 777 OH&S, Injury
Management and Fitness for Work Human Resources Policies

18. Identify the risks involved in work activities and apply safe working procedures
not limited to eliminating hazards.
19. Maintain work areas in a tidy and safe way and free from hazards.
20. Report to Manager/Human Services Department, all potential risks identified.
Professional Development (pre-filled area)

21. Participate in the Annual Performance and Development Review and regular
check ins.
22. Take responsibility for own professional development, learning and
performance.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
4+ years of background in AU payroll
Knowledge with AU law (related to payroll)
Role will check timesheet of employees
The client has 53 stores under 1 entity
Background doing fortnightly payroll
Relevant BG with MS Suite
Tool: any tool is okay but they're currently using Employment Hero

title: Legal Secretary - Onsite | Night Shift (A-MSA)
description:
Position Overview
We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Legal Secretary to provide comprehensive administrative and case support to our team. This role involves managing client communications, preparing legal correspondence, reviewing medical records, and coordinating the logistics associated with injured workers’ claims. The ideal candidate is proactive, meticulous, and comfortable balancing both clerical and case-related tasks in a fast-paced legal environment.

Job Details:
Onsite (Global One, Eastwood)
Monday to Friday | Night Shift | 8 AM to 5 PM PST or 11 PM to 8 AM Manila Time (Flexible after initial training)
*Following US Holidays
Responsibilities:
Draft, format, and proofread attorney correspondence, including letters and appointment notices.
Use case management software to identify packets of records requiring splitting for exhibit preparation.
Use case management software to create calendar entries and reminders for attorneys.
Arrange for interpreting services when appropriate via email with the provided appointment details.
Organize medical records and identify duplicates to prepare a single exhibit packet of unique records.
Prepare an exhibit list identifying all exhibits within the prepared exhibit packet.
Communicate with paralegals to communicate missing documents or information.
Use software tools to map and provide directions from injured workers’ locations to designated medical offices.
Follow up with doctors to confirm attendance and completion of pending medical reports.
Perform general administrative and paralegal support tasks as assigned by attorneys.
Qualifications
At least 3 years of experience in a paralegal, administrative, or paralegal support role.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in document preparation and record management.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a professional and empathetic client approach.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and case management or document management software.
Ability to handle multiple cases and deadlines with minimal supervision.
Knowledge of medical records, claims preparation, or workers’ compensation procedures is a plus.

title: Bookkeeper - NZ Account (Hybrid)
description:
About the Job
We’re looking for a Bookkeeper to join our growing team at ClockworX. In this role, you’ll be responsible for providing end-to-end bookkeeping services to our New Zealand clients. You’ll handle daily financial operations including accounts receivable and payable, bank reconciliation, payroll processing, and monthly financial reporting.
You’ll play an important role in ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance across all transactions, while supporting our client managers to deliver high-quality accounting services. This position is ideal for someone with strong attention to detail, experience using Xero for NZ and/or AU clients, and a passion for delivering excellent client service in a dynamic, collaborative environment.
Key Responsibilities
Process invoicing, accounts receivable, and accounts payable transactions accurately and efficiently
Perform regular bank reconciliations and maintain financial records in Xero and Dext
Prepare creditor payment runs and process internal business expense claims, credit cards, and fuel cards
Reconcile creditor statements and resolve any discrepancies promptly
Support the Finance team in ensuring adherence to internal policies and procedures
Assist with monthly accounts preparation, reporting, and compliance requirements
Maintain and update automatic payments and filing of creditor invoices
Provide backup support for Junior Accounts Analysts as needed.
Perform other ad hoc finance and administrative tasks to support the team

About You
You’re an organized and detail-oriented Bookkeeper who enjoys working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. You communicate well, manage multiple priorities with ease, and take pride in delivering accurate, high-quality work.
Here’s what you’ll bring to the role:
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
At least 2 years of hands-on bookkeeping or accounting experience, ideally supporting New Zealand or Australian SMEs
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook
Hands-on experience using Xero, Receipt Bank (Dext) and Hubdoc
High level of accuracy and attention to detail
Proven ability to work effectively with global or offshore clients
Willingness to work in a hybrid setup (2 days onsite, 3 days work-from-home) as part of our collaborative and flexible work culture

What's in It for You
At ClockworX, we believe great work deserves great rewards. Here’s what you can look forward to:
A competitive salary offer awaits the right candidate.
HMO coverage for you and one dependent upon hire
Life insurance coverage from day one
Work tools provided to help you perform at your best
Work-from-home allowance for a comfortable remote setup
Hybrid work arrangement offering flexibility and balance
Access to innovative AI tools to streamline your work and boost productivity
Learning and development opportunities to support your professional growth
Enrichment Day activities that foster collaboration and fun
Long Service Incentive Leave benefit to recognize your loyalty and contribution

title: Human Resources and Admin Manager
description:
The HR and Admin Manager is responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources and administrative functions within an organization. This includes strategic HR planning, recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, compensation and benefits, policy development, legal compliance, budget management, and team leadership. The role also involves providing administrative support, managing office facilities, and ensuring health and safety compliance. The HR and Admin Manager plays a crucial role in supporting the organization's overall business strategy and fostering a positive work environment.
Responsibilities:
Strategic Planning: 
Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.
Maintains the work structure by updating job requirements and job descriptions for all positions.
Develop and update the KPI, KRA and job description of employees under the HR and Admin Department.
Recruitment and Selection: 
Oversee the recruitment and selection end to end  process.
Coordination with Head Hunters and Manpower Agencies.
Maintains and develops a smooth onboarding process.
Employee Relations:
Leads employee relations issues, including conflict resolution, disciplinary actions, grievances, and termination procedures.
Ensure the timely processing of  IR, NTE, and NDA, for both direct and agency based employees.
Counselling and coaching of employees as needed.
Performance Management: 
Develop and implement performance management systems to monitor and improve employee performance.
Ensure that all performance evaluations are processed on time. (Probationary, for Regular Employees and Interim)
Training and Development: 
Leads the Training and Development team by identifying training needs and developing training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge.
Compensation and Benefits:
Manage, recommend and implement employee compensation and benefits programs, ensuring they are competitive and comply with legal requirements,  as approved by the Top Management.
Ensure timely enrollment of qualified employees to health insurance, accident insurance and life insurance with the help of HR Associate and HR Supervisor.
Ensure timely processing  of employees’ government claims, loans, compensation, last pay claims  and other government mandated matters, of direct and agency based employees.
Ensure updated third party billing processing and payment.
Policy Development: 
Develop and implement HR policies and procedures to ensure compliance with laws and regulations.
Legal Compliance: 
Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations, including maintaining employee records and handling legal matters.
Administrative Support: 
Provide administrative support to the organization, including managing office supplies, facilities, and equipment.
Carrying out necessary administrative duties.
Budget Management: 
Develop and manage the HR and admin budget, ensuring resources are allocated effectively.
Team Management: 
Lead and manage the HR and admin team, providing guidance, support, and performance feedback.
Reporting and Analytics: 
Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly, and year-end reports and analyze HR and admin data to support decision-making and strategic planning.
Weekly and monthly alignment with Management and department heads.
Retains historical human resource records by designing a filing and retrieval system and keeping past and current records.
Health and Safety: 
Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and promote a safe working environment with the help of Company Nurse, Admin Team and Safety Officers.
Communication and Improvement:
Communicate HR policies, procedures, and initiatives effectively to employees and Top Management..
Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance HR and admin operations.
Others:
Leads in HR projects and initiatives, such as employee engagement programs, diversity initiatives, and process improvements.
Performs other duties that may be assigned by the Management.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management, Psychology,  or equivalent.
At least 5 years of experience in General HR
Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with colleagues.
Experience in educating and coaching staff.
Experience in conflict resolution, disciplinary processes and workplace investigations.
Experience in following and maintaining workplace privacy.
Ability to give presentations.
Knowledge of relevant health and safety laws.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Powerpoint

title: Social Media & Content Associate
description:
Key Responsibilities
Content Creation & Branding
Develop, produce, and publish engaging content (images, videos, carousels, captions) for Facebook, TikTok, Instagram, YouTube Shorts, and other relevant platforms.
Ensure all materials follow brand guidelines, visual identity standards, and Philippine market compliance requirements (FDA/ASC).
Assist in conceptualizing branding campaigns that highlight Gfoxx products, events, and company values.
Collaborate with the creatives team to design brand-consistent assets for promotions, events, and social media campaigns.
Social Media Management
Maintain and execute the social media content calendar aligned with marketing plans, product launches, and events.
Engage with the online community by responding to comments, inquiries, and messages promptly, maintaining a positive and professional tone.
Monitor trends, pop culture, and viral content in the Philippines to create timely, relevant posts.
Campaign Support
Assist in planning and executing digital marketing campaigns, influencer collaborations, and live-selling activities.
Coordinate with distributors, brand ambassadors, and internal teams to gather content and testimonials (with proper consent).
Track and report content performance metrics to evaluate effectiveness and recommend improvements.
Compliance & Governance
Ensure all content adheres to the Advertising Standards Council (ASC) guidelines and FDA rules for supplements.
Use copyright-free music, visuals, and copy to avoid infringement issues.
Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Multimedia Arts, Advertising, or related fields.
At least 1–3 years of relevant experience in social media management, content creation, or digital marketing (Philippine market experience preferred).
Strong skills in Taglish copywriting; able to switch to full Tagalog or English when needed.
Proficiency in social media tools (Meta Business Suite, TikTok Business Center) and content creation tools (Canva, CapCut, Adobe Creative Suite).
Experience in short-form video content creation, basic editing, and visual branding.
Knowledge of Philippine advertising and FDA compliance for health and wellness products (or willingness to learn).
Preferred Qualifications:

title: IT MANAGER
description:
Purpose of the position:

The IT Manager will lead and oversee the company’s technology strategy, systems, and infrastructure to support business operations in a fast-paced FMCG environment. This role ensures the stability, security, and efficiency of IT systems while aligning technology initiatives with business goals. The IT Manager will also drive digital transformation projects, enhance business intelligence, and support sales, supply chain, and production operations through reliable IT solutions.
  Key Responsibilities:
IT Strategy & Planning
Develop and implement IT strategies aligned with the company’s business objectives.
Recommend and implement new technologies to enhance operational efficiency and competitiveness.
Manage IT budget, ensuring cost-effective technology investments.
Infrastructure & Systems Management
Oversee the installation, configuration, and maintenance of hardware, software, networks, and servers.
Ensure all business applications and systems are operating efficiently to support daily operations
Ensure minimal downtime in production and distribution operations through proactive IT support.
Data & Security Management
Safeguard company data through cybersecurity measures, backup, and disaster recovery planning.
Implement IT policies, procedures, and compliance with industry standards.
Manage user access, data privacy, and system security in line with corporate policies.
Business Support & Collaboration
Partner with Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, HR and Finance teams to provide IT solutions that improve business performance.
Support digital transformation initiatives such as e-commerce integration, data analytics, and process automation.
Train employees on systems usage and IT best practices.
Team Leadership & Vendor Management
Lead and develop the IT support team, ensuring excellent service delivery.
Manage external IT vendors, service providers, and consultants.
Negotiate contracts and evaluate vendor performance.
Design, implementation, and management of IT systems, applications, and infrastructure
Mastery on DevOps Technology especially Azure Cloud.
Mastery in .Net Programming, SQL database
Implementing containerization with Docker and Kubernetes for scalable application deployments.
Integrating security checks into the CI/CD pipeline for consistent security throughout the development lifecycle.
Setting up CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment using tools like GitHub CI.
Implementing monitoring and logging solutions for tracking cloud infrastructure performance and security.
Documenting DevOps processes and sharing knowledge with the team.
 Qualifications, knowledge, skills required:
 Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field (Master’s degree is a plus).
Proven experience as IT Manager or similar leadership role in FMCG, manufacturing, or distribution industry.
Strong knowledge of ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar).
Experience in managing IT infrastructure, networks, and cybersecurity.
Excellent project management and problem-solving skills.
Strong leadership and communication skills with the ability to work cross-functionally.

title: Senior Production Application Support (Prime Brokerage)
description:
About BNP Paribas Group:
BNP Paribas Group is a leading European bank with a strong global footprint across 72 markets and more than 202,000 employees. The Group provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.
 About BNP Paribas Solutions - Philippines Branch
Established in 2024, BNP Paribas Solutions Philippines Branch is a branch of BNP Paribas Group, a leading bank in Europe with an international reach. We provide support services, back-office operations services related to or which further the accomplishment of the corporation’s investment services, banking transaction processing, and equity investment.
 About Business line/Function:
Corporate and Institutional Banking has an active IT ecosystem with its own IT backbone that involves a large workforce of IT employees working for DEV, Testing and Support projects. 
  CIB ITO Production ensures the provision of industrialized and digital production services. The objective is to offer innovative products and services to its customers in a performing, global and secured environment, to speed up delivery and time to market. CIB ITO Production manages operational risk by running stable and robust IT production platforms. CIB ITO production hosts critical service delivery scope comprising of Global Markets, Global Banking, Client & Employee, ALM&T, Regulatory & Control IT and BP2S. 
 Position Purpose
You will be joining the Global Market Global Prime Finance Production Support team that provides application support services to Global Prime Finance business globally. The candidate will be interacting and working alongside the front office, developers, business analysts, middle office and infrastructure teams. Being at the fore front supporting the applications, the team members have high exposure to and work with the Front to Back Business teams on a daily basis within a fast-paced dynamic environment. 
 Responsibilities
This is a front office application support role that requires the candidate to investigate and resolve user, system & infrastructure generated issues across the Global Prime Finance Margin and Risk Production systems in a timely manner. You will be working closely with the regional and global teams across business, product, project management and technology teams. The candidate will also be expected to contribute to projects based on the core production management work streams such as stability programs e.g. Automation, Application Resilience etc.  
Drive an operational environment for front office business applications from daily operational tasks, ensuring a stable operating environment for the applications. 
Drive platform improvement initiatives in monitoring, stability, resiliency and capacity for Global Prime Finance systems across APAC 
Project manage the integration of the new Prime Solutions and Financing platform 
Engage actively with stakeholders including head of trading desk and technology managers 
Plan, review and execute change releases into production environment and work closely with business stakeholders, application developers, infrastructure teams and QA teams to minimize change related incidents 
Lead production governance meetings with compliance and control agenda 
Incident / Problem / Change management work 
Release management – being the gatekeepers for the production environment, ensuring all change is understood and scheduled appropriately 
Morning and weekend checks – in conjunction with global teams ensuring system readiness for the start of day and start of week 
Monitoring – use and continual improvement to the main monitoring tool 
Manage / participate in the implementation rollout of new services. 
Work with counterparts globally and ensuring there is a common/collective approach to issues/problems 
DR Drill – coordinate and participate annual DR events 
Assist in the automation of repetitive task 
Operate in a ‘follow the sun model’ to ensure issues are resolved globally 
Working alongside the existing team members on a shift basis. 
Provide on call coverage as required 
 Technical Requirements
Strong understanding of key IT infrastructure; Databases (SQL, Oracle, Sybase) , Servers (Windows, Linux) , Scripting (Bash, Python, PowerShell) , Batch control (Autosys, Control-M), Monitoring tools (Geneos, Dynatrace), Kubernetes  
Ability to both manage and adapt changes and complexity with confidence 
Takes initiative, self-learner, diligent, dependable and result driven team player 
Getting things done in large organizations – understanding of where to use processes and how to build and operate a network 
Self-sufficient drive and ability to work round blockers in a sustainable manner 
Good prioritization skills, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment 
Solid communication and interpersonal skills 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
Work across countries, regions and time zones with a broad range of cultures and technical capability 
Experience and understanding of Agile methodology
Good to have if you candidate has strong knowledge of financial markets and margin and risk methodologies and systems.

title: AWS Platform Security Architect
description:
NOTE: When you click the apply button, you will be re-directed to Cambridge University Press & Assessment’s website where you will be required to create a profile and upload a copy of your CV to complete your application.

Employment type: Permanent
Location: Makati City, Metro Manila
Work setup: Hybrid (open to 2x a week in the office)
Work schedule: 2pm to 10pm Manila time
Pay range: Php 122,000 to Php 166,000


Discover a world of endless possibilities with Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a distinguished global academic publisher and assessment organization proudly affiliated with the prestigious University of Cambridge.

We are looking for a Platform Security Lead/ Security Architect to join our English Technology Team. As a key member of our team, your goal will be to take the overall accountability for the Cloud Hosting and Security Strategies across the ELT Platforms, working with the key business stakeholders, Platform Lifecycle Managers, Solutions Architects, Central Technology, Support and our Vendors to analyze, agree and implement the appropriate cloud base hosting solutions and security measures.

Why Cambridge?

At Cambridge, our unwavering commitment is to excel in education, learning, and research on a global scale. With a presence in over 170 countries, we empower millions of individuals, unlocking their potential and enabling their success. From dedicated teachers shaping young minds to visionary researchers pushing the boundaries of knowledge, we embody a relentless pursuit of enlightenment, curiosity, and understanding.

We embrace change as an opportunity for growth and progress, constantly adapting to meet the evolving needs of our customers. Collaboration and attentive listening are at the heart of our journey, as we work hand in hand with our customers and each other to innovate and discover more effective ways to achieve our goals. We believe people thrive in an environment where Trust and Empowerment are at the forefront, which is why all our new team members are provided regularization on their first day so they can start #PursuingPotential from day one.

Joining Cambridge means becoming a part of an extraordinary institution renowned worldwide. Beyond that, you'll become a part of a vibrant and forward-thinking community that transcends tradition, fostering a culture of continuous growth and personal development. Here, we provide the right environment for you to thrive, supporting your professional journey and empowering you to reach your highest potential, that is why our pay philosophy is intricately tied to your skills and competencies, ensuring that your compensation aligns with the unique value you bring to the role you are applying for.

What can you get from Cambridge?

In this role, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with colleagues from diverse branches, expanding your horizons and enriching your understanding of different cultures. We value your wellbeing and offer stability, fostering your professional and personal growth through internal and external activities and training sessions to help enrich your skillset.

Enjoy work-life balance flexibility through our range of options, including flexible schedules, hybrid work arrangements, and generous paid leave. As a regular employee on Day One, you'll have access to comprehensive healthcare benefits, ensuring your peace of mind with coverage for dependents, group life insurance, and robust well-being programs.

What will you do as the English Platform Security Lead/ Security Architect?

Lead and mentor a small team of security engineers, providing technical guidance, managing priorities, and ensuring the execution of security initiatives aligned with platform operations.
Own the ELT Technology risk register and conduct risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies based on platform-specific risks and vulnerabilities. Leveraging frameworks such as NIST, ISO, and CIS to develop risk management programs in collaboration with Core Services.
Own and implement a robust Security Architecture Design to ensure a zero-trust approach across all APIs, integrating security into all aspects of platform design, deployment, and operations.
Working with Core Security, lead efforts in designing, testing, and refining security incident response plans and protocols. Manage and support ongoing threat intelligence programs and ensure timely remediation of identified security threats including completing comprehensive impact assessments of security related changes to platforms.

What makes you the ideal candidate for this role?

Experience in Platform Security, with the following:

CISSP Certification with strong knowledge of key domains:
Security & Risk Management
Identity & Access Management
Platform Security Architecture & Platform Operations (hands-on AWS security design and implementation)
Leadership: Proven ability to lead, mentor, and manage security teams and projects
Risk & Vulnerability Management: Skilled in threat modeling, vulnerability assessments, and penetration testing
Security Frameworks: Familiar with NIST, ISO/IEC 27001, CIS Controls, SOC 2
Technical Skills
IAM, SSO, MFA
Network security (firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS)
Cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Application security practices
Soft Skills
Strong communication and problem-solving
Education
Bachelor's in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field
Advanced certifications (AWS Security, CISM) are a plus
Preferred Qualifications

Experience in DevOps and CI/CD environments
Familiarity with Infrastructure-as-Code security practices for platform deployments (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation)
Exposure to automated security tooling and incident response

If you are driven by and have a passion for technology security and desire to be part of a globally renowned institution that celebrates innovation, embraces inclusion, and empowers learners, we invite you to pursue your potential with us.

title: Collections Officer (Makati, Alabang)
description:
About the Role
As a Collections Officer, you will perform collection activities through outbound communication efforts via the bank’s devices and document all transactions into the collections system for loans or credit card products. The purpose of this role is to collect due amounts and ensure client information in the database is accurate and up to date.
How you’ll contribute
Perform collections callouts and emails according to the collections workflow using the bank’s collections system.
Communicate with clients or related parties with the main goal of collecting promises to pay (PTP) and ensure accurate documentation of all transaction information into the collections system.
Monitor and reach the yearly and monthly KPIs (Number of connected calls daily, Number of PTPs collected daily, Number of kPTPs daily, Cash collected from target (team KPI), % of kPTP out of all connects, Call-Quality (per methodology of QA).
Escalate qualifying cases to their Team Leader for resolution (special cases, calls unable to be handled in a certain amount of time, etc.).
Prepare recommendation of accounts for endorsement to other Teams as an escalation measure (skip tracing, field visits, legal, etc.) according to escalation guidelines, in order to reach the client and secure payment.
May be assigned other tasks to support the Unit (temporary assignment to inbound calling, skip tracing verification, etc.).
What we’re looking for
With 3 years of experience in Collections gained from banks or other financial institutions.
Should have excellent decision making, negotiating, and communication skills
Must be willing to work on shifting schedule
Amenable to be assigned in Alabang and Makati
About Security Bank
Security Bank is one of the Philippines’ best capitalized private domestic universal banks.
Established in 1951 and publicly listed with the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE:SECB) in 1995, our major businesses cover retail, corporate, commercial, and business (MSME) banking.
We’re recognized as an Employer of Choice in Philippine banking by various award-giving bodies for our values-based culture, industry-leading engagement and benefits, and commitment to work-life balance.
Most recently, we ranked as the #2 best employer in the Philippines and #54 globally on the prestigious Forbes’ World’s Best Employers 2023 list.
At Security Bank, our approach to Human Capital Management (HCM) is embodied by our Employee Value Proposition (EVP): “YOU matter.”
Start your BetterBanking career with us today.

title: Data Specialist | Hybrid
description:
Let’s be real: most “data jobs” sound like glorified spreadsheet babysitting. This isn’t that. We’re looking for a Data Specialist who can wrestle messy data into submission, build pipelines that never hiccup, and quietly make everyone else’s dashboards look good. You’ll design and automate the systems that keep data flowing clean, fast, and trustworthy across our clients’ environments.
If you’ve ever yelled “it worked in dev!” at 2 a.m., only to fix it before anyone noticed—welcome home.
About First Focus
First Focus is Australia’s best Managed Service Provider (MSP), with 330+ technical professionals across Australia, New Zealand, and the Philippines. For more than 15 years we’ve been growing, delivering, and keeping things refreshingly drama-free. We hire smart people, trust them to do their jobs, and back them with real training, not just “online learning access.”
We’re proud of our Filipino team—they’re some of the sharpest humans we’ve got. You’ll be joining that crew, working on complex, high-impact systems while enjoying a culture that actually values you (and your merienda breaks).
What You’ll Do
Build and maintain reliable data pipelines, warehouses, and ETL processes across Azure and on-prem
Engineer solutions with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, and SQL
Automate everything you can with Terraform, Ansible, and CI/CD pipelines
Explore vector databases and support LLM data pipelines when needed
Contribute to Azure Datafoundry discussions and architecture POCs
Collaborate with devs, analysts, and cloud engineers to keep data healthy and scalable
Monitor, optimise, and occasionally save the day when a query goes rogue
What You’ll Bring
5+ years in data engineering, data management, or warehousing
Strong experience with Azure Data services, ETL frameworks, and SQL optimisation
Familiarity with data pipelines for LLMs or vector store management (nice-to-have)
Awareness of Azure Datafoundry (bonus points)
Scripting skills in Python, PowerShell, or similar
Experience with Terraform, Ansible, and DevOps pipelines
Background in a Managed Service Provider (MSP) or multi-client setup preferred

Standard AU shift, weekends off

Access to Uprise for 1:1 coaching with psychologists or counsellors
10 paid study days per year and certification exam fees covered

25 days paid leave annually
₱20,000 referral bonus and ₱10,000 MVP Award
Profit sharing and loyalty bonuses
Regular social events, team lunches, and zero forced karaoke (unless you start it)
Why First Focus
Hybrid work | Regular hours | Flexible leave options | High-end office
Paid training days | Certifications | Mentoring | Career growth
Loyalty profit share | Referral bonuses | A genuinely supportive team

Interested?

title: Senior Loan Processor/Parabroker WFH AU Mortgage Remote Cebu/Manilla
description:

Pathway to Cert IV Mortgage Broking

About You

What we will offer:

Professional Development: Ongoing training through personalised mentoring and comprehensive training programs.
