title: Security Control Assessor
description:
Control & Risk Compliance Analyst (GDS Philippines)
Today’s world is fueled by vast amounts of information. Data is more valuable than ever before. Protecting data and information systems is central to doing business, and everyone in EY Information Security has a critical role to play. Join a global team of over 950 people who collaborate to support the business of EY by protecting EY and client information assets! Our Information Security professionals enable EY to work securely and deliver secure products and services, as well as detect and quickly respond to security events as they happen. Together, the efforts of our dedicated team helps protect the EY brand and build client trust.
Within Information Security we blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security and technology solutions as we consider the entire security lifecycle. You will join a team of hardworking, security-focused individuals dedicated to supporting, protecting and enabling the business through innovative, secure solutions that provide speed to market and business value.

The opportunity
The Technology Assurance, Risk, and Policy (TARP) function within Information Security strives to create and promote a holistic Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) program by creating a robust, resilient, and proactive governance framework, supported by a strategic risk management approach and stringent compliance structures. It aims to integrate and align its GRC initiatives in line with the global firm's objectives and emerging threats within the cybersecurity landscape.
Furthermore, the Policy, Risk, and Controls (PRC) Enablement & Awareness team aims to establish policies and procedures that reflect the value we place on safeguarding our digital environment, while ensuring that these policies are effectively communicated and enforced across all levels of the organization. The Control & Risk Assessment team sits within PRC Enablement & Awareness and aims to directly enables the GRC program by designing control testing and risk assessment methodology to measure and quantify compliance to policies and control objectives.

Your key responsibilities
The Control & Risk Compliance Analyst will be expected to execute control testing plans, following the model for 1st line and 2nd line testing best-practice strategies. They will be responsible for routinely testing and assesses the effectiveness and efficiency of Information Security controls put in place to mitigate risks to determine if they are supporting the desired business outcomes under the support and direction of the Control & Risk Compliance team leaders.  Test plans include, but are not limited to, self-assessment questionnaires, control testing, and process assessments.  
Collaboration with other Information Security groups and external stakeholders across EY is key to this role. The primary service offering the Control & Risk Compliance Analyst will support is the EY China Compliance Program. This will mean they will need to work primarily with EY China stakeholders to evaluate and assess EY China’s compliance to Global InfoSec’s policies and control objectives. There will also be requirements to partner with other multi-departmental and multi-level stakeholders inclusive of, but not limited to Information Security, Client and Enterprise Technology, Data Protection, Global and Enterprise Risk Management, Internal Audit, Area and Regional Risk & Data teams, Service Line Quality Leaders, etc.

Skills and attributes for success
·       Execute and complete test plans for a variety of Information Security controls across the full scope of a Technology Risk Universe
·       Based on results of assessments and testing, assist control owners with the design and implementation of their controls in the organization's IT environment.
·       Build and maintain appropriate relationships with internal and external stakeholders.  
·       Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change.
·       Outstanding interpersonal, communication, organizational, and decision-making skills.
·       Ability to understand and integrate cultural differences to effectively participate on cross cultural teams.
·       Act as a thought leader in the firm, staying informed of changes in information security, regulatory requirements, audit standards, and industry trends, adjusting strategies, as necessary.
·       Demonstrate integrity and judgment within a professional environment.
 To qualify for the role, you must have
·       2+ years of experience in the Information Technology, Information Security and/or Risk Management field(s).
·       Audit experience or a demonstrated ability to design and test technology controls.
·       Experience working on global and virtual teams.
·       High proficiency in speaking, reading, and writing skills in English (primary). 
·       Moderate proficiency in speaking, reading, and writing skills in Mandarin (secondary).
·       An advanced degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field; equivalent work experience will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
 Ideally, you’ll also have
·       A working knowledge of external control standards like ISO 27001, NIST 800-53, COBIT, etc. and regulatory requirements like GDPR and SOX.
·       Skilled in Microsoft Office and M365 products; primarily Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, PowerApps, and PowerBI.
·       Flexibility to work outside of normal business hours when engaging with team members and stakeholders in various time zones.
·       Interest and ability to obtain one or more of the following or equivalent certifications: Certified Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC), Certified Information Systems Security Processional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information System Auditor (CISA), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC) in related area, CIPP, CIPT.
 What we offer
As part of this role, you will work in a highly coordinated, globally diverse team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer:
Continuous learning: You will develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We will provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a significant impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We will give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You will be accepted for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodations.
EY is committed to being an inclusive employer, and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.
If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
Apply now.

title: Virtual Assistant - Restaurant Operations
description:
Position: Virtual Assistant - Restaurant Operations
Location: Philippines, 
Role Type: Part-time (20hr/week) to start, moving to full time within 2-3 months
Salary: Competitive hourly rate ($6–$7.00/hr, based on experience)

*****IMPORTANT*****
To apply, kindly fill out this form: https://forms.gle/kBr4DswmnBrMq9iq6
Overview
A modern Indian kitchen and bar is seeking a Virtual Assistant to support its management team with a range of administrative, operational, and customer-service tasks.
This role is ideal for someone with prior restaurant or hospitality experience who understands the fast-paced nature of the industry and can bring structure, reliability, and strong organizational skills to the team.
The Virtual Assistant will manage scheduling, calendar coordination, payroll and bookkeeping assistance, inventory tracking, and email-based catering support. Experience with QuickBooks Online and Square is a plus, and familiarity with social media management is highly preferred. By keeping operations organized and communication flowing, this role helps ensure the restaurant continues to deliver smooth service behind the scenes.

Key Responsibilities
Administrative & Scheduling Support
Manage calendars and appointments for ownership and management team.
Schedule staff meetings, vendor appointments, and operational reminders.
Coordinate catering and event-related bookings.
Keep internal calendars and task lists organized and updated.
Operational & Bookkeeping Support
Track and update restaurant inventory levels; flag items for reorder.
Collect vendor quotes and coordinate service appointments (cleaning, pest control, maintenance, etc.).
Assist with payroll preparation and reporting.
Support bookkeeping tasks such as data entry and expense tracking using QuickBooks Online (QBO)

Customer Support & Communication
Manage incoming catering inquiries and client communication via email
Ensure prompt, professional responses to customer requests.
Maintain email templates and track inquiries through to completion.
Social Media & Marketing Assistance
Support basic social media management: post scheduling, caption drafting, and content creation & organization.
Coordinate updates with management for promotions or special events.
Maintain brand consistency across platforms.
Potential Expanded Responsibilities (as the role grows)
Update menus, hours, or promotions across Google Business, Yelp, and social platforms.
Help document restaurant workflows (inventory tracking, catering process, ordering checklists).
Track catering leads and assist with follow-up emails or proposal templates.
Maintain organized digital files for invoices, vendor contracts, and compliance documents.
Prepare weekly management reports (sales summaries, payroll, or inventory snapshots).

Required Qualifications
3+ years of experience in administrative, operations, or support roles.
Prior experience working in or supporting restaurant or hospitality businesses
Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail.
Excellent written English and email communication skills.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Proven track record of reliability, confidentiality, and proactive communication.

Bonus / Nice-to-Have
Experience with QuickBooks Online (QBO) and basic payroll preparation.
Familiarity with Square POS or similar restaurant payment systems.
Prior exposure to catering operations or client-service communication.
Social media management experience (Instagram, Facebook, etc.).
Interest in hospitality, customer experience, and process optimization.

title: AR FOLLOW UP SPECIALIST
description:
JOB SUMMARY
We are seeking a detail-oriented and results-driven professional to support the financial integrity of our organization through the accurate and timely recovery of outstanding medical claims. The ideal candidate will bring strong analytical capabilities, exceptional communication skills, and in-depth knowledge of insurance claims processes. This role is instrumental in optimizing revenue cycle performance and ensuring compliance with payer requirements.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
1.     Review and resolve outstanding claim accounts from worklists or management direction, focusing on denied claims across various payers and regions.
2.     Analyze account history and conduct in-depth research, including review of patient charts and encounter documentation, to support resolution.
3.     Investigate and follow up on denied claims, identifying causes related to coding discrepancies or contract issues. Prepare and attach appropriate documentation, gather additional information, and submit corrected claims to facilitate accurate and timely adjudication.
4.     Initiate and manage appeals for denied claims by researching root causes, collecting necessary documentation, making necessary account adjustments, and resubmitting claims. Maintain follow-up activities to ensure final resolution.
5.     Communicate claim issues and denial trends to leadership and contribute to continuous process improvement.
6.     Identifies, researches, and ensures timely processing of payments and error corrections, ensuring appropriate documentation of payments, allowances, denial, rejections, are recorded on individual accounts
7.     Review remittance advice and investigate underpayments or overpayments.
8.     Perform additional A/R tasks and support other departmental responsibilities as assigned.
9.  Reports security incidents and/or any identified security weaknesses.        
10.  Performs other tasks that may be assigned from time to time.     
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Graduate of any 4year college degree
Must have 2+ years in a Healthcare BPO setting
Knowledge of commercial, HMO, Medicare/Medicaid, and other payer requirements.
Working knowledge on the use of insurance payer websites ie: Availity, Optum, Medicare, Evicore portals.
Working knowledge with Practice Management systems, preferably KAREO a plus.
Effective communication abilities with and not limited to team members outside clients and patients.
Proven problem-solving skills. The ability to research and resolve complex insurance denials while obtaining a clear understanding to present actionable solutions.
Proficient knowledge of medical terminology is likely to be encountered in medical claims denials.
Denial management experience is a plus
PERKS OF JOINING US
Competitive Salary 
Hybrid arrangement (Training and nesting period is ONSITE-Alabang)
HMO on Day1 with FREE ONE DEPENDENT***
15% Night Differential
US Shifts 
Free Shuttle
Employee referral bonus
Employee engagements
Healthy working environment
Free webinars and internal trainings/events and more!
Office Location: Alabang Corporate Center

title: Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist | Hybrid | Sign-On Bonus
description:
Optimize, Test, and Transform Digital Journeys
Drive impactful user experiences by combining data-driven insights, technical precision, and creative experimentation to elevate website performance and conversions. Step into a global career in digital optimization where your skills shape online experiences with international impact. This role offers the unique chance to make your mark in the tech industry, refine user journeys, and craft lasting digital improvements-all while working from your home country.
Job Description
As a Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist, you will lead the development and execution of CRO strategies, implement advanced tracking, and drive experimentation to maximize site conversions. With expertise in GTM, GA4, and CRO tools, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making.
Job Overview
Employment type: Full-time
Shift: Night Shift, Weekends Off
Salary: PHP 90,000 to PHP 120,000
Work setup: Hybrid, Makati
Exciting Perks Await!
Sign-on Bonus equivalent to one month's salary
Day 1 HMO coverage with free dependent
Competitive Salary Package
Night differential pay to maximize your earnings
Hybrid work arrangement
Prime office location in Makati (Easy access to MRT stations, restaurants, and banks)
Fixed weekends off
Salary Advance Program through our banking partner (Eligibility and approval subject to bank assessment. Available to account holders with minimum of 6 months company tenure.)
Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)

Standard government and Emapta benefits
Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek
Minimum of 2 years' relevant experience in digital analytics, conversion rate optimization (CRO), or experimentation.
Proven expertise in Google Tag Manager (GTM) and Google Analytics 4 (GA4) (required)
Hands-on experience with A/B and multivariate testing platforms such as Optimizely, VWO, Convert, Mutiny, Google Optimize, Adobe Target, or AB Tasty.
Demonstrated success in CRO strategy, test planning, and data-driven experimentation to improve conversion performance.
Experience creating visual mockups or wireframes to communicate test experiences and hypotheses to stakeholders.
Solid understanding of HTML and CSS; JavaScript proficiency strongly preferred.
WordPress and WP Engine experience required for technical setup and tag implementation.
Familiarity with Marketo, HubSpot, or other marketing automation tools is a plus.
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, identify insights, and recommend optimization actions.
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to execute technical tasks accurately and efficiently in fast-paced environments.
Your Daily Tasks
Implement custom website event tracking using Google Tag Manager and validate setups with GTM debugger tools
Collaborate with stakeholders to design and execute CRO experiments
Report on CRO test performance and communicate insights
Ensure seamless measurement and interpretation of on-site behaviors
Use HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (as needed) to support test variants and tagging implementations
Contribute to ongoing CRO strategy, including hypothesis generation and prioritization
Participate in website design and layout discussions to support test variants and user experience improvements
About the Client
Optimizing Tech for Global Impact
Our client is a leading software solutions provider dedicated to driving measurable change through technology. They empower organizations with innovative platforms, advanced analytics, and digital transformation strategies to create lasting impact worldwide. title: Recruitment Manager
description:
About the role

FiberHome Phils., Inc. is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Recruitment Manager to join our dynamic team. As the Recruitment Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving the company's talent acquisition strategy and ensuring we attract, identify, and hire the best-fit candidates for our growing business. This is a full-time, on-site position based in our Mandaluyong City office.
What you'll be doing
Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies and processes to support the company's hiring needs
Manage the end-to-end recruitment lifecycle, including job posting, screening, interviewing, and coordinating with hiring managers
Leverage various sourcing channels, such as job boards, social media, and professional networks, to build a robust pipeline of qualified candidates
Conduct in-depth candidate assessments and make recommendations to hiring managers
Collaborate with HR and department heads to understand business requirements and align recruitment activities
Monitor and analyse recruitment metrics to identify areas for improvement and drive hiring efficiencies
Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process
Contribute to the development and implementation of the company's employer branding initiatives
What we're looking for
Minimum 5 years of experience in a recruitment or talent acquisition role, preferably in the Human Resources or Recruitment industry
Strong understanding of recruitment best practices, sourcing techniques, and candidate assessment methods
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills to effectively interact with candidates and hiring managers
Analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address hiring challenges
Experience in using applicant tracking systems and other recruitment-related software
Familiarity with employment laws and regulations relevant to the recruitment process
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field
What we offer

At FiberHome Phils., Inc., we are committed to providing our employees with a rewarding and fulfilling work experience. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical insurance, retirement plans, and opportunities for professional development. We also encourage a healthy work-life balance through flexible working arrangements and wellness initiatives.
If you are passionate about talent acquisition and excited to join a growing organization, we encourage you to apply for this Recruitment Manager role at FiberHome Phils., Inc. today.

title: URGENT: HR Business Partner - Employee Relations | Ortigas, Pasig
description:

title: Director (IT Incident Management/Crisis Response)
company: Visa Philippines Business Processing Center, Corp.
description:
As a Regional Lead on Visa's Operational Resilience team, you will be responsible for executing and managing the Operational Resilience program within the AP region. You will spend your days collaborating with key stakeholders across the AP region, with an aim to increase the overall preparedness to manage local risks, challenges and regulatory inquiries, all awhile adhering to global strategies, policies, and procedures. You will be expected to support regional operational coverage, ensuring robust operational stability and supporting business growth.  

Key Responsibilities 
Implement and maintain the global center’s policies, frameworks, and standards within the region. 
Respond to and manage incidents within the region in accordance with global processes and frameworks. Provide coverage for adjacent regions during periods of staff shortages. 
Identify and adapt practices as necessary to meet regional needs and requirements. Support Global Center development efforts for new initiatives. 
Report on regional performance against established KPIs, KRIs, and other performance metrics and requirements. 
Deliver training programs and promote awareness within the region. 
Ensure the annual program is successfully achieved in collaboration with global and regional resources.  
Conduct region-specific exercises based on locally/regionally identified risks. 
Pilot new initiatives at the regional level. 
Facilitate timely support for dialogues and discussions with regional leadership, clients, and regulators. 
Influence and embed operational resilience into regional practices and initiatives. 
 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

Qualifications
12 or more years of work experience with a bachelor’s degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g., Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6 or more years of work experience with a PhD
Advanced working knowledge of office software (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, and Project) and/or other report building tools with experience in data analytics and metrics reporting.
Highly driven, resourceful, and results oriented individual, allowing for limited oversight, with proven leadership in crisis management, business continuity, vendor resilience, and operational resilience methodology and best practice.
Advanced understanding of incident response and recovery processes. Working against solving significantly complex problems.
Experience with AI/ML Technology, Data Quality Management (DQM), Everbridge, Fusion, VEOCI, is desired.
Knowledge of risk, regulatory, audit, and governance best practices.
Proven ability to have led multiple small-medium sized projects effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with the potential for people management capability.
Ability to manage complex issues with limited direct managerial oversight.
A team player with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to mentor junior level employees.
Solid analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with an aim to influence the situation to architect successful outcomes.

title: Merchant Onboarding Manager | Implementation | SaaS
description:
Are you driven, results-oriented and a team player?
With 17,000 customers in over 15 countries, StoreHub's mission is to make business awesome for everyone by providing retail and restaurant businesses the technology and services they need to succeed.
At StoreHub, we believe that technology is essential for businesses to survive and thrive in today's fast-changing world. We also believe that equal access to technology is a fundamental right. That's why we’re committed to bridging this gap and making technology accessible to all, regardless of their background. By focusing on serving needs, not just profit, we level the playing field for those who have been marginalized. Our customers trust us with the success of their businesses, and we play to win by enabling everyone to build successful businesses.
At StoreHub we model ourselves on a pro-sports team whereby all of your colleagues are extraordinary at what they do and are highly effective collaborators. 
On a team like this, you learn the most, perform your best work, improve the fastest, and feel most fulfilled professionally.
If this is a journey you’d like to embark on, keep reading!

In the Merchant Onboarding Manager role, you’d be responsible for driving the success of our customers through using the StoreHub platform effectively and maximizing on our robust features to guarantee they get the most value.
You don’t need to be an expert or know everything about our industry. But the work is challenging, fast-paced, and always on the bleeding edge. So, we’re looking for someone with a curious mind, a strong drive to make things happen, and a passion to keep improving yourself.
What you will do:
Work with merchants to drive revenue and ensure operational excellence in their business
Educate merchants on StoreHub features, promotional campaigns, and market insights
Build long-lasting relationships and trust with merchants to understand more about their business and their key success factors
Negotiate deals with merchants and work with the marketing team to develop matching initiatives to boost revenue
Manage multiple projects at a time, delivering outcomes according to deadlines, while ensuring excellent quality standards are met
Be the focal point for merchant inquiries and take ownership of their requests/issues by working with different departments i.e. customer care, onboarding, and product to ensure satisfaction and merchant retention
Share challenges and ideas openly to ensure that the team is up to date-and constantly improving performance
What you'll need to have:
Experience of 1 to 3 years in roles related to Key Account, Merchandising, Retail Business, Business Development, Project Management
A BIG passion for helping small businesses
Lots of self-drive with the motivation and desire to succeed
Tenacity to develop ideas independently and thrive in a fast-paced startup environment
Strong conversational and rapport-building skills
Logical thinking and strong problem-solving skills
Ability to interact with a broad set of businesses and stakeholders while presenting both over the phone and in person
Knowledge using G-suite and basic Excel
Must be willing to work on-site in Makati City.
What makes working at StoreHub awesome (and refreshing!):
Our people - for real! StoreHubbers are some of the smartest and most interesting people you can work with. Expect to do a lot of peer-learning.
Culture of Candour.We embrace directness, hate bureaucracy, and move fast. If you're tired of 'corporate nonsense' you'll feel right at home.
Cutting edge tools. If something can be automated, we'll make it happen. You will be introduced to many different tools we use that support everyday tasks, so that we can focus our minds on the kind of work that matters.
Impact not just effort. We recognize that results are not tied to the number of hours worked. There's no reward for long hours with poor results and no penalty for leaving on time if your work is excellent. To be great, most of us have to put in considerable effort, but we don't measure contribution by hard work or long hours.
CHANGE. Our core values are super important to us. The more you resonate with them, the more you'll find yourself a good fit.
Communicate for Clarity
Humble and Hungry
Authentic but not an *sshole
Nimble and Quick
Growth Mindset
Efficiency and Excellence
  We do have all the other cool perks too:
Apple MacBooks for everyone to help you do your best work
Comprehensive healthcare benefits with our HMO Plan
Career development and mentorship
Cutting edge tools. You will be introduced to over 20 different tools we use that support basic tasks, so that we can focus our minds on the kind of work that matters.
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at StoreHub. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: BPO Operations Director
description:
Job Description
The Operations Director will lead high-performing teams across a diverse portfolio, including Accounting, Architecture & Engineering, Customer Service, Back Office, IT, and Healthcare, ensuring excellence in service delivery, operational efficiency, and financial performance.
This strategic, hands-on leader will align multi-industry operations with evolving client needs, technology trends, compliance standards, and business objectives. Key responsibilities include driving cross-functional initiatives, optimizing workflows, implementing best practices, and fostering a culture of performance, accountability, and client success.
Key Responsibilities:
Live and execute the mission and vision of the organization.
Communicate effectively and build strong relationships with all stakeholders, across all levels, and all departments, to ensure alignment and collaboration.
Lead multi-industry operations teams by developing tailored strategies for each vertical—ensuring high service levels across accounting, A&E, IT, customer service, healthcare, and back-office accounts.
Drive business growth by identifying opportunities within current accounts and collaborating on new business proposals and service expansion.
Conduct regular business reviews to evaluate team performance, account health, and client satisfaction across industries.
Translate business goals into operational objectives while aligning resources and capabilities across departments and account types.
Ensure service delivery excellence by implementing vertical-specific KPIs, operational metrics, and performance dashboards.
Champion process improvement and technology integration tailored to the unique needs of each industry (e.g., HIPAA compliance in healthcare, security in IT, SLAs in accounting services).
Develop long-term operational strategies that enable scalability, profitability, and high levels of client satisfaction.
Create talent development programs and succession plans tailored to the needs of each account type, ensuring domain expertise and high employee engagement.
Assess and manage risk across all business units including regulatory risks, service disruptions, and burnout.
Optimize budgets and resource allocation to ensure cost-effective operations without compromising quality or compliance.
Stay ahead of technology trends, tools, and automation strategies relevant to each vertical and implement enhancements to improve agent efficiency and customer experience.
Establish policies and processes that support both standardization and customization, ensuring operational consistency with flexibility for vertical-specific needs.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in any discipline is required.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (intermediate to advanced level).
Proven experience in customer service with strong people management skills.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience as an Operations Director in a BPO or similar multi-account environment.
Demonstrated expertise in team leadership and performance management.
Strong decision-making and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Exceptional organizational skills and keen attention to detail.
High level of integrity, honesty, and professionalism.
Adaptable, calm under pressure, optimistic, and flexible.
Results-oriented with a focus on productivity and quality.
Quick learner with the ability to assimilate new processes independently.
Self-motivated and confident working with minimal supervision.
Ability to build positive yet firm relationships with employees.
Consistent attendance and punctuality required.
Willingness to work 100% onsite, including night shifts, rotating schedules, weekends, and holidays as needed.
WHY INTELASSIST?
We grow together. We value your effort. We aim to empower you.

title: Network Analyst III - JR0298855
description:
As the world works and lives faster, FIS is leading the way. Our fintech solutions touch nearly every market, company and person on the planet. Our teams are inclusive and diverse. Our colleagues work together and celebrate together. If you want to advance the world of fintech, we’d like to ask you: Are you FIS?
Role location: Hybrid (two days in-office, three days virtual)
About the team:
The Network Delivery Team provides managed IT services for FIS clients. The high caliber members are among the technology leaders within FIS, utilizing multiple technologies and vendors. This team requires motivated members who are ready to develop personally and professionally as FIS grows to meet the challenges presented by today’s global economies.
What will you be doing:
Performs device configurations, internal operating system upgrades and software upgrades and deploys network devices including routers, switches, and SD-WAN devices.
Implements and manages SD-WAN solutions using VMware VeloCloud SD-WAN.
Troubleshoots and resolves network issues related to SD-WAN deployments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate SD-WAN solutions with existing network infrastructure and applications.
Provides technical support and guidance to team members on SD-WAN best practices.
Follows documented network services processes and procedures – identifies gaps in processes or documentation and suggests improvements.
Monitors, responds, and provides resolution for all network problem and incident tickets.
Utilizing ServiceNow, documents status updates and problem resolutions.
Performs customer service duties and responds to customer requests as defined by management.
Responds to customer requests as defined by management completing assignments in a timely manner with an acceptable level of quality.
Troubleshoots network problems and recommends corrective procedures; assists with troubleshooting circuit equipment and all other network issues.
Prepares activity reports as requested by management.
Identifies opportunities to improve workflow and creates supporting documentation for review by peers and management.
Maintains network services documentation related to work area.
Completes network change requests in accordance with service level agreements.
Maintains network lab and equipment inventory.

What you bring:
With experience in supporting WAN, LAN, WLAN networks
Knowledge of network technologies, i.e., routers, switches, load balancers, firewalls, network and routing protocols, DNS
Knowledge of basic IT technologies, i.e., operating systems, network devices, software development and architecture
Requires knowledge of basic office tools
Ability to understand and apply technical concepts
Team skills, including the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships
Flexibility, versatility, dependability

What we offer you:
At FIS, you can learn, grow and make an impact in your career. Our benefits include:
Flexible and creative work environment
Diverse and collaborative atmosphere
Professional and personal development resources
Opportunities to volunteer and support charities
Competitive salary and benefits

title: Travel Counselor
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
Travel Counselor
#4th in Great Place to Work's Best Company To Work For 2025
#10th in Fortune Magazine’s 2025 World’s Most Admired Companies
#1st in the J.D. Power 2024 U.S. Credit Card Satisfaction Study of National Credit Card Issuers
Top GBS Employers for the Philippines (2025) by the Everest Group

At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and leadership behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you’ll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.

Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.
How will you make an impact in this role?
You will delight our Card Members with unforgettable experiences 
As a Travel Counselor, you will refine your knowledge of customer needs by asking personalized fact-finding questions to deliver an innovative and extraordinary service through multi-channel servicing designed to meet customers unique requirements.
You will research, plan and execute customized travel experiences, through booking domestic and international flights, car and/or hotel travel arrangements.
You will use your in-depth knowledge to help Card Members access their exclusive benefits, including how to make the most of their Membership Reward points. 
You take your understanding of new and existing product offerings, value proposition and relevance to the Card Member, to curate your recommendation. 
At times, you will need to de-escalate a Card Member’s stress, when unforeseen travel situations arise.
You will always put the Card Member’s experience at the forefront of everything you do, reinforcing the Membership First mindset and winning their loyalty.
You will do back-office/callback work to make sure top-of-the-line customer service is given to our card members.
Minimum Qualifications
At least 1 year Travel industry experience within the last two years
At least 2 years collective Contact Centre/BPO experience
Basic knowledge of luxury products (e.g., airlines, hotels, cruise & tour, and/or dining, theatre, retail, fashion, sports & events)
Exceptional Customer Service and interpersonal skills
Ability to meet/exceed targets in meeting customer satisfaction & sales
Can think creatively & multitask
Exceptional written & verbal communication skills
A will to win and have worked in a Performance-based environment where regular coaching and feedback is provided to achieve results
Strong collaboration with others to achieve shared goals
Can work in a rotating roster, 24/7 schedule including Public Holidays
 Preferred Qualifications
Global Distribution System (GDS) working knowledge; Sabre is advantageous
Additional Details:
 Location: BGC Corporate Center 2, 5th Avenue corner 30th Street, Bonifacio Global City, Taguig
Workplace Flexibility: Full time. Must be amenable to follow a hybrid work arrangement (onsite and work from home)
Work From Home Requirements:
Must have at least 25 mbps internet connection plan / speed
Must have a private & quiet area to work at home
American Express offers a fantastic and diverse working environment. High performance is rewarded with target driven incentives.

We back you with benefits that support your holistic well-being so you can be and deliver your best. This means caring for you and your loved ones' physical, financial, and mental health, as well as providing the flexibility you need to thrive personally and professionally:
Competitive base salaries 
Bonus incentives

 To know more about our recruitment process, you may watch this short video – What to Expect: Recruitment at American Express

title: Digital Staff - Sharepoint & Power App
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. 

Position Details    
EY’s GDS Assurance Digital team’s mission is to develop, implement and integrate technology solutions that better serve our audit clients and engagement teams. As a member of EY’s core Assurance practice, you’ll develop a deep Audit related technical knowledge and outstanding database, data analytics and programming skills. 
 
Ever-increasing regulations require audit departments to gather, organize and analyses more data than ever before. Often the data necessary to satisfy these ever-increasing and complex regulations must be collected from a variety of systems and departments throughout an organization. Effectively and efficiently handling the variety and volume of data is often extremely challenging and time consuming for a company. 
 
EY's GDS Assurance Digital team members work side-by-side with the firm's partners, clients and audit technical subject matter experts to develop and incorporate technology solutions that enhance value-add, improve efficiencies and enable our clients with disruptive and market leading tools supporting Assurance. 
 
GDS Assurance Digital provides solution architecture, application development, testing and maintenance support to the global Assurance service line both on a pro-active basis and in response to specific requests. 
 
EY is currently seeking a Staff Software Engineer to join our GDS Assurance Digital practice in NCR/BLR and HYD, India.
Requirements (including experience, skills and additional qualifications)    A Bachelor's degree (BE/BTech/MCA & MBA) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems Management, Accounting, Finance or a related field with adequate industry experience.
Technical skills requirements
•    Minimum 1+ years of experience with Power Apps development and good experience in Canvas & model driven application development
•    Environment setup for Development, managing & publishing apps
•    Developing Microsoft Flows with REST-APIs, automated emails and SMS
•    Localization (PowerApps app Language based on to region)
•    Experience in sending Push notification to a specific user
•    Some experience in SharePoint, SPFx/React
•    Experience in Power BI Dashboard Development

Good to have skill
•    Experience in Azure DevOps
•    Experience in Agile / Scrum methodology
•    Integrating MS Remote Assist or any similar video chatting tools/services
•    SharePoint User Management/Permissions and List Settings
Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities: 
•    An ability to quickly understand complex concepts and use technology to support data modeling, analysis, visualization or process automation
•    Selects appropriately from applicable standards, methods, tools and applications and uses accordingly
•    Ability to work within a multi-disciplinary team structure, but also independently
•    Demonstrates analytical and systematic approach to problem solving
•    Communicates fluently orally and in writing and can present complex technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences
•    Able to plan, schedule and monitor work activities in order to meet time and quality targets
•    Able to absorb rapidly new technical information, business acumen, and apply it effectively
•    Ability to work in a team environment with strong customer focus, good listening, negotiation and problem-resolution skills
Additional skills requirements:
 
•    The expectations are that a Senior will be able to maintain long-term client relationships and network and cultivate business development opportunities 
•    Provide high quality client services by directing daily progress of engagement work, informing engagement manager of engagement status, and managing staff performance.
•    Must have presentation skills ' ability to create PowerPoint deck to communicate solution architecture to various stakeholders.
•    Should have understanding and experience of software development best practices
•    Excellent business communication, Consulting, Quality process skills
•    Must be a team player
 EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Motion Designer | Night Shift
description:
We’re looking for a creative and detail-oriented Motion Designer to join our growing creative team!
You’ll help bring our brand and products to life through engaging motion design — transforming static visuals into dynamic, high-quality animations that captivate audiences across web, video, and social media channels.
Working closely with the Video Director, Creative Director, and Product Marketing teams, you’ll create motion assets that clearly communicate complex ideas in a visually compelling and brand-aligned way.
Key Responsibilities:
Motion & Animation Design
Conceptualize and produce motion graphics and animations that highlight product features, workflows, and brand stories.
Create animated product demos and explainer videos using existing Figma design files, brand assets, and UI mockups.
Design and animate digital ads, social media content, and short promotional videos optimized for various channels (YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, etc.).
Animate typography, icons, logos, and other visual elements to enhance storytelling and viewer engagement.
Collaboration & Brand Alignment
Work closely with cross-functional teams (Video, Creative, and Product Marketing) to ensure consistency in branding, visual identity, and messaging.
Maintain technical accuracy and design integrity across all deliverables.
Manage multiple projects efficiently, balancing creativity with timelines and production needs.
Innovation & Continuous Improvement
Stay up to date with motion trends, animation tools, and design techniques to bring fresh, modern ideas to your work.
Proactively suggest ways to elevate visual storytelling and optimize content for engagement.

title: Customer Relations Associate - Collection Services. Day Shift!
description:

Credit Corp Group stand out as exceptional debt collection agencies. With a robust team of over 1,900 professionals, we have offices located in Australia, the USA, New Zealand, and the Philippines. As an ASX200 company, we operate primarily through two business streams: debt purchasing and consumer lending. Our Manila site supports three lines of business during the morning shift – AUS Debt Purchase, CCFS Lending, and Collection Services. Our performance in recent years has been impressive, and we are continually expanding. Central to our business values are fairness, respect, and inclusion for all our clients and employees.

What is the role of a Customer Relations Associate - Collection Services?

 You will serve as the frontline of our debt collection operations, playing a vital role within our organization.
As a problem solver, this position is ideal for those who are curious and driven to uncover solutions!
You will manage a portfolio of accounts or work through a Dialler system, dedicating half of your time to tracking down customers and the other half to negotiating, helping them find a sustainable way to address their financial challenges.

What's in it for you?
Enjoy working in a flexible Day shift Catering to both NZ  and AU business hours depending on the team assignment.
Predominantly weekends off
Paid extensive and structured training before you start the role 
Free breakfast choices
Free fresh fruits twice a week
Life insurance on day 1
HMO benefits on your first day + dependents upon tenure
Retirement  package to insure your future
Career development and progression 
Competitive monthly salary package (basic + tax free allowances) with performance appraisals  
Experience work-life balance in a culture-friendly environment

What are we looking for? 
Willing to work full time in the office (Onsite)
Willing to work  on some holidays with pay   
Some experience working towards deadlines, targets or KPIs in a previous role
Clear, confident English communicator with the ability to persuade or influence people
Competitive personality and drive for success
Respectful and empathetic 
Must have authenticated SSS, Philhealth, Pagibig,  TIN numbers and valid IDs ready before applying

You don't need to be harsh to work as a Debt Collector! We prioritize attitude over years of experience, so previous collections experience is not required. If you believe you have the skills to excel in this role, we would be thrilled to hear from you.
All of our leaders began their journey as Customer Relations Associates, so when we talk about career advancement, we truly mean it; we live by our values.
Join our exciting collections team today!

title: Data Scientist | Work-from-home, Nightshift
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
DATA SCIENTIST
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN DATA SCIENTIST?
At OptiCloud, we’re pioneering digital sustainability by redefining how businesses and individuals manage their data in the cloud era. Our AI-powered platform identifies and eliminates digital waste—unnecessary compute, redundant data, idle resources—turning inefficiency into actionable savings for businesses and measurable climate impact for the planet.
We’re looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join our mission-driven team and shape the algorithms and methodologies at the heart of our platform. You will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing cutting-edge machine learning models to analyze cloud data, email, photo, video, and other common data types to optimize storage, reduce waste, and unlock value.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Define and lead OptiCloud’s data science strategy, aligning models and methods with business and environmental impact goals.
Design, develop, and deploy machine learning algorithms to identify redundant, obsolete, or unnecessary data across corporate and personal cloud ecosystems (including emails, photos, videos, and files).
Build scalable pipelines to process and analyze structured and unstructured data from diverse sources in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate models into the OptiCloud platform, delivering actionable insights to customers.
Evaluate and experiment with cutting-edge approaches (including NLP, computer vision, anomaly detection) for digital waste detection across different data types.
Manage and mentor data scientists and machine learning engineers, balancing hands-on model development with leadership responsibilities.
Communicate findings and strategies clearly to executive leadership, customers, and external stakeholders, translating complex data science concepts into business value.
Monitor and continuously improve model performance to ensure accuracy, fairness, and ethical AI practices.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
✅ PhD or Masters in Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
✅ 5+ years of experience leading data science projects and implementing data-driven strategies at enterprise level.
✅ Proven track record of hands-on development of machine learning solutions deployed in production environments.
✅ Strong expertise in supervised and unsupervised learning, NLP, anomaly detection, clustering, and data deduplication techniques.
✅ Experience working with large-scale cloud data platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and relevant tools (e.g., Azure ML Studio, Azure Cloud, Spark, Databricks, TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
✅ Ability to bridge technical and non-technical teams, with excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
✅ Passion for sustainability, climate tech, and leveraging AI for positive environmental and societal impact.

title: Order Management & Customer Service Representative | Work onsite - Nightshift
description:

WHAT IS A/AN ORDER MANAGEMENT & CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE?

title: Customer Service Reservations Specialist
description:
The Customer Service Reservations Specialist is a key customer-facing role within a high-energy call center environment responsible for handling incoming calls, emails, and chats from customers and travel agents seeking to book luxury hotel rooms and cruises at high-end resorts across Fiji, French Polynesia, and Australia. Working collaboratively with team members, the primary responsibility is to convert customer inquiries into confirmed bookings while maintaining the highest standards of satisfaction for clients, customers, and staff. This position requires the ability to balance sales conversion objectives with exceptional customer service in a dynamic, fast-paced setting across multiple communication channels.
Responsibilities:
Serve as a remote front office extension for luxury tourism brands, delivering superior customer service and 24/7 availability that meets North American market expectations
Manage all inbound inquiries across phone, email, and chat platforms from prospective guests and travel professionals interested in booking high-end resort accommodations and cruise experiences
Develop and maintain comprehensive product knowledge including destination features, amenities, pricing structures, and availability to accurately respond to customer questions
Convert customer inquiries into confirmed reservations by guiding prospects through the booking process and closing sales opportunities
Maintain detailed and accurate booking records, manage customer data responsibly, and follow company protocols to ensure consistency and compliance
Handle customer concerns professionally and empathetically, resolving issues when possible or escalating appropriately to management
Ensure all interactions reflect the quality standards and brand reputation of the luxury tourism entities represented
Support team collaboration by sharing best practices, assisting colleagues with challenging inquiries, and contributing to a positive working environment
Maximize conversion rates through direct-to-product channels while balancing exceptional customer service delivery
Meet or exceed performance targets for booking conversion, customer satisfaction, and quality assurance metrics
Process and record payment transactions as required
Maintain calm and professionalism throughout the customer engagement process while managing multiple inquiries
Proactively assist travel agents and customers with problems that may occur on a reservation and work across departments to provide seamless resolution
May be required to travel overseas to visit resorts and cruise companies for familiarization purposes
Perform other duties as assigned by management based on business requirements
Qualifications
Education & Work Background
College Graduate (Required)
Travel industry experience; preferably in hotel reservations with a minimum of 1 year (Required)
Previous experience selling travel or travel-related products (Required)
Call center experience in hospitality (hotels/resorts), tour operations, or airlines (Strongly Preferred)
Work experience as a travel agent or in the airline industry (Preferred)
Travel agent experience (Beneficial and strong consideration factor)
Accounting experience (Helpful)
Core Competencies
Ability to clearly articulate information in a respectful, helpful, and professional manner
Excellent verbal communication, organizational, and listening skills with strong English language proficiency
Well-spoken in English with a good understanding of the language
Outstanding problem-solving and decision-making capabilities
Detail-oriented with accuracy in all work results (must maintain 99.9% accuracy, especially when quoting rates)
Self-motivated self-starter capable of achieving personal goals while supporting departmental objectives
Demonstrated strong computer proficiency
Demonstrated reliability with an excellent attendance record
Ability to work flexible shifts from home or office, including weekends and holidays (Monday– Friday 7:00 am–7:00 pm; Saturday–Sunday 12:00 pm–6:00 pm)
Ability to efficiently gain and remain current on all client product knowledge
Ability to multi-task and manage multiple inquiries whilst maintaining the integrity and accuracy of communication
Required Skills
Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, with adeptness in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Solid understanding of email programs such as Outlook
Basic understanding of software applications and web browsers

title: Cash Administrator | Hybrid | Ortigas | Mid Shift
description:
Drive Accuracy and Impact in a Global Commercial Network

Shift your finance career into high gear with a global role in the commercial parking industry. From auditing equipment to reconciling revenue lanes, you'll help streamline the financial engine behind smarter, safer, and more connected parking experiences.

Job Description

As a Cash Administrator, you'll ensure daily and monthly cash transactions are reconciled and posted accurately into the general ledger. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to investigate discrepancies and maintain seamless financial operations using Oracle and automation tools.

Job Overview

Employment type: Full-Time
Shift: Mid Shift, Mondays to Fridays, 03:00 PM to 12:00 MN
Work setup: Hybrid, Ortigas

Exciting Perks Await!
Competitive Salary Package
Hybrid work arrangement
HMO coverage with free dependent upon regularization
Prime office location in Ortigas (Easy access to MRT stations, restaurants, and banks)
Fixed weekends off
Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization
Standard government and Emapta benefits
Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek
Bachelor's degree in Accountancy, Accounting Technology, Finance, or a related field (required).
1-3 years of hands-on experience in cash application, bank reconciliation, and account reconciliation within a corporate or shared service environment.
Proven ability to manage high-volume transactions with accuracy, timeliness, and strong attention to detail.
Experienced user of Cash Module (including Oracle) or similar ERP systems.
Familiarity with ERP platforms and Cash Application Automation tools is a strong advantage.
Functional understanding of core finance processes such as Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel (formulas, pivot tables, reconciliation templates).
Strong analytical mindset, accountability, and commitment to meeting deadlines.
Your Daily Tasks
Post cash transactions into the general ledger on a daily basis
Perform daily bank reconciliations and explain all discrepancies between ledger and bank balances
Perform monthly bank reconciliations as part of month-end procedures
Understand the nature of bank transactions and make appropriate entries in the Oracle general ledger
Liaise with Finance and non-Finance teams to ensure accurate data and postings
Review and code supplier charges and payments with the team
Keep the Cash Manager updated on progress and escalate issues promptly
Audit parking equipment reports against bank processing reports
Identify and challenge exceptions with service providers and ensure timely resolution
Build and maintain strong relationships with senior members of non-cash teams
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely posting of payments through correct journal entries
Recommend and apply corrective actions to ensure accurate reconciliations
About the Client

Our client is a long-established leader in the parking and commercial services industry, operating hundreds of sites across the UK. With over 90 years of expertise and backed by global investors, the organization delivers cutting-edge, customer-focused parking solutions-combining technology, security, and sustainable practices. Their mission: make parking effortless through innovation, integrity, and exceptional service.

Who Are We

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Be empowered through personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Manager, Finance
description:
About Us 
MoneyHero Group (Nasdaq: MNY) is a market leading financial products platform in Greater Southeast Asia, reaching over 7.4m monthly unique users and working with more than 270 commercial partners across four markets including Singapore, Hong Kong S.A.R., The Philippines, and Taiwan.
The Finance team comprises dedicated professionals committed to shaping the financial health and success of the organization. Our team is characterized by expertise, diligence, and a shared goal of ensuring the financial well-being and sustainability of the company. Operating within a dynamic and collaborative environment, we provide diverse opportunities for growth and development in a regional setting. Join us to navigate intriguing financial challenges and contribute to the well-being of the organization every day.
What We Offer
You will be entitled to a competitive salary and attractive benefits, including:
Annual leave, birthday leave, tenure leave, international remote work leave, and more

About the Job
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Finance Manager to lead our local country entity's financial strategy, execution, and management. In this role, you will play a crucial part in supporting the local management team through economic analysis, planning, forecasting, and decision-making processes. Your responsibilities will extend to effective working capital and treasury management, tax compliance, and audit activities.
Summary
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Finance Manager to lead our local country entity's financial strategy, execution, and management. In this role, you will play a crucial part in supporting the local management team through economic analysis, planning, forecasting, and decision-making processes. Your responsibilities will extend to effective working capital and treasury management, tax compliance, and audit activities.
This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute significantly to the financial success of our local operations while actively participating in strategic decision-making at both local and group levels. If you possess a strong financial acumen, leadership skills, and a track record of successful finance transformation, we would love to have you apply for this pivotal role here at MoneyHero Group.
Skills
Lead local country entity’s finance strategy, execution and management
Assists the local management team in the business unit economic analysis, planning, forecasting and decision-making
Effective working capital and treasury management and
Tax compliance and audit
Hiring, training, managing and overseeing of the finance team and their day-to-day finance and accounting functions
Lead and manage finance automation and transformation projects involving people, systems, tools and processes
Ensures proper documentation and maintenance of accounting records in accordance with applicable regulatory and financial reporting frameworks
Preparation of monthly reporting package for HQ Finance
Preparation and filing of periodic tax and other statutory returns before the relevant regulatory bodies in the Philippines Liaise with local auditors and local regulators (e.g., BIR, SEC, BOI, BSP and Insurance Commission)
Assists the HQ Finance during quarterly reporting, due diligence audits, and Group audits
Observes and enforces compliance to business controls ensuring the efficiency, effectiveness, integrity & business focus of financial systems & processes

Qualifications
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) in the Philippines, preferably with auditing background from an auditor or client perspective or both
Updated knowledge of the local tax system and local commercial laws

title: Custom Production Estimator (Australian Home Building)
description:
Custom Production Estimator (Australian Home Building)
  
Are you a seasoned and Australian-experienced Estimator with a focus on both production and custom home building? My Offshore Team (MOT) is searching for a highly skilled professional to join our team, serving some of the best clients in the thriving Australian residential construction sector!

We are on the lookout for a dedicated Custom Production Estimator who possesses expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel and mandatory experience across the full estimation lifecycle.

This is your chance to manage complex whole package estimating, elevate your career, and contribute to significant Australian projects from the comfort of your home in the Philippines. Higher consideration is given to those seeking a hybrid or office-based role in Makati.

What We're Looking For: Minimum 4+ Years Recent Australian Experience   

We require an experienced estimator who meets the following mandatory criteria:
  
Mandatory Requirements   
Experience: Minimum 4+ years of production estimating experience in Australia (must be recent and relevant).
Technical Core: Expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data management, calculations, and reporting.
Core Functions: Mandatory knowledge of the full estimation lifecycle, including:
Detailed Takeoffs
Creating accurate Bills of Quantities (BoQs)
Managing Purchase Orders (POs)
Understanding Margin/Costing
Estimating Scope: Experience with Whole Package Estimating (not limited to simple square meterage calculations).
Material Knowledge: Basic knowledge or idea of material usage, consumption, and waste.
Quality Control: Experience in reviewing and checking (peer or own) estimates to ensure accuracy.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Work Style & Attitude: Proven ability to work both independently and as a team member, with an excellent, positive attitude and a clear drive for professional growth.
  
Highly Desired Experience (Ideal Candidate)   
Experience Type: Recent experience in Custom Home estimating (a mix of production and custom is ideal).
Longevity: 5+ years of total Australian estimating experience.
Software: Direct experience with Bluebeam or Planswift (similar take-off software is acceptable).
Leadership: Past Team Leader experience or strong, expressed aspirations to lead a team.
Supplier Relations: Willingness and past experience talking to Australian suppliers for pricing and technical queries.
  --

Why Choose My Offshore Team?   
At My Offshore Team, we value talent, accuracy, and professional drive. When you join MOT, you'll:
Work alongside experienced professionals, expanding your knowledge in the Australian residential market.
Enjoy a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, commensurate with your experience.
Benefit from excellent opportunities for professional development and career progression, supporting any leadership aspirations.
Enjoy the flexibility of remote work (Philippines-based), with higher consideration given to work-from-office or hybrid candidates as they are often more ideal for client requests, leading to faster application processing.
Experience unmatched full-time job security.
  
Benefits:   
Competitive salary and health benefits.
HMO from the first month of employment and an extra dependent at regularisation.
Life insurance.
Probationary Leaves and Compassionate leaves.
Opportunities for professional development and career progression.
20 leave days.
Ready to manage whole package estimating and take the next step in your career? Join My Offshore Team and be part of our continued success!

Apply today!

If this job isn't the perfect fit for you, but you know someone who might be an ideal candidate, please feel free to share this job opening with them. Send their CV to hireme@myoffshoreteam.com

Visit our website at www.myoffshoreteam.ph for more information.

title: Data Center Site Operations Engineer (ST Telemedia Global Data Centres)...
location: Santa Ana, Manila City, Metro Manila
description:

Any other duties or projects as assigned by the management. Qualifications At least 1 year of relevant work experience in 24x7 DC or facility operations environment, or fresh graduate with relevant qualifications such as building services, mechanical engineering Possess general knowledge of Network Critical Infrastructure
Good knowledge in M&E and building facilities-related systems, such as CRACs, Chiller, PDUs, UPS, Switchgears Ops, DX cooling, Network structure cabling, Security, etc. Meticulous team player with the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment Other preferred skills: Possess relevant facilities management and/or data centre-related certifications, such as ITIL, PMP, Uptime Institute and TIA-942 Familiar with certifications standards, such as ISO 20000 / 22301 / 27001, 45001, 9001, Uptime Institute, TIA-942
Good contractor management and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams Prepared to be on 24x7 standby recall to provide extra manpower coverage when necessary Equal Opportunity Employer Globe’s hiring process promotes equal opportunity to applicants, Any form of discrimination is not tolerated throughout the entire employee lifecycle, including the hiring process such as in posting vacancies, selecting, and interviewing applicants. title: Forester
description:
