Has prior fieldwork experience

title: Software Engineer
description:
Markem-Imaje is a trusted global manufacturer of product identification and traceability solutions. Our connected solutions help manufacturers to reduce waste, increase efficiency, achieve compliance and protect their brand.  
We offer the most complete range of market-leading marking and coding systems along with software, services and consumable solutions so you can streamline all your printing needs from one supplier. 
The Role
Software Engineer designs and configures solutions based on customer specific requirements and agreed specifications, performs testing of the configured solution, technical documentations, and installations until completion of the customer agreed solution. Software engineer also supports the Solution Consultant and the Project Delivery Team in reviewing of the technical specifications, efforts required and in liaising with customers and OEM partners whenever required.

What you will do:
Responsible in reviewing final Solution Proposal and converts it into a Detailed Technical Design Specification that contains complete software functionalities, project deliverables and acceptance criteria.
Execution of solution engineering process and its activities. Ensure that development and solution configuration are in alignment with the agreed project plans, budget and meet customer expectations.
Utilize the Standard Solution Template as the base for solution configuration and configure it according to the approved Detailed Technical Design Specification.
Responsible for performing in house testing of the configured solution and escalate out of scope request to immediate manager for approval.
Responsible for solution delivery, performs SAT, Trainings and supports Go Live.
Support and escalate issues encountered during installation, FAT and SAT.
Responsible for Project handover to Global Helpdesk team.

What you need to have:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
At least 3 year of experience in software development lifecycle and project delivery methodology including possessing the competencies as follows:
Configuration of PC-based software solutions, able to test, install and validate performance against project deliverables
Various .NET programming language, expertise on VB.NET.
Proven experience on Relational Databases (MS SQL), use of SQL Reporting service
Prior documentation skills is a MUST
Experience in direct customer-facing and acts in a professional manner to enhance customer satisfaction.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written communication skills and able to interact with diverse, cross cultural stakeholders 
Basic understanding of IT / networking and aptitude for quickly learning new software tools and hardware
Ability to work in a multi-tasked environment
Knowledgeable in manufacturing and supply chain automation is a plus

Other requirements:
The position involves approximately 10% - 25% of travel, on average, and includes domestic and international travel.  This involves traveling to customer sites, possibly involving air travel.
What we offer:
Growth & learning opportunities within international environments or assignments
Flexible Work Arrangement policy
Bonus scheme
Attractive benefits such as Annual leave, HMO for Employee & Dependents
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
You’ll only be the right candidate if you are aligned to our values and culture: 
Collaborative entrepreneurial spirit
Winning through customers
High ethical standards, openness and trust
Expectations for results
Respect and value people

If you believe you match our values and have the experience we’re looking for, then apply! We can’t wait to hear from you

title: SEO Project Lead
description:
About StrataNova Tech
StrataNova Tech is a fast-growing digital innovation and marketing solutions company under MindSpace Management (Malaysia). We specialize in developing high-performing digital campaigns and data-driven growth strategies across highly competitive industries, including iGaming, sports, and entertainment.
Our team is built on collaboration, creativity, and excellence — empowering professionals to take ownership of impactful projects that make a measurable difference.
Join us and be part of an agile, forward-thinking organization that values your expertise, autonomy, and results.
Position Summary
We are seeking a strategic and experienced SEO Project Lead to spearhead our SEO initiatives and drive measurable growth across multiple international markets.
This leadership-track role requires a highly analytical and proactive professional who can manage end-to-end SEO operations, oversee technical and content performance, and lead a team to achieve strong results in competitive online environments.
Key Responsibilities
Lead and manage full-cycle SEO projects — from strategy to execution — ensuring traffic, conversion, and technical KPIs are met.
Oversee timelines, resource allocation, and risk management, providing consistent progress reports to stakeholders.
Develop SEO strategies tailored for high-risk, competitive industries such as casino, sports betting, and live gaming.
Previous experience in iGaming, casino, or sports betting industries is required.
Stay up-to-date with search engine algorithm changes (Google's E-E-A-T, SERP updates) and iGaming compliance regulations.
Manage all aspects of SEO, including keyword targeting, content optimization, link building, and technical performance (geo/IP targeting, latency, dynamic content).
Collaborate with internal teams (content, development, design, and marketing) to align SEO with broader business objectives.
Mentor and train junior SEO specialists to maintain performance quality and brand consistency.
Utilize analytics and SEO tools such as Ahrefs, SEMrush, GA4, Search Console, and Screaming Frog to monitor and report on performance.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree or Diploma in Marketing, Communications, IT, or a related field.
At least 5 years of hands-on SEO experience, managing full-cycle campaigns and leading teams.
Minimum of 5+ years team management experience is required.
Proven success in driving measurable SEO performance in competitive industries.
Strong understanding of technical SEO, content architecture, and backlink strategies.
Proficient in Ahrefs, SEMrush, GA4, GSC, Screaming Frog, and related SEO tools.
Excellent leadership, communication, and project management skills.
Strong command of English (written and verbal).
What We Offer
Competitive base salary plus project-based commissions.
Full autonomy to build and manage your own SEO team with a flexible budget.
Work-from-home flexibility with global exposure.
Opportunity to grow within a results-driven, performance-oriented organization.
How to Apply
Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their updated resume highlighting relevant experience and achievements in SEO strategy and execution.
Applications will be processed under D&D Solutions Management OPC as the Employer of Record for StrataNova Tech.

title: Property Management Assistant (AU Experience | Remote)
description:
About the Company
Crew Offshoring Solutions (Crew) is a BPO looking for amazing offshore talent to work with its high caliber of Australian and UK clients.
On a day-to-day basis you will be working with an Australian real estate agency, trusted by local property investors in South East Queensland to deliver the highest standards and quality of service in property management.
About the Role
Your primary responsibilities will be to enter and manage bills via the Console Property Management system and ensuring that property management files are up to date and consistent across the portfolio of managements.
Depending on your level of experience, you may also be called on to assist with rental property listings, schedule open homes and inspections, coordinate tenants and tradespeople for repairs and maintenance, and manage key administrative tasks like lease preparation and following up rental arrears.
This role requires strong organisational skills, industry experience, and the ability to work independently while supporting a team. Familiarity with the property management software, Console and other peripheral systems experience is essential.
Key Responsibilities
Primary
Entering property bills and invoices into the Console PM system and ensuring that payment of important bills are front of mind for payment by senior staff members.
Ensuring that property management files are up to date and well maintained.
Secondary (desired)
Creating rental property listings on Realestate.com.au and / or Domain.com.au, including but not limited to; adding photos, descriptions and features of the property and weekly pricing within the admin portal.
Scheduling open homes and coordinating with Australian based property managers and prospective tenants.
Evaluating tenancy applications and putting forward suitable tenants based on the selection criteria set forth by the agency principal.
Preparing pro forma lease agreements for signing by tenants and landlords.
Procuring tradespeople and scheduling property repairs & maintenance.
Supplying tradespeople with information about the building or individual apartment.
Answering phone calls from tenants and logging their requests within the respective property management platform.
Coordinating routine inspections with Australian based property managers and tenants.
Maintaining a calendar of critical dates across the property portfolio, ensuring lease end dates and rental review are front of mind for senior property managers.
Ensuring that tenants that have fallen into arrears are being followed up and assisting senior property managers to case manage the remediation of their ledgers.
Assisting with the senior property manager with preparation of tribunal files.
Qualifications & Technical Skills
Attention to detail
Proven experience in property management (Australian Real Estate experience required).
Familiarity with Console property management software.
Knowledge of the Australian real estate market.
Strong communication, interpersonal, and multitasking skills.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
Relevant qualifications in Real Estate or Business (preferred).
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Job Benefits
Generous compensation package offered, including 13th month pay, penalty rates on swapped holidays, HMO (including for one dependent), employer government contributions and 20 leave credits. 
Work remotely with a highly collaborative and supportive team.
Enjoy a culture that values professional development and innovation.
Be part of a market leading Australian real estate agency. 
Equipment and remote working equipment provided.

title: Integration Architect
description:
About the Role
We’re looking for an Integration Subject Matter Expert (SME) who can design, implement, and optimize end-to-end integrations using API middleware and ETL tools within a cloud migration setup. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, scalable integration frameworks and guide the entire integration lifecycle—from planning to automation.
Key Responsibilities
Design and implement end-to-end integrations using API middleware tools, REST APIs, and ETL/data transformation solutions.
Lead integration architecture across cloud and on-prem environments, ensuring reliability, scalability, and security.
Manage configuration, testing, deployment, and troubleshooting in complex integration topologies.
Collaborate with development, QA, and business teams for smooth delivery of integration workflows.
Analyze requirements, document technical specifications, and ensure robust governance and security.
Support post-migration activities such as tuning, automation, and disaster recovery strategies.
Provide technical mentorship on integration best practices, data synchronization, and middleware management.
Must-Have Qualifications
5–7 years of experience in system integration and middleware implementation.
Hands-on expertise with API middleware, REST APIs, web services, and ETL/data transformation tools.
Solid understanding of integration design patterns, security, and automation.
Strong skills in SQL, Unix/Linux scripting, and troubleshooting integration frameworks.
Experience in integration for cloud migration or hybrid architectures.
Good-to-Have
Certifications in AWS, Azure, or equivalent cloud platforms.
Knowledge of Salesforce, Snowflake, or other modern data integration platforms.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Exposure to data orchestration and API management tools.
Why Join Us
Be part of a strategic digital transformation for one of the top banks in the Philippines.
Work with cutting-edge cloud and API integration technologies.
Collaborate with an elite global delivery team driving modernization across APAC.
Competitive contract and hybrid setup based in Manila.

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly accountable and experienced Offshore Sourcer / Recruiting Administrator to support our recruiting team. This individual will play a key role in identifying and engaging top talent across a variety of non-IT functions. The ideal candidate will have strong agency recruiting experience, excellent written communication, and be deeply familiar with North American workplace communication norms.
This role requires someone who is tech-savvy, organized, and committed to long-term success in a performance-driven environment
Duties and Responsibilities:
Sourcing & Talent Identification
Review detailed job descriptions and interpret hiring manager needs.
Search, screen, and shortlist candidates using LinkedIn, Bullhorn, and external databases.
Generate Boolean search strings and leverage advanced filters to improve candidate match quality.
Maintain a strong talent pipeline for active and forecasted roles.
Candidate Outreach & Engagement
Draft and send customized outreach messages to candidates.
Introduce roles in a professional, culturally fluent tone that aligns with North American communication norms.
Coordinate interest handoffs to our lead recruiter; no phone or video calls required initially.
Maintain a professional, brand-aligned candidate experience throughout the sourcing process.
Recruitment Admin Support
Track all sourcing activity in Bullhorn ATS including status updates, notes, and next steps.
Ensure all candidate records are clean, current, and complete with appropriate tags and source attribution.
Support resume formatting, manual uploads, and candidate tracking spreadsheets as needed.
KPI-Driven Execution
Meet weekly and monthly performance metrics (e.g., candidate outreach volume, lead conversion rate).
Adapt to recruiter feedback and continuously refine sourcing strategy based on results.
Participate in regular check-ins and provide progress updates to the recruiting team.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience: Minimum of 5 years of recruiting experience, with a strong preference for prior agency and staffing experience.
Proven success in high-volume sourcing and candidate engagement.
Experience working with international or North American clients is an advantage.
Strong employment stability and a desire to build a long-term career within the organization.
References and Reasons for leaving current career will be taken into account.
Prior experience in sourcing or recruiting with any of the following roles is preferred:
General admin and customer service
Sales
Project Managers
Accountants
H&S and Sustainability
HR
Geologists
Engineers
Technical Skills:
Bullhorn ATS or equivalent (e.g., JobDiva, Greenhouse, Lever).
LinkedIn Recruiter proficiency and strong Boolean search knowledge.
Google Workspace: Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Calendar.
Comfort with Slack, Microsoft Teams, Zoom.
CRM or data hygiene experience is a plus.
Soft Skills:
Exceptional written English, professional tone, and attention to cultural nuance.
High level of accountability and ownership of tasks.
Receptive to feedback and willing to iterate through processes.
Detail-oriented and data-conscious with strong organizational habits.
Interested in long-term career growth with a client-focused mindset.
What benefits await you by joining Intelassist?
Global career advancement and networking opportunities.
Access to both virtual and on-site intensive courses for career and personal development enhancement.
Monetary rewards for successful referrals that are hired.
Guaranteed weekends off and a total of 20 paid leave days upon regularization.
Collaborative work environment
Eligibility for Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) coverage starting from the first month of employment, with coverage of up to 100,000 PHP per illness.
About Intelassist
Established in 2007, Intelassist is a remote staffing organization that originated from a collaboration between US-based industry professionals and an experienced operational team in Manila, Philippines. Our US team brings over 20 years of experience in engineering, manufacturing, IT, finance, and high-level operations, while our Manila-based team offers over 15 years of experience in delivering exceptional support to global enterprises.
Our coast-to-coast US offices, in collaboration with our dedicated employees in the Philippines, enable us to deliver results to clients in various markets and for a wide range of roles. With over 15 years of experience in the BPO industry, Intelassist places a strong emphasis on organizational resilience and social stewardship to foster lasting, meaningful partnerships within our team and with our clients.
At the core of our business lie our people. Our ability to recruit, train, and, most importantly, retain exceptional team members is not only what enables Intelassist to attract the region’s finest talent but also what bestows stability upon our clients through reduced turnover and tangible outcomes.
With a workforce of slightly over 1,000 employees, we strike a balance – substantial enough to possess profound insight into the Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) industry, yet intimate enough to maintain the family-like, high-energy work atmosphere that our candidates seek.
At Intelassist, we specialize in sourcing, training, and retaining top-tier talent, each exclusively dedicated to meeting our clients’ unique needs. Our proven track record and local presence ensure that Intelassist clients enjoy increased productivity, reduced staff turnover, and significant cost savings
WHY INTELASSIST?
We grow together. We value your effort. We aim to empower you.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
BASIC FUNCTION:
The Digital Marketing Analyst supports the organization’s digital initiatives by developing, executing, and optimizing strategies that enhance brand visibility, strengthen customer engagement, and drive participation in digital programs.
This role is responsible for managing digital platforms and customer engagement systems, coordinating with partners to expand program value, and ensuring excellent user and dealer experience. The officer also supports digital marketing campaigns, monitors analytics, and contributes to data-driven improvements across online and mobile channels.
 Working closely with the Digital Marketing Supervisor, and external partners, the Digital Marketing Officer ensures seamless execution of initiatives that align with national marketing goals while continuously enhancing engagement, retention, and performance metrics.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
·       Manage the company’s digital loyalty and rewards platform, ensuring efficient operations and positive user experience.
·       Coordinate with internal teams and partners to enhance platform functionality, engagement, and overall performance.
·       Plan and implement digital campaigns and tactical promotions to drive awareness, usage, and retention.
·       Build and maintain partnerships with merchants and third-party collaborators to expand program offerings.
·       Monitor program data, analyze user trends, and generate insights for continuous improvement.
·       Ensure compliance with company policies and data privacy standards across all digital assets.
·       Provide customer support, training, and communication materials to assist dealers and users.
·       Perform other marketing-related tasks assigned by the Digital Marketing Supervisor.

JOB SPECIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Management, Economics, or any related field. Additional certifications in digital marketing, data analytics, or mobile app marketing are an advantage.
2–4 years of experience in digital marketing, brand management, customer engagement, or loyalty program management.– ideally in the agriculture or automotive industries.
Strong organizational and coordination skills with attention to detail.
Ability to multitask and manage timelines effectively.
Comfortable collaborating with internal stakeholders and external partners.
Proficient in Microsoft Office, Excel, Google Sheets and familiar with basic marketing tools; design software experience is a plus.

title: Client Success Coordinator | Onsite-Ortigas
description:
CLIENT SUCCESS COORDINATOR
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN CLIENT SUCCESS COORDINATOR?
The purpose of this role is to facilitate digital marketing booking workflow, acting as the liaison and primary point of contact for the Client Partner team (who own the client relationship) and the Digital Trading team, who are responsible for campaign activation. This is a conduit role ensuring end clients are able to activate their bookings on platform, and coordinating between internal teams to ensure optimal efficiency. This role will require strong organisational skills, a proactive mindset, and a passion for digital performance media.
As a Client Success Coordinator, you will play a critical support role at News Xtend. Working closely with Client Partners, you’ll help manage creative and reporting workflow, as well as general support to deliver exceptional digital marketing campaigns for Xtend’s Tier 2 accounts.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Support the execution of digital campaigns in SEM, Paid Social and Programmatic channels for Xtend customers, ensuring SLA’s are met for all briefed work including campaign setup, creative asset delivery, and dashboard reporting
Assist Client Partners prepare for strategic monthly and quarterly client calls by inputting performance data and insights for presentation
Work cross-functionally with Xtend’s Digital Trading and Creative teams to manage campaign optimisations, brief creative updates, and ensure on-time delivery of assets
Monitor campaign health, identify early signs of performance issues or creative fatigue, and escalate insights to Digital Trading team for resolution
Stay informed on our digital product suite (The Trade Desk, Google, Meta, LinkedIn, etc.) to support the Client Partner team in identifying strategic upsell opportunities
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Clear, professional communication skills with the confidence to collaborate and contribute with internal stakeholders
Strong attention to detail, a problem-solving mindset, and an eagerness to learn
Strong customer service skills include SLA management and prioritization
Key Metrics
Stakeholder feedback
Meet or exceed SLAs for BAU activity and critical response and resolution
OKR completion
Education & Experience
Comfort working with cross-functional teams and structured workflows
Previous exposure to digital advertising platforms (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn) is a plus

title: Training Manager — Mortgage Operations (Loan Processors & Parabrokers)
description:
The Opportunity
We’re hiring an experienced Training Manager to design, deliver, and continuously improve training for our loan processors and parabrokers in the Australian mortgage space. You’ll own onboarding, upskilling, and quality coaching—so new hires ramp quickly and the whole team stays sharp on lender policy, serviceability, compliance, and client communication.
What You’ll Do
Training Strategy & Delivery
Build a role-based curriculum and structured onboarding for loan processors and parabrokers (30-60-90 day plans).
Run live workshops, labs, and simulations (e.g., end-to-end application packaging, scenario triage, serviceability calculations).
Create modular e-learning (LMS), SOPs, checklists, and job aids for day-to-day execution.
Set and administer assessments (knowledge checks, case studies, nesting plans, calibrations).
Operational Excellence & Quality
Calibrate quality standards and scorecards (first-pass submission rate, data accuracy, compliance completeness, SLA adherence).
Perform regular QA reviews and coaching; run monthly calibrations with brokers/leads.
Convert best practices into repeatable SOPs; keep them current as lender policies evolve.
Tools, Policy & Compliance Enablement
Train on lender portals, CRMs, and serviceability tools; champion accurate data entry and documentation.
Maintain policy playbooks mapping lender rules to common scenarios and edge cases.
Embed compliance requirements (e.g., NCCP context, BID/record-keeping, privacy) into everyday workflows.
Stakeholder Partnership & Continuous Improvement
Partner with brokers and ops leads to spot skill gaps, run refreshers, and iterate training.
Use performance data to prioritize training roadmaps and reduce rework or delays.
Onboard new lenders/process changes quickly with concise enablement packs.
What Your Trainees Will Master (Scope You’ll Teach & Coach)
Preparing complete lender submissions and packaging applications end-to-end.
Interacting with customers to collect required information and set clear expectations.
Analysing payslips and financial statements; validating income and liabilities.
Liaising with brokers to clarify scenarios and select lender pathways.
Cross-referencing lender policy to find solutions for standard and complex deals.
Running serviceability across multiple lenders and documenting results.
Verifying that documentation is accurate, complete, and submission-ready.
Entering data into the CRM; generating lender compliance documents.
Emailing proposals and compliance docs to clients for review and signing.
Lodging applications; actioning missing info and conditional approval requests.
Driving unconditional approvals and assisting with loan contract signing.
Proactive updates to customers, buyers’ agents, and conveyancers through to settlement.
Post-settlement tasks (pricing and rate reviews).
Managing complex/urgent requests and day-to-day admin (email queues, lender follow-ups).
Success Metrics (KPIs you’ll influence)
Ramp time for new hires (to independent handling of files).
First-pass submission rate and rework rate.
Data accuracy & compliance completeness (QA score).
Turnaround time to unconditional approval and to settlement.
SLA adherence for client and stakeholder updates.
Client satisfaction/NPS for processing milestones.
Training adoption (assessment scores, certification completion).
What You’ll Bring
3–5+ years training/enablement experience in Australian mortgage operations (brokerage, aggregator, or lender), or 5+ years as a senior processor/parabroker with proven mentoring/coaching experience.
Deep knowledge of lender policies, serviceability, documentation standards, and submission workflows.
Hands-on familiarity with mortgage CRMs and lender portals (e.g., Mercury/Salestrekker/ApplyOnline or similar) and serviceability/borrowing calculators.
Strength in instructional design (adult learning), facilitation (virtual & in-person), and assessment creation.
Data-driven mindset; comfortable building scorecards, interpreting QA results, and turning insights into training.
Clear, empathetic communication; able to translate policy detail into practical steps and checklists.
Strong documentation skills—SOPs, playbooks, and concise enablement packs.
Nice to Have
Experience enabling distributed or Manila-based teams supporting Australian brokers.
Exposure to compliance frameworks relevant to mortgage broking (e.g., BID, record-keeping, privacy).
LMS administration and basic multimedia authoring (screen captures, quick how-to videos).
Benefits
Competitive compensation
Growth budget for certifications and courses
Modern tool stack and supportive leadership
Remote-friendly with AU-aligned hours

title: HVAC Draftsperson
description:
Job Description

At Realcognita, we’re committed to solving some of the industry’s most pressing challenges in building administration, and empowering builders with the technologically advanced tools and resources they need to compete in an evolving industry. We’re proud to have partnered with some of the world’s largest, most prominent residential building companies, helping them scale up, reduce costs, and deliver projects on time and on budget. We’re an experienced team of former builders, industry leaders, and experienced professionals located around the globe: Australia, the Philippines, Singapore, and the United States. Together, we’re on a mission to empower visionary builders. We offer competitive pay and benefits in addition to working to develop you and your career through educational opportunities, training, and mentorship. Help us build the best company culture out there.

Job Requirements

Proven experience in HVAC industry, ideally as a draftsperson or mechanical engineer (2 years + ideal, but open to less experienced candidates who show potential)
Can interpret construction drawings, house plans & associated documentation such as specifications and addenda
Degree qualified in Mechanical Engineering OR a degree recognized under the Philippines Technological Council Accreditation and Certification Board for Engineering and Technology (PTC-ACBET)
Knowledge and application of heat transfer/heat load principles
Knowledge and application of duct design principles
Can interpret manufacturer technical data sheets and manuals
Intermediate general computing skills (comfortable with MS Office & can navigate/learn new software programs easily)
Intermediate MS Excel
Experience with Plandroid drafting software highly advantageous
Experience with Revit MEP or AutoCAD advantageous for future plans
Knowledge or experience relating to residential air-conditioning in the Australian market advantageous (NCC & Australian Standards)
Knowledge or experience with products from well-known unit manufacturers advantageous (Fujitsu, Samsung, Daikin, Rinnai, Hisense, Haier etc)
Knowledge or experience with products from Australian duct equipment & controls manufacturers advantageous (Advantage Air or Polyaire)

Candidate Attributes:
Attention to detail
Quick and keen learner
Organized
Math & engineering background
Desire to provide high levels of customer service to both internal and external stakeholders
Can follow instructions and pre-existing procedures
Can think "outside the box" when necessary
Shows initiative


Job Responsibilities

Design, draft & estimate bill of materials for ducted reverse cycle air-conditioning systems for Australian residential home builders (Class 1 buildings)
Preliminary heat load assessment and equipment selection, typical system sizes will range between 7.0 - 30.0 kW
Draft basic preliminary layouts for client/homeowner to sign off, showing unit locations, outlet locations, controller locations, plus system details such as brand, capacity etc.
Duct design/layout using Advantage Air or Polyaire equipment
Compile bill of materials for projects that are ready for installation
System balancing and static pressure calculations as required
Provide Consolidated Energy with accurate information and fast turnarounds based on their requirements


Job Benefits

Salary: based on experience and skillsets
Work Set-up: Onsite @ BGC
Vacation Leave/Sick Leave
Mandatory Government Benefits/13th Month Pay
Annual Appraisal & Birthday cash gift
HMO upon hire

title: Account Manager - Marketplaces | Onsite | Ortigas | Day 1 HMO
description:
Innovating Commerce in Global Health & Wellness

Drive performance, strategy, and success across the world's biggest ecommerce platforms-where data meets creativity and your ideas turn into measurable growth.

Our client is a world-leading provider of wellness and rehabilitation products, connecting science, technology, and commerce to improve lives. With operations spanning multiple continents and partnerships across the health ecosystem, they bring trusted brands to the digital marketplace. Their ecommerce division drives innovation through data analytics, AI, and global marketplace strategies-making them an industry powerhouse shaping the future of health commerce worldwide.

Job Description

As an Account Manager - Marketplaces, you'll lead ecommerce operations and growth strategies across top platforms like Amazon and Walmart. You'll manage listings, pricing, inventory, and brand presence while partnering with cross-functional teams to boost visibility, performance, and profitability in a competitive digital landscape.

Job Overview

Employment type: Full-time
Shift: Night Shift, Weekends Off
Work setup: Onsite (Megatower, Ortigas)

Exciting Perks Await!
Day 1 HMO coverage with free dependent
Competitive Salary Package
Night differential pay to maximize your earnings
Prime office location in Ortigas (Easy access to MRT stations, restaurants, and banks)
Fixed weekends off
Salary Advance Program through our banking partner (Eligibility and approval subject to bank assessment. Available to account holders with minimum of 6 months company tenure.)
Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization
Standard government and Emapta benefits
Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek
Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Ecommerce, or related field
3+ years of experience managing ecommerce marketplace accounts (Amazon Seller Central/Vendor Central, Walmart Marketplace, etc.)
Proven track record of driving revenue growth and optimizing account performance in a fast-paced digital commerce environment
Strong knowledge of ecommerce platforms, digital merchandising, and online marketing strategies
Knowledge of AI-powered keyword research tools (e.g., Helium 10, Jungle Scout, Perpetua)
Analytical mindset with proficiency in Excel, Google Analytics, and marketplace reporting tools
Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship-building skills
Detail-oriented with strong project management abilities
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building AI-enhanced dashboards in Power BI, Looker, or Tableau
Skilled in using LLMs (e.g., ChatGPT, Jasper, Copy.ai) for reporting and content generation
Familiarity with AI chat agents or workflow tools for automating marketplace tasks
Knowledge of AI-driven review sentiment analysis tools to interpret customer feedback
Your Daily Tasks

Marketplace Strategy & Growth
Develop and execute marketplace account strategies to achieve revenue, profitability, and market share targets
Monitor competitor activity and marketplace trends to identify opportunities for growth
Collaborate with digital marketing teams to plan and execute paid search, sponsored product, and promotional campaigns
Account & Relationship Management
Serve as the primary contact for marketplace account managers and platform representatives
Manage joint business planning, negotiate terms, and track performance against KPIs
Build strong relationships with external partners to secure merchandising opportunities and enhance visibility
Product Content & Optimization
Ensure listings are SEO-optimized with compelling titles, bullet points, images, A+ content, and brand store enhancements
Maintain product catalog accuracy, manage variations, and oversee detail page improvements
Collaborate with creative teams for brand-aligned visuals and video content
Oversee brand registry, IP protection, and review strategies
Inventory, Pricing & Operations
Partner with supply chain and inventory teams to forecast demand and prevent stockouts
Plan and execute promotions, coupons, and seasonal campaigns (Prime Day, Black Friday, Cyber Monday)
Monitor fulfillment methods (FBA, FBM, WFS) and optimize for profitability
Ensure compliance with marketplace requirements and maintain pricing strategies
Coordinate with operations and 3PL partners for seamless fulfillment
Analytics & Reporting
Utilize tools like Amazon Business Reports, Helium 10, PacVue, and Seller Board to track KPIs
Provide regular reports on sales, traffic, conversion, and ROI
Identify and resolve risks such as suppressed listings or Buy Box loss
Present actionable insights to leadership and cross-functional teams
KPIs:
Total sales revenue (per marketplace, category, and SKU level)
% of optimized listings (SEO, A+ content, brand store updates)
Buy Box ownership percentage
In-stock rate across top SKUs
Required Competencies

Executes on Strategic Direction
Supports strategic initiatives across teams, vendors, and customers
Identifies and addresses challenges proactively
Adapts to shifting priorities while maintaining focus on company success
Collaborates effectively to achieve shared objectives
Energizes the Organization
Acts in alignment with company Vision, Purpose, and Values
Takes initiative and inspires others through action
Guides teams through change and builds confidence in success
Shares expertise and fosters collaboration
Drives & Delivers Results
Aligns performance goals and fosters accountability
Collaborates across functions to optimize resources
Anticipates risks and drives proactive solutions
Consistently meets or exceeds targets with high-quality outcomes
Builds Organizational Capabilities
Seeks continuous improvement and development
Acts as an ambassador for the organization, attracting and nurturing talent
Builds trust through emotional intelligence and awareness of internal dynamics
Demonstrates self-awareness and adaptability to achieve success
Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Accounting Operations Analyst II
description:

title: Regional Lead (APAC)
description:
What will you contribute?
As part of the US Payments, Customer Support Team, the Regional Lead will be responsible to support customers using Finastra payments systems and customer systems. The support will include functional application support, internal coordinating between internal stakeholders including but not limited to Finastra Product, Infrastructure, and Development teams. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, resourceful, and have excellent customer facing skills . We are looking for an individual who is able to coordinate, assist and maintain solid customer relationship. On a daily basis, you will collaborate with our Support Engineers, Infrastructure, Product, and Development to effectively support customers on their Payments platform. 
Responsibilities:
• Check the Morning Checklist for client prod outage and prioritize with CS and Dev on-call if needed.
• Check for client new escalations and coordinate with CS and/or coordinate with project team.
• Prioritize client meetings and workload for current day.
• Attend to client's 3rd party vendors in which a dependency is present for Finastra.
• Responsible/Accountable for any client escalation that requires management insight and CS/Dev/project/product team proper traction.
• Educate customer on Finastra’s Production and Enhancement process when needed.
• Facilitate/Elevate/coordinate any communication related to our 3rd party vendor like IBM/TCH/FedNow/etc  activities such attestation, Network or app certificate renewals, etc.
• Validate SLA reports are accurate for client refund if any.
• Build and maintain customer relationship to increase customer satisfaction and facilitate overall relationship with Finastra.
• follow up on production implementations such REQ creation, customer signoffs, customer downtime comms with CS team
• Accountable for project handoff to Ops process with CS manager. (this includes warranty period negotiation with Accenture or product team and defects handoff)
• If required coordinate client and CS or Dev working sessions proactively or upon request
• Build report of SF cases and prioritize by criticality.
• Build Jira report and coordinate with cs team.
• Update SF cases and jiras when required.
• Coordinate defect review with SME and client when required.
• Coordinate Internal Sync up meeting with CS team to follow up on prioritized defects and enhancements.
• Coordinate Sync up meeting with client to prioritize defects,  enhancements and negotiate timelines across teams.
• Present new P2G defects with product team during the defect call.
• Present new GPP defects with product team during the GFX defect call.
• Follow up on defect jiras with product team.
• Escalate defects and enhancements accordingly.
• Coordinate/attend client steering calls.
• Create enhancement request upon client request.
• present enhancement request during enhancement call with Soli, Pablo and Assaf.
• Attend to implementations after working hrs when possible (including weekends)
• Coordinate UAT testing sessions with client
• Communicate to client when a defect is been committed to a release date by product team
• Communicate to client when an enhancement is been committed to a release date by product team
• Follow up on the already committed defects are indeed included in release implementations
• Follow up on day2 defect items in which were committed by product project team to be fixed during project phase and after go-live
• Update client's defect list for timelines and latest updates

Required Skills & Experience:
Minimum 5 years experience managing a team of client facing team members 
Minimum of 2 years of experience as a customer advocate, relationship manager
Excellent communication and customer support skills will be corresponding with senior leadership to successfully solve complex problems exercising judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information
Incident Management experience by participating in bridge calls for major incidents and documenting troubleshooting steps and service restoration details
Must be a Bachelor's Degree holder

title: Communications & Engagement Analyst
company: Visa Philippines Business Processing Center, Corp.
description:
Job Description

The Communications & Engagement Analyst within the Client Services (CS) Strategic Initiatives and Transformation Office will be a skilled visual designer with a digital-first approach to content development in the form of executive presentations, web content, videos, GIFs, & more that enhance our reputation globally.
This role joins the team responsible for both internal and external communications and enablement efforts, working with colleagues from around the world across all facets of Client Services. The team tells the story of how we support Visa’s clients, ways that we’re incorporating generative AI into the service journey, and how we’re addressing client feedback across our products and solutions – all to drive our clients’ success. It’s an exciting time to join Client Services in a team with high visibility both across the organization and with leadership.
This role requires a dynamic, well-rounded team player who loves all things design and has a passion for process improvement with a keen focus on distilling what matters from what doesn’t to create digestible artifacts. The role will flex across a variety of mediums combining Visa’s brand standards, color theory, graphic elements, and typography to make audiences understand the power of the Visa brand.
This position will be based in Pasay and will report to the Senior Director, Global Client Services Communications and Engagement. This is an individual contributor role and requires a skilled communicator with strong business acumen, an ability to operate independently and deliver quickly, and a curiosity to streamline our daily work through technology.
 RESPONSIBILITIES
Drive awareness of our CS narrative through visual assets needed for thought leadership and sales enablement collateral including tear sheets, case studies, executive and client presentations, videos, social media, & more for internal and external stakeholders.
Leverage Visa’s existing brand assets to create visual text and imagery concepts to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, and captivate target audiences.    
Work with broader Client Services stakeholders to define and develop content and digital assets that support our business strategies and key performance indicators while continually improving processes to increase efficiency and impact. 
Lead the process of defining requirements, visualizing and creating graphics including illustrations, logos, icons, layouts and photos.
Stay informed of best practices in communication, change management and the platforms we use to bring innovative ideas to the organization and improve user experience related to design.
This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

title: Business Insights and Data Analytics Officer
description:
Unlock your fullest potential with us!

McDonald’s is the largest fast-food chain with over 40,000 employees serving Filipinos all over the Philippines, and we are continuously on the lookout for high-caliber talents to join our growing team!

With us, working means an opportunity to grow with our limitless career opportunities, and experience an empowering, inclusive and safe work environment.

What you will do:
Lead the use of business analytics tools to deliver diagnostics, forecasting, and risk assessments.
Conduct macro and microeconomic analysis to guide strategic direction.
Deliver business reviews and post-diagnostic analysis to measure performance impact.
Maintain competitive intelligence dashboards and translate business data into actionable strategies.
Collaborate with Marketing, Finance, and other departments to identify business opportunities and develop aligned strategies.
Work with the Data & Analytics (DNA) team to develop planning and insighting solutions.
Manage and execute business strategy projects, and represent Strategy & Insights in cross-functional engagements.

What we are looking for:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, or any related field with specialization in Information Technology.
2-5 years of experience in business strategy, analytics, or data-driven roles, preferably with strong commercial/finance or data science exposure. Also open to fresh graduates with outstanding academic performance and relevant internship or project experience.
Proficient in Excel, SQL, Python, Tableau/Power BI, and other BI tools.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Excellent communication, storytelling, and stakeholder engagement skills.

title: Event Production Coordinator - Night Shift (Work Onsite)
description:
EVENT PRODUCTION COORDINATOR
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN EVENT PRODUCTION COORDINATOR?
The Event Production Coordinator plays a key role in supporting global Account Managers by ensuring seamless execution of branded merchandise programs across multiple markets. This position requires strong coordination, organization, and communication skills to manage product sourcing, quoting, order processing, and delivery tracking while meeting the unique needs of international clients.
Event Production Coordinator's operate behind the scenes but have visibility into client needs, brand strategy, and service expectations. They collaborate closely with vendors, internal teams, and account managers to drive profitability, maintain high service levels, and deliver best-in-class branded merchandise solutions across BDA’s global operations.This role is ideal for detail-oriented and highly creative professionals with experience in sales support, purchasing, merchandising, or account coordination who thrive in a fast-paced, international business environment. Additionally, BDA is seeking candidates who are eager to develop their careers with us and have aspirations to eventually transition into the sales team. This position offers a clear pathway for growth and advancement within our organization.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Collaborate with global Account Managers to source, price, and present merchandise options to clients across different regions.
Research and recommend customized branded merchandise solutions aligned with brand strategy and client objectives
Prepare and manage sales proposals, quotations, and cost analysis reports.
Order Management & Coordination
Process and track global orders from initial request to final delivery, ensuring all details are accurate.
Liaise with regional and international vendors to negotiate pricing, timelines, and product quality.
Monitor and follow up on shipments, proactively addressing potential delays and logistical challenges.
Reporting & Data Management
Maintain order status reports, sales records, and inventory tracking for multiple markets.
Use Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, etc.) to analyze order trends, profitability, and operational efficiency.
Provide regular updates to Account Managers and leadership on order progress, challenges, and client feedback.
Collaboration & Problem-Solving
Work with cross-functional teams, including sales, production, creative services, finance, and warehouse operations, to ensure seamless execution.
Identify potential risks and proactively troubleshoot order fulfillment, vendor management, and client satisfaction issues.
Adapt to changing priorities and market demands while maintaining high service standards across multiple global accounts.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
2+ years of experience in sales or sales coordination.
EXPERIENCE in EVENT MANAGEMENT or EVENTS COORDINATION
2+ years of experience in account management, or purchasing, preferably in BPO, e-commerce, retail, or merchandising industries.
Experience in customer service, vendor negotiation, or procurement is a plus.
Ability to communicate effectively with clients, vendors, and internal teams across different time zones and regions.
Strong analytical and organizational skills with high attention to detail.
Proficiency with industry tools, including Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams), Salesforce, Oracle EBS, Smartsheet, Canva and other relevant tools is highly preferred.
Proficient in creating reports and presentations.
Project management skills – ability to handle multiple orders, deadlines, and priorities efficiently.
Knowledge of branded merchandise, promotional products, or supply chain management is an advantage.
Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, or a related field preferred but not required

title: Procurement Officer (Lapu-Lapu City-based)
description:
Note: Must be willing to work Monday to Saturday due to the nature of business operations.

POSITION OVERVIEW 
The Procurement Officer is responsible for the end-to-end strategic sourcing, contract, and supplier management. S/He is responsible in procuring high-quality and cost-efficient supplies for our organization. S/He will follow purchasing procedures, maintain an updated list of current and incoming inventory, and be responsible to request for approval. S/He is expected to create and maintain good relationships with key suppliers to ensure products are high quality and delivered on time. 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 
(The listed duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following key areas and performance indicators 
PROCUREMENT MANAGEMENT 
Develop a clear sourcing strategy that reflects the needs of the organization and is aligned to procurement policy objectives and plans for the necessary approval. 
Ensures that all pre-procurement engagements have been completed. • Performs purchasing functions in accordance with the predefined requirements that is according to forecast and demand of o Factory Supplies – Plastic 
Factory Supplies – Inner box, Stickers, Assets – IT Related materials, Office Supplies, HR Special Projects and Marketing POPs 
Production (machine parts, building maintenance) marketing and sales events, installer, and warehouse requirements (forklifts and hand pallets), other maintenance related. 
Monitors price increases and communicating changes as necessary. 
Oversees the requisitions and purchase orders for suppliers and equipment. 
Communicates with other department personnel regarding purchasing needs, policies, procedures, and related issues. • Prepares comparative and prices analysis and audits invoices from vendors. 
Requests material photos and samples for submittals 
Reviews and encodes purchase orders on NetSuite and faxes PO to suppliers. 
Monitors price increases and communicating changes as necessary. 
Maintains a variety of documents files and records related to assigned activities and personnel like purchase orders in bids, reference materials, mandated reports etc. for providing up-to-date references and audit trails. 
Monitors shipment to ensure goods are delivered on time. 
Prepare purchase orders and review for accuracy. 
Detect, research, and resolve purchasing issues and problems with incorrect orders, invoices, and shipments. 
Provides weekly bank transactions, reports, updates on the incoming shipments and status of the inventory of imported goods to stakeholders. 
VENDOR MANAGEMENT 
Responsible for managing assigned suppliers including: 
Performing vendor reviews, audit, and scorecards, including QBR’s. 
Payment of relevant supplier invoices. 
Monitor and manage contract renewal and expiration to ensure sufficient time for negotiation, termination, and conversion to new supplier as desired by the business unit. 
CONTRACT AND SUPPLIER MANAGEMENT 
Develops and maintains excellent working relationship with suppliers by fully understanding their strengths and materials offering, leading contract development and price negotiation. 
Develop and maintain excellent relationships based on trust, commitment, and communication. 
Maintains awareness of integrity imperatives and obligations when dealing with suppliers 
Constantly evaluates and monitors supplier’s performance and service concerning delivery schedule and quality of materials supplied and service provider. 
ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS 
The effective performance of the position requires that harmonious and productive working relationships are developed and maintained throughout different department and across the professional and administrative structure of the Company, and with external stakeholders. This position’s internal rapport should include: Marketing, Production, Sales, Finance, Accounting, Logistics, HR and Product Development.

title: Executive Secretary
description:
Key Responsibilities:
Manage and maintain the executive’s calendar, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements
Serve as a liaison between the executive and internal/external stakeholders
Prepare and organize documents for review, signature, or approval
Maintain and ensure the confidentiality of sensitive information
Perform other related administrative tasks and responsibilities as assigned
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field
Proven experience as an Executive Secretary, Administrative Assistant, or similar role
Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and office management software; familiarity with SAP is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational and time-management abilities
High level of discretion and integrity in handling confidential information

title: Lean QMS Specialist
description:
The role of Continuous Improvement & QMS Specialist is to act as a business partner who works closely with middle management and the teams, understand business priorities, proposes and implements improvement projects/initiatives which support successful achievement of DSV GBS strategic goals and objectives.

Tasks and responsibilities:
Support to build and strengthen continuous improvement culture within GBS
Work with operations teams and drive process improvements that quantitatively and qualitatively improve costs, quality and service,
Cooperation with GBS units and teams and other process stakeholders, e.g. Global Process Owner, Business Change Managers, RPA, PA, BPD in the scope of improvement activities,
Track and report continuous improvement project and initiatives
Assist process transition to operations and participate in SLA review,
Support the establishment and delivery of an operational excellence/ standard work program for GBS
Designing, preparing and conducting continuous improvement methodologies training sessions including, but not limited to Six Sigma, 5S, Lean Principles and others,
Support in defining new KPIs for services provided by GBS and support in their implementation,
Develop, implement and maintain reporting framework for business KPI metrics,
Implementation and maintenance of the process maturity model of the organization (Maturity Matrix Model),Ad Hoc reporting requirements, Support employees in the development of knowledge and skills in the field of continuous improvement, Compliance with internal regulations, procedures, law and managers orders, including labor regulations, regulations on remuneration and other internal regulations in the company, including company’s intellectual property protection, Behaviors and attitudes consistent with the values.
Support Operations in the creation, development/update of process documentations outside of process migration scope, and conduct documentation audits based on GBS standards
Constant skills development by participating in training and self-development
Compliance with internal regulations, procedures, law and managers orders, including labor regulations, regulations on remuneration and other internal regulations in the company, including company’s intellectual property protection.
Behaviors and attitudes consistent with the values of DSV.
Professional skills development by participation in training and constant self-education.

Special rights:
Organize work and give instructions to employees taking part in projects.
Make independent decisions in project management.
Support Managers in matters related to organization, improvement, required resources, increase the efficiency of operations and others to achieve the goals set in quality policy.

Education and skills:
Minimal requirements
Higher education: Finance / Economics / Industrial Engineering
Completed training: Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt
Knowledge of English at C1 level.
Knowledge of the Ms Office package that enables effective and correct: sorting and filtering data, conditional cell formatting, "freezing" rows, columns, securing form/ cells, cell formatting, creating pivot tables/ graphs, vertical searching for data, validating/ consolidating and grouping data and support for simple macros.
Highly developed skills of cooperation with internal and external clients.
Ability to work under time pressure.
Good organization skills of own and others work.
Critical and objective observation of the process and implementation of new solutions enabling efficient and effective solving of any problems in the managed process.
Analytical skills.
Teamwork.
Implementation of new processes, improvements in processes.
Decision-making skills.
Prioritization of entrusted tasks.
Cooperation with people and effective motivation to self-development, considering the needs of the organization.
Communication through effective speaking and listening, and at the same time perfecting others.
Identifying and formulating your own values and priorities and using them in practice.
Time management.

Minimal work experience:
Minimal requirements
Experience in working in an international corporation environment supported by a minimum of 4 years of professional practice.
Experience in describing business processes in logistics/ freight forwarding
Experience or participation in the implementation of projects/ savings programs in the organization.

title: US Tax Client Specialist (Remote Work)
description:
About TaxValet
We’re not just a tax company. We’re an emotions company. We believe that the work we do is a reflection of our higher purpose in life. And if the work isn’t fulfilling and enjoyable, what’s the point? At our company, our Core Purpose is to “transform negative emotions into something positive for our clients, partners, and each other”. It just so happens that we do that by eliminating the hassle and stress of sales tax. We are looking for candidates who are enthusiastic and want to work towards our Core Purpose, too.
As a fractional sales tax department, TaxValet handles everything for clients, from nexus analysis to permit registrations, filings, audit support, and more. Unlike traditional sales tax software that overpromises and underdelivers, we provide a comprehensive, custom-tailored solution that grows with our clients' businesses. And unlike traditional professional service firms, we offer an all-inclusive solution for a simple, predictable monthly rate with no billable hours. 
We're a fast-growing, fully remote, financially stable, and profitable business with an AWESOME team of 80-ish teammates. We're building a world-class fractional sales tax department, and new team members will be part of the reason why.
As a certified B-Corporation, TaxValet is committed to using business as a force for good. This means we consider the impact of our decisions on our team, clients, community, and environment. We're also a "give 1%" organization, dedicating 1% of profit, employee time, and service time to nonprofits.
We are a core-value-driven business. That means we hire, promote, and reward based on alignment with our core values:
Feel It: We value connecting with the real emotions and experiences of others. We also value respectfully sharing our own real emotions and experiences with others.
Shape It: We proactively contribute our ideas and talents by speaking up, challenging the status quo, and taking calculated risks to shape our future.
Own It: We take full responsibility for our actions, decisions, and outcomes. We use both successes and failures as opportunities for growth, openly sharing lessons learned.
Crush It: We relentlessly pursue exponential impact in our business and life.
Question It: Be curious. Ask questions. Seek clarity in the pursuit of continuous improvement and excellence. Create a culture of fearless inquiry.
If you're enthusiastic about transforming negative emotions into something positive and want to work towards our Core Purpose, we'd love to hear from you!

Title:  US Tax Client Specialist 
Location: Must be residing in: Luzon island, Cebu City, Davao City or Iloilo City (REMOTE WFH)
Shift: Flexible late shift with core working hours 8:30 PM - 1:30 AM PHT, the remaining hours can be completed before or after that.

Your Qualifications
We’re looking for someone who is ready to learn and grow professionally, and wants a career (not just a job). We can train you on a lot of things, but here are our non-negotiables:
Professional
Strong preference for experience in tax auditing, tax consultancy or tax advisory. 
Experience working with project management and detailed analysis and research. 
Positive references from past supervisors.
Sales tax experience is a plus, but not required. 
Interpersonal 
High attention-to-detail and a perfectionist at heart. 
Effective and comfortable communicating in writing, over webcam, and on the phone.
Able to put someone at ease who is stressed out and anxious.
Able to set clear boundaries and expectations with clients. Not afraid to follow-up to get what you need to get across the finish line.
Excellent at time management. You don’t waste time on frivolous activities. 
Eager to learn new skills and technologies. Great at researching (and understanding) complex information. 
Enjoy bringing order and clarity to complex and chaotic situations.
Please note that the final step before being hired is for you to arrange reference calls with your former managers and others. 

About The Role
Our team is looking for a US Tax Specialist to join our onboarding team. At our company, we are fanatical about our clients having an incredible impression working with us. And if you join us, you’ll be a big part of the reason why. 
Internally, we refer to this role as “Client Tax Specialist.” The purpose of the Client Tax Specialist is to serve as the principal contact for existing client accounts in the following areas: annual nexus reviews, application for new permits, permit closure requests, offboarding, tax settings, new sales channels.  
Check out our latest culture video from some of our very own Client Tax Specialists to see if this could be the right role for you! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zLVL9KuDD4I
At a glance, you’ll be responsible for organizing transaction data, compiling nexus information (with supervision), updating tax software, broadly overseeing the sales tax permit application process, and communicating effectively with your clients.  
You will work directly with clients to help address any new needs or concerns that arise, and ensure your clients are having a wonderful time working with you.
In time, you’ll be considered a sales tax expert and someone that many will turn to when looking for advice. We are looking for more than just a traditional accountant. We are looking for someone who is a little bit more on the outgoing and social side and would feel comfortable researching and then explaining (in simple terms) that information to clients - in English!
Don’t worry—we’ll provide lots of training and help along the way. Your attitude and potential is much more important than your current knowledge and experience.  

Your Primary Responsibilities
Existing Client Project Management. The Client Tax Specialist is responsible for managing changes to existing client accounts in the areas outlined above. They must communicate effectively and move the project through the identified workflow process in a timely way. 
Support Existing Clients.  You will support existing clients and their Sale Tax Accountants to help with any issues that come up in regard to tax collection settings, new platforms, new permits, permit closures and offboarding. 
Sales Tax Settings Setup and Testing.  The Client Tax Specialist will update and test tax collection settings on sales platforms to ensure clients are collecting sales tax on their new permit start or end dates.
Client Offboarding.  You will support clients who offboard from TaxValet including managing permit closure information, final billings and paperwork, removing the client from TaxValet's systems, and ensuring the client has a positive experience at the end of our service. 
First Contact for Existing Clients Needing Support. Support includes the following areas: annual nexus reviews, application for new permits, permit closure requests, offboarding, tax settings, new sales channels. You will work to maximize time New Client Onboarding Specialists spend onboarding new clients by supporting existing clients.
Billing Support. You will be the primary point of contact for any billing related changes or issues for all clients. 
Contributing to Onboarding Process Improvement. You will work with the Onboarding Team to identify and implement improvements to project workflow for existing clients so that clients have a hassle-free and enjoyable experience, while minimizing risk for both our clients and TaxValet.

Specific Measures of Success
No surprises here! After a year on the job, you’ll be measured by these specific outcomes:
Capacity. The Client Tax Specialist will be responsible for managing 70 existing clients and able to finalize 2-4 nexus reviews per month and 20-25 existing permit projects and offboarding projects per month.
Education Hours. The Client Tax Specialist will complete 3 hours per quarter in work related education or training.  
Quarterly Rocks. All rocks have at least an 80% completion rate for the year. 

Compensation and Benefits
We believe working side-by-side with an awesome team is the greatest benefit there is, but there are other reasons why we love working at TaxValet including.:
Flat monthly salary (dependent on experience) ranging from 102,725php - 105,144php.
43 days off per year. This includes 22 holidays per year, plus 21 days of PTO per year. Yes, seriously. 
100% Remote Working from Home.
The ability to participate in the company profit sharing program. 

Some intangible benefits include:
Don't just take our word for it—see what our employees have to say:
For the past 5 years, we've proudly maintained an impressive eNPS score of over 90!
Our team has consistently awarded us a 4.9-star rating on Glassdoor!
TaxValet has made the Inc 5000 list in 2023, 2024, and 2025
We’re proud to have made the top 10 list for Best Remote Workplaces in America by Best Companies Group in 2023 & 2025
Come join us and find out why!
We encourage ongoing training, and learning and development, through munch and learns, coaching, the chance to work on diverse projects, our continuous education reimbursement program, and more!
We believe in and support growth opportunities. We take pride in promoting from within, and we encourage cross-department moves to explore new areas of the business and broaden your skill set.
We are proud to have a diverse team of employees where everyone’s voice matters. And we mean that! We have regular processes in place for everyone to share their feedback, thoughts and ideas. 
Are You Our Next Teammate?
We’d love to be in touch. Please apply online with a resume and cover letter. Each application will be reviewed with intention and care. So, the more effort you put in up-front, the higher likelihood we’ll reach out. If there’s a mutual interest, we’ll reach out to you to collect additional information. Thanks, and we’re really looking forward to meeting you.
Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
We're actively taking steps to make sure our culture is inclusive and that our processes and practices promote equity for all, including people of color, people from working-class backgrounds, women, and members of the LGBTQ+ community. We welcome and encourage applications from people with these identities or members of other historically marginalized groups.
Research shows that women and people of color tend not to apply to jobs unless they believe they are 100% qualified and apply to fewer senior-level positions. With that in mind, we encourage you to apply if you're not sure whether you meet our qualifications. We'd love to have the opportunity to consider you.

title: IT Desktop Support Technician (MSP)
description:
We are a California-based MSP looking for a Remote IT Desktop Support Technician to deliver Level I & II technical support to our clients. This role requires strong troubleshooting skills, excellent customer service, excellent communications skills, and the ability to resolve software and hardware issues efficiently.
Must be available to work Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM PST (California time zone).

Must be legally authorised to work in the Philippines with reliable high-speed internet connection
Essential Job Functions:
• Support client laptops & desktop computers, printers, VoIP phones, and other devices that touch the network, utilizing
remote support methods.
• Install, configure, and maintain desktop hardware, software, and peripherals, etc.
• Perform proactive systems monitoring, backup and routine maintenance to ensure systems operate correctly with
minimal interruption
• Maintain and administer computer networks and related computing environments including computer hardware, systems
software, applications software, and all configurations
• Perform data backups and disaster recovery operations
• Track customer issues and resolutions with using our ticketing system
• Build rapport with clients

Technical Skills:
• CRM & Ticketing software — Autotask, Datto
• Backup or archival software — Datto, backup software
• Desktop operating systems — Windows 10, Windows 11, and MacOS
• Experience in VoIP , 3CX admin management
• Experienced in working RMM services PSA, Datto, Kaseya
Demonstrated proficiency with RMM tools (Datto, Kaseya) - minimum 2 years hands-on experience
Advanced knowledge of Windows 10/11 administration and troubleshooting
Qualifications:
• Must have minimum 4 years working for MSP in the USA in a Help Desk / Support Center environment - Required
• Experience trouble shooting, diagnosing and resolving PC, internet and systems related issues -Required
• Excellent communication and customer service skills - Required
• Excellent organizational and time management skills - Required
• Detail oriented with ability to identify and resolve problems - Required
• Ability to work independently with little to no supervision - Required
• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills - Required
• Strong team-oriented mindset and the ability to collaborate effectively - Required
• Experience in Cyber Security - Preferred
• CompTIA A+ certification or equivalent technical certification - Required
• Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator - Preferred
Any level of CompTIA A+ certification will satisfy this requirement.
Acceptable equivalent technical certifications to CompTIA A+ include CompTIA Network+ or other recognised vendor certifications.
Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science or related field OR equivalent work experience - Required
The Bachelor's degree requirement can be waived with 4-5 years of equivalent work experience.
Minimum 4-5 years equivalent work experience required in lieu of Bachelor's degree
Fluent English proficiency (written and verbal) - Required
Neutral accent for clear phone communication - Required

title: Franchise Business Development Associate

Toyota Motor Philippines is looking for Franchise Business Development Associate to join our Dealer Development Department based in Makati City, Metro Manila, Philippines.

Proficient in MS Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
Excellent in business communication and good interpersonal skills
Strong analytical, data analysis and planning skills
Highly organized, detail oriented
Excellent presentation skills
