title: National Sales Planning Specialist
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
As a National Sales Planning Specialist, you will be the central planner for assigned car models and accessories, directly influencing market strategy, sales achievement, and company profitability.
You will be responsible for translating market insights and demand into concrete, strategic sales and supply plans, coordinating efforts across local dealers and regional office.
Key Responsibilities
Your duties will focus on three main areas: Forecasting, Strategy, and Execution.
1. Sales Forecasting & Supply Chain Planning (Niguri)
Lead the development, presentation, and negotiation of mid-term and monthly sales plans (Niguri), covering booking, retail, and wholesale volumes for assigned car models and accessories, ensuring plans align with company profit goals.
Manage the supply chain by proposing and submitting monthly order placement, production, and arrival plans to regional offices ensuring healthy and manageable stock levels for both HCPI and our dealerships.
Monitor daily sales pace and monthly achievements, proposing timely countermeasures to ensure targets are met.
Propose and monitor healthy stock targets and manage aging inventory to ensure inventory cost efficiency.
2. Strategic Analysis & Direction Setting
Conduct comprehensive research and analysis on market trends, competitors, economic factors, and government regulations to set strategic direction and targets for assigned models.
Conduct quarterly reviews to update targets and strategies based on evolving internal and external factors.
3. Promotion & Campaign Management
Propose and manage effective monthly and special promotions for assigned models and variants, ensuring maximum utilization of budget while boosting sales performance.
Collaborate and negotiate with internal and external stakeholders (HCPI groups, Partners, Suppliers) to ensure the effective and timely implementation of all sales programs.
Monitor program effectiveness, conduct thorough analysis, and report recommendations to HCPI Management.
Qualifications and Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, Economics, or a related quantitative field.
Strong analytical and numerical skills are essential for forecasting, data analysis, and financial reporting.
Excellent negotiation, presentation, and communication skills; must be able to confidently present plans to top management.
Highly proficient in using Microsoft Excel for complex data modeling and reporting.
Ability to manage multiple complex projects and deadlines simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Preferably able to safely and confidently drive a 4-wheel vehicle.
Experience or deep interest in the Automotive Industry is a significant advantage.
The successful candidate will be primarily based at the Honda Cars Philippines Metro Manila Office located in BGC. Note that regular reporting and meetings at the Head Office in Sta. Rosa will also be required as part of the role's duties.

title: Technical Business Analyst - Data
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to craft your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reinvent what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more balanced, more inclusive world!
Your Role: 
Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand project objectives and gather detailed requirements related to data deletion (if applicable) or analytics initiatives. 
Data Analysis: Utilize analytical tools and techniques to analyze complex datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights that contribute to business decision-making. 
Technical Solution Design: Work closely with technical teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications, ensuring alignment with project goals and objectives. 
Project Management: Manage the end-to-end project lifecycle, including planning, execution, monitoring, and reporting. Ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and in accordance with quality standards. 
Data Governance: Implement and maintain data governance practices to ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with regulatory requirements, especially in the context of data deletion projects. 
Documentation: Create comprehensive documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, process flows, and user manuals to facilitate effective project communication and knowledge transfer. 
Stakeholder Communication: Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders, technical teams, and other relevant parties, providing regular updates on project status, issues, and risks. 

Your Profile : 
Detail-oriented and technically proficient Technical Business Analyst that will play a key role in either the Data Deletion Project or our Data and Analytics Team, depending on project needs and candidate's expertise. Will also be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring the successful execution of projects related to data management, deletion, or analysis.
Proven experience (3-5years) as a Business Analyst or similar role, preferably in the context of data management, deletion, or analytics projects.
Strong understanding of data management principles, including data governance, data quality, and data lifecycle management.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, or other programming languages for data manipulation and analysis.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with a keen attention to detail.
Project management experience and familiarity with agile methodologies is a plus.

description:

a hands-on designer to champion and implement our visual direction, turning concepts into beautiful, effective multi-channel work.

title: Sales Training Officer
company: Public Safety Savings and Loan Association, Inc. (PSSLAI)
description:
Job Summary
The Sales Training Officer is responsible for designing, delivering, and evaluating training programs for new hires and existing sales personnel. This includes the creation of comprehensive training modules that reflect the Association’s Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), core values, and operational processes. The role ensures that employees are well-equipped to perform effectively and consistently across all offices and branches. The officer also conducts training audits to assess compliance and performance and recommends retraining when necessary to uphold service excellence and operational standards.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
1. Training Delivery & Facilitation
Conduct onboarding training for new sales hires.
Facilitate refresher courses for personnel within the operations group, focusing primarily on sales personnel.
Ensure trainees are familiar with operational workflows and SOPs.
2. Training Design & Development
Create and update training modules, manuals, and digital content.
Integrate operational processes and core values into training materials.
Customize content based on performance gaps and business needs.
3.Training Audits & Evaluation
Conduct regular audits of training implementation across offices.
Assess adherence to SOPs, operational standards, and company values.
Recommend retraining or coaching interventions based on audit findings.
4. Monitoring & Reporting
Track training attendance, completion rates, and post-training performance.
Analyze training effectiveness and prepare reports for HR and Management.
Maintain accurate training records and documentation.
5.Operations Familiarization
Stay updated on operational processes and changes.
Collaborate with operations teams to ensure training reflects current practices.
Serve as a bridge between HCMD and Operations for training alignment.
6. Collaboration with stakeholders
Coordinate with department heads to assess training needs.
Provide feedback and recommendations to improve training programs.
Qualifications and Required Skills:
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource, Education or Training Development, Communication or its equivalent.
At least 3-5 years of experience in Training/ Learning and Development role.
Must have a good floor presentation skill.
Excellent communication (verbal and written), interpersonal and organizational skills.
Adaptable and can work under pressure.
Keen attention to details.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Ability to work with multiple stakeholders at different levels in the organization
Excellent team collaboration and ability to establish positive working relationships across the organization.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
Willing to travel.

title: Area Manager | Bancassurance | Visayas (Preferably from Cebu)
description:
Why Join AXA?

Job Description

title: Product Manager
description:
About the role

As a Product Manager at One Pharma Marketing Inc.', you will play a crucial role in the development and growth of our innovative pharmaceutical products. Based in our office in Las Pinas City, Metro Manila, this full-time position will see you shaping the strategic direction of our product portfolio and ensuring we deliver exceptional value to our customers.
What you'll be doing
Define the overall product vision and strategy in alignment with the company's objectives
Collaborate cross-functionally with teams in marketing, sales, R&D, and operations to drive the product life cycle
Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities for product development and enhancement
Develop and prioritise the product roadmap, translating business requirements into technical specifications
Monitor product performance, gather customer feedback, and implement data-driven improvements
Communicate progress and updates to key stakeholders, including senior management
Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and industry standards
What we're looking for
Minimum 5 years of experience in product management, preferably within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry
Proven track record of successfully launching and managing products from concept to commercialisation
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret market data and identify trends
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information to diverse audiences
Proficient in using product management tools and methodologies, such as Agile, Scrum, and user story mapping
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as business, marketing, or engineering
Familiarity with pharmaceutical regulations and industry best practices
What we offer

At One Pharma Marketing Inc.', we are committed to providing a rewarding and fulfilling work environment for our employees. In addition to a competitive salary, you will have access to a range of benefits, including:
Comprehensive health insurance coverage
Generous paid time off and sick leave
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
Collaborative and supportive team culture
Modern, well-equipped office facilities

About us

One Pharma Marketing Inc.' is a leading pharmaceutical company dedicated to improving the lives of patients through innovative and effective healthcare solutions. With a strong focus on research and development, we are at the forefront of the industry, consistently delivering high-quality products that meet the evolving needs of our customers.
If you are passionate about driving product innovation and making a meaningful impact in the healthcare sector, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Apply now to join our team!

title: Accounts Payable/Receivable Officer
description:

title: Sr Financial Analyst Financial Planning, Reporting, and Analysis
description:
About the Company
IWG has been at the forefront of the flexible workspace revolution for more than 30 years. We have made it possible for organizations and individuals everywhere to take a new approach to the traditional working day. We have over 3,400 locations across over 110 countries allowing millions of people every day to have a great day at work.
Our customers are start-ups, small and medium-sized enterprises, and large multinationals. With unique business goals, people and aspirations. They want workspaces and communities to match their needs. We provide them with choice through our portfolio of brands, covering serviced offices (Regus, Spaces, HQ, Signature and No18), commercial real estate brokerage and managed office solutions.
Join us at www.iwgplc.com

Job Purpose
The Senior Financial Analyst supports the reporting and operational activities of the IWG Partners Reporting team. This role is primarily responsible for analyzing partner centre financial performance, preparing insightful commentaries, and ensuring the timely and accurate submission of financial reports to partners and landlords, in accordance with contractual terms.

Key Responsibilities
Review and analyze partner centre profit and loss statements, providing clear explanations for significant variances and balances.
Identify and coordinate the correction of posting errors with relevant teams to ensure accuracy and data integrity.
Prepare and deliver timely, accurate reports to business reviewers, partners, and landlords.
Generate invoices, statements of account, and other required financial reports to facilitate payments to partners and landlords.
Review lease and management agreements, interpreting key financial provisions for use in partner or landlord reports.
Address inquiries from business reviewers, partners, and landlords within agreed service level timelines.
Coordinate with auditors for agreed-upon procedures to validate calculations and amounts payable to partners and landlords.
Reconcile submitted reports with the general ledger and provide supporting documentation for audit purposes.
Collaborate with Group Finance, local finance teams, and Partnership Performance teams to ensure high-quality, timely deliverables.
Partner with other Global Shared Services teams, supporting external auditors and legal authorities as needed.
Maintain comprehensive and up-to-date process documentation to support operational excellence and audit readiness.

Qualifications
Minimum of seven (7) years of experience in Financial Reporting and Analysis.
Background in a blue-chip multinational or shared services environment preferred.
Demonstrated experience working with global teams and financial stakeholders.
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or equivalent qualification preferred.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and familiarity with various accounting applications.
Excellent command of the English language, both written and verbal.

Core Competencies and Attributes
Proactive, hands-on, and results-driven, with a high degree of professional resilience.
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to comprehend complex financial issues and make sound recommendations.
Flexible and adaptable to change, with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Proven ability to work under pressure and deliver results within tight deadlines.
Effective communicator with strong interpersonal skills, capable of engaging with all levels of the organization.
Collaborative team player with a customer service mindset and high energy level.

Working Conditions
Regular work schedule: 10:00 AM to 7:00 PM (Monday to Friday).

Onsite Requirements
Onsite daily during the first month of employment.
Thereafter, onsite three (3) times per month as part of a hybrid working arrangement.

title: Sales
description:
Company Introduction
KEYENCE is a global leader in industrial automation. We contribute to manufacturing industries all over the world by providing the world’s most innovative automation technologies and the best consultative sales.
This will be an opportunity for you to become a direct sales professional as we are dedicated in providing QUICK RESPONSE and ADDED VALUE to our customers. In order to achieve this, we especially put effort into training personnel for it.
Training
Our training program typically lasts 1 to 2 months consisting of classroom training, on-the-job training and mentorship, respectively, in order for you to develop a thorough understanding of KEYENCE products and application. You will also be trained to practice consultative, pro-active and solution-based sales. After of which, you will become responsible for customers in your own sales territory.
Responsibilities and Duties
At KEYENCE, our sales professionals work in a highly professional and fast-paced environment. Sales professionals travel within their own territories on an average of (3) three or (4) four times a week to:
(1) provide technical consultation
(2) provide service to customers
(3) conduct product presentations and demonstrations
Aside from these, (1) one or (2) two office days will be dedicated to cold calls on prospective or existing customers to introduce and assist them with their inquiries and applications.
You will also be solely in charge of your customers in your division from new customer development to closing offers-- all these working within a sales target and activity targets in process.
Qualification
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree in ANY field. We are looking for people with diverse backgrounds.
No work experience required. Fresh graduates are highly encouraged to apply.
Willing to travel to your domestic territories for business trips
Ability to communicate in English both written & oral is required.
Must be hardworking
Amenable to work one Saturday working day once every quarter
It will be a premier opportunity for you to earn a starting salary of P 39, 000 and as much as P 49, 400/ month and P 747, 800 annually ! We are looking forward to working together with you.

title: Quality Assurance Associate
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Quality Objectives Reporting:
Collate, validate, and submit monthly quality objectives reports to ensure compliance with company standards and goals.
Corrective Action Requests (CAR) Management:
Issue and follow up on Corrective Action Requests (CARs) and Non-CARs.
Conduct reviews of accomplished CARs and Non-CARs to ensure issues are resolved and corrective actions are effective.
Trend Analysis & Improvement:
Conduct trend analysis for issued Non-CARs and recommend improvements to prevent recurrence of issues.
Internal Audits & CAR Follow-Up:
Conduct periodic internal quality audits, including follow-up verifications and closure audits for issued CARs to ensure compliance with quality standards.
Customer Satisfaction:
Administer customer satisfaction surveys, analyze feedback, and suggest improvements to enhance customer satisfaction.
QMS Documentation:
Review and update Quality Management System (QMS) documents, including MOP (Manual of Procedures), Risk Register, Quality Objectives, Records Matrix, Interested Parties, and Forms.
Process Improvement Projects:
Plan, manage, execute, monitor, control, and close process improvement projects aimed at enhancing quality and operational efficiency.
Project Status Updates:
Provide regular project status updates to stakeholders, ensuring timely and transparent communication on project progress.
Monitoring of RHQ Projects/Initiatives:
Monitor the completion and implementation of RHQ projects/initiatives assigned and ensure their alignment with organizational goals.
Reporting:
Submit required reports to RHQ as applicable, ensuring accurate and timely delivery of information.
ADS Monitoring:
Monitor ADS reports and ensure that ADS is filed for CIN categorized as CAT I or II (and III for CLT BU).
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
A graduate of any 4-year course (preferably a Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering or any related field)
With at least one (1) year of work experience as a Quality Practitioner/Staff or in a similar role.
Familiar with ISO 9001:2015 and has a strong understanding of quality management systems and processes.
Proven experience in quality assurance or a similar role within the logistics industry.
Strong understanding of quality management systems, corrective action processes, and internal auditing.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey information and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and familiarity with QMS software/tools.
Preferably with ISO 9001:2015 Awareness Training; Six Sigma. Certified Internal Quality Auditor is a plus.
Amenable to work in Sucat, Paranaque.
Additional Information:
Only qualified applicants will be contacted.

title: Data Analyst II (Alabang)
description:
What will you do?
• Partner one-on-one with IT INF subject matter experts for ad-hoc data exploration sessions to uncover actionable insights from infrastructure data.
• Transform simple dashboard requests into deeper analytical investigations - turn "show me server uptime" into comprehensive analysis of failure patterns, root causes, and predictive insights.
• Hunt for patterns, anomalies, and correlations in operational data that reveal hidden opportunities and operational improvements.
• Utilize PowerBI and Excel as analytical thinking tools to explore data, test hypotheses, and build compelling insight-driven visualizations.
• Ask probing questions to understand business context behind data requests and guide stakeholders toward more strategic data-driven decisions.
• Demonstrate analytical thinking approaches to Analytics Engineers through collaborative project work and informal knowledge sharing.
• Document discovery processes and analytical methodologies to enable knowledge transfer and build analytical capabilities across the team.
• Create insight-driven dashboards that reveal "why" behind operational patterns, not just "what" is happening.
• Support IT INF SMEs in understanding what their operational data is really telling them about system performance, user behavior, and business impact.
What do you need to succeed?
• Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Economics, or related analytical fields.
• Minimum of 3 years of experience in analytical roles with proven ability to uncover insights from complex datasets.
• Advanced proficiency in PowerBI as an analytical tool for data exploration, hypothesis testing, and insight development.
• Expert-level Excel skills for quick data exploration, statistical analysis, and hypothesis validation.
• SQL knowledge sufficient to understand data sources, validate findings, and collaborate effectively with Analytics Engineers.
• Experience in pattern recognition, anomaly detection, and correlation analysis across operational or business datasets.
• Strong background in root cause analysis and business problem-solving methodologies. • Ability to work independently on exploratory analysis while maintaining collaborative approach with domain experts.
• Fluent in English (written and oral) with ability to explain complex analytical findings to technical audiences.
Personal Attributes:
• Intellectual curiosity with genuine interest in understanding how systems work and what data patterns reveal.
• Strong analytical mindset with natural tendency to ask "why" and "what if" questions about business scenarios.
• Collaborative approach with ability to influence through expertise rather than formal authority.
• Self-directed exploration capabilities - comfortable diving into unfamiliar datasets and developing analytical hypotheses.
• Flexible availability and responsiveness to ad-hoc analytical requests from business stakeholders.
• Clear communication skills with ability to translate complex findings into actionable recommendations without overwhelming technical audiences.
• Shift flexibility and schedule adherence are required for the position.

title: ERP SCM SPECIALIST
description:
Job Title: ERP·SCM Specialist – Food & Beverage Industry
Job Level: Professional / Specialist

Job Summary: The ERP·SCM Specialist is responsible for efficiently managing inventory, logistics networks, ordering, and supply processes across food service operations using an ERP system. This role ensures the smooth flow of ingredients and consumables, stable logistics between commissaries and store locations, and supports data-driven decision-making through accurate ERP utilization.

Key Responsibilities:

ERP System Operation and Maintenance
• Configure and manage ERP systems tailored to food service operations to optimize inventory and logistics flow
• Implement system upgrades, enhancements, and troubleshoot issues
• Monitor system usage across commissaries and store branches and provide support

Inventory and Logistics Process Management
• Manage inbound/outbound movements, stock levels, and expiration tracking of ingredients and consumables via ERP
• Analyze and improve logistics between commissaries and stores
• Optimize ordering and delivery processes with suppliers

User Training and Support
• Conduct ERP training for store managers and commissary staff
• Develop user manuals and operational guides
• Ensure compliance with system SOPs and best practices

Data Analysis and Reporting
• Generate reports based on ERP data including inventory turnover, ordering patterns, and cost analysis
• Maintain dashboards and KPIs to support executive decision-making

Project and System Improvement
• Participate in ERP module expansion and system improvement projects
• Collaborate with external consultants and internal IT teams
• Test and validate system functions to ensure stable deployment

Security and Compliance
• Manage system access controls and maintain data security
• Ensure compliance with food safety standards and company data policies

Qualifications:
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Logistics Management, Business Administration, Food Service Management, or related fields
• Experience: Minimum 2–3 years in ERP and SCM roles within the food service or retail industry
• Technical Skills: o Experience operating ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, NetSuite, Dynamics preferred) o Understanding of inventory control, logistics operations, and ordering processes o Familiarity with database tools such as SQL is a plus
• Soft Skills: o Strong communication and documentation skills o Problem-solving and project management capabilities o Detail-oriented and highly organized

Core Competencies:
• Understanding of food service inventory and logistics workflows
• ERP system operation and optimization
• Data analysis and reporting
• Cross-functional collaboration and training
• Continuous improvement mindset

title: Customer Experience Technical Writer (REMOTE)
description:
As a Technical Writer, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining a variety of documentation, including Standard Operating Procedures, training materials, and user manuals, ensuring that all content is tailored to meet the needs of both technical and non-technical audiences. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather product and documentation requirements, while also taking ownership of projects from start to finish. Your expertise in Salesforce will be crucial as you design and manage Salesforce Experience Cloud Sites and maintain a Salesforce Knowledge instance, ensuring high-quality knowledge management practices. Additionally, you will review and edit content produced by team members, striving for clarity and accessibility in all technical communications. Your ability to adapt to changing priorities and your innovative approach to improving processes will be key to your success in this role.
What's in it for you?
Global and dynamic culture
Competitive compensation package
HMO benefits + free dependents
20% night differential rate
Remote work setup
Company provided equipment

RESPONSIBILITIES
Create and develop comprehensive documentation including Standard Operating Procedures, instruction manuals, training materials, policies, and work instructions tailored to the needs of diverse audiences, ensuring clarity and accessibility for both candidates and customers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and define product and documentation requirements for both existing and new First Advantage products, services, and implementations, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
Design and implement Salesforce Experience Cloud Sites using Salesforce Site Builder, while writing and maintaining basic HTML and CSS code to enhance user experience and functionality.
Manage and maintain a Salesforce Knowledge instance across the First Advantage organization, ensuring high service levels, quality of the knowledge base, and effective audience administration for all knowledge management activities.
Translate complex technical information into clear, concise language that is easily understood by non-technical audiences, facilitating better comprehension and usability.
Review, proofread, and edit content produced by team members, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and adherence to established standards before publication.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Technical Writing Experience: Proven experience in technical writing, specifically in creating service, product, and client-facing documentation, with a strong portfolio demonstrating your ability to convey complex information clearly.
Global Perspective: Experience working in a global or international service environment, with the ability to adapt content for diverse audiences across different cultures and regions.

Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate technical jargon into user-friendly language for non-technical audiences.
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating flexibility in adjusting to changing priorities and demands while maintaining high-quality standards.

Minimum of a High School Diploma; a degree in English, Communications, Technical Writing, or a related field is preferred.
2+ years of experience in technical writing, particularly in a service-oriented or technology-driven environment, with a strong portfolio showcasing relevant documentation.
Experience in a global or international service setting, demonstrating the ability to adapt content for diverse audiences and cultural contexts.

Strong background in creating user-friendly documentation that effectively communicates technical information to non-technical audiences.

title: Claims Investigation and Resolution Analyst
description:
R1 RCM Philippines, INC. is looking for a Claims Investigation and Resolution Analyst to help resolve issues related to health insurance claims and payments. This role involves working with various teams and insurance companies to ensure claims are processed correctly and on time.

Key Responsibilities:
Understand and follow insurance company guidelines using their portals, manuals, and contracts.
Submit escalated claims based on specific payer instructions.
Review contracts and gather needed documents to help resolve unpaid accounts.
Study data to spot trends and ensure compliance with contracts and internal processes.
Find the root cause of escalated issues to improve collections and reduce future problems.
Work with other departments to solve escalated concerns and avoid repeat issues.
Share updates and feedback with clients, teammates, and other departments.
Handle moderately complex problems and respond to urgent inquiries.
Review payer responses and decide the next steps to resolve issues.
Quickly raise concerns to insurance companies or internal teams when needed.
Represent issues professionally when dealing with payers, aiming for the best results for our clients.
Coordinate with leaders to improve payer performance and resolve escalations efficiently.
Support both internal and external customers by managing complaints and escalations.

Qualifications:
At least 2 years of experience in healthcare claims processing or claims analysis, Claims Denials and Appeals, Claims follow-up up or end-to-end Claims within a BPO environment.
Knowledge of healthcare claim types and payer requirements is an advantage.
Should have familiarity with healthcare industry standards (HIPAA, CMS, etc.).
Experience with claims management software and electronic claim submission platforms.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently and within a team in a fast-paced environment.
Able to work onsite and on rotating shifts.
With good analytical, problem-solving solving and critical thinking skills.
Amenable to work onsite (Quezon City) and on night shift.

description:

Bring your Building Information Modeling expertise to projects that inspire progress-while still having time for what matters most. As a BIM Coordinator, you will lead the coordination of architectural, structural, and MEP models, ensuring project compliance, efficiency, and collaboration. Day 1 HMO coverage

Fixed weekends off

Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)

Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
Fun engagement activities for employees
Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
Career growth opportunities
Diverse and supportive work environment
The Qualifications We Seek
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field
1-3 years of experience in BIM coordination or VDC-related roles, supporting design, modeling, and construction workflows
Technical
Proficient in Autodesk Revit, Navisworks, AutoCAD, and ACC/BIM 360
Strong understanding of construction documentation and project delivery methods
Skilled in troubleshooting and resolving modeling issues to ensure design accuracy and collaboration efficiency
Business and Management
Excellent organizational and time-management abilities
Ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple project deadlines
Basic understanding of construction workflows and project coordination processes
Interpersonal
Exceptional communication, collaboration, and problem-solving abilities
Ability to work effectively with diverse, cross-functional teams
Professional demeanor with a strong customer service orientation
Personal
Detail-oriented, self-motivated, and committed to producing high-quality work
Demonstrates integrity, accountability, and adaptability in a dynamic environment
Willingness to learn and grow with evolving BIM/VDC technologies
Your Daily Tasks
Support VDC Team Leads and Project Managers with model-based planning, scheduling, and visualization to improve coordination and decision-making
Coordinate BIM workflows across architectural, structural, and MEP disciplines, ensuring model consistency and integration
Conduct clash detection and model coordination using tools like Navisworks and Revit, and document issues for resolution
Update NWD files and export NWC files regularly to reflect the latest model progress and distribute to stakeholders
Publish models and documentation for sign-off in Procore, ensuring version control and accessibility
Submit weekly reports to the project team summarizing recent uploads of subcontractor models
Facilitate model reviews with project teams and stakeholders, providing visualizations and walkthroughs as needed
Overlay 2D deck penetration drawings onto models to validate alignment and ensure constructability
Apply RCP (Reflected Ceiling Plan) overhead overlays to coordinate ceiling systems with MEP components and architectural finishes
Provide technical support and training to project teams on BIM tools, standards, and best practices
Ensure compliance with company and client BIM standards and protocols, and assist in quality control of model deliverables

Our client is a leading general contractor with over 90 years of expertise in delivering complex and high-profile construction projects. They combine innovative building practices with a commitment to quality, safety, and sustainability. Operating across diverse sectors, they are trusted for their technical expertise, collaborative approach, and ability to bring ambitious visions to life.

We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Human Resources Director
description:
Job Overview 
The Human Resources (HR) Director is a strategic leader responsible for shaping and driving the people strategy, fostering a strong organizational culture, and ensuring an exceptional employee experience. This role will oversee all aspects of human resources, diversity and inclusion, employee engagement, and workplace culture. The ideal candidate is a forward-thinking leader who aligns business and people strategies to drive performance, engagement, and growth. 

Key Responsibilities 
Develop and implement comprehensive people strategies that align with the company's mission, vision, and goals. 
Champion a positive and inclusive workplace culture, ensuring employees feel valued, engaged, and supported. 
Oversee performance management programs, employee development initiatives, and succession planning. 
Design and execute employee engagement strategies, including recognition programs and feedback mechanisms. 
Drive diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives to create a fair and equitable workplace. 
Lead change management efforts to support organizational transformation and growth. 
Ensure compliance with Philippine labor laws and HR best practices. 
Develop and manage compensation, benefits, and wellness programs to enhance employee satisfaction and retention. 
Serve as a strategic advisor to leadership on all people-related matters. 
Implement HR technologies and data analytics to optimize people processes and decision-making. 

Qualifications & Experience 
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Organizational Development, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred). 
8+ years of progressive HR leadership experience, preferably in a fast-paced or high-growth environment. 
Proven track record of driving people and culture strategies that enhance business performance. 
Strong understanding of Philippine labor laws, compliance, and HR best practices. 
Experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) programs and initiatives. 
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. 
Ability to build strong relationships and influence at all levels of an organization. 
Experience with HR technology, data analytics, and workforce planning tools. 
Certified HR professional credentials (e.g., SHRM-SCP, SPHR, CHRP, or equivalent) are a plus.

title: Sales Operations & Support Coordinator II (Order Entry)
description:

This position is a training ground to have the coordinator become very familiar with all aspects of the Vertiv sales organization, internal and external. The Mis-ship Coordinator provides Sales support by processing Mis-ship orders with Resellers, National VAR’s, direct end-users, OEM accounts and Global Strategic Accounts. Process RMA (if necessary) and coordinate with Reverse Logistics for pick up appointment to ensure timely receipt of returned items.

Provide sales teams updates on the status of their requests and work closely with them in securing required supporting documents.
Act as a backup whenever Reverse Logistics Coordinator is out. 
Assist Order Coordinators on change requests when bandwidth permits.
Performs any reporting activity or task assigned by immediate supervisor as needed, or in fulfillment of and in relation to essential functions.
Qualifications
2 years minimum exposure in a Sales/Order entry support role ideally within a Manufacturing/Engineering setting.
Bachelor's degree of any 4-year course.

Innovation

title: Project Manager – Odoo ERP Implementation
description:
Toolkit is seeking an experienced Project Manager to lead and manage the successful end-to-end implementation of the Odoo ERP platform across multiple business functions. The ideal candidate will bring strong ERP project management expertise and a CPA qualification, enabling them to bridge the gap between finance/accounting operations and technical implementation. This is a strategic role, requiring a hands-on, detail-oriented professional who can manage stakeholders, align business goals with system capabilities, and ensure timely project delivery.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Project Management:
* Lead and oversee all phases of the Odoo ERP implementation lifecycle (gap analysis, initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, closing).
* Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, resource allocation, budgets, and risk assessments.
* Manage cross-functional project teams (internal and external stakeholders, developers, consultants).
* Monitor project progress, ensuring milestones are met on time and within scope.
* Implement change management strategies and training plans to ensure smooth adoption.
ERP Implementation & Functional Expertise:
* Serve as the primary point of contact between business stakeholders and technical teams.
* Translate business requirements (especially in accounting, finance, inventory, purchase and sales) into functional specifications for Odoo modules.
* Assist with the configuration and testing of Odoo modules (Finance, Sales, Inventory, Procurement, CRM, HR, etc.).
* Coordinate data migration activities, ensuring integrity and accuracy of legacy data.
* Oversee system integration with third-party applications (payment gateways, banking, e-commerce, etc.).
Finance & Accounting Focus (CPA Role):
* Leverage CPA expertise to lead the implementation of the Odoo Accounting module, ensuring compliance with local GAAP and tax regulations.
* Validate accounting workflows, chart of accounts, financial reporting, and audit requirements.
* Provide advisory on financial process optimization through automation and ERP capabilities.
* Act as a liaison between finance teams and developers to ensure proper configuration of finance-related features.
Stakeholder & Vendor Management:
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels (executives, department heads, end users).
* Collaborate with third-party vendors for integration and technical development and support.
* Facilitate project status meetings, prepare reports, and present to senior leadership.
* Quality Assurance & Support:
* Define and oversee UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and training sessions.
* Ensure system performance and user experience meet quality standards.
* Post-implementation support and continuous improvement recommendations.

REQUIREMENTS
Must-Have:
* Proven experience managing end-to-end ERP implementations, preferably with Odoo.
* Professional certification in accounting (CPA or equivalent).
* Strong understanding of accounting principles, financial reporting, and compliance.
* Minimum of 5+ years of project management experience in ERP or IT systems.
* Familiarity with business processes across finance, inventory, sales, CRM, and HR.
* Excellent communication, organizational, and leadership skills.
Nice to Have:
* Odoo functional certification.
* Experience working in consulting environments or software/tech companies.
* Agile or Scrum certification (PMI-ACP, CSM, etc.).
* Experience with API integrations and data migration tools.

title: Senior Data Analyst - Contract Digitalization (Project-Based)
description:
The Senior Data Analyst will lead the strategic transition of our company's contract management lifecycle from a manual (analog) process to a digital, data-driven system.
This role requires a unique combination of legal acumen, project management discipline, and data science proficiency. Familiarity and/or expertise on Microsoft Power BI is an advantage. She/he will be responsible for defining, planning, and executing the digitization project, including overseeing data migration and eventual management of client contracts.
The Senior Data Analyst is expected to collaborate with IT, Business Development, Business Excellence, Operations, Procurement, HR, and Finance Departments on customization of the system to be used in the contract transition and integrating data analytics to enhance our contract management capabilities.
                                           A.    General Responsibilities: 
Project Leadership: Lead the end-to-end project of digitizing the company's contract management lifecycle, ensuring alignment with Indonesia and Philippine teams’ objectives.
Strategy and Planning: Develop a comprehensive project plan, including scope, objectives, timelines, budget, and resource allocation.
Legal Process Analysis: Conduct a thorough assessment of existing contract management processes, identify key pain points, and design a streamlined, automated, and efficient digital workflow.
Technology Implementation: Select, implement, and maintain contract lifecycle management (CLM) software, e-signature platforms (e.g., DocuSign), and other relevant legal tech tools.
Data Migration and Governance: Manage the process of migrating all existing paper and electronic contracts into a new centralized digital repository. Ensure data accuracy, security, and compliance during and after the migration.
Data Analytics and Insights: Apply data science techniques to extract, analyze, and visualize key information from contract data. This includes:
Using Natural Language Processing (NLP) to identify key clauses and obligations.
Conducting risk assessments based on historical data.
Providing business intelligence and data visualization to give stakeholders actionable insights into contract performance and trends.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with relevant departments in the Philippine unit. Serve as the primary point of contact for project communication. Effectively engage and manage expectations with cross-functional teams, including Indonesia team and relevant departments in the Philippine unit.
Reporting: Provide regular, detailed status reports and performance updates to senior management, highlighting project milestones, risks, and budgetary adherence. Present findings and visualization tools to senior leadership in the Philippine unit.
Risk Management: Identify and mitigate project risks. Monitor KPIs and project health using Power BI tools.
Represent the company in cases before the Department of Labor, NLRC and/or other government agencies and such other tasks that may be assigned by the Chief Legal Counsel.
Ad hoc task may include representing the company in proceedings before the Department of Labor, the National Labor Relations Commission (NLRC), and other pertinent government agencies
B.    Qualifications
1.     Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business, or related field. Graduate of law, underbar, newly admitted lawyer or recent Bar passer is an advantage.
3+ years of experience in project management, preferably in BI or analytics projects.
Strong proficiency in Power BI, including DAX, Power Query, and data modeling.
Experience with Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall methodologies.
Familiarity with SQL, Excel, and cloud platforms (e.g., Azure).
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Law, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Engineering. A J.D. or master’s degree in legal technology, Data Science, or a related field is a significant plus.
Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.
 2.     Professional Experience:
Proven Project Management Experience: 3+ years of demonstrable experience managing complex projects, preferably in a legal or technology context.
Data Science Skills: Proven experience with data analysis, data visualization, and data extraction from unstructured text. Expertise with tools like SQL, Python, or data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is highly desirable.
Digital Transformation: Direct experience with technology implementation and digital transformation projects, ideally within a legal or professional services environment.
Legal Domain Knowledge: Deep understanding of the legal contract lifecycle, including drafting, negotiation, execution, and renewal. Experience with contract law is essential.
Legal Tech Proficiency: Hands-on experience with contract lifecycle management (CLM) platforms (e.g., Ironclad), e-signature tools, and database management.
 3.     Key Competencies and Skills:
Project Management Certification: PMP, PRINCE2, or other recognized project management certification is preferred.
Communication Skills: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills to effectively translate technical requirements for legal teams and legal needs for IT teams.
Leadership and Influence: Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, influence stakeholders, and manage expectations in a multi-stakeholder environment.
Analytical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights for the business.
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and manage competing priorities effectively.
 4.     Behavioral Competencies:
Analytical and research skills and attention to details
Organization, time-management, and project management
Problem Solving
Teamwork, interpersonal skill and leadership
Communication, networking, and confidence
Adaptability and flexibility

title: Data Analyst | Grafana using Python Exp | Onsite - Ortigas
description:
DATA ANALYST
Work for our global clients and immerse in our rich and diverse company culture where you can thrive, grow and just be aweSOme! Apply now and discover the Satellite Office Candidate Experience – recognized as one of BEST among BPO companies worldwide.
WHAT IS A/AN DATA ANALYST?
The Data Analyst role is responsible for managing and maintaining the Centre’s visualisation and analytics platforms, with a primary focus on Grafana dashboards and reporting tools. This role ensures service desk requests related to Grafana are actioned promptly, hot fixes are applied when needed, and new dashboards are developed to support operational and maintenance needs. Secondary to visualisation, the role involves performing data analysis outside Grafana using tools such as Python or other analytics programming languages. This role is suited for candidates with a foundation in data analytics and a strong interest in visualisation systems.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Grafana Visualisation & Dashboard Management:
- Monitor and respond to service desk requests related to Grafana dashboards.
- Conduct hot fixes and adjustments to existing dashboards and reports.
- Build new Grafana dashboards from scratch, ensuring usability and accuracy.

· Data Analytics & Reporting:
- Extract and analyse data outside Grafana using Python or other analytics-focused programming languages.
- Support the preparation of customised analytics reports and visualisations.
- Assist in identifying trends and insights to support machine health monitoring.

· Collaboration & Support:
- Work closely with remote monitoring specialists, maintenance teams, and IT support.
- Ensure data visualisations align with operational and reporting requirements.
- Provide technical assistance for visualisation-related queries from the team.

· Documentation & Continuous Improvement:
- Maintain clear documentation of dashboard configurations and changes.
- Contribute to process improvements in visualisation and reporting practices.
- Stay updated with best practices in data visualisation and analytics tools.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):
· Timely response and resolution of service desk requests related to dashboards.
· Accuracy and reliability of Grafana dashboards and reports.
· Quality of analytics insights delivered to support operational decisions.
· Contribution to continuous improvement in visualisation and reporting workflows.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
· Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
· Experience with visualisation tools (Grafana or similar).
· Knowledge of analytics programming languages (Python, R, or SQL preferred).
· Familiarity with data analysis and reporting in technical or operational environments is an advantage.
Skills & Competencies:
· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
· Ability to design clear, effective dashboards and reports.
· Basic programming and data handling skills.
· Strong attention to detail with a focus on accuracy.
· Good communication and teamwork abilities. on accuracy.
· Good communication and teamwork abilities.

title: Data Specialist
description:

We work with our clients around the world to create, support and enhance smart safe and sustainable places where people live, work learn and thrive. Places impact on the quality of people's lives. Whether new homes, shops, workplaces, schools and hospitals, manufacturing, research and development facilities or data and distributions centers. People and communities thrive when spaces in which they live  work, move and play are designed managed in a wat that best meets their needs
As part of Project and Program Management team, you'll help deliver some of the biggest, most iconic project imaginable, with some of the best talent around. With your energy, agility and a keen eye for detail, you'll deliver transformational outcomes for multiple clients everyday
Role accountabilities:
Work within established standard operating procedures and systems with clear project objectives to produce delivery outputs
Deliver/assist to manage small to medium scale projects or programs ensuring appropriate use of resources to deliver the required scope of work within set deadlines
Present any project risks or issues to senior managers to ensure the project is not adversely impacted, and ensure that the delivery of projects is  compliant to standards
Analyse and review a range of data to identify key themes and trends and use  the outputs to produce recommendations that support project decision-making.
Interact effectively across the organisation, completing complex professional level tasks for others in order to ensure projects/programs can be delivered to meet client and customer expectations.
Advise colleagues on issues relating to own projects, providing subject matter advice in order to support delivery and ensure there is alignment between policy and operational practice.
Collaborate with stakeholders and third party contractors, in order to ensure all parties are informed and aware of project progress and expectations. 
Qualifications & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline (e.g. Engineering, Architecture, Project Management, Construction Management, etc.), master’s degree an advantage
Minimum of 4 years relevant experience including management of large and complex projects and/or programmes
Advanced communication skills, including the ability to liaise with peers and senior colleagues and build and maintain relationships / Advanced interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interact and maintain relationships with high-level stakeholders.
Building the ability to negotiate and manage relationships with external stakeholders  
Has good logical understanding of business and digital transformation
Proficient in using Microsoft Power Platform such as PowerAutomate, PowerApps, PowerBI etc.
Preferably knows how to use Python, SQL
Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.
You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.
Together, we can create a lasting legacy.
Join Arcadis. Create a Legacy.
Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging
We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day, which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. At Arcadis, you will have the opportunity to build the career that is right for you. Because each Arcadian has their own motivations, their own career goals. And, as a ‘people ﬁrst’ business, it is why we will take the time to listen, to understand what you want from your time here, and provide the support you need to achieve your ambitions.

title: Learning Experience Designer
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
The Learning Experience Designer will design & develop eLearning/online learning content and programs using the latest instructional and educational technology methods. This role will be instrumental in building our learning solutions through, research and consultation to develop content across a wide range of topics for onboarding, compliance and foundational skills.
WHAT WILL BE YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES?
Design and development of learning resources that are engaging and relevant to the workplace and industry context (including but not limited to job aids, workbooks, handouts, skill and knowledge assessments as well as case studies)
Designing curriculum, content outline and storyboards, applying appropriate multimedia learning methodologies considering scalability, delivery requirements and limitations
Manage and execute graphic design and video development projects for instructional and presentation needs
Maintain training materials, courseware, and online content, to ensure that information is current and accessible
Research and make recommendations on educational best practices, instructional technologies, and multimedia hardware/software to support teaching and learning
Perform other duties as assigned or required
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
PERSONAL SKILLS & QUALITIES
Ability to communicate well
A strong interest in learning & development which means you are keen on following the latest trends in L&D, changes in learning technologies, willing to embrace and open to all types of training
Ready to question the ways in which our organization is doing learning & development and always “hungry” to keep learning yourself
Self-starter with the ability to multi-task, manage own time, work under pressure and work under minimum supervision
Thrive in a fast-paced, agile and dynamic environment
Flawless integrity, with strong interpersonal and analytical skills
High energy, team orientated
Must demonstrate initiative and a ‘can do’ attitude – solutions-oriented and results focused.
REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong visual design sense, highly creative, and innovative
Detail-oriented with good organizational skills
Previous experience in training, curriculum design, training needs analysis, and training evaluation
Knowledge of adult learning theory and instructional design principles
Ability to collaborate with others at all levels of the organization as well as vendors
Experience using Microsoft Office applications and e-Learning software/ content creation tools
Proficiency with learning management system
At least 1 year experience of eLearning development
Must be willing to work Australian hours
Must be willing to work at Bonifacio Global City
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in digital design, media production, motion graphics, and video editing an advantage
Working knowledge of multiple web design technologies, such as HTML

title: Corporate Communications Officer
description:
The Megawide Corporate Communications Officer is responsible for creating and maintaining a strong brand image for Megawide. This role involves developing brand strategies, managing brand campaigns, and ensuring consistent messaging across all marketing channels. The Corporate Communications Officer works closely with various departments as well as oversee Megawide business units to ensure that the brand is effectively communicated to internal and external stakeholders.
The Corporate Communications Officer is also responsible for developing and executing events and multi-media strategies that enhance the company’s brand image, increase visibility, and drive engagement. This role involves managing relationships with media and different stakeholders, overseeing digital platforms such as the website and social media, and coordinating with internal teams to align initiatives with business goals.

Key Responsibilities:
 Communications
 Copywriting – blend of creativity, communication skills, and basic technical know-how to craft compelling and persuasive content.
Research, write, and edit content for various platforms, including websites, blogs, social media, newsletters, speeches and marketing materials.
Develop original content that is clear, concise, and tailored to the intended audience.
Collaborate with different stakeholders to produce content that supports business objectives.
Ensure all content adheres to style guidelines and maintains consistency in tone and voice.
Proofread and fact-check content to ensure accuracy and quality.
Media Communication and Relations
Develop and enhance strong relationships with media outlets, journalists, and influencers to secure positive coverage and manage potential crises. 
Assist business units in their media requirements, including but not limited to 
Reputation and Crisis Management Communications
Monitor and manage the company’s online and offline reputation by tracking media coverage, social media mentions, and general feedback. 
During crisis situations, the Corporate Communications Officer shall execute the approved crisis communications plan following agreed timeline.
Brand Management
Develop and Implement Branding Strategies that enhance Megawide’s reputation and visibility, ensuring alignment with overall business goals, which include the following:
Social Media and Website 
Events 
Merchandise
 Regularly monitor the use of the Megawide brand across all internal and external channels, as well as oversee and provide guidance to all business units of Megawide to ensure adherence to brand guidelines and standards.

Training & Education
Develop and deliver training programs for employees, partners, and stakeholders to ensure understanding and adherence to Megawide standards in terms of the following:  

Branding – Website and Social Media Management, Brand Understanding 
Communications – Copywriting
Media – Spokesperson Training, Crisis Communications

Qualifications: 

1. Education: Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, Business, or a related field. 
2. Experience: 
At least 3 - 5 years experience in corporate communications or marketing
Proven track record of developing and executing successful communications and branding strategies. 
 3. Skills: 
3.1) Strategic and Creative Thinking
Strong ability to develop strategic plans that align with business objectives and foster brand growth. 
Media and Crisis Management: Expertise in managing media relations, including crisis communication and proactive PR efforts. 
Project and Brand Management: Excellent project management skills to oversee branding initiatives and ensure consistency across all platforms. 
3.2) Writing Skills
       •   Excellent command of grammar, punctuation, and language.
       •   Ability to write clear, concise, and compelling copy that resonates with the target audience.
       •   Versatility in writing styles to suit different media, and target audience
3.3) Creativity
       •   Strong creative thinking to generate original and engaging content.
       •   Ability to craft unique, memorable slogans, taglines, and brand messaging.
       •   Skill in storytelling to make content more relatable and impactful. 
3.4) Research Skills:
       •   Ability to conduct thorough research on various topics to create accurate and informative content.
       •   Familiarity with market trends, audience preferences, and industry-specific terminology.
       •   Ability to synthesize complex information into easily understandable content.  
 3.5) SEO Knowledge:
       •   Understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) principles and how to incorporate keywords naturally into copy.
       •   Familiarity with tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, or Ahrefs to enhance content visibility.
       •   Ability to write meta descriptions, title tags, and other SEO-related content.
 3.6) Attention to Detail:
       •   Strong proofreading and editing skills to ensure error-free and polished content.
       •   Ability to maintain consistency in brand voice and messaging across all materials.
       •   Keen eye for detail in formatting, layout, and overall presentation.
3.7) Communication and Collaboration:
       •   Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with designers, marketers, and other team members.
       •   Ability to interpret client briefs and translate them into compelling content.
            •           Skill in presenting and explaining creative ideas to stakeholders

Willing to report onsite at Santolan Town Plaza, San Juan City Mon-Fri 9am-6pm

title: Human Resources Supervisor
description:
The HR Supervisor is responsible for overseeing day-to-day HR operations, ensuring the implementation of HR policies and procedures, and supporting the organization in achieving its strategic goals. This role involves supervising HR staff, managing recruitment, training, and employee relations, and ensuring compliance with labor laws and organizational standards. Key Responsibilities:
HR Operations and Compliance:
Oversee daily HR activities, employee records, and benefits administration. 
Ensure compliance with labor laws, company policies, and industry standards. 
Manage and update HR policies, handbooks, and procedures as required.
2. Recruitment and Onboarding:
Supervise the recruitment process, including job postings, interviews, and selection. 
Oversee the onboarding process to ensure new employees integrate smoothly into the organization. 
Collaborate with the hiring team to identify staffing needs and create job descriptions. 
3. Employee Relations:
Serve as the main point of contact for employee concerns, grievances, and conflict resolution.
Promote a positive work environment and address employee satisfaction issues. 
Mediate disputes and implement corrective action plans where necessary.
4. Performance Management and Training:
Coordinate performance appraisal processes and provide support to managers in evaluating employees. 
Identify training needs and oversee the development and delivery of training programs. 
Support career development and succession planning initiatives. 
5. Supervision and Leadership:
Supervise and mentor junior staff, providing guidance and support in their roles. 
Assign tasks and projects to the HR team and ensure timely completion. 
Conduct regular team meetings to ensure alignment with HR goals. 
6. HR Metrics and Reporting:
Track and analyze HR metrics such as turnover rates, hiring trends, and employee satisfaction. 
Prepare regular reports for senior management on HR activities and performance. 
Use data insights to recommend and implement improvements in HR processes.

title: AIA Vitality Propositions, Strategy and Engagement Principal
description:
Role and Responsibilities:

Propositions Development
Develops compelling health and wellness propositions to regularly improve the AIA Vitality program with the goal of driving member growth and engagement and to ultimately deliver business value.
Spearheads regular AIA Vitality program review, the annual Vitality Pricing Review/PLPM Analysis, and Vitality Experience Study to evaluate program financials and identify areas for improvement.
Researches and looks for new trends and developments in health & wellness that may potentially be introduced to customers through the AIA Vitality program.
Regularly conducts competitor and industry scan to look for opportunities where AIA can be the thought leader or have the first-mover advantage in the health & wellness space specifically in the insurance industry.
Works with Propositions Leads and Product Tribe in integrating AIA Vitality for new product introductions or enhancements.
Leads the creation of compelling and value-adding propositions and campaigns anchored on AIA Vitality ecosystem that will result in business growth and impact other key metrices.
Conducts customer research and validation to test the viability of the proposition and test if it does meet market needs.
Aligns with group and regional counterparts to ensure synergy of propositions and get AIA Vitality best practices from other markets.

AIA Vitality Customer and Distributor Strategy
Crafts overall AIA Vitality customer and distributor strategy to meet key metrices aligned with company strategy.
Plan out and implement AIA Vitality annual refresh that shall include new propositions, program enhancements, and campaigns.
Ensures inclusion of AIA Vitality in the training roadmap of distribution force and training materials/modules are regularly enhanced.
Work with distribution channels in developing and implementing campaigns and incentives to drive integrated product sales, enrolment, and engagement.


Member Engagement and Experience

Work with the AIA Vitality Campaigns Consultant in crafting campaigns to drive member engagement.
Take necessary steps to make the AIA Vitality customer journey simple and engaging, to drive higher engagement.
Identify opportunity areas to enhance the customer experience on the AIA Vitality ecosystem.
Work closely with the Proposition Partnerships Principal to ensure selection, onboarding, and integration of compelling partners with lucrative offers that can drive ‘healthy behavior’ and make a difference in customers health journey.
Supports in the user acceptance testing (UAT) and give timely feedback so it may be addressed prior deployment.

Launch and Promotion of AIA Vitality Propositions and Offerings

Collaborates and strategizes with different stakeholders to ensure a smooth and effective launch, introduction, and promotion of new and propositions that will drive desired KPIs.
Contributes in the setting of KPIs to measure the success of the new proposition.
Prepares training materials and conduct train the trainers (TTT) to all training teams.
Designs and executes employee promotions and campaigns together with the Human Resources Department to drive awareness and utilization of new offerings.
Works with distribution teams on effectively cascading the proposition and new offerings to the entire distribution force and ensuring that is embedded in on-going agency initiatives, events, and promotions. 
Partners with Brand Marketing and Comms teams in developing comms calendar, overarching campaign, and materials/collaterals to push for awareness and utilization of new proposition/offering.
Links with CEG Team to come up with campaigns utilizing AIA Vitality propositions as a hook to further drive business value.

Reporting

Regularly monitors key AIA Vitality metrices and on-going campaigns.
Prepares the necessary and regular reports and updates. 
Provides other reports as requested.
Oversee AIA Vitality GOE and ensure spend is within budget

Minimum Job Requirements:

Education – Graduate of a business course (Business Administration, Commerce, Management, Economics, Marketing and Insurance)
Experience – An experienced Management, Marketing or Business Development professional, who has built his or her credentials and developed a solid track record with one or more reputable retail, financial services multinationals in the banking, insurance, fund management, or consumer finance sector
Certifications/licenses – MBA, FLMI an advantage
Special skills - Strategic thinking, Excellent analytical skills, Strong leadership, Skills, Communication skills (English and Filipino), Presentation skills, Relationship Management skills, Campaigns/Events management, People Management skills, Resource Management skills, Customer Orientation, Creativity, In-depth knowledge on use of Microsoft Office and Problem-solving Skills
The Principal will have experience working with multiple markets in Asia and will possess in depth knowledge of health & wellness space, sales, marketing, propositions, programs, tools and support mechanisms

title: Part Time or Full Time External Sourcing Associates (Permanent Work-From-Home)
description:
Part Time or Full Time External Sourcing Associates (Permanent Work-From-Home)

Please read very carefully below (all answers to possible questions pertaining to work and earnings are already indicated below)

Job Function:
- Permanent Work from Home (Part time or Full time)
- Will just email CVs for various positions to the Talent Acquisition (Recruitment) Team
- 1,500 per successful referral given the following week via bank transfer (please open Robinsons bank atm account) 
- Our team will inform you ASAP once your referred candidate has been hired by our client
Incentive Summary effective April 1, 2024
Per Successful Referral = 1,500 Php
Bonus Level 1 : 4-6 Hires = 3,000 Php
Bonus Level 2 : 7-9 Hires = 6,000 Php
Bonus Level 3 : 10 & Up Hires = 12,000 Php

Requirements:
- Since the task is to just refer or email us resumes for our further evaluation, we are not strict on educational attainment
- Must be passionate in sourcing / recruitment
- Must be submissive and committed. Should be consistent in sending us CVs (You can source applicants from facebook)

Note: 1,500 per successful referral is the ONLY fee we can provide (Plus bonuses, see chart above). No base pay. This is purely commission-based but if you're good, we can eventually absorb you to become one of our official employees in Dempsey with basic pay, 13th month and incentives.
For interested candidates, please click “APPLY NOW” and be sure to upload your updated CV or resume through Jobstreet.

title: Urgent Hiring | Collections Analyst | Quezon City
description:
Ready to shape the future of work?  
At Genpact, we don’t just adapt to change—we drive it. AI and digital innovation are redefining industries, and we’re leading the charge. Genpact’s AI Gigafactory, our industry-first accelerator, is an example of how we’re scaling advanced technology solutions to help global enterprises work smarter, grow faster, and transform at scale. From large-scale models to agentic AI, our breakthrough solutions tackle companies’ most complex challenges.  
If you thrive in a fast-moving, tech-driven environment, love solving real-world problems, and want to be part of a team that’s shaping the future, this is your moment.  
Genpact (NYSE: G) is an advanced technology services and solutions company that delivers lasting value for leading enterprises globally. Through our deep business knowledge, operational excellence, and cutting-edge solutions – we help companies across industries get ahead and stay ahead. Powered by curiosity, courage, and innovation, our teams implement data, technology, and AI to create tomorrow, today. Get to know us at genpact.com and on LinkedIn, X, YouTube, and Facebook.  

Inviting applications for the role of Process Associate, Collection Representative!  
In this role, agent is supporting one of the Biggest Financial Banks in the World by providing outstanding Customer Service Experience to their existing Clients.  

Responsibilities  
Support one of the Biggest Financial Banks in the World by providing outstanding Customer Service Experience to their existing Clients.  
Expertly and promptly resolve client inquiries at the first point of contact or call out to appropriate level for resolution.  
Be able to service customers on a variety of topics, which can include, but not limited to, providing account transactions details, placing investigations, or on-line navigation assistance.  
Customer Service for American consumer credit card customers  
Use of CRM tools & collecting/documenting detailed information  
Ability to utilize tools and resources appropriately to efficiently resolve customer inquiries  

Qualifications we seek in you!  
Minimum Qualifications / Skills  
High School / Senior High School graduates are accepted, College graduates are preferred.  
At legal/age by the time of application  
Ability to perform in a fast-paced and high-volume service center.  
Ability to multi-task alongside compliance to the process  
Shall pose no challenges in adhering to work schedules.  
Flexible to work in any schedule.  

Preferred Qualifications/ Skills  
Relevant collections experience required.  
Able to demonstrate understanding while improving chance to create rapport with the customer.  
Has previous experience in meeting/driving Net Promote Score performance/expectations, preferably in a customer service business for Consumer Credit Cards  
Displays excellent English oral and written communication skills - using accurate grammar with smooth flow.  
Displays excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.  
Proficient computer skills and attention to detail  
Significant months of experience in the phone customer service field is desired.  

Why join Genpact?  
Be a transformation leader – Work at the cutting edge of AI, automation, and digital innovation  
Make an impact – Drive change for global enterprises and solve business challenges that matter  
Accelerate your career – Get hands-on experience, mentorship, and continuous learning opportunities  
Work with the best – Join 140,000+ bold thinkers and problem-solvers who push boundaries every day  
Thrive in a values-driven culture – Our courage, curiosity, and incisiveness - built on a foundation of integrity and inclusion - allow your ideas to fuel progress  
Come join the tech shapers and growth makers at Genpact and take your career in the only direction that matters: Up.  
Let’s build tomorrow together.  
  Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex/age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.   
Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training.
