Reporting – Oversees the generation of various monthly and quarterly reports from the general ledger; responds to complex internal requests for reports, investigations, and analysis primarily using Excel and other advanced financial reporting tools and databases. Strategic Planning – Collaborates with senior management to develop and implement strategic financial plans. Engages in long-term planning to align financial goals with the company's overall strategy.
Variance Analysis and Reporting – Prepares and presents comprehensive variance analysis reports for senior managers. Identifies key drivers of variances and provides actionable recommendations to improve financial performance.
Other Duties – Performs other job-related duties as assigned by senior management. Continuously seeks opportunities for professional development and contributes to the overall success of the finance team.

title: Finance Manager Property Funds
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
JOB SUMMARY
Join a dynamic and growing property funds management team as a Finance Manager, where you’ll play a strategic and hands-on role in driving the financial success of a portfolio of unlisted property funds.
This role goes beyond numbers — you’ll be a trusted financial partner, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and performance across all fund operations. You’ll collaborate closely with Fund Managers, Auditors, and Senior Leadership, providing insights that shape investment decisions and fund performance.
As a key member of the finance function, you’ll oversee trust accounting, financial reporting, taxation, and investor communications, ensuring that every aspect of fund management meets the highest standards of integrity and excellence.
Function: Finance
Reporting to: Senior Fund Finance Manager (Manila)
 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Fund Accounting & Reporting
Oversee monthly unit pricing, trial balances, and consolidation entries to ensure accuracy and compliance.
Manage trust-level journals and balance sheet reconciliations.
Prepare and review statutory financial statements, board papers, and monthly management reports.
Deliver insights to support data-driven decisions and fund performance.
2. Tax, Compliance & Governance
Ensure full compliance with tax obligations (BAS, tax returns, taxable income statements).
Support internal audits and risk assessments.
Maintain robust internal controls aligned with fund mandates and regulations.
3. Stakeholder Engagement
Act as a key liaison between Fund Managers, investors, auditors, and internal teams.
Provide strategic and technical financial advice to senior stakeholders.
4. Process Improvement & Projects
Lead and support finance transformation initiatives, including system enhancements and automation.
Continuously improve reporting accuracy, control frameworks, and operational efficiency.
5. Treasury & Cash Flow Management
Manage cash flow forecasting and liquidity planning for optimal fund performance.
Monitor and report on debt facilities, ensuring compliance with covenants.
Oversee investor distributions, capital calls, and redemptions.
6. Team Leadership & Development
Mentor and support junior finance staff, promoting collaboration and growth.
Contribute to recruitment, onboarding, and professional development initiatives.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Degree in Commerce, Accounting, or Finance.
CA or CPA qualified.
Minimum 5 years of experience in fund accounting, property finance, or professional services.
Strong technical understanding of IFRS, trust accounting, and fund structures.
Proficiency with large ERP systems (experience with MRI, Power BI, or OneSource highly regarded).
Advanced Excel skills; solid working knowledge of Word and PowerPoint.
Experience in the property or funds management sector is a strong advantage.
 IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE
Commercially astute with a solid understanding of property markets and fund structures.
Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with multiple stakeholders.
Analytical, detail-oriented, and solutions-focused.
Proactive in identifying process improvements and driving efficiencies.
Committed to upholding confidentiality, compliance, and integrity in all aspects of work.
The successful candidate is expected to:
Adhere to, support, and promote the organization’s Compliance Policies and Procedures, consistently demonstrating the highest standards of ethical, personal, and professional conduct.
Ensure all activities and deliverables are performed in accordance with established policies, internal controls, and regulatory requirements, maintaining accuracy, transparency, and accountability.
Maintain strict confidentiality of all sensitive and proprietary information, recognizing the privileged level of access entrusted to this position and always upholding the organization’s integrity.

title: Customer Service Representative (US Healthcare Account)
description:
What Customer Service Operations contributes to Cardinal Health

Customer Service is responsible for establishing, maintaining and enhancing customer business through contract administration, customer orders, and problem resolution.

Responsible for providing outsourced services to customers relating to medical billing, medical reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.

Job Summary

The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations is responsible for providing outstanding customer service and managing accounts while providing sales support to field sales representatives. This job establishes, maintains and enhances customer service via appropriate contract administration, timely order fulfillment, and providing exemplary customer support including managing accounts and providing sales support to field sales representatives. The job is also responsible for tracking demand and backorders, complaint and incident reporting and supporting post-sales issue resolutions. The job works directly with customers to strengthen Cardinal Health’s operational performance, strengthen existing customer relationships and assists with the prospecting of new business opportunities. The Senior Representative, Customer Service Operations collaborates cross functionally with Commercial, Finance, Supply Chain and Operations teams to ensure customer account needs are meet, and operational performance is optimized to enhance customer experience.

Responsibilities
Provides outstanding customer service and supports improvements in operational execution to ensure service levels are achieved and exceeded.
Manages customer account activity including, but are not limited to; customer order fulfillment, customer backorders/substitutes, product change requests, new/lost business submissions and coordinating any customer questions / issues that may arise.
Provides outsourced services to customers relating to invoicing, reimbursement, and/or other services by acting as a liaison in problem-solving, research and problem/dispute resolution.
Collects and reviews customer feedback, complaints, recalls and product returns, working closely with Quality and Regulatory teams.
Identifies customer trends and challenges/opportunities to develop potential alternatives to support business, operational efficiency and develop new customer opportunities.
Supports process improvement initiatives, including but not limited to opportunities for optimizing inventory levels, suppliers and operational performance, cost control and profitability and ultimately customer service.
Builds strong relationships with key business stakeholders (Supply Chain, Finance, Operations, Marketing and Commercial) to work in collaborative approach for improved customer service.
Communicates with customers regarding their needs, questions, and concerns and helps trouble shoot equipment issues as necessary.
Manages cases regarding reporting, backorders, customer complaints, and pricing and processes product complaint and incident reports.
Supports general sales by analyzing account histories, and coordinating internal resources to resolve customer needs.
Investigates and reports on anomalies and discrepancies in point of sales systems, website ordering, and general customer complaint issues.
Redirects customers to applicable in-house resources as necessary.
Supports general post-sales issues resolutions as necessary.

What is expected of you and others at this level
Effectively applies knowledge of job and company policies and procedures to complete a variety of assignments
In-depth knowledge in technical or specialty area
Applies advanced skills to resolve complex problems independently
May modify process to resolve situations
Works independently within established procedures; may receive general guidance on new assignments
May provide general guidance or technical assistance to less experienced team members

title: Enterprise Account Executive | SaaS | Uncapped Commission
description:
Are you driven, strategic, and hungry to close complex deals?
With 17,000+ retailers and restaurants in over 15 countries, StoreHub is on a mission to enable everyone, big or small, to build successful businesses. At StoreHub, we're building a dream team where every colleague is extraordinary at what they do and highly effective at collaborating.
It’s in such a team that you learn the most, perform your best work, improve the fastest, and have the most fun.
If this sounds like a journey you’d like to embark on, keep reading!
In this Business Consultant - Enterprise role, you’ll be at the forefront of driving StoreHub’s expansion into the mid-market and enterprise segments. You’ll own the full sales cycle—from identifying key target accounts and executing outbound strategies, to engaging C-level decision-makers and closing high-value, complex deals.
This role is for someone who’s independent, strategic, and obsessed with impact—a consultative seller who thrives on challenges, takes pride in building relationships, and knows how to turn conversations into partnerships.
What you will do:
Strategic Account Targeting: Identify, segment, and maintain a dynamic enterprise hit list based on verticals, deal size, and growth potential.
Outbound Prospecting: Execute structured outbound campaigns and account-based strategies to engage senior decision-makers.
Consultative Selling: Understand the client’s business challenges and tailor StoreHub’s solutions to align with their strategic goals.
Pipeline Ownership: Manage the full enterprise sales process including qualification, demo, proposal, negotiation, and closure.
Stakeholder Navigation: Build internal champions and navigate complex buying environments to accelerate deal velocity.
Deal Execution: Lead negotiations with multiple stakeholders while maintaining pricing integrity and profitability.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with Solutions Engineers, Onboarding, and Customer Success to ensure seamless post-sale execution.
Revenue Growth: Drive revenue across Software, Hardware, and Value-Added Services to ensure a balanced enterprise portfolio.
Data & Insights: Track and analyze sales metrics to improve forecasting accuracy and execution.
Customer Relationship Management: Build long-term partnerships with enterprise customers as their trusted advisor.

How you will need to be:
Independent & Self-Driven: You manage your own strategy, time, and pipeline effectively.
Gritty & Motivated: You push through rejections and long sales cycles with resilience and self-reflection.
Consultative & Strategic: Skilled at influencing stakeholders and managing champions within organizations.
Emotionally Intelligent: Adept at navigating complex relationships and decision-making environments.
Analytical & Insight-Driven: You use data to guide conversations and decisions.
Adaptable & Agile: You pivot easily based on client needs and market shifts.
Relationship-Oriented: You believe in building long-term partnerships, not just closing transactions.
Organized & Disciplined: You maintain clean CRM hygiene and structured follow-ups.

What you need to have:
Proven experience in B2B or enterprise sales with a track record of closing high-value deals.
Strong communication and negotiation skills with senior executives.
Experience in SaaS or tech industry is a plus.
Prior consulting or advisory experience is advantageous.

What makes working at StoreHub awesome (and refreshing!):
Our people - for real! StoreHubbers are some of the smartest and most interesting people you can work with. Expect to do a lot of peer-learning.
Culture of Candour.We embrace directness, hate bureaucracy, and move fast. If you're tired of 'corporate nonsense' you'll feel right at home.
Cutting edge tools. If something can be automated, we'll make it happen. You will be introduced to many different tools we use that support everyday tasks, so that we can focus our minds on the kind of work that matters.
Impact not just effort. We recognize that results are not tied to the number of hours worked. There's no reward for long hours with poor results and no penalty for leaving on time if your work is excellent. To be great, most of us have to put in considerable effort, but we don't measure contribution by hard work or long hours.
CHANGE. Our core values are super important to us. The more you resonate with them, the more you'll find yourself a good fit.

Communicate for Clarity
Humble and Hungry
Authentic but not an *sshole
Nimble and Quick
Growth Mindset
Efficiency and Excellence
  We do have all the other cool perks too:

Apple Macbooks for everyone
Fully stocked fridge and pantry - Coffee, snacks, and more yums
Cutting edge tools. If something can be automated, we'll make it happen
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at StoreHub. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Field Junior Training Officer (Visayas/Mindanao)
description:
Job Overview:
The Field Junior Training Officer is responsible for implementing and delivering sales capability programs to frontliners in the field. The role involves facilitating training sessions, coaching sales representatives, identifying skill gaps, and aligning training interventions with sales objectives. This position requires independence, field leadership, and strong collaboration with area sales teams.
Area of Assignment: 
Visayas-Mindanao DCs – BAC/ILO/TAN/CDO/LAB/DAV but willing to travel to different sales locations / go on field (at least 4x a week) and support field teams. Reports to the nearest DC when not in field.

Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct interviews with applicants for entry level positions.
Facilitate in-field sales capability training and coach frontliners on selling techniques, customer engagement, and execution standards.
Collaborate with Field sales managers to identify development needs and customize interventions.
Monitor and evaluate post-training performance in assigned territories.
Lead onboarding field immersion programs for newly hired sales representatives.
Provide feedback and insights to the Training group for continuous improvement of learning materials.
Report on field training activities, participation, effectiveness, and outcomes.
Serve as the point person for capability-building efforts in assigned regions.

Qualifications and Skills:
A graduate of any 4-year course.
At least 3-5 years of experience in sales, field execution, or training roles (preferably in FMCG).
Field Sales experience is a plus.
Strong exposure to frontline sales environment.
Experience in conducting coaching or facilitation is required.
Excellent communication, facilitation and coaching skills.
Strong relationship-building and field presence.
Ability to assess training needs based on performance data and behaviors.
Proactive and resourceful with minimal supervision.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
Tech-savvy: can easily learn and adapt to technological advancements.
Willingness to travel frequently and work in field conditions.
Preferably with a valid motorcycle license and able to drive a motorcycle for field visits OR able to ride a motorcycle for field visits when necessary.
Can be based anywhere near one of the Visayas-Mindanao DCs – BAC/ILO/TAN/CDO/LAB/DAV but willing to travel to different sales locations / go on field (at least 4x a week) and support field teams. Reports to the nearest DC when not in field.

title: Importation Officer
description:
Role Profile:
The Importation Officer reports directly to Purchasing Manager. He or she handles and processes incoming shipments of raw materials, machines, and spare parts of Bonpack and Bonflex.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities:
1. Communicate with the suppliers for the following concerns:
- send and follow up confirmation of LC draft
- send LC cable
- status and updates of all incoming shipments
- request shipping documents
- inform supplier regarding payment
2. Send shipping documents to broker for their checking and review.
3. Coordinate with broker for the status of the releasing of shipments.
4. Coordinate with warehouse for the delivery of shipments.
5. Monitor and update payment schedule.
6. Update importation summary daily.
7. Update summary of Materials Complaint Report. Submit claim to supplier related to MCR.
8. Photocopy and scan documents for file and reference as needed.
9. Filing of documents and submit the folder to accounting department once complete.
10. Coordinate with DHL/Fedex/UPS for the status of door to door shipments
- Fill out SDV form (supplemental declaration on valuation)
- Apply/secure government certificate (if needed)
- Prepare payment request for door to door charges
11. Monitor and update summary of Incoming Raw Materials.
12. Prepare payment request to be submitted to accounting.
13. Prepare discrepancy report for all shipments.
14. Check and review billing/releasing charges of brokers.
15. Prepare monthly VAT report to be submitted to accounting 1st week of every month.
16. Prepare monthly report for other consignee shipments 1st week of every month.
17. Request sales invoice from consignee to be submitted to accounting with complete supporting documents.
18. Apply/secure government certificate needed in the shipment.
19. In charge in renewal of accreditation
Qualifications:
1. Graduate of a 4 year Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management or other Business related course. Particularly in fields like Customs Administration, Business Administration & Logistics. At least 2 years work experience as an Importation Officer or in a similar position.
2. High Proficiency in Microsoft office is required.
3. Pro-active, organized & efficient, willing to multi-task and able to work under minimum supervision.
4. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, organizational and interpersonal skills.
5. With experience in import/export operations, customs compliance or international logistics.
6. Knowledge of freight forwarding and shipping industry.

title: Chart Analysis Specialist (HIM) - Medical Records Reviewer
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
description:
JOB SUMMARY
The HIM Chart Analysis Specialist is responsible for advanced clerical functions and entails the analysis of medical records for completion upon discharge, by the Medical Staff, and other licensed practitioner who are authorized to document in the medical records in compliance with hospital, regulatory and accrediting guidelines. They understand privacy and security issues related to patient information. The purpose of the position is to perform analysis of all discharges for compliance in accordance with departmental and federal standard.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze medical records for completion and assign deficiencies as needed
Work involves the analysis and final processing of all incomplete and delinquent medical records distributed or assigned by the HIM staff
Work is performed under the supervision of the Health Information Management Supervisor; however, the individual is expected to perform independently and exercise good judgment
Analyzes all discharges for compliance with documentation standards, completeness and accuracy in accordance with departmental, hospital, and federal regulatory and accrediting guidelines
Records deficiencies on the computer for tracking and reporting purposes
Removes deficiencies from the computer upon completion of the medical records
Track individual daily productivity
Maintain quality score of 98% on a monthly basis
QUALIFICATION
Required:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The list below is representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Demonstrates proficiency in keyboard operations
Privacy and Security: demonstrates an understanding of the importance of providing privacy and security of all patient information
Quality Orientation: accomplishing tasks by considering all areas involved, no matter how small; showing concern for all aspects of the job; accurately checking processes and tasks; being watchful over a defined timeframe
Knowledge of Health Information Management Principles and Practices and the ability to apply such knowledge to the analysis process
Knowledge of TJ, CMS and Medical Staff Bylaws regarding chart completion and documentation standards
Knowledge of computer and medical terminology
Knowledge of the approved order of assembly for medical records by care unit
Knowledge of the importance of timely documentation to prevent delay in the Revenue Cycle
Ability to keep open communications with US-based HIM staff
Ability to analyze and interpret data relative to incomplete and delinquent medical records
Organization: establishes courses of action to ensure that work is completed efficiently; proactively prioritizes assignments and keen ability to multi-task
Works Independently: is self-supporting; does not need to rely on others to complete a job
Preferred:
At least two years experience in a hospital Health Information Management department
Nursing or other Clinical discipline
HIM (RHIT/RHIA), Coding or Clinical Credentials Certification is highly desirable but not required
Microsoft Office applications and others as required
Education:
Bachelor's degree
